Of course, Mann is not the only writer to debunk this general theory.What I took away from this book was quite deep: but for a few germs and other unfortunate circumstances, the world today could be a much different place than it is.  As they say, the victors get to write the history, and what we consider today to be the "proper" way to do things and what signifies culture is shaped by the narrative written by the Europeans as victors.  But in reality, the Europeans were nothing if not "savages" themselves in the 15th century.  Had the Americans succeeded in beating them back, we could live in a world with very different societal norms.  Getting into this takes much more than a simple review, but I loved this book because it changed how I view the world.The added bonus is that Mann does this with gripping writing.  There is nothing dry about this book.And one final caveat: once you read 1491, you have to read 1493 as well.  They complement each other and complete the story.  In 1491, we learn that the Americas were much different than you think.  In 1493, you learn how much of our current culture was shaped by what was found in the Americas.

Olmstead writes this novel using sparse prose that leaves the reader with a feeling matching that of the book: cold and lonely, yet achingly human.  The protagonist, Henry, is young when he is hearbroken and ends up in war.  Although Henry suffers, Olmstead excels at letting the humanity and love shine through.  The portrayal of war is one of the best I have read: nothing is romanticized; rather, the war is brutal and miserable.The comparisons to Hemingway are warranted: Olmstead captures the warmth where it is needed and lets the reader feel the chill where warranted.  Overall, the style matches the story.  This is no happy tale, but I still enjoyed reading it.

We have twins that are now just a little over the year.  And I am not generally a fan of the electronic toys for the kids with lights and sounds and songs.  But of course we end up with a lot of those toys and the kids love them, so I'm not going to stand in their way based on some antiquated idea of what toys kids should play with.But that doesn't mean I don't get annoyed by the singing toys.  When your kids are young and hit the same button over and over, the songs can wear on your nerves.But not with Potsy.  After just a few days of receiving this toy as a gift, I think my wife and I had all of his sayings and songs memorized.  Not only that, we started to jokingly say them all the time.  ("I got five foods, gonna make a pot.."; "cream it, steam it, eat it on the cobb...corn!")  The voice is not the usual voice you hear on kids toys, but rather a man's voice that just seems to be having so much fun.And the kids love it too.  They love throwing the food, or really any of their toys, into the pot and stirring with the spoon to make it sing.  Even with the sound off they like to put things in the pot and put the lid on.  Although they aren't really learning from it yet, the songs are all about eating your vegetables and how much fun it is, so there is at least something educational about it.I'm sure the novelty will wear off, but this is the least annoying singing toy that our kids have.  For that reason alone, it's worth getting for your kids, or as a gift.  The fact that the kids love it to is only icing on the cake!

I know someone that works for RVCA's parent company and have been given several RVCA t-shirts over the years.  I love RVCA designs, but every t-shirt I've had shrinks significantly after the first wash.  Being long torso-ed, the shirts come up too short on me and I have to stop wearing them.  Unfortunately, getting the next size up resulted in a shirt that's too baggy.  It's a shame, but I had to give up on RVCA t-shirts, although I own several buttoned shirts and love them.

My wife and I bought two pairs of these shears, one for each of use.  Within a year of use, the rubber grips on both had split and fallen off.  Without the grips, these are painful to use.  We tried to make new grips out of some bicycle handlebar grip and it somewhat works, but now I am looking to just replace them with something better.  So although they seemed to cut fine, the low quality made them unusable quickly.

Most of the existing reviews are great, but limited to impressions shortly after buying the caddy.  This is a longer-term review.Although I was a bit turned off by the price, I bought this caddy after two previous caddies rusted out.  We've now had this in our shower for three years and there is no sign of rust anywhere.  With a simple cleaning every now and then it still looks great and functions like it did when it was brand new.This is a steady, durable caddy.  Truly, if you want a shower caddy, the cheapest option is to buy this one:  by the time you replace the cheaper ones over and over, you will have spent more than you would have just buying one of these.

After our twins got too big for baths in the sink but still too small to just sit in a tub, we were at a loss.  All of tubs we saw were meant for one kid and we were hoping to be able to give them baths at the same time.  I finally saw the EuroBath and decided to try it out.  It worked fantastically!  One baby had to recline while the other partially sat up, but we could finally give them baths at the same time.  We've been using it for several months now with no problems whatsoever.  Our kids love it and so do we!

As some of the other reviewers have mentioned, this case will scuff quickly and not look so great.  I eventually ditched mine and found that the hard metal case of the MacBook itself is more than enough of a "case" for the computer.  Whereas the scuffs on the case are noticeable, a light scuff on the MacBook isn't really visible.Likewise, this case really doesn't add much protection for the laptop.  With a phone, a good case will protect it if you drop it on the floor.  With a laptop covered by this shell case, it's not going to protect your computer if you drop it, the shell will just snap off.  In my opinion, that doesn't add much "protection," it's really only for looks.  But like I said, it scuffs up easily and doesn't look so hot.  So what's the point?Instead of using a shell case like this, I suggest leaving your MacBook naked (come on, it's beautiful!) And then get a larger sleeve to transport it in.  I guess it takes a little longer to open up the sleeve than just using a shell case like this, but a sleeve will actually help protect your computer.

I got a good deal on a open box for this fan.  Install was easy and straightforward and the fan has functioned well.  Very quiet operation.  I don't have much to add that isn't said in the other reviews.My one caveat is that the light on this is very weak.  Our previous fan had multiple lights and was enough to light up the room.  The halogen bulb on this fan only emits enough light for right below the fan.  We still like this fan, but don't count on the light to be enough for the room.

As we've been remodeling our house we've been putting these handles on all the doors as we go.  I love the nice, clean look and these handles are durable and easy to install.  My one negative is that to get the door open, you basically have to turn the handle a full 90 degrees.  It seems like a minor thing, but it can be a pain when you have your hands full.  I would prefer it to open with just a slight turn, but maybe that's just me.  Nevertheless, we'll continue to install these as we continue our renovations room by room.

We put this set on our front door after putting on a fresh coat of paint and it made a big difference.  This was the most modern-looking front door handle I could find that didn't cost too much.  The handle is really just black with just a slight touch of bronze on the edges, a really nice look.  The instructions were detailed and provided for adjustments to fit different size doors and the set includes both a left-facing and right-facing interior handle.  I had it installed in about 10-15 minutes and it has worked great since then.

We read about Charlie's Soap online as the perfect soap to wash cloth diapers.  We've been using it over a year now and it has worked wonderfully.  As you can imagine, some of the diapers and pretty gross when they go into the washing machine but they always come out clean and odor-free after using Charlie's Soap.  Moreover, our babies' sensitive skin didn't develop any rashes that can be more common with the more typical detergents.Charlie's Soap works well, is cheap, and is green to boot.  What more could you ask for?

Let me start out by saying that although I do like computers and tech-related topics, I was never a gamer.  I am not a video game fan.  I did not play role-playing games when I was younger.  Given that, I skipped over this book despite the buzz I kept hearing about it.  Finally, I gave it a read and was so glad I did.  I don't think I have been so absorbed in a book as I was with this one, I could barely put it down.  Although this book is heavy into the world of gaming, it didn't get caught up in esoteric knowledge or focus too much of incomprehensible technology.  In the end, this is a book about an adventure and friendship, not gaming.Cline writes brilliantly and creates characters that you can't help but identify with. RP1 proceeds with a spell-binding pace and builds a level of suspense that it very rare in modern fiction.  Sure, you could say this is just a silly fun book and not "serious," but I think he touches on some important questions and presents a future that is entirely imaginable.Ready Player One combines the exuberance of young people on an adventure immersed in an alternate reality set in the bleak future (i.e., Goonies + E.T. + Matrix).  I really loved this book and didn't want it to end.  I would recommend this book to anyone, but especially the young at heart or those that appreciate an epic quest.

We got these for our twins as they started to outgrow their simple baby toys.  Although they aren't consistently stacking them yet, they still seek out this toy.I actually prefer the recycled plastic in Green Toys to the new plastic in other toys.  This plastic is nice and durable and has a matte finish.  They really are beautiful, it any plastic toy can be called that.  Each stacker fits into the other very precisely, this is no junk toy!The middle of each stacker has a large knob that the kids can easily pick up. (they really remind of or air hockey pucks).  Our kids love to grab two of them and use them like cymbals to raise a racket.  The edges of each are also wide, allowing our kids to roll them down the hall, which they also love to do!  The ease with which they can be handled, combined with the chew-proof durability, lead to these being played with often in our household.  I think these will be around for awhile!

My parents got us this Cuisinart for Christmas after our cheaper, smaller food processor died after a couple years of use.  When I first opened the box, I thought the 14-cup size was overkill.  But since we started using it, we fell in love with it.  One of the nicest features is the three different bowl sizes: if you just need it for a small job, use the small bowl and that's all you have to wash.  This thing takes care of all foods with ease and will drastically cut down on your prep time and open up a whole new world of cooking if you aren't used to having a food processor.When I was reading the manual, Cuisinart said that they recommend that you just leave the food processor out on your counter and adopt it as an everyday cooking tool.  Boy, a bit presumptuous! But they were right: by leaving it out rather than putting it in a cabinet, you end up realizing how often you can use it.This is a high quality product and you can tell from the first time you use it.  In my opinion, it is worth spending a little extra on an appliance that is going to last a long time rather than spending half as much on one that you will have to replace in half the time!And one little extra bonus: our twin babies love the sound of the Cuisinart and can't help from laughing when they watch it go!  Instant entertainment!

Although this juicer makes good juice, we don't really use it anymore.  It's not difficult to clean, it just takes too much time for everyday use.  There are several parts that need to be cleaned after every use, and then they take up a lot of room to dry.  We weren't hard-core juicers, so for some people I am sure it will be worth it.  But if you just have a passing interest in juicing, my guess is you won't end up using it that much.  Instead of juicing we started to just use the blender, which leaves the pulp in so its not as smooth as pure juice, but it has more fiber and is a LOT easier to clean up.

I was very hesitant to give Mark Bittman's VB6 only three stars.  I have closely followed Bittman's writing in the New York Times for several years.  I own two of his cookbooks, How to Cook Everything and How to Cook Everything Vegetarian, and use both constantly.But perhaps that is the problem.  For anyone that follows Bittman or other similar food writers, there is really nothing new in this book other than collecting all of his recent ideas in one place.  I actually read about Bittman's "VB6" diet over a year ago in one of his Times articles and adopted it for myself despite not having it explained in a book.  I wasn't very overweight, but like Bittman I lost about 15 pounds quickly and, as he notes, noticed that as I ate healthier during the day, it changed my eating habits overall and I continued to eat healthy food at night as my cravings for highly processed junk foods subsided.An obvious benefit for the VB6 diet is its simplicity, but unfortunately this also leads to not having much to add in the actual book.  The "diet" is just what the title says: eat vegan before 6 pm, and then you can eat anything you want for dinner so long as you try to avoid processed food and treats.  Really, that's it.  The majority of this book is devoted to explaining why such a diet works, and why you should avoid processed foods.  Although this information is great for beginners or people with no real knowledge of nutritional science, most of this information is pretty basic to most people.  If you want to know the details,  I think you can gain a lot more from watching Robert Lustig's "Sugar: the Bitter Truth" video on YouTube or even reading Bittman's own columns about Lustig, without buying a book.The other major portion of this book is the recipes.  Again, while I love Bittman's recipes, I have his other cookbooks and wasn't really needing more recipes by him.Again, I love the content of this book, and my three stars is not a reflection on the VB6 diet theory or Bittman's writing.  By way of analogy, I guess I would say it's like buying a "greatest hits" album from a band you really like: those albums aren't meant for the fans, they are meant for people who don't know that band's music.  If you're a fan of Bittman or others like him (e.g., Pollan), you don't need this book.  Likewise, if you're looking for a new "diet," just read the title of this book and you're good to go, perhaps with also reading some of Bittman's recent columns on the Times website.I would only recommend this book to someone who needs to learn the basics and needs some good recipes to succeed.  If that's you, I can wholeheartedly say that this book will explain why you need to change your diet and why this one will work.  A vegan diet can be dangerous if you aren't well informed and work hard to make sure you get the proper nutrients.  If you try to be vegan by eating only potato chips, you'll obviously be in trouble!  Luckily, although VB6 isn't a true vegan diet, Bittman explains everything you need to know in this book.  Additionally, the best feature of the VB6 diet is that it is entirely doable.  Although some sacrifices have to be made, you can spend the rest of your life eating this way.  If you're skeptical, I suggest you give it a try: as I mentioned above, you'll notice your cravings for junk food go away once you switch to better food.  I used to drink multiple sodas a day but now they are too sickeningly sweet to handle more than a couple sips.  Also, I didn't only lose weight, I also felt more alert and calm after switching to a VB6 diet, and some random aches and pains went away.  If you are new to the "flexitarian" approach to eating set forth by Bittman, you will be a convert by the end of this book.

My wife uses this simple Kindle and I recently got a Kindle Paperwhite.  With the difference in price, there are obvious benefits to getting the simple Kindle.  Which one should you get?In the end, it really comes down to a difference in two features for me.  Assuming you don't need anything fancy, the Paperwhite is better mainly because of the light.  I don't use this to read in the dark so much, but more because having it on even during the day in full sunlight results in a higher contract screen with a whiter background.  There is no question that the display on the Kindle Paperwhite is much better than the other versions.The simple Kindle, however, has what I consider the best feature of the Kindles: page turn buttons!  It seems minor, but if you read a lot the page turn buttons are wonderful.  You don't have to move your hand from the bezel to turn the page.  Likewise, if you are reading a book with footnotes or links, you don't have to be careful where you tap to avoid hitting one of those links instead of turning to the next page.  The more I use the Paperwhite, the more I am annoyed by this.So which one is better?  It's really up to you: if you read a lot (especially non-fiction with in-text references) and care about convenience that this simple Kindle may be the one for you.  If you care more about how the text looks or read a lot at night, then I would go with the Kindle Paperwhite.  For me, if I was buying a kindle again, I would probably go with this simple Kindle.  Hopefully the next version of Kindle combines the best features of both!

When we were remodeling a bathroom a few years ago, I was looking for a dual flush toilet to save some water.  I read some reviews online praising the Toto Aquia II and decided to get it even though it was a little more pricey than some.Three years later, we still love this toilet.  Even the lighter flush is strong enough for most visits.  We have NEVER had this toilet clog on us and, contrary to some other reviews, the bowl is almost always cleaned by the flush.  Compared to our other existing toilets, I find the bowl on this one stays cleaner.And my favorite feature is the smooth skirt design.  It's probably just me, but I hate that most toilets look like they have intestines, with the curvy shape running into the ground.  This isn't just a looks problem, as those toilets tend to get dirty in the back and it's so difficult to clean all the curves.  With the Toto Aquia II, it is all smooth surfaces that don't collect dust and grime.A few notes:  this skirted design also requires some extra work to install.  We put this toilet on a concrete subfloor and had to drill holes into the concrete to get it attached.  It wasn't difficult, but it is slightly more work than a standard toilet.  Also, you need to buy the toilet seat separately, don't forget!We are starting a new bathroom remodel soon and will be buying another one of these toilets soon.  I can't imagine using anything else at this point.

I think I've read every one of Pollan's books.  I loved some, especially Omnivore's Dilemma, while others were just good (In Defense of Food).  With Cooked, there were parts I loved, while other parts I was ready to skim over.  In the end, I enjoyed the book immensely, but not as much as some of this others.Like many of his other books, Pollan divides Cooked into thematic sections (Here: Fire [Grilling], Water [Cooking in water], Air [baking], and Earth[fermenting/pickling]) but they seemed a little forced, as Pollan himself seems to acknowledge. You need fire for three of the four, and yeast plays a pretty big role in both beer and bread.  I get what he was trying to do, but it felt like it didn't quite work to enhance the themes of the book rather than merely provide breaking points.His introduction sets the stage for the entire book.  He identifies a dilemma in modern culture: we spend less time cooking than ever but more time watching and idolizing others who cook.  Pollan explains that contemplating this dilemma triggered something in him to write this book, and I think he makes an important overarching observation: although cooking may not be the most efficient use of time, it is an alchemic process that transforms both raw foods and people.  Without cooking, humans would not be what we are today.  The modern trend to remove cooking from everyday life, therefore, is likely to have huge consequences on who we are.  As Pollan notes, our fascination with cooking reflects the deep-seated position it holds in our lives.The book contains long sections with meditations on what cooking is and what it means to culture, both ancient and modern, and for the most part I enjoyed them.  For example, although it is somewhat tangential to cooking, Pollan discusses the role that microbiotics play in our gut and the effect on our health.  Tying this topic into modern cooking, he raises some very interesting questions about the effect of a "no-microbe" policy on our health.  As Pollan excels at pointing out repeatedly, the food we eat today is at the long end of the combined evolution of man and food: we eat what we eat and cook food the way we do because it is necessary to our survival.  Removing certain types of food (e.g., whole grain bread, fermented vegetables) without thinking of the consequences is fraught with peril.The meditations are interspersed with stories about masters of cooking and Pollan's own personal experiences. In each section, Pollan seeks out the masters in each particular field to teach him about cooking.  As with his other books, Pollan always finds the philosophers within a certain field that combine their expertise with an ability to discuss their field in a way that opens your eyes.  Who knew that bread baking would be so complex and more of an art form than simple mixing?  Pollan is a masterful storyteller, combining an ability to explain complex issues with a sharp sense of humor and self-deprecation.With Omnivore's Dilemma, Pollan changed how I think about the world.  For me, Cooked was different in that rather than changing how I see the world of food, he reinforced ideas I already have and gave voice to some subconscious thoughts I had about the importance of cooking my own food.  Although I have always enjoyed cooking, Pollan helps highlight WHY cooking is so enjoyable and so worthwhile.  I especially enjoyed his section on brewing beer and have been inspired to try to brew my own batch.  As he notes in his afterword, many of these endeavors seem at first glance to be an incredible waste of time and totally inefficient.  As Pollan explains, however, there is a "satisfaction that comes from temporarily breaking free of one's accustomed role as the producer of one thing -- whatever it is we sell into the market for a living -- and the passive consumer of everything else."  Over the course of the book, Pollan successfully proves that cooking is special and shouldn't be given up so easily, and there are benefits to slowing down and becoming immersed in something so basic as the food we eat.  So while I can't claim that Cooked is as eye-opening as some of Pollan's other works, I enjoyed it immensely.

I got a Sigg after giving up on Nalgene for a daily water bottle.  I was looking for a metal bottle to avoid the aftertaste left in plastic bottles.  Sigg bottles, however, still have a plastic lining on the inside.  This didn't bother me too much until it started to peel off on the threads around the mouth.  I had to start picking it away and was worried it was going to continue to come off.  I don't know if this was just a quality issue with my one bottle or something that happens over time with use, but I decided to try a new bottle.  I got a Klean Kanteen, which is all metal, and love it.  The Sigg wasn't horrible, but I like the Klean Kanteen much more.

Growing up in Southern California, Rainbow Sandals were a known classic and all my surfer dad would wear.  I've had a succession of Rainbows since I was a little kid.  We buy them straight from the factory store in San Clemente, which is a great little place if you're in the area.  Rainbows are durable and supremely comfortable after you give them a chance to mold to your feet.  There is a short breaking-in period, but once you get them molded they are the best.  I'll never wear any other sandal.

We've been using two of these mats now with two Inglesina clip-on high chairs on the island in our kitchen for several months now.  There are things we love about them, but also things we don't love so much.LOVE:  These mats are made of a good quality plastic that can take a beating.  They also feature a little catch that fills the gap almost perfectly between the edge of the counter and the front of the seat.  This helps with containing some of the mess.DON'T LOVE: We can never get the mats to lay perfectly flat.  The suction cups are in from the edges so the edges tend to curl up.  Also, the suction cups are so strong that you really have to give them a tug to get them loose.  Although this sounds like it would be a good thing, it's not good when the tray is covered with food after feeding the kids.  On many occasions I have pulled on the mat to get the suction cups loose only to have it pop off and fling food all over the place.  I wish it was easy to take off so you could just fold it up and dump it into the trash.  Of course, then the kids would be able to pull it up, so it's definitely a difficult design challenge.  Regardless, the kids have discovered it's fun to pop off the suction cups and fling the food themselves, so I'm not sure this design dilemma really exists.Also, we stained these mats pretty quickly with some tomato sauce, even though we cleaned them pretty quickly.  This isn't a huge deal, but the stains remain despite repeated washings.  In terms of cleaning, the raised ridges of the design printed on the mats makes it harder to scrub out stubborn bits.  I don't really get why they put the design on, our kids could care less. A flat design would have been easier to clean.We are still using these; I never found anything better.  So perhaps this is as good as it gets, but I wish they worked a little better.

Reading the premise for this show -- four senators living together in a house in DC -- I was really hoping it could deliver.  Seeing Bill Murray in the first scene made me think there was potential, but after his cameo was over it was all downhill.  Although the casting is great, the show fell flat for me.  I have no problems with making fun of Republican politicians, but it's almost too easy.  Rather than offering intelligent comedy, this show relies on gross caricatures of conservative senators for easy gags.  It's almost as if they spent 5 minutes developing the characters based on the most common stereotypes and then just ran with it.The biggest problem I see with this show is I don't know how it can carry on for an entire season.  Some of the jokes were funny, but I really don't see any plot developing or any viewer really caring what happens to these characters.

I only had these for about 6 months before the cord at the jack broke.  It's not reinforced in any way and couldn't handle being bent when I kept my phone in my pocket.  I'll admit that I didn't put them away into their case every time, but I think simple headphones should be able to stand up to light abuse.  I didn't love the sound from these headphones so I didn't bother trying to get them replaced.  Instead, I bought some Velodyne Vpulse headphones that I love and find far superior to the S4's.

The key to reusable bags is getting a set that you'll remember to take with you and use.  These are small enough that you can slip them into your glove box and always have them with you.We got a set of these a few years ago and they are wonderful.  They fold up easily into their little pouches and are the perfect size for groceries.  They seem to hold just enough to where the bag is getting heavy.  Extremely durable, they show no wear after several years of use and no sign of any tearing or wearing thin.

I can't say I'm too picky when it comes to soap, but I love this soap.  It has a very minimal scent and for whatever reason, the foaming soap feels like it does a better job cleaning my hands.  Maybe it's all in my head, but I don't think I can ever go back to normal soap again.  We bought the six pack and placed them at every sink, and then we buy the big refill bags.  Super simple, and excellent all around.

Although I owned a flat screen TV for several years, I never thought of hanging it on the wall given how expensive the mounts were at Best Buy and other stores.  After reading the reviews for this Cheetah Mount, I decided to give it a try.  Getting it on the way was easy and mounting the TV was even easier.  It's a simple mount but I've never once felt the desire to swivel my TV.  Do yourself a favor and save your money and just get this simple mount.

As first time parents, and parents of twins born a few weeks early, my wife and I were always worrying if our babies were eating enough and gaining enough weight.  Going to the doctor once a month, and then less, helped, but we had no way of knowing how the babies were doing in between.  Then we got this scale.  For not too much money, we were able to weigh our babies at any time.  When we weighed them on the same days we went to the doctor, it seems this scale was often off by a couple of ounces.  But really, the scale is helpful to see how much the kids weigh compared to yesterday, or last week, not to determine their actual, accurate weight.  The cradle bed envelops babies nicely and makes weighing them quite easy.  You can zero out the scale after putting a blanket down for comfort, and the "hold" button allows you to get a weight reading even when the kids are squirming around.  Although it might not be the highest calibrated scale ever, it served its purpose and provided peace of mind.  I would highly recommend any new parent get this scale.

I've followed Robin Sloan online for awhile, both on Snarkmarket and his other writing in various places.  This book reads as if Mr. Sloan took all of the wonderful things happening in the world today that he shares online and encapsulated them into a "fiction" novel.  This wasn't the best-written book I've read all year, and you can tell that Mr. Sloan is not a career fiction writer.  But I could care less because this book is just so much fun to read!  If you are the type of person that is equally fascinated with history and the modern world, and all the exquisite intersections and collisions that happen in real life, you'll really enjoy this novel.  I hope he continues to write novels!

For whatever reason, I've read a fair number of these post-apocalyptic novels recently.  And although I like the genre in general, The Dog Stars really stood out.  Sure, it takes place in a near-future where humanity has basically been wiped out, but this book has a optimistic quality and presents an almost child-like fascination with the world.  I couldn't put this book down and loved both the story and the writing.  Despite the ravaged world presented here, Peter Heller managed to write a book that makes you cherish the beauty in the world and in people.

As our twins grew too large for their infant car seats/carriers, I started to research convertible car seats.  We wanted a quality seat that was easy to install and adjust, but also didn't want to spend TOO much.  In the end, it came down to this seat and the Britax Marathon.  After reading way too many reviews and looking at the seats in stores, we settled on the Recaro.  So far, no problems.  We still have them installed facing the rear, so I can't comment on their use as forward facing seats.My wife has a VW Jetta Sportwagen which is roomy, but not huge.  Being tall, I was looking for a seat that wasn't too long so we would be able to move the front seats back far enough to fit in.  The Recaro fit the bill and is slim enough to leave enough room for the front seat.Installing was a breeze.  The LATCH connectors on the Recaro were of MUCH better quality than those on the Graco car seat we had before, and much easier to get in.  We had to place some rolled up towels under the seat to get it level, but this wasn't a problem and is the consequence of our Jetta's seat slope, not the Recaro seat.  I think our favorite feature of this seat is the height adjustment knob.  It offers a continual height adjustment that is incredibly easy to set, rather than other seats that require you to undo all the straps and only offer a few step heights.  With the knob, we can just give it a twist every now and then as the kids grow.  With the ease of adjustment, we always feel confident that we have it set up right, giving us ease of mind that our kids are safe.My pet peeve with the Graco infant seat we had before was how difficult the buckles were to get undone.  The Recaro buckles seem like they are very high quality and don't take herculean strength to get on and off.  Those few saved seconds are crucial when you have a crying baby you are trying to get out of the car.Other simple things make using the Recaro a breeze.  For example, the shoulder straps have a little white stripe on the front so you can easily tell if they are twisted.  It might not seem like much, but these little things add up when you use the seat every day.  Also, as a dad, I'm happy these seats have simply colors and don't look too childish. They also look streamlined and not too bulky.  Their looks aren't a critical factor, but a nice bonus.Also, as other reviewers have mentioned, the kids sit up high in these seats and are able to see out the window.  Our kids love this and seem to deal with car rides a lot better when they can see outside.We've had these seats for several months now and have no issues with them.  You can tell they are well built and will last a long time.  Although we didn't try different seats, I'm glad we settled on the Recaro seats.

We got this to give to my little sister-in-law for christmas.  She asked for a sewing machine but we weren't sure how serious she was so we didn't want to get anything too fancy or too complicated.  After looking at reviews both on Amazon and elsewhere, we settled on this machine.  She had it out of the box and set up within a few minutes on Christmas day.  With some scraps of fabric, her older sisters helped her make a simple bag.  This machine was easy to set up and worked well enough for her to start working with it right away and with no problems.  I can't attest to its ability to handle more advanced users, but for someone just starting out on simple sewing, this machine offered a good balance between value, quality, and simplicity.  Also, its small size makes it easy for her to put away when she's not using it and not have it take up too much room.

Let's face it: kids are dirty.  And kids outdoor are even dirtier.  This blanket provides the needed protection from the ground and is super easy to clean.The surface of the blanket is a nylon-like material, but soft.  It's not a cozy, snuggle up blanket, but a durable, waterproof mat to sit on.  With actual cloth blankets, any dampness from the ground quickly soaks through and any crumbs or food end up smashed into the fabric.  This blanket, however, avoids both of these problems.  Spilled food can be easily wiped up or swept up.  The waterproof, thick, cover prevents any moisture from wicking through.Maybe the best feature, however, is the ease in folding it up.  One section has a sturdy card built into it to assist in folding it up to the proper size.  Simply fold the blanket lengthwise into quarters (which are stitched into the blanket to help you get the right size) and then roll it up using the built in "card" to get the size right.  Then a velco flap folds over to hold it all together and you're ready to hit the road, carrying it by the included shoulder strap.  One person can fold this blanket up neatly in a matter of seconds.  It's a lifesaver when the kids are ready to go!We take this with us everywhere.  Like the name implies, it is an essential for any parent, or really any person, that spends time outside.  It has stood up to a lot of abuse over the last several months and is still going strong!

I purchased this based on the review on The Wirecutter and I'm glad I followed their advice.Let's be honest: it's a toothbrush.  It doesn't need a ton of special features, it just needs to get your teeth clean.  And this does the job.  As the review on The Wirecutter mentions, and as confirmed with a simple search, the sonic toothbrushes are really just a marketing gimmick and all the extra cleaning options don't really add any true benefit.Having used it for a few months now, I have no regrets.  It has a small, powerful head that allows you to reach all areas of your mouth.  Unlike some weaker brushes, I can feel that this is really getting my teeth clean.  It has a very indiscreet "skip" in the vibration every 30 seconds, with a "double skip" at two minutes to help you ensure a proper brushing time.  This feature alone makes this brush worth the purchase over simple brushes.  I'm sure I often got impatient when brushing with simple brushes and stopped brushing too quickly without some guide to gently remind you that you need to brush for two minutes.  I focus on a quarter of my teeth for each 30 seconds and then move on.  I've actually noticed a difference in the feel and look of my teeth after using this brush.The charging base is also easy to use.  The brush sits on top of the base and charges wirelessly.  The base is concave and ends up getting a little gunky no matter how clean I think my brush is after use, but it's simple to clean.Overall, after my research, I decided this brush offered the best value without going overboard on silly features.  I also have no doubts about it's quality: it's a Braun brush made in Germany and I plan on having it for a long time.

Installed these in a mid 2009 13" MacBook Pro, 2.26 Intel Core 2 Duo.  So if that's what you have, these will fit.  Packaged well and easy to install.  They've been working just fine since install a few months ago.  With the price of RAM dropping so low, upgrading your computer to the max is a no brainer.

I needed a set of Torx drivers to replace the hard drive in my MacBook Pro.  I was looking for a cheap set as I don't need a set that will stand up to repeated use.  These did the job.  They were in fine condition on arrival and seemed to be adequate for regular use.  I'm sure you can find better Torx drivers if you use them regularly, but for infrequent use these are a great value.

Recently put this in my 13" mid 2009 MacBook Pro (2.26 Intel Core 2 Duo)  to replace the standard hard drive.  I did some research before buying and decided this SSD offered the most bang for the buck.  I've been using it for a few months now with no problems.Immediately after upgrading, the change in speed was incredible.  Very easy to install with clear instructions (combined with the guide on Ifixit.com). If you're on the fence about upgrading to a SSD, do it today, you won't regret it.

I can't compare this to other products because we used this from day one and never looked back.  As we were expecting our twins, a friend with kids gave this to us as a gift and said she swore by it.  Anytime there has been even a threat of a rash, we apply this and it's gone in the morning.  Haven't run into any rash yet that Grandma El's can't handle.  As an added benefit, it's easy to put on and doesn't leave your hands smelling or oily.

I'm glad to see Green Toys continuing the trend of blurring the gender lines.  Little boys who like trucks can ask for a pink one, and girls who like pink can also like trucks.  Like all our other Green Toys, we love this one.  The recycled plastic definitely has a different feel to it than new plastic, but I happen to prefer the recycle plastic.  It seems indestructible and is holding up well so far.  Lots of fun!

I admit that this bottle sits on my desk all day, it's not out hiking all the time.  I'm sure this is true for most people.  After using a wide range of bottles, here is how I settled on the Klean Kanteen:My criteria:  I sit at a desk all day and fill this up in the office kitchen.  I was only looking for a bottle to drink water out of.  I don't like the straw or sippy lids, I just wanted an open mouth design. Also, the ease of cleaning was critical given that I use the bottle everyday and was growing tired of the funk of other bottles.  After researching, the Klean Kanteen stood apart:1.  Perfect size mouth.  Nalgene's are wider, but too wide:  if you're not careful, it's easy to spill out the side of your mouth, especially when walking or in a car.  Also, the threads on the mouth are uncomfortable.  On the other side of the spectrum, I found the mouth of the Sigg bottles to be too small.  The size of the mouth matters not only for drinking, but also for cleaning:  I felt that I could never get the Sigg clean, whereas this is easy to get inside of with a brush to remove any nastiness that may accumulate.2. Just metal, nothing else:  I find that the metal bottles retain less "flavor" than plastic bottles.  My Nalgenes and Camelbaks seemed to retain a soapy residue after washing and also the flavor of anything other than water that I placed in the bottle.  The Sigg bottles seem like they are just metal, but actually has a plastic coating inside that started to flake away with time.  This Klean Kanteen is metal and nothing else, which always tastes clean and is also durable.  Although the metal conducts heat more than plastic, this wasn't a concern for me as I don't drink hot liquids out of the this bottle.3.  I would, however, get a different cap if you use this in an office or care about noise.  Inserting or removing the cap causes a loud metal-on-metal noise that is hard to avoid.  Likewise, the loop will hit against the body causing more noise.  Although the all-metal construction (other than a small silicone seal) is nice, it's not worth the noise to me.  Luckily, the lids are interchangeable.  If you don't care about noise, the bamboo lid is quite attractive.My search for the perfect bottle ended when I got the Klean Kanteen.  I can't see going back or switching to a different bottle any time soon.

As the time for the arrival of our twins approached, I wasn't sure that the idea of cloth diapers would actually be worth it.  They seemed so expensive and just gross.  Who wants to wash off dirty diapers when you can just throw them away?  Other than the obvious "green" factors, the idea of cloth diapers just seemed like overkill.Now, 14 months later, I will admit that I was wrong.  These are just SO easy, really!  With the addition of the Fuzzi Bunz diaper bag, we simply remove the inserts from the diaper and put them in the bag after each changing.  then, in the morning, we unzip the bottom of the bag and drop them in the washer, run a couple of cycles, and they come out ready to hang and dry.  The exposure to poop is hardly any more than disposable diapers.And being the pragmatic dad, the best feature of these diapers is the cost savings.  With these one size diapers, we have used them from when our twins for just a couple weeks old up til now, at 14 months, with plenty of room to grow.  I would recommend these diapers for this reason alone.  The cost of disposable diapers is enormous when you add up the cost from birth to potty training.  Although cloth diapers have a high upfront cost, it is well worth it in the end.Also, we've had almost zero problems with diaper rash.  We wash the diapers with Charlie's Soap and the kids haven't been irritated at all.  After hearing horror stories from friends, the absence of diaper rash issues has been very welcome in our house.One final piece of advice:  don't think of it as an either/or proposition.  We still use disposables at night and on longer trips out of the house.  When it comes to diapers, practicality is more important than making a moral stand against disposable diapers.  By using the cloth diapers at home and disposables when out and at night, we do our part for the environment (and our wallet) while still staying sane.

I purchased this battery online and noticed something odd, it weighs the same as my another brand battery that has a 1300mAh rating. Putting my engineering hat on I was wondering how that could be. I am familiar with the LiPo battery world and I know there hasn't been any major advancement in the technology in this market in years so that leaves one of two things; a) the battery mAh rating is lower than it is rated OR b) it has a horribly lower discharge rating.Putting the battery on the scale it weighs 110 grams while my BASTENS brand 1300mAh battery weighs 100. This is odd because the hard case should weight at least 10 grams, so I took it apart and weighed just the case ... the hard case is 16 grams. Ok, something funny is going on here. The raw parts of the 1500mAh battery weighs 94 grams! Thats significantly less than the 1300mAh *AND* more importantly less than the stock hard case 1000mAh battery!!! I should point out that the Parrot brand AR.Drone 1500mAh battery weighs more than 130 grams .... hmmmm ;)I decide it is time to measure the mAh on the next charge, I have a charger that measure just this. The trick is to put it at a lower amp charge rate to get the most accurate test. My results were as I suspected (see picture to the right in the 'Customer Images' area of this listing) it only took a 1292mAh charge.Now you may be wondering maybe I didn't deplete the battery correctly before charging or my charge meter is wrong. I ran this test on  another brand battery found here BASTENS 1300mAh LiPo battery or here with a charger BASTENS LiPo battery 1300mAh battery upgrade and balance charger for the Parrot AR Drone 1 & 2 type batteries Notice the BASTENS brand battery took a 1272mAh charge. Note that I used both batteries in the drone until I got the low battery warning then measured the cells, both batteries were at about 3.65v per cell. Point being my test was fair and scientific.The question now is why others have such good reviews, its simple. They are comparing to the stock 1000mAh battery and of course even a 1300mAh battery will be better. The point of this review is that this product is falsely advertising the mAh rating of the battery. My guess is that it is also has a low quality discharge rating as a result you will get less cycles.Taking a closer look at the product image, look close at the "charge at" on the label. Notice it says 1.3A. This proves my point, again let me explain. In general companies build LiPos to be charged at 1C which mean one times the capacity. In this case if they suggest to charge the battery at 1.3Amps than the capacity must be 1.3Ah (aka 1300mAh) using the 1C rule. Case closed.In summary this battery fails on many fronts:1) not as advertised, its really a 1300mAh battery2) has poor discharge rating resulting in fewer cycles (won't last as long)3) shame on the manufacture AND the sellers who are selling this battery!I don't know about you but I will stay clear of this battery in the future. There is no cheating this weight other than by cutting the capacity or the hard case. This is why I use a soft case battery, its the only way to save on weight without giving up quality and capacity.Happy Shopping!

As the product mentions the battery does provide more flight time, the down side is it takes longer to charge with the stock battery charger and its heavier than the stock battery. The fact is the stock battery only weighs in at about 105 grams while this battery weighs in at over 140 grams! That is enough to affect the maneuverability of the aircraft, a trade off but something to consider. I wouldn't expect using this battery during a dog fight but if you are looking for raw flight time increase this battery will do the job. I had a hard time fitting this battery under the shell, some shaving may be needed to get a proper fit.Alternatively if you looking for a increased flight times with no performance decrease plus faster charging times than the stock battery and charger there are other options:BASTENS LiPo battery 1300mAh battery upgrade and balance charger for the Parrot AR Drone 1 & 2 type batteriesHappy Shopping!

This is a beautiful feeder and very functional too. I've had some that are pretty but when it comes to actually using it and cleaning it they are a nightmare. This has a big enough opening to reach a bottle brush into to get it clean, plus it is glass not plastic and the hanger is sturdy metal. The only reason i'm not giving it 5 stars is the base is a bit tough to pry apart. My other style has an easy to clean base that just sets on but the bottle cannot be cleaned easily. This design has a better bottle, but then they made the base snap together too tightly. It's not a deterrent from purchasing again though because it is the best feeder i've used.

This is a great idea. The liner keeps light from reaching your potatoes so they don't turn green, yet it is still breathable. The quality seems great. I look forward to being able to keep my potatoes firm and fresh. It is new so I cannot say yet exactly how long they will keep.

Loads of fun on a small scale. The great thing about small scale RCs is building a course is quick and easy. I own over 20 RCs (I am addicted) and I have lately relized the full of crawlers. Most think that without speed its no fun but with crawlers its all about the chalange of the terrain. This little RC will flex raising one wheel up to 2 inches !! This thing is a great crawler in that is has awesome slow speed to grab traction up rocks. This is great for those bad weather days. Throw a blanket on the floor and you have an instant course. Better yet a couple rocks (rinsed off of course) and even more fun.  How about a book or two ... the possibilities are endless.Now about the car. It comes with everything you need to get running, hense the term Ready To Run (RTR). In all honesty the included batters are a joke. They only last for about 15 min. An upgrade to LiPo type batteries will provide over 50 min of fun with only about 15 min to charge. No joke, its a night and day difference between the included batteries and LiPo. Here is an example battery upgrade kit offered here on Amazon:Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery and balance chargerOther than a battery upgrade this RC will last a long time. No adjustments needed. Though you should keep an eye on the motor temperature. If the motor gets too hot that you cannot hold your finger on it for more than 5 seconds then give it a rest. Over heating motors is the number 1 failure in all RCs and it is easy to prevent.I recommend this RC!Happy Shopping!

Stanley is a well know brand. Though this may not be highest quality I was looking for more extensions without breaking the bank. At this price I couldn't go wrong and I was please to see that the quality was average. Exactly what I was looking for.Happy Shopping!
Exactly what I was looking for. No surprises as the items pictures were what arrived in the package.Happy Shopping!

They are as great as the description makes it sound. I like the rubber like edge which is better for kids. Having a 6 year old still practicing this is important. A kit to the face with a typical Frisbee could cut deep enough for stitches, not with this Frisbee. Surprisingly the rubber holds well and stands up to pavement and concrete. If you can believe it the rubber is soft to the touch but tough enough to handle hard surface direct hits.It fly's very well and is easy to handle. At this price it is hard to beat. I recommend this Frisbee!Happy Shopping!

Loads of indoor fun, will work on pavement. Best in the garage but will work on sidewalks and driveways as long as the cracks are not too big.Being 4WD it is much easier to handle in comparison to the 2WD buggy styles that Losi offers. This truck handles little jumps quiet well, remember the scale of the little car so don't build too big of jumps, resist the urge or you will break something. Since Losi is a well known brand parts are easy to find online. Other small RCs are a one-off design so often parts are nonexistent. Sticking with a well known brand like Losi makes fixing and upgrading the RC possible.For the price it is loads of fun and great when racing with friends. Since it is small it is easy to build tracks and courses.Run time with the stock battery is not that great, only 15 min. If you run a larger LiPo upgrade you will get more than 50min run time and about 15 min charge times.I do recommend upgrading the battery, keep in mind to upgrade to LiPo you have to buy a new charger as well, for example here is an upgrade sold here on Amazon:Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery and balance charger kit for the Losi 1/24 Micro SCT Short Course Truck / SCTE / Truggy / Rally / 4X4 Trail TrekkerWith a LiPo upgrade this car is MUCH faster! so before you hand it to a little kid they should be use to driving at partial throttle. Point being is the user has to be experience with the trigger because it is hard to handle at full throttle. Why have so much speed? really its the punch that is needed. If you come out of a corner to a little straight stretch the punch is used to pull ahead.I recommend this RC!Happy Shopping!

Loads of indoor fun, will work on pavement. Best in the garage but will work on sidewalks and driveways as long as the cracks are not too big.This car is fast, so before you hand it to a little kid they should be use to driving at partial throttle. Point being is the user has to be experience with the trigger because it is hard to handle at full throttle. Why have so much speed? really its the punch that is needed. If you come out of a corner to a little straight stretch the punch is used to pull ahead.Being 4WD it is much easier to handle in comparison to the 2WD buggy styles that Losi offers. This truck handles little jumps quiet well, remember the scale of the little car so don't build too big of jumps, resist the urge or you will break something. Since Losi is a well known brand parts are easy to find online. Other small RCs are a one-off design so often parts are nonexistent. Sticking with a well known brand like Losi makes fixing and upgrading the RC possible.For the price it is loads of fun and great when racing with friends. Since it is small it is easy to build tracks and courses.I do recommend buying another battery, if you do buy an upgrade like this one that will give you even more run time:Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery for the Losi 1/24 Micro SCT Short Course Truck / SCTE / Truggy / Rally / 4X4 Trail TrekkerI recommend this RC!Happy Shopping!

I was very happy with the performance as it arrived as advertised. If you are looking for software to use this with your Arduino check out "AccelStepper", it got my project going.The heatsink comes with a gooy type film on the back and seem to hold decent to the board. Seems to be working well. I recommend this board.Happy Shopping!

Loads of fun on a small scale. The great thing about small scale RCs is building a course is quick and easy. I own over 20 RCs (I am addicted) and I have lately relized the full of crawlers. Most think that without speed its no fun but with crawlers its all about the chalange of the terrain. This little RC will flex raising one wheel up to 2 inches !! This thing is a great crawler in that is has awesome slow speed to grab traction up rocks.This is great for those bad weather days. Throw a blanket on the floor and you have an instant course. Better yet a couple rocks (rinsed off of course) and even more fun.  How about a book or two ... the possibilities are endless.Now about the car. It comes with everything you need to get running, hense the term Ready To Run (RTR). In all honesty the included batters are a joke. They only last for about 15 min. An upgrade to LiPo type batteries will provide over 50 min of fun with only about 15 min to charge. No joke, its a night and day difference between the included batteries and LiPo. Here is an example battery upgrade kit offered here on Amazon:Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery and balance chargerOther than a battery upgrade this RC will last a long time. No adjustments needed. Though you should keep an eye on the motor temperature. If the motor gets too hot that you cannot hold your finger on it for more than 5 seconds then give it a rest. Over heating motors is the number 1 failure in all RCs and it is easy to prevent.I took my Trekker a step further and added four wheel steering using this controller :P Bastens QuadSteer 4 wheel steering control module works with either 2Ch or 3Ch transmittersI recommend this RC!Happy Shopping!

The quality was exactly what I was hoping for. Since I wasn't able to see the quality like I would in the store I was cautious but I am happy to see they are of quality vinyl. I am happy with AMMEX and I would continue to buy their brand.Happy Shopping!

The key with brushed motors is to not overheat them. Keep min mind this motor is not a high performance motor so don't over gear it. If you do you will over work it and it will overheat. Too many times people try to get performance from this motor that isn't there. The rule is if you cannot keep you finger on the motor for 5 seconds than it is too hot.If you are overheating the motor than you have two options:1) gear it different, which will lighten the load on the motor in turn decreasing the temperature2) add a heatsink, it a simple addon and will prolong the life of the motoraluminum side mount silver heatsink fin fits 540 550 560 35mm brushed brushless 1/10 1/16 RCs Don't forget to break in your motor when you get it new. Water dipping is a trick old-school guys used to break in their motors, but it would also help clean your brushed motors. You will need a cup of water and your motor wired back to your electronics so it works just like if you mounted it in the vehicle. Put enough water into the cup so that you can submerge your motor in it. Next, turn on your radio and your electronics just like you were going to run the vehicle. Run the motor, and hold it in your hand while you turn the throttle trim up until the motor is running at a nice, steady rpm. You don’t want the motor going at full speed but you also don’t want it going too slowly. With your motor submerged in the water, let it run for about 10 minutes. As the motor runs in the water, the brushes will contour to the shape of the commutator and help the motor produce more efficient power back in your vehicle. After the time is up, remove it from the water and the other electronics. Let it dry, put some oil on the bushings or bearings, and let it sit for a few hours.Happy Shopping!

A must upgrade to increase performance AND run time. Yup you read that right, it increases run time. Turns out brushless motors are more efficient compared to brushed motors.In addition brushless motors have almost no upkeep. The experts would argue that there is upkeep to any motor but the reality is for the averge user this has no upkeep in comparison to brushed motors. In theory this motor will last for ever ... if you use it right. To make it last longer don't push its limits. This motor is intended for a 1/10 scale (not the larger Summit or E-Revo), more or less for 5 lbs RCs.Don't over gear it, meaning if you put too tall of gear you will over work the motor. Stick to the charts and you will be safe.Keep it cool! The general rule is if you cannot keep your finger on the motor for more than 5 seconds than it is too hot. You can use passive heatsinks to keep the temperature down and keep your motor lasting longer ... like this one aluminum side mount silver heatsink fin fits 540 550 560 35mm brushed brushless 1/10 1/16 RCs Next to take advantage of the power in this motor you need a good battery. I recommend LiPo type batteries. LiPo batteries offer more power and weigh less. In addition LiPo batteries have no maintenance compared to NiMH (such as power cycling) and LiPo batteries will charger faster. Here is an example LiPo battery and charger kit (note you must get a LiPo charger, a NiMH charger will damage the battery and could cause a fire)LiPo 7.4V 5000mAH upgrade battery & balance charger kit factory fit for Traxxas connector 2x4 4x4 VXL Stampede Skully Rustler Bandit Slash Rally Brushless Velinion VXL-3s Brushless ready This motor is of good quality and you will not be disappointed. Its a good price for what you are getting. I recommend this motor.Happy Shopping!

Its a good price for what you are getting. I recommend this ESC and motor combo.Happy Shopping!

I don't recommend this card. Even with my Electrical and Computer Engineering degree and extensive experience with the latest gadgets this wifi card is not ready for the main stream. I had a hard time getting my android device to sync with it. The documentation was not helpful either. I was hoping to get this to work for my father-in-law but clearly it is not ready for the average consumer.I suggest they go back to the drawing board and continue developing, meanwhile I will wait for the next iteration.Happy Shopping!

I was a little concerned about the quality of the switch, no worries as it has good quality contacts, good feel and button is strong. Worked great in my boat. I would recommend this switch as it works as good as it looks in the picture.Happy Shopping!

Traxxas continues to lead in the RC market and still able to introduce fun changes like with the top on this one and the matching colored chassis.The great thing about Traxxas RC products is that they are built to last with a proven design. Parts are inexpensive and easy to find on the internet and at your local hobby store.By no means is this truck fragile rather if your doing a 20ft jump this truck will take the beating ... its all on how you land. If you land on the wheels you on your way, of course if you drop from 20ft doing a car wheel something may break ;)The fact is this car is fast for its size, almost too fast but that's a good problem to have :)I do recommend a couple accessories that will make the truck even more enjoyableLED lights. Who wouldn't like these?RC Car & Truck 6 LED Kit Set with Snap-In Holder Rings - 2 White Headlight / 2 Red Tail Lights / 2 Blue Fog or Parking Accessory Lights A LiPo battery upgrade. Don't get me wrong with the stock battery that came with the truck is fun but just doesn't last like a LiPo battery will. In addition the stock NiMH battery will not hold a charge on the shelf, so if you grab the truck you will have to charge the battery first ... with a LiPo you grab it and go. In addition LiPo batteries charge faster, take about 45 min or so. Here is an affordable kit that will speed the truck up AND I get run times of over 45 min of fun!Battery:7.4V 5000mAH LiPo upgrade battery and balance charger kit for the TraxxasI don't recommend upgrading parts to aluminum for kids use nor the RPM brand aftermarket plastic parts. If you do upgrade a part to aluminum or the tougher RPM brand parts the part will hold better but usually cause something else to brake that is harder to fix. If you keep the A arms stock than if you take a 20ft jump and brake one it is cheap and easy to fix.The stock servo may give out as they are the typical standard plastic geared servo that comes with any stock RC on the market. Go ahead and run it till it breaks then the trick is to get a metal geared servo. Increased torque is another good idea as well. I have found even the highest quality traxxas brand servo is not metal geared, so look a little harder for 'metal gear' in the description or title of the product. For example take a look at this servo:high torque and fast response servo upgradeIn the end I recommend this truck for bashing in the yard, in the grass, on dirt, and simply for loads of fun!Happy Shopping!UPDATE: One of you marked this review as helpful which motivated me to include one more tip. Most don't know that depending on how you drive the RC (full throttle all the time or just cruising) the motor may get hot to the point you may prematurely shorten the motor. The fact is with all RCs you should constantly watch the temperature of the motor. This can be done with a temperature gun and make sure it doesn't get hotter than 180F OR you can use the rule that if you cannot hold your finger on the motor for 5 seconds than its too hot and let it cool.If your driving style is pushing the limits of the motor than a simple heat sink fin will help a lot 540 550 560 can ( 35mm O/D Inrunner) size Aluminum side mount silver heatsink fin - fits 1/10 & 1/16 scale including the Traxxas models

Wow! what great detail and as an added plus the curves adds rigidity making the body stronger than previous body styles. Needless to say this outperforms previous styles by holding up the the rolls and flip type abuse that is put on these bashers.I do recommend adding on some lights, I was able to get creative by placing red LED lights in the back skulls eyes, blue LED lights in the front eyes and white LED lights down by the white teeth. Looks awsome at night. Here is were to buy the LED kit here on Amazon LED light kit for traxxas and other 1/10 scale RC'sHappy Shopping!

I have used this soldering station for years. The station is quick to come up to temperature, is high wattage so it can keep up with bigger jobs, and the dial with temperature readout is very handy. I have on for in my lab and another in my garage. I use my soldering iron for my small business so it gets use every day.The tips are also easy to change. There are many of affordable tips here on Amazon and elsewhere. For the price you cannot beat this solder station.Happy Shopping!

The reason why this will not get good flight time is because its way too heavy. The key is to get rid of it and use one that weighs the same but has higher capacity. This also means you will need to get a charger as well, which isn't a bad thing since the stock charger is slow to charge. Note there are some choices available but be careful, if you buy an aftermarket battery that weighs any more than the stock battery then the added capacity will be offset by the added wait resulting in no flight time gains :(There are higher capacity options that weight the same as this battery. You are lucky if you get 9-10 min of flight with this stock battery. If you are looking for more flight time, around 15-20 min flight times than here is a better solution:Bastens 1300 mAh LiPo battery upgrade for the Parrot AR.Drone 2.0 & 1.0 - a high capacity alternative replacement battery  - 15 to 20 minute flight timeYou may want to consider purchasing the upgrade battery AND charger is to decrease charge time. You could charge the battery in about 40 min with the a charger upgrade. The down side of stock batteries are slow charge times. With the stock charger this can take hours to charge. Now there are faster charger options, this is a big deal because previously there were no other options than the stock charger. The following charger offers faster charge times and is worth considerationBASTENS LiPo battery 1300mAh battery upgrade and balance charger for the Parrot AR Drone 1 & 2 type batteriesHappy Shopping!
No surprises, arrived as pictured and per the specifications. The plastic was good quality like any other version you would find in department stores.Happy Shopping!
arrived as expected. Good quality and fit my FlashForge as it was advertised to do.Happy Shopping!

I was very happy with the detail in this aircraft, it adds so much to the overall experience. In comparison to the balsa wood type rubber band airplanes this holds up better and provides more adjustments. The key is to tweak the aircraft for longer flights or for fun twists and loops! Of course this is a great way to teach the basics of flight aerodynamics ... and no you cannot just hand it to your 8 year old and expect them to have successful flights. This is a great family toy and eventually your child will pick it up and won't need help.I suggest getting an electric winder for two reasons. One, its quicker to wind the aircraft. Second and more importantly a winder with a counter provides a consistent thrust. What people don't realize if you adjust the aircraft but then wind the aircraft differently than the initial lift changes thus for consistent flight you have to wind the aircraft the same ever time.Here is where to buy an electric winder AA battery powered winder accessory for rubber band propeller propelled airplane Happy Shopping!
