This is a great replacement for your stock setup. On the other hand if you are going to spend money then you may want to consider an upgrade to LiPo as other have mentioned. Let me explain further. NiMH batteries are cheap and are often supplied with a stock RC because of that fact. With a NiMH battery the seller of the RC can claim its Ready To Run (RTR). The rub with NiMH is they don't hold charge on the shelf and they require maintenance such as conditioning. In addition and most important they don't offer the run times that LiPo type batteries can offer.Here is a link to a LiPo battery and charger (remember a NiMH charger will *NOT* charger a LiPo battery):Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery and balance charger kit for the Losi 1/24 Micro SCT Truggy / Rally / 4X4 Trail TrekkerIf you want to buy a second battery for 24/7 fun ! ! (so one can charger while using the other, charge times are only about 15 min):Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery for the Losi 1/24 Micro SCT Truggy / Rally / 4X4 Trail TrekkerBy upgrading to LiPo you will not only increase the speed of the RC but it will have more consistent speed throughout the run. Have you noticed with your stock NiMH that after half the battery juice is gone the top speed is horrible. With LiPo type batteries you will get that high speed for almost all of the run time.Most important though LiPo's offer longer run times (should be near double), they charge quicker AND they will last longer (meaning charge more times). The RC world has changed a lot since the development of LiPo type batteries. In my opinion RCs are now more fun because the power is unbelievable and the run times are awesome!Happy Shopping!

I have seen a few reviews already mention the same underlining point. This is a great replacement for your stock setup. On the other hand if you are going to spend money then you may want to consider an upgrade to LiPo as other have mentioned.Let me explain further. NiMH batteries are cheap and are often supplied with a stock RC because of that fact. With a NiMH battery the seller of the RC can claim its Ready To Run (RTR). The rub with NiMH is they don't hold charge on the shelf and they require maintenance such as conditioning. In addition and most important they don't offer the run times that LiPo type batteries can offer.Here is a link to a LiPo battery and charger (remember a NiMH charger will *NOT* charger a LiPo battery):Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery and balance charger kit for the Losi 1/24 Micro SCT Truggy / Rally / 4X4 Trail TrekkerIf you want to buy a second battery (so one can charger while using the other, charge times are only about 15 min):Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery for the Losi 1/24 Micro SCT Truggy / Rally / 4X4 Trail TrekkerBy upgrading to LiPo you will not only increase the speed of the RC but it will have more consistent speed throughout the run. Have you noticed with your stock NiMH that after half the battery juice is gone the top speed is horrible. With LiPo type batteries you will get that high speed for almost all of the run time.Most important though LiPo's offer longer run times (should be near double), they charge quicker AND they will last longer (meaning charge more times). The RC world has changed a lot since the development of LiPo type batteries. In my opinion RCs are now more fun because the power is unbelievable and the run times are awesome!Happy Shopping!

My son has a blast with this car. It is a lot of fun! Thought looking at this product page you don't realize what comes with the car. Note that this car comes with (and is mentioned in the description):a) 2.4GHz transmitterb) brushless motor upgradec) NiMH battery and chargerHere is a video link on YouTube if you want to see it in action: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DIW9hgEw9KEI would like to mention a LiPo upgrade will increase fun by increasing the speed and run times while decreasing frustration by no using the NiMH batteries (the batteries that are supplied with the car). NiMH batteries are frustrating because they don't hold a charge on the shelf. Meaning you should charge them before each first use if the battery has been sitting longer than a month. In addition you have to maintain NiMH by conditioning the battery.Meanwhile LiPo's drasticly increase performance, hold a charge on the shelf ( unlike NiMH ), need no maintenance, and offer more run time. LiPo's are worth the upgrade. Note you must buy a LiPo charger as the stock NiMH charger will *not* work on LiPo batteries:Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery and balance charger kit for the Losi 1/24 Micro SCT Truggy / Rally / 4X4 Trail TrekkerHere is a link the to the LiPo only battery in case you already have a LiPo charger OR just want to buy more than one battery:Bastens LiPo 7.4V 300mAh upgrade battery for the Losi 1/24 Micro SCT Truggy / Rally / 4X4 Trail TrekkerHappy Shopping!

I have been very happy with the performance of this ESC. Using a 2cell LiPo it has been a robust ESC with excellent performing drag brake. If you are an advanced user than of course you already know this may not be the ESC for you. If you just want a reliable crawler that you can hand to your kids that expect it will work every time than this is the ESC for you. I have not had to worry about overheating during my use OR when my son uses it.I would recommend this ESC.Happy Shopping!

We have found that this little charger doesn't seem to perform to the rated 1 Amp. The original battery that comes with the AR.Drone can charge up to a 1C rate of 1 Amp. The problem is if the charger only outputs 800mA than it takes longer to charge the battery, hence the performance complaints.The solution is to buy a better performing charger. The charger We offer can output a true 1 Amp rate and even more (remember do not charge the original battery fast than the 1 Amp battery or you will harm the battery or your self). You will get better charge times with this charger: Fast LiPo Battery Balance Charger for the Parrot AR DroneOr go one step further and buy an upgraded battery that will increase flight time and charge at a faster 2C rate of 2.6 Amps. The following battery will not only charge a little faster but it will also increase the flight time to 15-20 min: LiPo battery upgrade upgrade for the Parrot AR.Drone - 15 to 20 minute flight timeOR battery and new charger here: Fast LiPo Battery Balance Charger and 1300mAh battery for the Parrot AR DroneI hope this helps you enjoy your AR.Drone as it was intended!Happy Shopping!
Color very light. Starting to really fade after a few washes in dishwasher. Other than that the owl looked very good at first.
Color is very vibrant and pretty. Seems to be holding up well through dishwasher. Still looks good after several cycles compared to the dragon fly which can barely be seen anymore.
Color is very vibrant and pretty. Seems to be holding up well through dishwasher. Still looks good after several cycles compared to the dragon fly which can barely be seen anymore.

Great for low carb snacks occasionally. I had a bag which I hadn't closed very tightly and they weren't very crisp. I poured them onto a plate and microwaved them for a couple of minutes. After they cooled, REALLY cooled, they were BETTER than a freshly opened new bag! I microwave them all now regardless.
Excellent product. Worked just as expected. Thank you SO MUCH!

I think the other reviewer may have a cold!!! This lovely smelling candle is VERY fragrant! A strong floral "white flower" type scent. Just perfect as a background on a lazy summer day rereading a Rosamunde Pilcher novel!

These are great for loose tea. LOVE the bright colors and the whimsical shapes. The holes in the metal part aren't too large so most tea leaves are contained and don't escape into the cup. I'm very satisfied with my purchase and speed of delivery. THANK YOU!
I've worn size 7 for decades (& my weight is the same or even a few pounds less) and these were ridiculously small. Guess I'm now an 8. 😂
Great product for baking GRAIN FREE. I like that it's NON GMO and organic.
This was a fun, easy read which kept my attention. Others have dissected the plotline and flaws, so I'll just say it was an entertaining time machine to 1924.
Happy, if predictable, tale. Just a nice, feel-good film with beautiful locales and engaging characters.
Fun to hear everyone speaking with their normal accents! Not a "southerner" in the lot!

As much as I enjoy Laura Dern, et al, this show was just too top-of ones-lungs-poor-me. Really just too much screaming. I only made it through 1-3/4 episodes. Maybe the rest of the series calmed down. Also seemed very predictable. It was then I decided to REwatch Family Tree!
Babs got a "little" annoying after the first 20 minutes, and the ending was predictable but still an entertaining way to spend 90 min.
Great product! It does what it's supposed to! I have one for my car and one for my desk chair.

Please read my reviews of other julienne slicers AND the Paderno Spiral Slicer.By comparison this is made to order.I finally bought the Grunwerg Spiral Vegetable Slicer after watching a YouTube demo. (youtube.com/watch?v=kRFzjgeb54M) It was a little bit more expensive than the Paderno (and made of solid steel, not plastic) but it works wonderfully (still having trouble with the suction cup feet so maybe that's my counter's problem!) Only "drawback" to the Grunwerg is that it makes such LONG strands! Like 3 - 4 feet long! I have to remember to cut them before serving! Also there's that little nub of veggie left after slicing. I save them for the dogs!
Best Toasted Coconut Chip EVER!Crispy and Toasty. Just the right amount of sweetness and saltiness.Fat strips with tons of flavor!Buy some NOW!  :-)

Perfect size to fit in a large pot to can only 4 or 5 jars of jam at one time.But 2 of the rack wires were not welded to the edge.I don't think it will be an issue since there's no food involved, only boiling water. But it was definitely defective. Not worth the trouble of returning.

Because I really love "zoodles" (and carrot, parsnip, butternut squash, and sweet potato noodles), I ordered ALL the highly rated julienne peelers/slicers on Amazon to compare.The Paderno World Cuisine Tri-Blade Vegetable Slicer Paderno World Cuisine A4982799 Tri-Blade Plastic Spiral Vegetable failed and was returned immediately. It mangled the zucchini, didn't make noodles but clunky, misshapen strings, and wobbled all over the place. The suction cup feet were a joke. The carrot I tried never did get sliced into julienne strips but stayed in thick bands. (Yes, I had the julienne blade in!) And after slicing, the teeth were bent in all directions!I can only figure that the one a reviewer bought & raved over 3 years ago was made by a different supplier. This sort of thing happens all the time... companies change suppliers for one reason or another and the quality goes down. Possibly the "good" recent reviews are for machines which were made 3 years ago and just now found in an attic???I also tested the Gefu Spirelli Spiral Cutter GEFU Spirelli Spiral Cutter. It was about as disapointing as the Paderno and was returned right away. Read some of the 1 or 2 star reviews to understand why it was bad. Really never worked at all! Very gimmick-y. Makes me wonder if anyone actually tests these things before manufacturing them!A few months ago, I purchased an OXO julienne peeler OXO Good Grips Julienne Peeler and enjoyed using it for about 4 meals when I noticed the blades (teeth) which score the food before being sliced were all bent at different angles! The blade didn't seem all that sharp and dragging it over a carrot or parsnip was sort of difficult. However it had the widest teeth at 3.7mm making nice fat zoodles.Next I compared the Kuhn Rikon Kuhn Rikon Julienne Peeler with Blade Protector, Stainless Steel Handle and the MIU France MIU France Stainless Steel Swiss Peeler, Julienne Blade peelers. They both worked very well for hand-held tools. (Remember to anchor the base of the veggie, as one other reviewer noted, with a carving or large fork so you don't nick the fingers holding the veggie.)The MIU worked great, easy to use, but a relatively short handle which I found harder to hold on to. Comes with no protective cover for the blade, but I made one out of 3" of clear plastic 1/2" diameter tubing slit all along the long side. The teeth are 3.3mm apart which makes a thin spaghetti-type noodle, but thicker than angel-hair.The Kuhn Rikon has a nice long handle which I liked, and a cover for the VERY sharp blade. The teeth were only 2.2mm apart which makes a sort of angel-hair noodles rather than a spaghetti-type. Nice for root veggies like carrots and parsnips, and sweet potatoes; they cook quicker.I hope this helps anyone wading through the julienne peeler swamp!
