If you are looking a book with the most passionate love story ever told, pent-up sexual angst, and the good guys walk on the right side of the law, do not download it, in fact, don't bother reading anymore of this post because this book isn't for you. Sempre is several genres rolled into one; it's a YA at times but deals with very adult issues at other times, it's a love story but instead of erotic, it's a love story filled with sacrifice and hope not just between a couple, but between a parent and child, and amongst a family.Sempre tells the story about Haven, a 2nd generation slave, and Carmine, the son to one of the most powerful mob members. Carmine is the usual narcissistic wildchild who changes because of his love for Haven. Haven isn't the usual damsel in distress though, she has nothing, she wasn't born with any rights to strip from her. Haven's life has been hell and sheltered from the rest of the world, and even though she is scared and unsure when thrust into a new world, she does whatever is needed in order to survive, and has hope that life will get better. Carmine's father is a high ranking member of the mob, and even though he has sworn loyalty to the mafia family, he wants his son far from the mob life, even if he has to sacrifice Haven.Sempre is a tale about beauty found in an ugly world, hope blooming from despair, betrayal to protect the one that you love, gentleness from the ruthless, sacrifice from the callous, and it's about surviving when everything you've known is gone. If you have $1.99, go place a bet on the thoroughbred called Sempre, because this one is a winner.**********SPOILER*********SPOILER******SPOILER********One question has been bugging me, after Haven was kidnapped, why didn't the doctor track her GPS immediately instead of waiting a day or two?

The Lost Souls is a novella in The Holy Trinity series, although this series was originally planned to be a trilogy, the author gives us this novella before completing the final installment in the series.  Although The Lost Souls is being called a novella, it could be considered a book, and it doesn't disappoint.  TLS continues in the tale of a Gypsy clan trying to survive in a post apocalyptic world after a plague of Skin-eaters have destroyed most of the human population.  The clan are descendants of Romanian gypsy clans and although they have lived in the U.S. for many generations, they still have traditions and rules from the Old World; women don't have a say in marriage, and outsiders are not welcomed.  We learn in the two previous books, The Soul Mates and My Soul To Take, that gypsies caravan and move around often is so that outsiders don't learn that they have white magic.  Gypsies are gifted with a special white power, that power comes in the form of four elements: earth, air, water, and fire. There is a fifth element, power of spirit, but that is only possessed by the most powerful Roma or Gypsy, who also have the gift of the other four elements .  We were left at the end of My Soul To Take with Gerik turning into a dragon because the dark magic had taken over after his predestined soul mate, Trinity, had married Xan.  Trinity wasn't aware that she and Gerik had shared souls in previous lives, and she didn't know that she was predestined to share souls again in this lifetime.  Before Gerik became dragonized, he was able to unite with Trinity and pass on to her powerful white magic she was destined to possess.  Although Trinity was now more powerful than the Skin-eaters and clan members, she was dying from loneliness. Xan, finding out that Trinity was still alive, and she thought that he and the clan had abandoned her, left the clan in search of Trinity.  Xan finds Trinity at the end of the second book, but she is no longer the wife that he last saw.I was excited when The Lost Souls was released, I wanted to see how Xan and Trinity reunion was going to play out.  The love triangle between Xan, Trinity, and Gerik had been gut wrenching because there were two hot Gypsies in love with one gal.  One had loved her and shared the same soul in previous lives, and the other had loved her immensely and Trinity had reciprocated out of free will, not because she was fated to love him.  Now with Gerik out of the triangle,  I would get to see Xan and Trinity united again.  WRONG!!!  The author, Madeline Sheehen, changes course with this novella, this is no longer the Trinity/Gerik/Xan show.  The background characters from the first two books: Hockey, Shandor, Marko, Becki, Nico,and others, it's their stories unfolding in this novella.  It is a gamble by the author that pays off, because at the end of the book, I discovered that I was so caught up with the lives of  these characters, that I didn't have time to miss Gerik/Trinity/Xan.  There is minimal Xan and Trinity, mostly scenes from book 2 re-told, but at the end of the novella, we get a glimpse of the couple and their reunion isn't going the route that I expected.  The reader learns in this book to expect the unexpected.and two things to remember in this novella:  #1.  No one is safe  and #2.  No one is safe.  I don't want to give away any spoilers, but it was hard to see the demise of some that finally were given a voice in this story, you make that connection, and you get into their heads, and then you gasp as you watch their end.  One thing about this Gypsy clan, they know that their days could be limited, so they don't waste time figuring out relationships, they stake their claim, and have sex.Life is certainly hard in this post apocalyptic world, most of the human population have been either killed or turned into Skin-eaters (Skins).  The majority of survivors belong to the Gypsy clan, because clan members are gifted with some form of white magic that is hidden from the outside world, therefore they are equipped to fight off the Skin-eaters.  Also aiding in the fight is that info has been handed down for generations in the form of stories of how Skins originated, although most thought this was Romani folklore, the Gypsies discover that the centuries-old stories were true.  The Skins originated not because of some disease or government project gone wrong, Skins had been in the making for centuries. A powerful Gypsy named Mullo called upon dark magic to avenge the death of his family and clan, the consequence for his actions was that he would always hunger for blood and never again know peace or life without suffering.  Lore has it that Mullo is still alive, and the only way to break the spell of being a Skin is to kill Mullo.  The number of Skins is now so great that they are running out of food, both humans and animals; Skins are trying to survive, just as the humans are doing.  Shandor is unlike the other Skins, he was a Romani gifted with the power of fire, and to his surprise, he still has the gift of fire after he morphed into a Skin.  Perhaps because of that power, Shandor has maintained some piece of his soul, and works toward influencing the members of the Skins clan that he rules over to become more humanized or in control.  Shandor prefers his clan to eat animals over humans, he is in love with Tahyra, the Skin that he dethroned to take over as the Skin clan leader, and unbeknownst to him, Trinity's sister. Shandor's remaining piece of humanity could facilitate the eradication of  the human population even faster, if he trains Skins to emulate human behavior, Skins may be harder to spot.  That remains to be seen, just speculation on my part.  I have to throw out there that the sex scenes between Shandor and Tahyra are barbaric, animalistic, fury-filled, and HOT!!!  Seriously, if I got a companion like Shandor, I might consider becoming a Skin.Marko redeems himself from his bad behavior in book 2; in search for Trinity, he saves a Gaje, a non-Gypsy girl.  Marko ends up on the receiving end of Trinity and Gerik's souls and vast knowledge.  He has no idea what he is suppose to do with the power and knowledge, but he finds his way back to Trinity's camp, with a pregnant girl and two extra souls in tow.Hockey was separated from his group on their last raid, it's been months now, he isn't sure that anyone is still alive, but he is trying to work his way back to his clan and wife, Becki, while trying to survive the Skins and some evil humans.  Becki remains at the Gypsy camp, not sure if Hockey is still alive, whether she is married or widowed.  Life at camp isn't easy for a female because it's a man's world, and women still don't have a voice in marriage. But since it's a post-apocalyptic world, Becki doesn't let something like she may or may not be married stop her from seeking out another's bed.  But since marriage candidates are dwindling every day, Becki finds herself once again voice-less and being forced into another marriage.  Nico is desperately in love with Becki, who may or may not be married, and recently gave birth to a baby that she admitted wasn't fathered by Hockey. As we all know desperate times call for desperate measures, and Nico does just that to be with the woman he loves.I thought that The Soul Mates referred to Trinity/Gerik or Trinity/Xan, but now I suspect that the title could reference Marko/Carrie and/or  Shandor/Tahyra.; these couples have found soul mates in each other.I eagerly await to see the final installment because I desperately want to see what happens to Gerik now that he is a dragon and soulless, will Xan manage to help Trinity retrieve her soul and obtain forgiveness, will Shandor remain just a powerful leader of Skins or will he find a way to track down Mullo, and the fate of all the remaining players.Excellent series, this is the first paranormal/science fiction-fantasy series that I've follwed.  I'm not usually a huge fan of this type of genre, but Madeline Sheehan has made me a fan.I'm not sure how to rate this novella versus the first two books in the series; it is shorter than the other two books, and it doesn't have quite the meat of the other two books.  But it is being marketed as a novella, instead of as a book, so I'm giving it five stars vs. 4 stars if it was being marketed as a book.  The Lost Souls  provides an insight as to what is going on in the lives of this Gypsy clan and building up to the finale, while providing historical info on the Gypsies and Skins.  It is a fantastic read, and I recommend the series to everyone, even if you think that you won't enjoy the science fiction/fantasy/paranormal genre.

I want to take Karina Halle's "Bold Tricks", roll it in batter and deep fry it in a vat of butter and Crisco, then chew it up so that it goes directly to my thighs, and that way I will have a piece of Ellie with me forever because my cellulite ain't goin' anywhere. This book just rocked my world, I loved it, and Karina gave me one of my favorite female book characters. Ellie is part "Kill Bill" and part Lisbeth from "Girl With the Dragon Tattoo", she's the most intriguing character that I've seen in.... I can't tell you how long. Heck with the alpha male, this alpha chick trumps the men in this story. Ellie holds her own; she's not only capable of saving herself, but she's capable of saving all the alpha males in this series. If you are looking for a sweet romance with the wholesome female and the alpha male; just walk on by, don't stop here, don't peek in. Ellie isn't innocent, she's a con artist, she's a damn good con artist, but she really didn't have a choice being born to con artists parents that made Joan Crawford look like Carol Brady. If giving us an alpha female wasn't enough, Karina then throws in the alpha nerd, that's right, the alpha nerd. For once the nerd is pushed around once too much and instead of falling on his face in defeat, Camden comes out fists swinging and serving up gun power, and BAM taking on an entire cartel to save his girl.Love doesn't come easy in this series, especially when one is in love with the leader of a drug cartel, and Ellie has deceived others for so long that she no longer knows who she really is or who she can trust. In the middle of this cat and mouse chase with bullets flying all around, she finds out who she truly is, or maybe she decides to become a better person, but Ellie discovers that she isn't as bad as she thought she was.Halle breaks all the rules in this series, there's a little bad in everyone and a little good; you find yourself still loving the bad boy even though you know you shouldn't. The ending is brilliant, I love it because there was zero predictability; lots of readers love predictable or hate change, so brace yourself.In case you aren't aware, this is the 4th book in The Artists Trilogy series; a novella and two books precedes Bold Tricks. 5 huge-bold-flashing-in-the-sky stars.

This gritty tale of the Hell's Horsemen Motorcycle Club just got grittier, the dirty  became dirtier, and the WP  got wilder.  UnAttainable is the 3rd book in the UnDeniable series by Madeline Sheehan, and just when you think that the ride couldn't get bumpier or more surprising, Ms. Sheehan revs up the engine and you best hold on.Before I continue my review, let me just state if you are expecting an MC that sells legal merchandise and hates prostitution and drugs, please allow me to point you to Colorado, because in Montana, that ain't how an MC operates.  I've read reviews on the first two books in this series with comments such as "there was too much violence" or "none of the characters were likeable", does everyone understand how many of the REAL motorcycle clubs operate, look up Hell's Angels and the Bandidos.  Now, that we have this out of the way, are you ready to hop on the back of Deuce's bike and take that ride for the 3rd time?This story may be Tegen's and Cage's story, but it has plenty of Deuce, and I love it.  Deuce has evolved, and he's getting older.  But this story shows us pieces of Deuce that no one else knows, some of the Horsemen may know bits and pieces, but not all of it.  Deuce loves his boys, and not just his boys, but their families too.  OMG, Deuce taking care of Dirty and the others when they were boys, but especially Dirty, does things to my heart. Deuce has went from a life of bedding club nasties to keeping his MC ran like a fine oiled machine, he takes on all their problems.  But Deuce is still Deuce, and he's not always going to be perfect...thank goodness.  His relationship with his son, Cage, reminds me of a younger Deuce, the one that kept messing up his relationship with Eva, and like the younger Deuce, just when you think he has it figured out, he messes up again.Cage is as much like Deuce as he is so different from Deuce.  Whereas Deuce knew that Eva was the one as soon as he saw her, Cage doesn't figure out the one for him for a long time. In between figuring that one out, he does a lot of fooling around...A. LOT.  The scene where he visits Preacher and finds all the old photos from the past, it was a riveting nostalgic moment.  We see pieces of Deuce and Eva from her first visit to Montana, and we relive Frankie.  Cage's beauty is part of his downfall, it makes women easier to obtain, but it also made them disposable to him.Tegen, all she wants is to put her feelings for Cage and the MC as far behind as she can.  Tegen spends so much time reminding herself that she is the opposite of Eva and Danny, and sensitive that she doesn't fit in with the beauties at the MC.  What Tegen doesn't see is that she has a strength far greater than Eva's and especially Danny's, and in the end, she is actually more MC than those two.Now let's get down to the good stuff.SPOILER......SPOILER......SPOILEROh hell fire and brimstone...no more are the gates opened.....and BAM...here Sheehan hands the reader our first surprise....Z-freakin''-Z....ZZ...are you kidding me?!?! My second surprise, I wasn't expecting to like Tegen, by the end of UnB, I wanted someone to shut her loud crass mouth, I didn't care how, just shut her blasted trap.  Just a few pages into UnAttainable, and Tegan causes a lump in my throat with her feelings about Dorothy and feeling abandoned. Cage and Tegen are an example of how the author's writing has evolved. The characters are grittier and more complex than in the two other books.  I swallow the lump, turn the page, lo and behold, that lump that Tegen gave me is pea-size compared to the fist that Dirty has shoved down my throat.Dirty is killing me, and I don''t want Dirty killing me, I was in this story for Cage, Tegen, and hot angst sex; Dirty wasn't suppose to matter to me. He is chipping away at my heart a little at a time, and melting each individual chip. It would have been easier if the author just ripped my heart from my chest, sprinkled it with cheese, melted it in the microwave and then pour it over chips, and have a pile of Slittified Dirty nachos. I wasn't prepared to see this side of them, I expected sex, feckedupness, and badassery. I don't ever cry, NEVER-EVER, now I have a box of tissues, and I just want to cradle him and take care of him. I swear if Sheehan turns him into a murderous killer, I will defend him and nurture him until death.At 51% into the story, and my heart is beating as if I jogged 5 miles after 12 cups of coffee and 3 lines of coke. Stuff is hitting the fan because the club went into lockdown, and Cage and Danny just found out about T & ZZ, and then Ripper just blurted out my 2nd favorite line thus far "Does Dirty need a new name?".I've finished the book, and I cried, and I cried hard over Blue and I cried even harder when Deuce had a heart attack. Deuce....Cole "Deuce" West.... he had a heart attack, super heroes don't have heart attacks. There is a formula on how to create the perfect HEA, but no, this author had to be different, she had to show the vulnerable side of Deuce, show that he wasn't perfect, and then she let Cage be a a junkie, for heaven's sakes, members of MCs are clean-cut do-gooders that work with Habitat for Humanity and build houses for the homeless. Bikers aren't suppose to be hard-core bad-a** like Hell's Horsemen, they are suppose to pretend to be bada**es, sober, and monogamous. Madeline Sheehan took the cookie cutter biker mold and raped it with machete and then used an AK 47 to pump holes into the remaining pieces, then dug a hole and buried the leftovers. Sheehan had to be original, and instead of giving us faux bada**ery, she gave us raw, dirty, and gritty bada**ery. She had to write characters that we couldn't love 100% of the time, no, instead she gave us Dirty. When I wasn't wanting to cuddle him, I was flinching from his admittance of dosing women, then I went back to wanting to fix him. Instead of letting Cage be the golden boy and saving the MC from illegal acts, she wrote him as having doubts, hangups, troubles, and flubb-ups, lots of them. Tegan, what the heck, doesn' she know that heroines don't sleep with more than 2 guys in a book, are well-mannered, perfect bodies with a large chest, and wearing Jimmy Choos. Sheehan was suppose to follow the blue-print so that 12% into the book, I knew which characters were going to be together and live HEA. No, she had to be original, make my insides feel like they were being ran over by a Peterbilt, remind me that stuff happens in an MC, that bikers aren't perfect and they aren't always the perfect criminals. And they age, they don't stay 25 for an eternity, and they consume too much salt, and they have heart attacks. Madeline Sheehan made them REAL, and REAL isn't always pretty and perfect. I felt so many emotions, and not just the good vibes ones; love, hate, disgust, shame, healing, protective, pissed off, scared, worried, hope, and compassion. All of these in one book. Madeline Sheehan, be proud of your achievements with UnAttainable, you knocked this one out of the ballpark.
I am not a spelling Nazi, and I will overlook a few errors, but there were so many that it was difficult to comprehend some of the sentences.  I could have drunk texted this book with fewer mistakes.

It's been nearly a month since I read UnBeautifully, or should I say devoured UnBeautifully.  I downloaded it as soon as it went live on Amazon, I read it until 3 am woke up at 5:30 am to go to work. It was worth every second of sleep that I lost, it was worth much more than that.  During this month, I have read many other books, but they cannot fill the hangover from UnBeautifully.  I once referred to Madeline as the Charlie Sheen of the literary world, but I stand corrected; Madeline Sheehan is the Pablo Escobar of the literary world and her readers are the Charlie Sheens , she gets her readers addicted and leaves us craving for more.  Maybe someone will establish a rehab center or a 12-step program to wean us off our addiction.I think there are two types of readers for this series: you either hate it or you love it.  No middle ground.  I understand why some readers hate UnDeniable and UnBeautifully, because Madeline Sheehan forces the reader to make a choice.  Most of us envision the good guy/hero as law abiding and almost perfect.  That doesn't work with this series because these characters don't live in a 4b/2ba house, with an accountant father, and the mother is a Girl Scout volunteer.  These characters were raised in a violent world, one without stay-at-home moms and where fathers make their living transporting drugs and guns.  So when you begin reading these books, you have to decide whether to cross the line; do you remain in your world with your safe assumptions and defined rules about love and life, or do you cross over the line into their world and leave all of your rules and judgment behind?  If the reader decides not to cross, he/she isn't going to enjoy these books.  The ones that jump over are rewarded with a story weaved with characters unlike any that I've encountered before.  I must warn you though, that once you cross over, you can't go back to the way you were before.  The books and characters that you love before now become one dimensional and boring.  The book boyfriends that caused you to swoon (you know the educated, makes a billion dollars, and dresses his lover in Prada and Jimmy Choos), that book boyfriend will feel like a middle school crush.  You will no longer be looking at the man dressed in the Armani suit, your eyes will be focused on the man in a cut and wearing leather.  I remember when I had to decide in UnD whether to cross over, I looked up and there was Deuce staring at me from the other side, then he grinned, and I found myself hopping on the back of his bike and riding out the story with him.  I never looked back.Madeline Sheehan broke a bunch of rules with this series, she didn't give us a love story, she gave us a story.  She didn't give us a hero/heroine/bad guy, she gave us many characters, characters that are flawed, and when I say flawed, they are ******-up flawed.  Somehow Sheehan made their flaws and vulnerabilities appeal to the reader, the characters became even more desirable and loveable.  This band of outlaws see their own flaws, and they don't stop trying to fix them.  It isn't an immediate fix either, it takes Deuce years to get to a good place with Eva.  Just when he passed one hurdle, I felt myself wincing again over another ***-up, and hoping that Eva didn't give up, or hoping that he didn't give up on Eva.UnB is the story of Danny and Ripper, and like UnD, the book isn't only about the couple.  Both books are weaved with different characters and we witness how the action of one can cause a ripple throughout all of their lives.  Ripper has changed since his introduction in the first book, this is post-Frankie Ripper.  The previous fun-hearted playboy is now saddled with scars and anger, lots of both.  Ripper is still a member in Deuce's MC, but almost everything and/or everyone has changed somewhat since UnD.  This book could have been titled "UnFrankie" or "Life After Frankie" because the after effects of that maniac is felt throughout this book.  Even the characters that never met him, such as Danny, still feel the repercussions from Frankie's existence.  But these characters are survivors, they may not be polished and refined, but they do what it takes to survive, and they find beauty in places where others cannot.  This is what makes the characters so different than the ones in other books.  Remember in the Crossfire novels when Eva said that she and Gideon needed each other like air and couldn't exist without each other, this isn't that kind of story.  These characters don't cease to exist when they are abandoned by their lovers, they keep breathing, they don't throw in the towel, they try to fix themselves, and learn to forgive each other, and I'm referring not to just the couple, but also the brotherhood and the families.  And those flaws that I keep mentioning, well those flaws, they become scars, and as Ripper explained, those scars tell the most amazing stories.

I devoured the first two Crossfire novels, I mean devoured them, I couldn't put them down until I was finished reading them.  I waited impatiently for this 3rd book to be released, then I saw the ridiculous  price, I decided that I would wait, but curiosity got the best of me.  I downloaded the book on Tuesday, and when I was 11% into the story, I was soon wanting the bedroom scene to just be over.  I was so bored that I didn't bother picking up the book until Thursday and not finishing it until Friday.  I'm not against erotica, but it was tiresome to see the sex scenes repeated over and over.  For any reader that has read the first 2 books, we already know that Gideon is well-endowed, we don't need the same descriptions of how thick it is, or that it spurts a lot. We get that, we've known that since Book 1, what we didn't know was how the Nathan incident was going to pan out, and apparently it wasn't important enough to resolve in this book. There are so many sex scenes and so few scenes with other characters.  Her father's visit was over very quickly, and the outcome of an incident that occurred during his visit was pushed aside.Bottom line, the sex scenes are fillers for this book so that the issues and plots from the first two books can be dragged out to complete the next two Crossfire books.  Other than Eva feeling more secure in her relationship with Gideon, very little has changed.  Cary is still dating both Trey and Tatiana, Corinne still mourning for Gideon, Eva's mom still trying to track her, and Brett is still harboring feelings for Eva.I hope that the publishers are happy with my $10 for this book, because it is the last dollar that I will spend on this series.  The book being just mediocre isn't what angers me, it's the greediness.  I also think that the book was filled with sex scenes so that there would be enough material to finish the next two books. Most readers wanted to see the how the twists and plots from Book 2 would end, they were barely addressed. This series went from being one of my favorite to being a series of sell-out and greed.

Edited from original review: It's been a month since I've read this book, one whole month, an entire month that I've spent trying to get myself wrapped up in other books, but only to find myself still thinking about "Undeniable". Now I know how Deuce felt when he was with Miranda, but was still thinking of Eva. When a book is that good, and you're still feeling withdrawals a month later, and biting your nails hoping that the author will show mercy and have an early release of the second book in the series, "Unbeautifully", it deserves more than a 4.5 rating, "Undeniable" deserves 5+ rating. I only wished there was a book rehab to help me fight this book addiction, it isn't fair to all the other books that I've downloaded and ignored over the past month.***************************************************************************************************************4.5 Stars Before I get started let me just explain that this isn't your ordinary love story. In order to understand this love story, you have to take everything that you know about love and relationships, sweep it into a dustpan, empty into the garbage disposal, turn on the garbage disposal. This isn't going to be that kind of love story, because Eva, Deuce, Preacher, ZZ, and Cage aren't our kind of people. They don't live by our rules, they live in a society where drugs and other illegal activities bring home the paycheck, a world where wrongdoings will get you in the ground instead of jail, they have different rules for a lot of things, including love. This story contains violence, sexism, rape, and illegal activities, the characters are primal, they like to curse, they have double standards for men and women, and they like using 3-4 word sentences . But like I said, this ain't our world, it's their world, their love story, and their rules."I don't remember the day I was born, but I remember the day I found out why.His name was Deuce.He was my "why".And this is our story.It is not a pretty one.Some parts of it are downright ugly.But it's ours.And because I believe everything happens for areason, I wouldn't change a thing." --Eva Fox WestDeuce meets Eva when she's five, at Rikers Island, both were visiting their incarcerated fathers. Deuce was twenty-three. Okay, get your mind out of the gutter, it didn't go down like that. Eva did leave her handprint on Deuce's soul that day, but their love tale didn't unfold until years later. "I am Preacher's little girl. And I'm going to be just like him when I grow up. I'm gonna have a Fatboy, but I want mine to be sparkly and I want a pink helmet with skulls on it. And instead of being the club President, I'm gonna be the club Queen, cuz I'm gonna marry the biggest, scariest biker in the whole world and he's gonna let me do whatever I want because he's gonna love me like crazy."Another thing that sets this story apart from others, is that Deuce isn't a young millionaire, you won't find his pic on the society page, he doesn't give millions to charity, he doesn't date debutantes. Deuce is the president of motorcycle club. He likes to hang out at his club with his boys, they like to ride, drink beer, and fornicate...a lot. Deuce is eighteen years older than Eva, and their story doesn't unfold over night, it unfolds over years. His mistakes with Eva are fueled by his passion for her, it's raw and he doesn't know how to deal with it. Some of the dumb stuff that he does would have caused me to plead with any other lead female to dump his sorry behind, but like I keep saying, their world is different than ours. One thing that bothered me about Deuce is that he gave a speech twice about respecting women, yet he's threatened to slap a couple, and he didn't treat Eva the way that she deserved. Towards the end, Deuce steps up to the plate, especially with Ivy.Miss Eva Fox, what a character. I was shocked to learn what she did when she returned from Montana (it's so freakin' hard not to write a spoiler), and I wrote her off as weak. But as events unfold, I come to see that she was more than Preacher's spoiled daughter, she held that m.c. together. Eva did things that I didn't understand, but I realized that I'm in a different world than hers, Eva took care of stuff. She wasn't a princess, because a princess waits on the King or Prince Charming to show up, Eva was a Queen and took care of stuff herself. When Eva hit rock bottom, she hit rock bottom hard, and it was paining me to see how far down she went. In the end, I saw Eva as the strong one, but for the life of me, I cannot understand the way that she dealt w/ the Frankie situation.If you are looking for another multi-millionaire-playboy-meets-virgin-falls-in-love-and-lives-in-a-penthouse-HEA, then this isn't your story. But if you want to see a love story filled with many mistakes, regrets, obsession, primal fear, and lust; one where the love is so wickedly strong that it burns a tattoo in a lover's mind, then you've found your story. "If you were older darlin', I'd have you on the back of my bike and in my ****in' bed and you'd be not just likin' it, but lovin' it., beggin' me for more."One last thing, I didn't understand, Kami referring to the club house women as the "w" word, pot meet kettle. That girl was straight up cray-cray.Bottom line, I loved this book, I didn't think that I would or could, but I had to remember that our lives are so completely different than this band of outlaws. I'm a vanilla cone, they are Jack Daniels waffle cones sprinkled with tattoos, Harleys, and leather cuts.

I really love Pull-Ups both for potty training and for the 'I can do it myself' phase where little ones love to put their clothes on (and take them off!) all by themselves.The cooling sensation when wet does help alert little ones when they've gone, which is nice.  Most diapers just whisk all that moisture away, which is great, but it does make potty training harder.The only negative thing I can say is I sometimes find leaks when Pull Ups are worn during naptime or overnight.  So I try to only use them during waking, active hours.

*First of all, I wanted to give a heads up that this seat is made to fit oval or oblong toilet bowls, not round toilet bowls.I think this seat is a fantastic idea and I love using it for our daughter.  For some reason she has always disliked using a kid's potty, and even the kids removable toilet seat.  She wants to use the potty just like big people do I suppose.  So this is perfect because she can sit by herself on the big potty without needing a lot of extra support.  I like that the lid closes slowly and doesn't bang.  The light is interesting.  When you push the button it stays on for 7 hours, and it illuminates the back of the seat and also the water in the toilet bowl so you can see it easily.  The seat was also easy to install, not much more complex than a regular toilet seat.I would recommend this to anyone with young children and anyone who prefers to use the bathroom in the dark at night and could use the lighting feature.

This is a great toy that I'm proud to give to my daughter.  She is at a phase where she just loves building - with blocks or anything else.  She likes that she can build the house for the dolls in new ways, take it apart and try something different.  She isn't really into dressing the dolls yet but she might in the future.  For now she loves building the house and moving all the people and pets and accessories around.I love that this toy encourages her to develop thinking skills and motor skills, and it helps her figure out how things go together.  I also love that it's wood and not plastic.This would make a great gift, I recommend it.

I got these for my young daughter because she loves fruit!  These pouches are lightweight and easy to toss in my bag on the way out the door.  She likes that they are crunchy and sweet and also a bit tart.  I like that it is 100% fruit without unnecessary added stuff.  Raspberries are some of our favorite fruit (and apples) so we would definitely recommend these.

I love having this product on hand, I give it to my daughter a few times a year when she has seasonal allergies.  It's mild with no side effects, and she likes the taste.  It helps relieve some of her symptoms and makes her feel better, without a lot of artificial ingredients.I would recommend this for kids with mild allergy symptoms.

These are great batteries, they work well, and it makes me feel good to know they are made from some recycled batteries.  We are always looking for batteries in our house with the abundance of kids toys floating about and so I like that it comes in a 12 pack.  They also last longer than a lot of other batteries we use.

I like this cat food, I appreciate that it is gluten free, and I like the small kibbles that can easily be eaten by both kittens and adult cats.  Our cat loves it and gobbles it up with no complaints, so that is great too.I would recommend it to anyone looking for a holistic cat food that is gluten free.

These chocolates are very tasty and will definitely impress whoever receives them.  You can tell they are 'gourmet' by their appearance and taste.  They almost look too beautiful to eat!The box comes wrapped very well (if you count the Amazon shipping box, I had to unwrap 5 different things to access the chocolate!) and there is a little guide that describes what each chocolate is.This is primarily for those who love dark chocolate, but those who only prefer milk chocolate might find something that interests them as well.This would make a great gift!

Bottom line: This seems like a great range extender, but it hasn't been working for us, due to a problem with interference in our house.The good thing I can say is that it was really easy to set up.  Setup took a half hour or less.  The instructions were very clear and accurate.It seemed to work well for about one day and then stopped helping us.  We have one area of the home on the 2nd floor where we can't get a good signal.  We've tried another range extender to solve this problem and it also stopped working after about a week.  We had a technician come to the house to try to help and he couldn't figure out the problem.  The same thing happened after this extender was installed, except it only worked for a day.  I think there must be something in our house that is interfering with the wi-fi signal.  It does seem to help when the extender is shut off and turned back on, at least briefly, but then the signal cuts out again.I'm giving this 3 stars because it seems like a good product, but I think there is something else going on that is interfering with the signal.  I will update my review if/when we figure out the issue.

I have tried a lot of different brands of diapers over the past few years, and these diapers have been one of the most consistently reliable brands I've tried.  Little Snugglers are soft and don't seem to irritate or give diaper rash.  They rarely leak, and they seem to stay in place and conform to baby as baby moves around.  Sometimes I have chosen other brands just because they are cheaper, but buying Huggies on Amazon in a larger case like this is not too expensive, and I love the convenience of home delivery.  Also signing up for Amazon Mom gives an even bigger discount on these.  Whenever possible, I choose Huggies diapers because they have consistently been my favorite over the years.  I also like Huggies Little Movers and Huggies Slip Ons.

I use these cough and cold formulas by Hyland's once or twice per year when my little one gets a cold - fortunately she doesn't get sick too often.  While they don't take her symptoms completely away - only time can take it away completely - they do soothe her and make it easier for her to get through the cough and cold.  The cough syrup makes her cough less severe and her cold a bit easier to endure.She loves the taste and gives me no problem taking it.I always keep this product on hand in our medicine cabinet and pull it out anytime my little one starts having a cold or cough.

This is a great activity book for infants and very young toddlers, they will love it!  The book is colorful and features the Baby Genius characters.  It focuses on five or six different shapes and colors.  There are crinkly tabs and some flaps to lift, and there's a mirror.  There's also a button attached by string that plays recordings about the shapes and colors.  That is my little one's favorite part of the book.  This book opens up fully, not like a traditional book, and ties shut with string.This book would be a great gift for babies and young toddlers, perfect for a diaper bag when on the go as well.

This is a great activity book for infants and very young toddlers, they will love it!  The book is colorful and features the Baby Genius characters.  It focuses on the numbers 1 to 5, in fruits and vegetables.  There are crinkly tabs and some flaps to lift, and there's a mirror.  There's also a button attached by string that plays recordings about the numbers 1 to 5.  That is my little one's favorite part of the book.  This book opens up fully, not like a traditional book, and ties shut with string.This book would be a great gift for babies and young toddlers, perfect for a diaper bag when on the go as well.

These are really nice cups and would be the perfect first sippy cup for a baby or toddler.  They are bright and colorful, my little one was drawn to them immediately.You can adjust the flow, but even on the biggest flow there is still not a lot of liquid that comes out at a time.  Older toddlers would probably be frustrated that they can't get more liquid out at a time.They really are leakproof, which I love.  My little one has a tendency to shake sippy cups, so I'm glad these don't leak.They are easy to clean too.The little one and I are very pleased with these cups.

I think the nicest things about this doll are the size and the beautiful face.  Most of my daughter's baby doll's faces are a bit creepy, to be honest (the ones that are supposed to look like very little babies).  This one is beautiful, and almost looks like she did when she was tiny.  The face is pretty, realistic, and not at all creepy.The doll is small, perfect for toddlers and preschoolers to carry around.  My daughter likes trying to take off the hat and put it back on, and she loves giving her the bottle.  She even tries using the bottle herself and sharing with the doll.I wish they didn't make it baby powder scented because I have some allergies and sensitivities to smells, but so far I'm not overly bothered by it and I know it will wear off with time.Bottom line is, this doll is small and cuddly, and very attractive to look at.

This is a really, really nice stroller tote.  And I've come up with other possible uses for it too.  It can be hung on a stroller with the velcro straps, but it can also be hung in the car on the back of a seat, by putting the tabs around the headrest supports of the seat in front of you.  It can also be used on a shopping cart, so young ones can use the tablet or smartphone while in the cart, and keep wipes, bottles, snacks, etc at hand.You can detach the holder for the tablet, as mentioned, and the tablet and smart phone can be used while underneath plastic.  It is a little more difficult with the plastic there, but you can still swipe and push with your finger through the plastic.  So it protects tablets and smartphones somewhat, from being dropped or from liquid or sticky fingers.  And with the hooks attached it prevents them from being dropped too!There's only one problem I can see.  It has two velcro straps, but otherwise no handle.  A removable handle would be perfect for carrying the tote to the shopping cart, or in and out of the car, or when it's not attached to a stroller.  It is not easy to carry when it's full, and not connected to the stroller.

This is a simple toy, but often it seems that simple is best!  It's a bucket with a removable lid and a slot, and 15 plastic cards with basic pictures and words in English and Spanish.It can be used in a multitude of ways.  You can show the cards to an infant as flash cards, while you say the name.  Baby or toddler can dump the cards on the floor and put them back in the bucket, building motor skills.You can use this to teach colors, such as "which card is blue?  which one is green?"It also could be used to teach Spanish words in addition to English, or vice versa.For babies/children learning to speak, the cards can be used to encourage speech.  This toy could also be good for an older toddler/preschooler with a speech delay.Again, this is a simple basic toy with a lot of possible uses.  My little one loves it!

I love these slip on diapers!  We are at the potty training stage, so slip on diapers are really helpful, they go up and down like training pants or pull ups.  However, I had recently been having problems with pull ups leaking, particularly overnight or over nap time.  So I was afraid to keep using pull up diapers.  These however are a great compromise, they have the absorbency of a regular diaper but can be pulled up and down during potty training.  They also fit well and don't bunch up, and I like the easy off tabs for changing.

I love these earrings!  Purple is my favorite color and I think I will get a lot of use out of these.  They are approx. 1 inch high from top to bottom, and they are heavy, good quality - they feel well made.  It's easy to put them on and take them off.  They come with traditional backing on the earring and an additional plastic piece for added security.  They come in an attractive black gift box.I think they would look fine on their own without the matching necklace.  However, I almost always have a chain around my neck so I think I'm going to purchase the matching pendant to put on my silver chain when I wear the earrings.These are truly beautiful and I can't think of anything bad to say about them.  I think they would make a great gift as well.

Recently our family has used both Scott and Charmin, so I can compare this Panda bath tissue to both of those brands.  The Scott brand we've used has 1000 sheets per roll and is 1 ply, very thin.  This Panda bath tissue is 2 ply, much softer and thicker than Scott.  It is not quite as soft as Charmin, but just as thick and doesn't seem to fall apart as easily as Charmin.  You also don't need to use as many sheets per use as you do with Scott.  However, the Scott 1,000 sheets per roll does last longer.  We seem to use these Panda rolls up very quickly, it seems like I'm always changing the roll.  I felt the same way with Charmin as well.I would say this is almost as soft as Charmin, for a cheaper price.  This brand is ideal for someone who likes soft toilet paper but are on a tight budget.  Buying in bulk like this saves money, and it is convenient to have a case delivered right to your door instead of bringing it home from the store.  Bottom line is, it is a good soft toilet tissue at a decent price, with the convenience of home delivery.  Make sure you have room to store all 96 rolls, and you'll be stocked up for a while. :)

I ordered this in the Marina blue color and first of all, it's a very attractive color.  I was skeptical about it being leakproof but it really is, trust me my daughter put it to the test and it does not leak, when it is closed.  I can put some water and a couple of ice cubes in it and toss it in my large handbag/purse/diaper bag and it doesn't leak or sweat.  It keeps my drink cold for quite some time.  I don't use it for hot drinks but I think it would work well for hot as well.I also like that it simply comes apart and can go in the dishwasher without a lot of fuss.  Very convenient and easy to keep clean.I'm very glad to have this and will definitely use it a lot.  Did I mention it fits in my car cup holders??  An added bonus. :)

We've been using this product for my daughter whenever she gets a cold, and it has been working well for her.  She responds well to it, she likes the taste, and it helps ease the cold symptoms and helps her feel better.  It doesn't take away the cold but helps her feel better until it passes.I appreciate that it has no sugar, no dyes, and no negative side effects. It's a cold remedy I can give her without worry.  I always keep some on hand.

This animal train is very cute.  It plays songs, educates, and asks questions to help children learn.  The train can be pulled by a little one with the attached cord, but does not move around by itself.The animals on the train snap together and can easily come apart, and the train knows which animal is attached.  A child can attach the correct animal in quiz mode when the train asks "who likes carrots?" for example.I think this toy is more suited for younger children, I don't' see it holding the attention of a 3 or 4 year old.  My daughter likes it but loses interest after only a few minutes.  Also, the train cars seem difficult to snap together at first, but then when the train is pulled, they can come apart fairly easily too.  My daughter got frustrated trying to get and keep the cars put together.I would recommend this toy for ages 1 1/2 to 2 1/2.  It's cute, educational, and builds motor skills.

These cups are great for a backyard barbeque or a party.  They are a cool color, very festive.  Unfortunately mine arrived with a big hole in the bag so some of them fell on the floor before I realized that.  But I decided to let my daughter 'test' the ones that fell on the floor for durability.  She stacked them on top of each other and she bent some of them, but they never cracked.  Other plastic cups that we've tried have cracked immediately when they got dented.  So these are definitely more durable than other cups we've tried.The size is perfect for adults, it gives you a nice big serving.  It's convenient to have 100 of them delivered to the house too, instead of buying several smaller packs at the store.  I would recommend these to have on hand around the house, and definitely for parties and picnics.

I tried this product after getting back from vacation.  On most vacations I eat a little bit too much of the wrong foods and don't drink as much water as I usually drink when I'm home.  So I usually come back from vacation a little bloated and have to get myself back into a healthier way of eating again.  This product does help with that.  There are capsules to take before breakfast and with lunch and dinner.  There's also a powdered drink to have before dinner.  It didn't taste great, but it was okay, I was able to tolerate it.The first day I didn't notice much but days 2 and 3 I noticed I was using the bathroom a lot more.  It definitely helped me lose a few pounds by helping shed water weight and get rid of backed up waste.  I didn't notice too much reduction in appetite, although after the powdered drink mix in the afternoon I noticed less appetite for an hour or two.For most people, this product alone isn't going to make you lose 10 pounds or more, but it does help shed a few pounds and reduce bloating by a little bit.  I think this is ideal for coming back from vacation and trying to lose the vacation weight and get back into a healthier way of eating.  I also think it would be nice to use this at the beginning of a new diet plan to jump start results.

I love Hyland's Chamomilla and have used it with my daughter ever since she started teething.  Teething was really rough for her, it bothered her greatly and she would be agitated and irritable until the tooth popped through the skin.  Chamomilla really seemed to help her, it didn't take the teething symptoms completely away but it definitely 'took the edge off' where I could tell if I had given her Chamomilla or not.After she was done teething, and still now to this day, I give her Chamomilla sometimes when she is cranky from being sick, or when she is stressed out in new situations - anywhere that causes her anxiety, and it definitely seems to calm her down a little.  There's no side effects either, which makes me feel so much better about giving her a dose.She also likes taking the dissolving tablets, they must have a good taste, and they melt away instantly so there's no choking risk.I would recommend these for any parents whose child is going through teething or just for irritability and anxiety.

I have long, fine, wavy hair that I can choose to wear either straight or wavy/curly.  Because it is still warm and humid here, I've been wearing my hair wavy/curly.  As I was testing out this hair dryer, I realized this dryer is absolutely perfect for blowing out your hair to wear it straight.  The dryer is super powerful with a very strong flow of air.  It is so powerful I had to put it on the lower setting to keep some of the curl in my hair.  The diffuser attachment is great for getting nice curls as well.If you often use a dryer to blow out your hair, making it smooth/straight with extra volume, this dryer would get it done in record time!I like that it is lightweight and easy to hold, and an attractive color.  I tested out both heat settings and I did not feel like the high heat was any hotter than my last hair dryer, but it is hot enough to get the job done.  I also used the cool button which works well.If I wanted to be picky, the only negative things I could say is that it is a little too easy to push the buttons on the dryer while using it.  I accidentally changed the setting on the dryer a couple of times.  Also, I would like if it had a retractable cord - just my personal preference with hair dryers.  Overall this is an excellent hair dryer.

These little Stikbot figures are pretty cool and my daughter loves playing with them!  She's been sticking them on the refrigerator, the washer and dryer, and the front of the stove and dishwasher.  They also stick to the mirrors in her room and the bath tub.The way the figurines are designed, they almost always look like they are in an 'action' type pose, with very little effort.  My daughter does not fully understand the app and the animation effect yet, although she likes to take pictures on my smart phone.  I think she will appreciate the app and the animation feature more in maybe 6 months to a year as she grows.  The action poses make for great animation and I think even some 'big kids' would love playing with it! :)The tripod is a handy gadget to have and is a good size for my iphone, but the larger phones probably would not fit in it.  It's a great way for little hands to hold the phone steady while they take pictures or video.So far my daughter's favorite is the action figures but the whole setup - figures, tripod, and app is a fun package and I think kids of all ages would like it.

My husband is very very happy with this alarm clock, because of the large display.  He can wake up in the middle of the night and know what time it is without his glasses.  He couldn't do that before.  We have the alarm clock on his side of the bed because the display is actually too big and bright for my tastes, but he loves it.  It's also nice because all the way on the other side of the room, it's easy to see the clock.The radio and alarm work fine.  Setup was fairly easy.  I would love to test the feature where it plays music from my iphone, however the cord is not included for that.  So I have to try to figure out and buy a cord in order to connect my iphone to this product.  I am not sure what cord to buy, however it seems like it might be a dual headphone jack type cord.Overall we are pleased with it, I'm a little disappointed that there is no card included to connect iphone/mp3 player.

I have some food sensitivities, and we were having some friends over who have even more sensitivities than I do.  I made these cookies the allergy free way, with coconut oil instead of butter.  I also added in a little bit of honey.  I wanted to add chocolate chips but needed to keep them dairy free for our friends.They were easy to make, simple enough that my young daughter enjoyed helping me make them.  I made them in bar form instead of cookie form, I simply had to increase the baking time.They came out very nicely.  We all tried them and they are okay as they are, but I think they would be better with other things added.  For instance, these would be great as a crust for a fruit tart or an apple crisp!  I also think they would taste better if I added chocolate chips to them, or even raisins.  Just by themselves I think they are just okay.  If I could make them all over again I'd make them as an apple crisp with maybe some whipped cream or cool whip on top - it would be ideal for that.

This watch definitely has the Wow Factor.  It is large and shiny and catches the eye, but in a classy way not in a gaudy way.  My husband said it felt really heavy at first compared to his last watch, so it took time to get used to that.  We also had to shorten the band a lot for him to wear it.The watch has a lot of features, we like the display showing the day of the week as well as the date, and the secondhand/chronograph features are nice for using as a stopwatch, which he does occasionally.We both found the manual included to be a little confusing because it is a general manual made for several different models of watches, and it is difficult at first to determine if what you are reading applies to your watch or a different watch.Some of our favorite features are the water resistance - it seems to be water resistant up to 330 feet.  My husband's job involves water and he sometimes gets splashed and even has to work outside in the rain at times, so it's great not to have to worry about this nice watch getting ruined in the water.Another great feature of this watch is the ability to see at a glance what time it is in another time zone - or even one other time zone specifically.  So this watch is great for someone who is away from home, out of the country perhaps, or for someone with a close relative or friend who is far from home.  You can set up the watch so that you always know what time it is where your loved one is, or what time it is back home.I would recommend this watch for anyone looking for an attractive watch that is water resistant and with a number of great extra features.

When I think of weight management dog food, I think of dry kibble that my dog tends to ignore.  This is different - he absolutely loves it!  Even our picky cat came over to see what this new stuff was.  The can is full of large chunks of formed chicken in gravy.  Our dog scarfed it right down.  The chunks of chicken are large but soft to chew and I think even medium sized dogs could easily eat this.It seems like it could get expensive to feed our dog only this food every day, but I think mixed with dry kibble every day would be do-able and should help him lose a couple of pounds.  So far he seems to think he's getting a treat. :)  I also like the convenience of home delivery instead of buying it at the store.

These postcards work very nicely with our Canon laser printer.  I've used these postcards for advertising and reminders for my job, and I've also used them for personal reasons like family pictures with family contact information, birth announcements, etc.The micro perforation is helpful because no one likes a jagged edge when you tear them apart.  It also helps to fold first, they practically fall apart on their own after folding.I would recommend these, in my experience they do what they claim to do.

My daughter recently started school for the first time so I am on the lookout for possible lice.  I wanted to have this kit on hand in case of an outbreak.  I prefer to use natural or homeopathic remedies for myself and my daughter first, and save the chemicals for last resort.  I like the preventative spray and have been using it on her hair after a bath (a light spray or two), but I will save the rest of the kit for a future lice outbreak and hope I don't need to use it.  But I'm glad to have it on hand, and I am so glad this product exists.  I didn't know there was a natural/homeopathic treatment for lice before.

First of all, I'd like to say that my daughter LOVES this doll.  We told her that she could feed the doll and she immediately began feeding the baby the doll food that's included.  It feels a lot like play-doh.  You can use the shapes included to make the play doh into fruits and vegetables to feed the baby.  A fake juice box is included.  The doll does not drink, only eats.  She says a lot of things, either in English or Spanish.  You turn her on by pushing her wrist.  She chews her food and the food is supposed to fall down and come out in her diaper.  Two diaper changes are included.However, as a grown up I have to admit that this doll stresses me out a little bit.  My daughter took off the diaper and the 'play doh' food fell all over the carpeting.  When she ran around with the doll, little bits of food were falling out all over the place.  It was stressful for me to try to pick up all the food before it got ground into the carpeting.  My daughter picked some of it up but she did not see all the little pieces.Also, when she chews the food sometimes it sticks in her mouth and does not come out, it gets stuck in there.  There is an opening in the back of her head, you can open it with a screwdriver, to get out any food that gets stuck.  Well, I didn't feel like opening up her head all the time so I stuck a piece of plastic in her mouth to get the food unstuck.  I don't think you are supposed to do that but I did it anyway.Bottom line is, this doll is very cute and my little girl LOVES feeding her!  She really really likes the toy but it's kind of high-maintenance from an adult point of view, picking up the bits of food that fall out and cleaning the food that gets stuck in her mouth.

This is the best feeling toilet paper we've ever tried!  We normally buy those 1,000 sheet per roll toilet papers, and you have to use a lot of it.  You definitely use less toilet paper with this Charmin, however, the rolls do not last us as long as the 1,000 sheet rolls.Years and years ago we stopped using Charmin because we had trouble with our septic system and the septic service advised us to change our toilet paper.  I'm happy to see that this Charmin is septic safe and breaks down more easily now.If we end up having any septic problems I will come back and edit my review but so far, so good.I like the convenience of having the toilet paper delivered to the house instead of hauling it home myself.

This toy is delightful, adorable, and my daughter just loves it.  It's small in size, about the size of a toaster, and if you are creative, you can fit all the included food and accessories inside the oven for storage.  So it saves space - which I love.  The oven door is on the front and there are two burners on the top.  The accessories include a 4 piece pizza, 3 piece french bread, 2 cupcakes, 2 plates, a frying pan with an egg, and a spatula.This makes lots of noises and says lots of things.  There's lots of chatter and songs about cooking and also a lot of counting worked in.  There's a button for music and the numbers 1 through 5 on the front - your child can move the lever between 1 and 5 to make the oven say different things.  When you put something on the burner it makes a sizzling noise.  The food snaps together and comes apart which builds motor skills and encourages counting.We don't have space for a full kitchen toy set in our home but this oven does a lot in a small space, and it holds my daughter's attention.  I would recommend it!

We had a death in the family earlier this summer, and I've been using these cards to print out Thank You cards from the family, for all those who have given us support over the last few months.  These work well with our laser printer.  I like that they come with envelopes included, one less thing to worry about buying, and I can print the cards and envelopes all at once if I choose.The thickness is okay, not too thick and not very thin either.  It definitely works better if you fold them a couple of times before tearing them apart, no one wants a torn looking edge.I like the convenience of having the cards and envelopes together, and this works well as it was intended to be used, with a laser printer.

Recently I had nail tips on my fingernails, and when I took them off, they left damage to my nail beds - some rough patches and ridges that weren't there before.  I was looking forward to trying this nail care kit to help fix some of the damage.It was easy to use, right out of the package.  I didn't really even need the instructions.  It didn't work right away, but I removed and reinstalled the included battery and there was a red piece of plastic in there that fell out.  After that it worked well.There are 3 attachments - filing, buffing, and shining.  There are 2 speed settings.  I used all 3 attachments on my fingers and my toes.  I didn't like the filing attachment as much, but I did like the buffing and shining attachments.  The filing one worked well for my toes, but on my fingers it felt too rough, it was hard to file my nails without hitting the skin on my fingers which didn't feel great.  On my feet however where my skin is tougher it was fine.This is a convenient tool which makes filing and buffing go quicker, and I did like the way my nails looked afterwards.  Of course and emery board and some effort works really well too.  If you have trouble reaching your toes to use the emery board by hand, this would probably help a bit to get to all your toes.Bottom line is: this works, but some people are going to prefer just using an emery board, which is cheaper and simpler.

I have been using Free and Clear detergent since before my daughter was born.  I love it, and I use it for the whole family.  I have sensitivities to fragrance so love that there are no fragrances.  I also use Oxi Clean in the laundry to brighten it and get out stains.These pacs are great because they are quick and convenient.  No measuring required.  Just toss in the machine and go.I would recommend these and would definitely get them again.

***NOTE*** I had to edit my review and take this bath mat down to 2 stars, because after only one use and one trip through the washer and dryer, there are 3 small holes in this bath mat!  I washed it in cold water, with a load of towels, and dried it on permanent press which is a more gentle setting.  I don't know what happened, but I don't feel like I can use it now, with the holes in it. ***Original Review:Our bathroom is gray, white, and purple, so I was excited to try out this purple bath mat.  Our old bath mat is getting faded from washing and using and this one is a nice vivid pop of purple color.  It feels great on your feet when you step out of the shower.  It is easy to wash and re-use.Personally I feel like the 17x24 inch size is a bit too small.  Our old bath mat is bigger and gives more coverage from dripping when we get out of the shower.Bottom line is I really like the function and color, I would just prefer the bigger size.

I have long wavy hair and this product does really help my curls look nice, without being crunchy and stiff, and without frizziness.  I really liked the results I got from it.The only negative thing I have to say is that the fragrance is very strong.  It is definitely not unscented.  I have some sensitivities and allergies to scents and I was barely able to tolerate the fragrance.The product worked great on my curls though and lasted over a day.

This is a really cute purse that would be perfect for any young lady.  It measures 7"x7"x3.5" deep, and the strap drop is 23", making it long enough to be used as a cross body bag.  Or you could tie a knot in the chain to make it shorter.This bag is very feminine and girly and reminds me more of a bag for a pre-teen or a teenage girl, but an adult could pull it off with the right outfit.  It has a Parisian look in my opinion, it reminds me of my time in Europe.There is one small interior pocket, the rest is one big compartment.I would recommend this bag to anyone looking for a purse for a young lady or anyone looking for a unique fashion accessory.I received a sample of this product for review purposes.

I love this headlamp!  First of all, when I took it out of the package, I was almost blinded by how bright the light is. :)  It is super bright!  It is easy to push a button to turn it on or off (while you are wearing it) and to turn it to flashing, even a red light.I like the adjustable strap, it is very comfortable.  It doesn't feel heavy when you wear it either.This will come in handy for camping, for a survival "go bag" and even for around the house, for taking the trash out to the curb at night, etc, etc.I received a sample of this product for review purposes and I'm very glad to have it.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a headlamp, or for a survival bag, camping gear, etc.

This is a great toy, my daughter and my husband had a blast putting it together.  It really holds her attention well, she loves to push the remote button and make the car go forward and back.  The elevator is so much fun - seeing the car go up and down.This is rather big so make sure you have the floor space for it, it is 4 or 5 feet long and maybe 3 feet wide.  Also, once it is apart it takes a while to put back together.We had this set up for at least a week before we had to put the track away because company was coming, but my daughter still likes to play with the car and the remote on the floor by themselves, so that is a play option as well.We really like this racetrack toy and I'm thinking about buying a second car for the track.  This is a great family toy.

This is a great dog food brand.  I like feeding my dog a grain free diet whenever possible, he sometimes has a sensitive tummy but I never have any trouble when he eats grain free food.  And the added healthy fats give him healthier skin and fur.  My dog has been eating it with no complaints as well, which is important!He's actually a medium sized dog and he has no trouble eating this food, the kibbles aren't too big for him.  The price seems reasonable too compared to other specialty grain free brands out there.  And the home delivery is very convenient, much nicer than dragging a heavy bag home from the store.I would recommend this dog food to anyone looking for a grain free dog food for their pet.

This is a very nice detangler, with a great added benefit of allowing me to go longer between washings if I need to.  I use this product for my daughter.  She has fine, wavy hair, that also gets dry.  If I do not wash and deep condition her hair every few days it starts to get dried out and the tangles get even worse.  I've discovered that if I spray this product in her dry hair and brush it out, it gets softer, shinier and more moisturized.  It looks like it was freshly washed and conditioned even if it's been a few days.The smell took some getting used to but now I like it.  I would recommend this as a detangler and also for adding moisture and shine.

This mop is really nice from a space-saving perspective.  The separate buckets fit inside each other and the mop goes on top, so it takes up very little closet space.  This is very nice for us because we live in a small space.The mop and bucket were easy to put together, and it's easy to learn how to spin the mop.The one thing I do not understand is the claim that is made that the 'clean and dirty water are kept separate'.  This is not true.  As soon as you rinse your mop after the first use, the clean water is now dirty.  I tried many times to figure out what they meant by keeping the water separate - I thought maybe I was doing something wrong, but no.  It doesn't really work that way.Also, if you are doing a large area, you will have to refill the clean side and empty out the dirty side several times.  The mop is so absorbent, that it sucks up a lot of water from the 'clean' side.  And then when you spin it that water goes in the dirty side.  But after a few times the clean side is empty, and the dirty side is so full that you can't spin water out of the mop anymore without emptying it.  I mopped our kitchen and bathroom with this and had to change the water one time.  Not too bad, but they aren't big rooms.  I was surprised how quickly I ran out of water.Overall, this mop is okay and works well for us.  I like the space saving design, but I don't like the misleading statement about keeping water separate and I don't like changing the water so often.

These work well for refrigerators, filing cabinets, even washing machines and dryers.  They also work well on bathroom tile.  And possibly wood paneling.  I haven't had as much success with painted drywall, but for our needs this works well.  It holds light objects like a few pieces of paper or pictures.  They are easy to use and remove and re-use again.The colors are bright and attractive.  I think these would work well particularly in a home office setting or family organizational area for hanging schedules, calendars, pictures, notes, etc.  They would also work well in a kid's room.

These bottles are a very classy off-white color that goes with any decor, and works for either boy or girl.  They work well and seem to cause less gas bubbles than other bottles due to the vent holes on the bottom.Another thing I noticed about these bottles is the nipples are more thick and strong and seem to last longer before they get holes in them.  They hold up well even when baby gets teeth. :)We have the larger 9 oz size and this smaller 5 oz size.  These little sizes are nice for carrying in your bag 'on the go' and can even be used as baby's first sippy cup if you like.I also like that the bottom and the top come completely off for cleaning purposes.  You can even sterilize them in the microwave by filling the bottom with water.  The lid also doubles as a measuring cup.  I was impressed at all the possible uses.But most importantly they do seem to cut down on gas, and my baby seems to love drinking from them!

My dog loves this stuff!  I alternate it with dry food and he looks forward to it like a treat.  I like that there is no artificial colors or flavors.  What more can I say?  Even the finicky cat tries to sneak some of this food so it must be good. :)  We would recommend it.

These bottles are a very adorable light blue color.  They work well and seem to cause less gas bubbles than other bottles due to the vent holes on the bottom.Another thing I noticed about these bottles is the nipples are more thick and strong and seem to last longer before they get holes in them.  They hold up well even when baby gets teeth. :)We have the larger 9 oz size and this smaller 5 oz size.  These little sizes are nice for carrying in your bag 'on the go' and can even be used as baby's first sippy cup if you like.I also like that the bottom and the top come completely off for cleaning purposes.  You can even sterilize them in the microwave by filling the bottom with water.  The lid also doubles as a measuring cup.  I was impressed at all the possible uses.But most importantly they do seem to cut down on gas, and my baby seems to love drinking from them!

These bottles are a very cute pink color.  They work well and seem to cause less gas bubbles than other bottles due to the vent holes on the bottom.Another thing I noticed about these bottles is the nipples are more thick and strong and seem to last longer before they get holes in them.  They hold up well even when baby gets teeth. :)We have the larger 9 oz size and this smaller 5 oz size.  These little sizes are nice for carrying in your bag 'on the go' and can even be used as baby's first sippy cup if you like.I also like that the bottom and the top come completely off for cleaning purposes.  You can even sterilize them in the microwave by filling the bottom with water.  The lid also doubles as a measuring cup.  I was impressed at all the possible uses.But most importantly they do seem to cut down on gas, and my baby seems to love drinking from them!

These bottles are a very classy off white color, which works well for boys or girls and goes with any nursery them.  They work well and seem to cause less gas bubbles than other bottles due to the vent holes on the bottom.Another thing I noticed about these bottles is the nipples are more thick and strong and seem to last longer before they get holes in them.  They hold up well even when baby gets teeth. :)I also like that the bottom and the top come completely off for cleaning purposes.  You can even sterilize them in the microwave by filling the bottom with water.  The lid also doubles as a measuring cup.  I was impressed at all the possible uses.But most importantly they do seem to cut down on gas, and my baby seems to love drinking from them!

This doll is adorable, and absolutely perfect for my daughter - who loves to take things apart and put them back together.  Yes, she has to ask for help sometimes because the buttons are too hard for her occasionally (the arms and legs come apart and together by buttons).  But she likes it.  She also likes taking the hair bows off and changing them.  And she is at the age where she is really starting to love dolls and 'babies' so she likes it simply because it's a cute doll.It's actually larger than I expected, which makes it easier to snuggle and carry around, maybe even fall asleep with.I agree with other reviewers who said that this doll helps build fine motor skills.  I would recommend it for any little one who loves dolls, and even more so if she likes taking things apart and putting them back together :).

These work nicely with the Tru-Fit underwear.  They absorb a lot of wetness, and they work great for potty training older children (children who potty train late because of special needs), or for children with bed wetting problems.  When they have sleepovers there is no embarrassment because someone is wearing 'diapers' - they look just like regular underwear.We would recommend these.

My family and I have been using a surround sound system by RCA, with 6 speakers all around the room, that is at least 15 years old, possibly older.  Recently though, one of the speakers has broken and the sound quality has diminished.  So I was pleased to be given the opportunity to try out this Yamaha sound bar.My husband hooked it up and he said it was very easy, it took him less than an hour.  It would have been quicker except our TV didn't have the right plug in the back so he had to find a way around that problem.The results have been great.  We are very pleased with it.  We all feel that the sound quality is equal to the quality of our old RCA sound system (before one speaker broke).  Is the sound quality better than a new surround sound system with many different speakers?  I don't know.  Maybe not.  But for us, this is perfect, it gives the sound quality we were accustomed to, and best of all - it SAVES SPACE.One sound bar takes the place of 6 speakers around the room and one receiver.  We live in a small apartment and space is precious.  So we get to downsize and just use this one attractive simple sound bar.  There are less wires and cords to worry about too.It is attractive to look at, looks great with the flat screen TV's.  It is a little longer than we realized and actually doesn't fit in front of the TV because of our entertainment center.  So we had to put it above the TV on top of the entertainment center.For us, there is hardly anything negative to say about this sound bar and lots of positive things to say, we are very pleased to have it and would recommend it to anyone needing good sound in a small space.

I use a kitchen scale both for weighing food, and also for mailing envelopes and packages.  I like this scale because you can use the clear bowl attachment or you can take the bowl off and just use the scale.  You can also use your own plate or bowl on the scale.It is easy to use, and takes 2 AAA batteries (not included).If you are looking for an inexpensive scale to weigh small items like food and small packages, this is a nice scale to use.I received a sample of this item for review purposes.

These bottles are a very adorable light blue color.  They work well and seem to cause less gas bubbles than other bottles due to the vent holes on the bottom.I also like that the bottom and the top come completely off for cleaning purposes.  You can even sterilize them in the microwave by filling the bottom with water.  The lid also doubles as a measuring cup.  I was impressed at all the possible uses.But most importantly they do seem to cut down on gas, and my baby seems to love drinking from them!
