That option has disappeared in the 2013 version, but you can accomplish the same thing by going into each account that you want to exclude and checking a different box called "Keep this account separate" which isn't very enlightening.I will continue to exercise both the PC application and the new mobile app and report back later, but so far it has been a pain-free upgrade, and I am really hoping to finally "go mobile" with Quicken - like I used to do some years ago, except hopefully better.

Earlier this year I bought a Carson LM-20 2X LED Illuminated Magnifier & Desk Lamp because I needed a lighted magnifier for doing some hobby projects, and also to pull slivers and thorns that I get from gardening out my fingertips.  I selected that product because it seemed to best fit my needs at the time, and it has worked well for its intended purpose.Now comes along the Normande lamp, which is almost identical in size and can serve many of the same purposes.  Which should you choose?  Here is a comparison:Compared to the Carson, the Normande:- Has a magnifier of similar size and power, but lacks the small higher-power 5x spot magnifier of the Carson.- Uses a circular fluorescent light that provides much more light than the 2 LED lights in the Carson.- Must be plugged in to 120v power for the light to work, while the Carson can run on batteries if necessary but also can be plugged in, albeit with one of those annoying little power bricks.- Is much lighter, so much so that it skates around on your work surface.  The Carson is just heavy enough to stay put.- Is usable as a task light on your tabletop, while the Carson really can't be used as a lamp.- Has a cover that flips up & down to expose or cover the magnifier, which the Carson lacks.  This helps keep dust off of the magnifier, and is also a very important safety feature - see NOTE below.- Subjectively feels a bit "cheap" compared to the Carson, even though both are made of plastic.If I had gotten both of these units at the same time and only kept one, it would have been a close race but with a slight nod to the Normande because of its dual-purpose capability as a lamp and magnifier, and also because it has a cover on the magnifier, but it lacks the 5x magnifier and the "nicer" feel of the Carson.NOTE on magnifier cover:  If you *ever* leave a magnifier of any kind in a location that can be reached by natural sunlight, beware!  If you are not careful, it could focus the sunlight onto a combustible surface and start a fire very quickly as any schoolkid knows.  I almost had this happen years ago, so know to be careful.

When the old Actiontec modem that I got from Qwest failed, I got this unit to replace it.  I plugged it in, it self-configured itself for Qwest/CenturyLink, and I was up and running.  No need to use a setup CD like Qwest supplied with the old unit.  It has now been running on my network for several months without a hitch.Conclusion:  Simple & reliable unit for Qwest/CenturyLink.It does have a few drawbacks that may or may not be important to you:1. Very basic DHCP server.  I run a home network that has several devices that require specific IP addresses, but I don't see any way for this unit to provide some fixed addresses with others dynamically assigned.  Not a big deal, but I'm glad that I have another more sophisticated DHCP server on my network that can provide this capability.2. Very basic blocking capabilities.  For example, I don't see any way to have it block a certain web site during certain hours: it only allows you to block completely or not at all.One other thing that I haven't figured out yet is whether this modem will work with CenturyLink's higher-speed services or not.  I have been limited to their 1.5m service until just recently, when they upgraded to fiber in my area, and now supposedly 7m and 12m speeds are available.  CenturyLink uses VDSL2 for some of their higher-speed services, and since the GT784WN is an ADSL2 unit I am not sure yet if it will work with a speed upgrade I am hoping to get.  Will update this if/when I learn something about this.Other than the comments above, this is a very satisfactory unit.UPDATE 12/28/11:  When CenturyLink *finally* introduced faster (12m) service in my area and I upgraded to it, this unit continued to work just fine at the new speed.Some people have reported that this unit doesn't work on Qwest/CenturyLink, but one thing to keep in mind is that CenturyLink uses at least 2 different DSL technologies.  This unit works with the "ADSL" variety and not the "VDSL" variety, so you need to check that before trying to use this unit or complaining that this one does not work.One other CenturyLink tip that I don't think is specific to this unit:  Sometime after I upgraded to the higher-speed service, I lost the ability to refer to most of the computers on my home network by name, i.e. when I did a Ping or RDP to another of my computers by name, it could no longer be found, although they still could be addressed by their IP addresses.  After much frustration, I finally fixed this by overriding the DNS addresses provided by CenturyLink and replacing them with the free DNS provided by Google (8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) and that fixed the problem.  Not sure if the problem was caused by this Actiontec unit or a change in CenturyLink's DNS - I just know what finally fixed the problem.  Specific instructions to do this:1. Open the modem's admin page by browsing to its address (usually [...] but yours could be different)2. Click on Advanced Setup icon3. Click on WAN IP Settings link4. In section called "5. Select DNS Type":  Select "Static DNS" and enter the addresses of Google's DNS servers (8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) in the 2 boxes provided.  There are other DNS servers you can use, too.

Great product.I bought this for 2 reasons:1. To reduce noise during air travel.2. For hearing protection while shooting.It succeeds in both, and is a big improvement over the various solutions I had been using.While flying, I like noise protection to reduce the ambient airplane noise (not to mention the noise of chatty passengers) while I am reading.  I fly a lot, but do not like using any type of electronic noise reduction for many reasons, including the restriction on using electronic devices below 10,000 feet.  My solution up to this point was an expensive set of Israeli-made SilentEar earplugs that were supposedly really good, but just would not stay put in my ears despite trying several sizes.  This product fits my ears *perfectly* and results in a quieter environment, so will be coming with me on all future flights.While shooting, I have been using various brands of ear muff style hearing protection, including ones from Stanley, Beretta and Browning.  Besides being bulky, nearby gunfire still sounded LOUD.  But with these, the sound is now tolerable, and I don't have to fill up 1/4 of my range bag with big bulky ear muffs.You get 3 sets in this package, which is nice and very good value.  The only cautionary note I will add is that in each set I got, the yellow cord connecting the two ears was tied in such a tight knot that I almost could not get it apart.  For a moment I actually considered *cutting* the knot, thinking that it was not part of the cord, but quickly realized that doing so would cut the cord between the 2 earpieces.  You can untie the little knots - if you have patience. [Update:  For some time now, they have come tied with knots that are much easier to untie, unlike the earlier version, thus no longer an issue.]I like them!  Sorry, what was that you said???UPDATE ONE YEAR LATER:It puzzles me why a few people have had such trouble with these and think they don't work.  Unlike what a few others have reported, these work really well for me at the range, and in fact when I have tried wearing ear muffs over the top of these I really can't detect any further reduction in sound.For anyone who has had trouble or think they don't work, be sure that you have inserted them properly and completely.  As the instructions indicate, you have to pull out on your ear lobe with one hand while inserting them into your ear with the other - you can't just push them in with one hand because they won't go in far enough to fully seal the ear canal.  When properly inserted, you *will* notice the difference - a feeling that I can best describe as being "cut off" from the world.  If you don't feel that, they are not inserted properly and you will NOT get anywhere close to the level of sound reduction that these can provide.Anyway, these work just great for me, and I am about to order more.UPDATE, several years later:I keep buying more, because I am concerned about my hearing, and these help a lot.  If you don't do anything around noise, you won't need these, but most of us do.My latest use, which perhaps negates my original title a bit, is to wear while out on my side-by-side ATV, which is quite noisy.  I keep several pairs of these in the vehicle, to wear myself, for my spouse to wear, and for guests.  While they greatly suppress the noise of the ATV, my spouse and I actually *can* easily hear each other while wearing these.  Seems perfect.I've seen a lot of silly comments by others here, who say that:* They are uncomfortable.  True, you won't want to wear them all day.  That would be true of any hearing protection.* The state of California says that they are "known to be carcinogenic."  Perhaps true if you eat them, but half of the things I have purchased lately have come with such a warning.  I live in the real world, not California.* They don't work.  Well, they do for most people - especially if you insert them correctly.

Given that the 100th anniversary of the Titanic's sinking is coming up soon (April 2012), we can expect a spate of new books on this popular and still-fascinating subject.  Here is an early entrant in that derby.This book is about J. Bruce Ismay, the "owner" of the Titanic who was excoriated for being one of the surviving male passengers from an age when "women and children first" was the expectation.  The re-telling of the familiar story of the actual sinking in this book is brief, as it should be.  Ismay himself is an interesting character who obviously had a major role in the Titanic episode, and a book about him is a useful addition to the literature on this subject.The biographical details of his life are well-covered, including how he grew up, how he inherited the White Star Line from his father who founded the company, his deportment at the enquiries on both sides of the Atlantic that followed the sinking, and his later family life.  The book spends considerable time recounting his behavior at both enquiries, in which he comes across as unhelpful, aloof and enigmatic - exactly as he was in life.Other familiar Titanic characters such as Lightoller figure prominently here too, and we are given the impression that both he and Ismay are hiding deeper secrets that mostly were never revealed.According to the author's bio, she was a lecturer in English literature for many years before writing this book, and it shows.  Early on she starts using Joseph Conrad's "Lord Jim" as a parallel to Ismay's story, and after many references this device emerges in full bloom to fully occupy one whole chapter (out of 8), including a mini-bio of Conrad.  It was interesting at first, but then it went on for page after page until I found myself skimming to the end of that chapter and hoping to get back to the story.I found the book interesting because it added to my casual interest on the famous Titanic story, but it was just "too literary" for me.

Having found that the larger version of this product makes reloading 9mm and 45 ACP magazines much easier, I got this - the Baby version - at the same time as I ordered my first .22 pistol (from another source, obviously!).While the Baby seems functionally similar to its larger sibling, after trying it on 2 different .22 magazine types (Browning and Beretta), I threw it in a drawer and don't ever expect to use it again.  Why?1. It doesn't work on many types of .22 magazines!  Nowhere in *Amazon's* description does it tell you this (although other reviewers have now mentioned this).  Included with the product is a tiny label that says "Does NOT load the following mags with projecting side pin, like:" and then lists 6 of the most popular .22 pistols including Browning Buck Mark, Ruger, Walther, Beretta, etc. Here is one disadvantage to buying online where you can't examine the merchandise first.2. The Browning and Beretta .22 mags I use are so easy to load by hand that any extra mechanical assistance is totally unnecessary.  The springs in them are very soft compared larger-caliber magazines, where it truly is a bit difficult to push each cartridge in.  Maybe others have stiffer springs, but mine are easy.My advice:  Check compatibility before buying.  Better yet, save your money and buy more ammo instead.

I was delighted when I found this product, which was exactly what I needed to provide hot showers at my remote mountain cabin.  I love going there, but didn't like having to go too long without a shower, especially when working on projects which are dusty or dirty.  This little unit now allows me to feel fresh and clean while in the boondocks.It was not without its tribulations, though.  When I first connected the unit to an LP tank (standard 20 lb container used for outdoor grilles) and a water supply, I was delighted to have hot water emerge from the spray handle.  I shut it down and planned to take a shower a bit later.  A few hours later, as I was preparing to savor my first hot shower in the wilderness, I was surprised when the battery compartment on the bottom (which takes 2 D cells for the igniter) was very warm to the touch.  And the unit wouldn't heat.  :-(Disappointed, I had to give up on having my long-anticipated shower.  Later in the day when I reached an area with cell phone reception I called Camp Chef's customer service.  The company is in Utah, and someone answered immediately and took my info.  A short time later a very helpful "engineer" came on the phone, who immediately offered to ship me a replacement unit overnight.  Given my remote location that didn't seem like a good option, so then he told me that likely the batteries were shorted somehow (creating heat) and gave me simple instructions on what I might try to fix the problem.  Again he emphasized that he could send me a replacement as well.Back at my cabin I followed his instructions to remove the cover (1 screw) and found that the insulator that was supposed to cover the spot where some wires connect to the battery compartment had slipped, allowing the battery connect to short to a pipe inside.  I easily correct this and - voila! - hot water again.Some other things I learned by talking to the helpful engineer that were not covered in the instruction manual:- It's OK for the unit to get wet, e.g. if it is out in the rain.- Might be obvious, but if you leave the unit somewhere where it might freeze, be sure to drain it thoroughly.  There is an unlabeled knurled knob on the bottom that can be unscrewed to ensure it drains thoroughly.Summary:- Unit is made in China (like everything these days) and should not have been designed to allow the battery contacts to come into contact with other internal metal parts, even if insulated.  I would expect this problem to affect every unit, even if there is an easy work-around.- Once working, the unit is great.- Camp Chef is to be highly commended on their prompt, knowledgable and personal service.  Even if the unit is made in far-away China, the service is right here in this country by real people who care.

I've owned/used several other blood pressure meters over the years, including ones from Omron and LifeSource.  The older units look pretty basic compared to this latest Omron, which provides significant more computerized functionality than the older units.  However, this does come at the cost of greater complexity.Good things about the new Omron:* "TruRead" mode, which automatically takes 3 sequential readings and averages them.  I always did this manually with my older units anyway because the readings would differ slightly from time to time, but this one does it with one touch of a button, and then computes the average for you.* Cuff is very nice: broad and stiff, which I find much easier to apply.* Automatically determines if you have applied the cuff correctly.* Like a dozen other things I own these days, this unit can connect to my computer via USB, which fortunately is by the common "mini" USB connector and not the less common "micro" USB connector, which means that you can use the same USB cord as you use for many other devices.Things that may or may not be good:* It is set up to handle 2 regular users, via an A/B slide switch. This really is only useful if you have 2 people who both use the same unit regularly, and they both want to have the unit keep track of averages and/or download readings to a computer.  Of course, you have to remember to set the switch in the right position for you so you don't get mixed up, which would destroy the value of any history.* You can connect it to your Windows computer as mentioned above, supposedly to connect to Microsoft Health Vault (which I did not try - who wants to upload their personal information to something run by Microsoft?) or to Omron's Health Management software package which you can download and run privately on your own Windows PC.  I did try out the latter, which does allow you to upload stored readings to your computer for graphing of historical trends.  I find this only marginally useful if at all - I do keep my own log in Excel, where I can also add notes, add other data, and analyze and graph it myself - all without having to plug it in to my computer.  I did experience some difficulty uploading, where it was not obvious what to do to start the upload after connecting the unit to my computer.Things that are not so good:* It has various computational abilities such as a memory, ability to keep history for morning & evening readings, etc.  I suppose this could provide some value to those who are tech-oriented and would value the additional information, but I find that it just adds unnecessary complexity to the device with little value to me.  I found it difficult to figure out how to make this work, even after (re)reading the instruction manual several times.  Anything that requires you to keep the instruction manual handy flunks my usability test, and likely will not be used by 98% of most users.  Factoid to provide contrast:  My old LifeSource unit had just 1 button, my old Omron had just 2, while this unit has 7 buttons.Overall, I like the unit because it is a useful improvement over my older devices, particularly due to the useful TruRead feature.  It does provide PC connectivity and more computational features that older units too, but not everyone will find those capabilities useful, and they do increase the complexity of the unit.UPDATE 12/23/11 - Long-term experience report:The unit is still working well, and I like it.  The good features I mentioned above, especially the TruRead feature, have turned out to be real advantages over previous units, and I would really miss them if I had to go back.For anything other than very occasional use, you *will* need to run this unit plugged into the power adapter (included), because it consumes batteries more rapidly than older units, perhaps because of the TruRead feature.  I don't find this a problem.I'm a satisfied user.

I have not been one to enjoy a spate of good murder mysteries until this past year. That said, in the past I have read murder mysteries by such diverse authors as Diana Mott-Davidson and John Sandford, so this genre of books are in my repertoire; they just are not my norm. However, when offered the opportunity to read the latest Henning Menkel book I jumped at the chance.I opened the book with, I will admit, some trepidation. I enjoy the Wallander television series and feel Kenneth Branagh does a snap job of portraying a somewhat dry, often depressed and unsmiling detective Kurt Wallander but to read an entire book composed of dry and lifeless conversation seemed a bit daunting. Imagine my surprise when one morning I laughed out loud at a line of conversation between Wallander and another character in the book. I actually asked my spouse if I had just laughed out loud and, in fact, I had. Obviously, this is not a humorous book but it is a book that speaks to you of someone not unlike yourself who has chosen to be a policeman and solve heinous crimes.I still feel that Menkel's style is one of simplicity. Simple dialogue, simple premise for a murder in a simple land and yet you cannot put the book down. I felt compelled to turn page after page to keep reading even though I had other deadlines to make. I finished the book in record time with an inexplicable feeling of emptiness perhaps because it appears this is Kurt Wallander's last appearance in the printed media. I suppose all characters eventually  must have the last story written about them but having just discovered Henning Menkel's Sweden and  Kurt Wallander I was not prepared to say goodbye.It seems I have read things totally out of order as this is my first Henning Menkel book but it will not be my last. As soon as I finish my long line of Elizabeth George books, Henning Menkel's books will fill my shelves.

These lamps were exactly what I wanted for bedside reading.  Color and appearance were a perfect match for my decor, and the size and style were just right as well.  After installing them, I removed the lamps that had been taking up space on my nightstands, creating a tidier appearance.Installation was fairly easy (I mounted them on the wall, but plugged them into nearby outlets.  They also can be hard-wired, but obviously that's not an easy thing to do in an existing house.) All you need to do is drill 4 holes in the wall for the set of screws that is used to attach the mounting plate to the wall.  I agree with the other reviewer, who strongly advised against using the included drywall anchors because the anchors looked pretty flimsy, although that would not be a problem if you are mounting into studs because the supplied screws would be fine for that.All was well until, after mounting them, I noticed that each lamp shade hung slightly crooked.  The fault is in the arcing tube that comes up from the mounting plate and curves out to the top of the lampshade - on both of mine, the part that hangs from this tube does not hang straight down, but is slightly angled to one side (both lamps were the same in this regard).  I really like the lamps and didn't want to go through the delay and hassle of exchanging them, with no certainty that the replacements would be better, so I did my best to adjust the shades to minimize any appearance of tilting.  If I can't get used to this over time, I might take them down and try to bend the metal tubes.Summary: Really nice design, appearance is great, but suffers from quality control in the manufacturing process.  Needless to say, these lamps, like 90% of all products being sold these days, are made in China.  :-(

I've never read Gibbon, nor did I know much about the late Roman empire (376-476 AD), which is why I got this book. Reading this book filled in a lot of knowledge gaps and corrected a lot of misconceptions for me, but it was heavy reading at times.Things that surprised me (keeping in mind that I am a casual reader and not an expert):- There actually is quite a significant written historical record from this period.  Although it was not the golden age of the early empire, with fewer famous writers, much was written and still available to modern scholars (even if a huge additional amount that was known to exist has been lost).  Most of this is in sources that are not commonly available to the modern reader, and from the excerpts quoted by the author, are unlikely to be of interest to the modern reader due to their style and fragmentary nature. Thus Peter Heather provides a great service to readers like myself by piecing together and interpreting that material, turning it into this volume.- Contrary to the belief popularised (I believe) by Gibbon, the western Roman empire did not collapse from its own weight or decadence, but the "fall" of Rome was a gradual process that was primarily driven by external sources, mainly the brief rise of the Huns under Attila who drove others (Goths, Vandals, etc) out of their traditional spaces and into Roman territory.  Those once-fractional groups finally coalesced into much larger groups such as the Visigoths that became serious threats to the Romans.- Economic factors also loomed large even back then. (What's Latin for "It's the economy, stupid?")  Heather makes it clear that only large nations with large tax bases could remain economically able to maintain the large armies needed to survive in that period, and the Roman decline was caused by the combination of the cost of armies necessary to fight off increasingly-larger Barbarian forces, while at the same time deal with a shrinking tax base caused by a slowly shrinking empire.- Another fascinating insight is how the "Dark Ages" came to be(Heather never uses that term, and the period is beyond that covered by this book). During the Roman empire, literacy was widespread among the upper classes, with a strong command of Latin or Greek being necessary for high public status.  But after the fall of Rome, when Europe fell under Barbarian rule, the way to impress one's superiors shifted to being good with fighting instead of writing, and literacy fell out of favor until it was only of interest to church officials (hence the importance of monks to preserve ancient writings through the period after the fall of Rome).This book was a good reading choice because I learned a lot from it, but it was quite heavy going at times - probably a lot like reading the details of the goings-on in some small, faraway town that you have not heard of.  Fortunately, Heather has provided useful appendices that made it a bit easier to figure out and remember the multitude of little-known and barely-pronounceable Barbarian bigwigs of the era.

I have always believed that complexity is bad, but after reading this essay by Donald Norman (former VP at Apple and now author, professor and expert on design) I have come to understand that complexity is both unavoidable and not *necessarily* the evil thing I once thought.Norman himself made this same transition in belief, coming to understand that complexity is bad only if it causes confusion.  Since the modern, technology-filled world is filled with complexity that will not go away, we have to look for ways to tame it - And good design is one of the ways.In this context, design is not just how something looks, but is how it operates in the context of the user's experience, and could be a whole "system" rather than a single product.Norman offers many fascinating insights; here are a few:* Apple, famous for design and usability, first used a 1-button mouse because it was the simplest (Windows used a 2-button mouse and Unix preferred 3). This wasn't just a guess; studies have consistently shown that while humans have no trouble attaching unique meanings to "up" vs. "down," the difference between left and right is arbitrary.  Thus a mouse with a left button vs. a right button seemed complex.  But guess what?  Apple now uses a 2 button mouse!  Why?  Although slightly more complex, the 2-button mouse provided many more advantages at the cost of only slight complexity, and was deemed superior from experience in practice.* From a variety of studies, it seems that people actually WANT complexity in many cases.  For example, when purchasing electronic equipment, people equate more buttons with more function, and will pay more for it even if they have no idea of how to use it.* Having more buttons on a control is better than fewer buttons - Provided that each button has a unique purpose that is obvious and easy to understand.  The contrast is that a device with only a small number of buttons is actually more complex if each button has many different purposes (like on an electronic wristwatch).There were numerous other insights I found fascinating, such as Norman's belief that error messages are bad ("the machine should be scolded, not the human"), and his disdain for modern numbers-driven management because it fails to take into account the human aspect of what is needed in products and systems.So Norman helps us understand that complexity is inevitable and not necessarily bad, and thus it is imperative that we pay a lot of attention to the design of products and services to make things understandable to the humans who use them.

Phoebe O'Byrne came up through the foster care system. She always believed her mother ( a very special woman) didn't want her. But she's always had her best friend Jax at her back who is more like a brother to her. He is now a retired Marine and Phoebe just passed the bar exam. Life is good, right?... Then (gorgeous, but shady) Grant Hollingsworth Esquire comes along with some unexpected  and life changing news, and SNAP!....Let the journey begin!  These absolutely amazing and most times hilarious characters Rock this unique story line..... Well, not the evil step-sister Helen. Did not care for her at all! Was so happy that Grant turned out to be a hunk of wonderful!

Going undercover for the newspaper is a chance to get that one big carreer making story for Baz...His cover story? To write the autobiography of the Band, Pogon's members. The main objective? Get the goods on lead singer Rex....Rex, however is a tough sell, he wants nothing to do with any of it. He is a private person. For good reason. He has a secret that the record company insists stay a secret.... But what happens when you are drawn to the very person that can destroy you? And Baz? well, over time, it turns out he really likes the band  (especially Rex) and the line between doing his job and doing what's right begins to blur. Can he truly "out " the ones that have come to count him as family?  I really enjoyed meeting this motley crew of band brothers. Sometimes you just have to follow your heart......  I do recommend this to adults only please.

The very first chapter had me just as fascinated as Julian was as we watched Kate (quite unknowingly) put on that little show in the parking lot of the Shelter she volunteered. It is the importance to details, here and all through the story that brings the characters true to life. It also made me wonder what Kate would have thought, had she known, something as simple as dropping her keys was about to change her life forever. I felt like this was the defining moment Julian knew he was going to have her, for just one night. ( yeah, right?)I have read hundreds of vampire stories, and what I really liked here was the fact that Julian, although he is in fact knock me down and do me gorgeous, he is by far not perfect. He makes a few bad calculations and he isn't the strongest vamp around, at least not until his friend Reese, who is an older vamp gives him some of his blood, that gives him a fighting chance when he decides to take on Evangeline, his maker. She wants Julian, who never wanted her, and when she learns of Julian being with Kate, well, that's when things get intense....But I have to say, this isn't your usual, beautiful woman meets dangerous, dark vamp and fawns all over him, & they spend eternity together. no no no ....First off, Kate is not teenage model material, she has her flaws just like the rest of us, and she's a little older, and a little heavier than she'd like to be. and her " forever" with Julian is not a given. One lusty, erotic, fantasy filled night in the arms of a stranger, does not forever make....at least it's suppose to only be one night, remember? Hell, she doesn't even know that he's a vampire. A lot is going to happen before that little cat is let out of the bag...which brings me to Kate's BFF Mazzie. She is one tough cookie, and she is fierce with her loyalty to Kate, and I am still waiting to find out what in the 7 hells went on in that bathroom between her & Julian. And way later with Mazzie, laying in a pool of blood when Reese finds her and Julian is going insane looking for Kate who is no where to be found....& Insert cliffhanger here..This amazing saga continues with even more excitement as Reese is forced to make a decision that could result in losing the love of his life, as Kate is kidnapped, believing her bestie is dead......Julian scrambles to achieve and perfect a vampire talent that will allow him to reach and link to his beloved Kate who is in the clutches of John, the deranged creation of Evangeline, who in her own madness believing that Kate stole Julian from her as the way of getting him to come back to her.The action never stops as there are a few different and very enlightening story lines that explains a lot of the why's and who's of this saga........Evangeline's origins and all she went through, made me believe that she never stood a chance.So, I have mixed thoughts about the emotional cliff hanger that I hope means that there is another installment coming in this series.These characters are so well developed, each as individuals and together, they were so true to life for me, from the smexy erotic scenes to the horrors that are visited on some of them. This is a most amazingly believable Vampire romance....I have read many, so, I do recommend this series as an adult read. I definitely give it 5 fanging stars!

Things are about to real now that Bruce has been swooped away in the claws of  Tauria's enemy. The Mesmer ritual has to be completed now if they have any hope to rescue Bruce and win what is bound to be a fight to the death. Karla doubts that even with the ritual done, Taruis won't be strong enough....she has it in her head to go after him herself.....Like I said,  it's about to get real.

This second installment is very entertaining. Karla takes Taurian Shopping for clothes and the poor dragon has no concept of the modern human world let alone how to work a zipper or a button. So  they end up in the dressing room together. Things are really starting to heat up between them. Bedding Taurian  to get this bonding thing done is starting to sound like the only thing to do.  And by the time they get everything they need and check out, Karla is simply frazzled.  I so enjoyed the cat and mouse fiasco when they realize their being followed. Karla really has her hands full coming up with trick after trick trying to lose the dragon tailing them. This is also a quick read, but oh so much fun!

This is a fast paced quick read that just captivated me from the start. A different twist to the usual  Dragon shifter finding a mate story. I found this approach of "waking" the dragon a refreshing change and I am looking forward to the rest of this series.

This first installment had me right from the very beginning and never let up, not even when I reached the cliffhanger, I'm wanting to stay with Adrian King.Elizabeth and Adrian meet during an art exhibit. The draw is immediate for Adrian, he must have her. Turns out, he has something she must have. A bargin is struck and she is his for one night. And what a night it is, in fact, Elizabeth never experienced anything as erotic as this before, but when she learns that Adrian truly meant "one night" she is beside herself. She is so sure that there could be more between them. She sets out to convince him even though he's tried to make her see what he is. She is relentless, shameless even in her quest to be with him. She agrees to be his submissive and signs a contract to that effect.... but where Adrian takes her, and what he shows her there is enough to make Elizabeth doubt what she was so sure she wanted.If this is only the beginning,..... Holy Mother Of All Erotica..... Bring It On!

Unwrapping Noel by, Jennifer TheriotI really like the cast of characters in this story. They developed into true to life people. These are adults with adult issues along with all the good or bad that implies. I like when I "know" who they are and I really identified with Noel and her struggles, within herself and in her life. Like being "curvey." She can't see how beautiful she truly is. And coming out of a 14 yr toxic marrage to a cheating husband hasn't helped. After being single for about a year she is starting to develop some independence and while on a business trip she meets Leon Hallas, the hottest man she's ever seen. The draw is instant and relentless. And he wants her....But that cad of an ex husband has a couple of secrets that just may ruin Christmas.--------------------------------------------------------------It's a Marshmallow World by Diane RinellaThis is a lighthearted story about Darla, her friends Jacqueline & Rox, and the place they all like to hang out at called Mulligan's. This is where Darla meets "heaven on legs" Chris. I really enjoyed watching that relationship grow. It was an age of discovery for sure.----------------------------------------------------------Collide & Burn by, Claudy ConnWade Devon wanted a retreat. A place away from the daily grind. He is out to look at three farms his realtor has to show him when the sound of laughter turned his head. It's then that he saw her face, then he saw the name on the door of her jeep. "Norcross Stables" Charlene (Charlie) Wells folks are selling the farm and moving. Now Charlie is a tenant. She gets the apartment in exchange for pitching in if the employees need a hand, and keep Mr. Devon ( she hasn't even met yet) informed about the renovations being done....Their first meeting is flat out hysterical.... She quite literally almost choked on a fly! Yep, he is that jaw dropping gorgeous!  And yep, these two are going to Collide & Burn in a very erotic way!-----------------------------------------------------------Snowflakes Exes & Ohs by, Melanie JamesDylan Parker left Cedar Lake, joined the Navy right after graduation 6 years ago. He was done with small town mentality, he wanted to see the world. He did not want to take over Parker's Pub & Grill like his dad expected him to do. Nor did he want to get married at 18. He didn't want hurt Abbie or his dad. He just wanted more. That was 6 years ago. Now he gets a call from his mom who tells him that his dad is not doing well. Prostate cancer. He is losing the battle. Dylan took leave but didn't make it. His dad passed away before he got there.... He headed for the Pub to see his mom. Abbie ( now a police officer) and her partner Jason are also on their way to break up another brawl. When they arrived, a very different looking Dylan was already throwing someone out the door. So starts the remarkable story of Abigail Johnson and Dylan Parker. One of redemption, forgiveness and love not forgotten.  ( Merry Christmas Emmie)

"AVENGE" This third book of the series is what "ABUSE" & "ACCUSE" have been leading up to....  the romance between Grant Wilkinson and Renata Koreman has grown into everything Andre' Chevalier could have hoped for. When Grant came to Andre' (in need of therapy)  he put "the monster together with the little mouse" in the hope that they would heal each other. Grant  now believes he has the best of both worlds. It turnes out Renata, his sex therapist is  also his soul mate. They compliment one another in all things, especially in the bedroom, or any room for that matter! They continue therapy in the most erotic ways.... but an adult that has been abused as a child has many obsticals that must be addressed before life can be anywhere near normal. If that abuse was sexual, even harder. If that sexual abuse was at the hand of someone the child should have been able to trust ...Well, I think you can see where this is going. We see the full depth, depravity, and lengths people will go to in order to keep their secrets. I'm talking about wealthy, well educated, and connected people, some in high places. People that can frame you for murder, or make your death look like a sucide. There are secrets within secrets covering up other secrets. No wonder these sex rings are so hard to take down. But at least for this story, our beloved Andre' Chevalier has come up with a plan. Why would Andre' do this you may ask? It seems our favorite frenchman has kept a little secret of his own....I was so enthralled by this whole Trilogy, but this last installment is not only an erotic romance, but a mystery/suspense/detective novel all rolled into one.

Here we follow Kelly and Gabe into some magical mischief and of course mayhem.... we meet some new players and see old friends....Deal with a few surprises, with a curse thrown in for good measure......I jsut laughed, giggled and snorted my way through this lastest adventure. Truly entertaining

Autunm has a degree in Advanced Practice Registered Nursing with a specialty in Psychiatric Mental Health. She moved to Washington a year and a half ago and works in the psychiatric ward at the hospital as well as putting in time on the base counseling soldiers and their families with a wide range of PTSD issues. Autunm knows first hand what can happen as a result of it. Her friend Amy is running a pen pal program for soldiers as part of the Family Readiness Group and Autunm signs up thinkng to help another solider cope with deployment. So she writes to Brock Mallack and is surprised when he writes back.  One thing leads to another and then he comes home.....This is the beginning of their story.  Well, more like a whirl wind romance where Brock introduces Autunm to the world of Kink. But it's not all about wine, roses, and happy ever after. Oh no, far from it. In fact, just three days before the wedding Autunm finds something on Brock's phone that shatters her trust in him.... who the hell is Eva?  ....Fight or Flight?  Just what is Autunm going to do?... Yep, cliffhanger..... can't wait for the rest of the story.

This is a coming of age story about Greeta....They call her Dragonfly..... She knows she is different than anyone else in the village, with her pale skin, white hair and blue eyes. But it goes much deeper than the way she looks. She has always felt like something important was being kept from her...... Well.....That's all about to change, and all I can say is, her nickname is only half right.....I have enjoyed reading this fantastic fantasy so far, and am so glad it continues on with the promise of even more exciting discoveries to come for Greeta.

A short, but emotional tale about choices made by a witch, and the possible consequences that can and do touch everything and everyone around her.I do hope we see more of these characters. I have a feeling their stories have only just begun.
An amazing and captivating story about the bond between friends, the love of family and truly growing up. Sometimes friendship turns into love, and sometimes all roads don't lead home.
This is an absolute must read! If for no other reason than for people to "Listen, just once"......
I got theses to put up under my porch roof..... They look amazing and give off just the right amount of light for when we sit outside at night. It's pitch black at night on the mountain otherwise.

"Killer" is a brilliantly written prequel to the coming soon, " Stalker".. All the characters are really well developed. I could see Phoenix quite clearly in my minds eye...the story line grabs you, holds you, and pulls you in until the end. There are secrets within the secrets and nothing is as it seems. The blurb does not prepare you for this fast paced, dark erotic story, or the look into the pitch black mind of  Phoenix Sullivan..... what really scared me was to watch Vanessa's mind  slowly going over to the dark side. Or has she been there all along?StalkerFirst of all...... WOW, just, WOW! .....This story is just one revelation after another.  These characters  are so well develped, in fact they continue to develop all the way through as we share their memories, mistakes, and sins....Some believe that people are a product of their up bringing. Others believe that at some point we can choose how we are going to be. But what if that up bringing was so stringent, dark, abusive, never to feel loved,...so terrifing that it truly became the only way to survive?  To do or die...Or to do, so someone else doesn't die? ... This is such a story.  We get both POV's from Miles, who later becomes Phoenix Sullivan, a killer,  who has escaped prison with vengeance, his sole focus. and then there's  Vanessa, who is molded into the object that will further the power of her family, and much later, she escapes one hell, only to find herself in another hell, and to top it off, she knows he is coming for her, she is stalked, and hunted. She knew this day was coming, but she's not ready this soon.......There is so much going on.... stories within stories... secrets, deceptions, corruption, greed, and murder...I recommend this to adults who like a fast paced, dark, read. There is cruelty and violence involved.....  Are You Ready?

KARMAThis is a story of how different lives can become connected by the smallest of happenstance. It is a tale of greed, lust, abuse, cruelty, courage, trust and love.The characters are true to life and so believable that I found myself feeling what they felt and even had to stop and blow my nose and wipe away tears at the wedding!KARMA truly makes you believe in "what goes around, comes around".This is a tale of the courage of two totally different women, who despite unbelievable heart break and abuse learn to love again.There are vivid erotic scenes, and yummy role playing, so adults only please.I am hoping that Nikki isn't done with this. I would love to see Andre' get that truck load of good karma that Marcy is sure is heading his way and maybe see more of her and Mike too!Promises To KeepFirst I would like to say how much this story touched me ....Nikki & Zachary came together with the perfect mix of their talents and experience to give us this incredible story of a promise made and all that happens before, during and after that promise is kept.The cast of characters are true to life and exstremely well developed. I could honestly see them and feel what they felt. From the very first chapters, my emotions became invested and I was hooked! I ran the entire gambit of laughing, being afraid, getting angry, heartsick and even teared up several times. And I loved it that our very own Andr'e Chevalier was given an honorable mention. ( you rock Nikki)...Also, it is a fact that PTSD can happen to anyone who has any kind of a tragic life event, soilders or civilian. (thanks Zachary)Dr. Jack Curren, USMC , serving in Fallujah, Iraq and Laura Wynn, widow of Robert Wynn, USMC Corpsmen, living in North Carolina have lived through their own seperate brand of hell and survived. What Laura doesn't know is that hell isn't quite finished with her yet. It comes at her in the form of one Jonah Lacks, ex-boyfriend and OxyContin pill head.This is a story of these two people drawn together through letters, the comfort & strength they draw from each others words in their little corners of hell to be able to go on, so when they finally meet 6 months later it seems like a natural, easy thing to continue where they left off with the friendship which soon blooms into a sweet romance and then love. But Jack soon realizes all is not well in Laura's life despite the up beat and pleasant front she puts up. And Jack, well, he has his own secret and wonders now if he's waited too long to tell Laura the truth of Bob's death leading up to the "promise." Can this relationship continue in the light of truth? ..And Oh Yeah! Don't forget about the ex-boyfriend, Josh the pill head who has become exstremely unstable in his addiction and will stop at nothing to get what he wants. One person has already paid the ultimate price for getting in his way. Will Zack be next?What Wendy WantsThis is a very intriguing look at how a couple, Wendy and Frank, put life back into their relationship with the help of a Kindle, sex toys, love and trust. Having a good marriage and three children was all well and good but it doesn't replace the spark that seemed to fizzle over time with the saddest thing being that Frank had no idea it was happening until the day he found his wife's books of choice. I enjoyed following these two on their quest of rediscovery and do recommend it to any adult who enjoys a sexy romance.

SPOILER ALERT!!!This is to be Agent Rebecca Quinn's first solo assignment as an ATF Agent... She always wanted to follow in her Father's footsteps. He was an ATF senior special agent ( until he was killed).... Agent Marshal tells her that she is to infiltrate the motorcycle club, Sinister Sons Syndicate, over in Savannah. Someone in the club, or the club itself is part of a huge sex trafficking ring of under age girls. They are used for prostitution and drug mules. If they say no, they die. He says she is to infiltrate the leader by "ANY means necessary."  So of course Becca flips out... She will not be a whore in hopes that Gavin, the President will tag  her and give her info with some pillow talk!...Turns out they have Gavins little brother Lucas as CI and he will do the intros. He is not part of the club so Gavin won't talk to him but it seems Gavin has been lonely lately and just wants an ol' lady.... That's when Becca sees his picture and her jaw about drops to the floor. He is gorgeous.... she will probably get caught..... she will be killed......but, whatever......she says, "lets get this done"...She's In! Thanks to the cast on her arm from an abusive ex boyfriend that is.... who knew, ( Lucas did) Gavin has a soft spot for damsil's in distress. Gavin  and Becca get close and soon he is falling for her. The only thing is, she is falling for him too..... when it turns out it is his VP "Hammer" who is the one running the girls and drugs, Gavin has him voted out of the club, chained down and club tatoos removed with a blow torch.... Becca and Lucas are to be Hammers revenge on Gavin. Becca manages to shoot Hammer but not before Gavin hears her ID herself as ATF...... a club pledge was in on it with Hammer and is in Beccas car with a knife at her throat as he calls Gavin to come meet her. Gavin gets there, Becca gets the knife he traded out for a gun. She yells to Gavin, The pledge shoots her and she wakes up in hospital with Gavin by her side.......They spend the next week in Blairesville GA. at Becca's cabin, grtting to know each other for real this time, being in love and making love. but soon the time came for Becca to return to work and Gavin to get back to the MC..... Later he calls and tells her he will be away for the next week on club business.....she finds herself being put back in the field. It's the same kind of assignment but not deep cover this time. She just needs to get some bugs in place inside an MC clubhouse. Mia is put out there with her and she meets up with her contact, one of the ol ladies who is willing to get Becca inside.Unbeknownst to Becca, Gavin has his own agenda for this MC. They are involved with human trafficking, but also with distribution of a drug with deadly side effects. And the president threatened Gavin with Becca's life. Gavin has Blade build and plant bombs in their clubhouse ....and .....thats just where Becca is heading.....Becca is in the ER, and it seems she has survived, barely, but not without some problems.... bleeding on her brain, multible broken bones, cuts ect....her memory is impaired! She is missing about six months. But she dreams about the handsome man who pulled her into a stairwell....she wakes up screaming "Gavin!"Most of her memeory is back by the next day..... She believes that Gavin is dead.Three bodies were pulled from the rubble with her and it looks like only she made it....Heartache turns to rage and all cords are ripped from her chest as Becca jumps out of bed. Alarms are going off as she hits her knees, tears running down her face as she remembers Gavins last words to her..."I'll find you wherever you are. I will love you until the dust from reality settles into the dying sun."Becca is determined that she is getting out of there and back to work as soon as humanly possiable. She no longer cares if she lives or dies.....There is a mission Agent Marshall wants to send Becca on in a few weeks if she is ready. It's in Escondido Ca. She is perfect for this. The Madmen of San Diego's kutte. Pres. Mark Swathmore who is a completly brutal, crazy nut case and VP Jacob Miller and other memebers are responsiable for the gangland style murders on the streets of Escondido. The old Pres, Terry Swathmore was the one that pulled the trigger of the bullet that killed her father in Las Vegas.....The Madmen are an outlaw MC working with Yakuza from Japan. They're planning assassinations, bribery, and drug shipments.Meanwhile Becca is moved to a normal room and may be out in a couple days......Gavin is alive!.... He thinks that Becca is dead.Becca writes Gavin a letter, addresses it, stamps it and mails it on her way out to this new mission, knowing no one will ever read it...or so she thinks.Agent Stopher's brings her up to speed on this new mission...Stacey is her contact She meets Becca to brings her up to speed on the cover story that they will bring into the group. But.......Some one sees her with Stacey and reconizes her from Savannah. It turns into a trap. She is tied up and on her way to the MC when Mia texts and tells her that Gavin is alive, he got her letter and is looking for her. .The whole time Mark is tortutring Becca, (and it is horrific,) she never made a sound. Stacey, who is watching this can't believe how strong Becca is and finally pulls Beccas gun and shoots Mark in the neck. The rest of the MC just walked away from the dead Pres who went mad ...They just let them go.The ATF pulled up & took Becca to the hospital...Gavin is there holding her hand. ...364 stitches,.. 42 staples, a transfusion later, he is waiting for her to wake up. She finally opens her eyes and sees Gavin.3 weeks later, & out of the hospital for 2 weeks. Gavin by her side and wanting to finally ask her a question........This is without a doubt a tear jerker and a heart breaker of a read. This is one of those that you think about long after your done reading.

This second installment opens with Chastity still unconscious. Cameron feels something malevolent is holding her lost and hunted. Can he use his magic to link with her? Can he bring his White Wolf out?So much is going on simultaneously here that the action never stops..... Not only is the playboy business man wrestling with feelings for Chastity he never wanted to feel, but he's faced with being Alpha to more than one pack after the abusive and twisted Alpha was run off, and the hunt for him begins....... an extremely gruesome discovery kicks the hunt into high gear as they realize how dangerous the situation seriously is..... in fact, a fight to the death isn't out of the question.But that's not all ...It also seems like Cupid is working overtime..... there is some lusty, erotic romance for some that may surprise you, it did me! .. there is still the pack bantering and laughable moments from the packs and,.... O M Goddess! Cameron's Kilt Dance is a true knock me down and ____ affair!I truly love the strong, determined, and vibrant women, .... weather they be, Wolf, Witch, or half human they have what it takes to be exactly what their fated mate needs. And they are not the least bit shy about it!I think the universe had the Alphas Decisions made already, he just needed to listen.....

This story opens right up with us seeing just what Angel is all about. He is an unfeeling killing machine for his father's company Cosa Nostra. It is his job to intimidate, shakedown or kill a victim to get information. There is no question that he is the best at what he does. He enters the cell and goes to work.....Sky wakes up in total, all consuming darkness. A burlap bag over her head. She can remember the men in black masks and a black SUV.... she knew it was only a matter of time before they came for her. Now she waits for whatever punishment and pain her captor is to deliver, she will endure it all. She made her choice, it was the only one a good person could make.... Her soul has already been tainted and defiled. She's already been past her breaking point once, and she survived...... His father sends him to Sky's cell do his job with no clear direction except that, she stole something from him, he wants it back. He is to wear a mask at all times and he is NOT EVER to remove the burlap bag....... This story is told by both Angel and Sky, which I really liked because they helped develope each others characters as well some of the others, ..... This gets very intense very quickly and I found my emotions bouncing all over the place with the deceptions, surprises, brutality and yes, even some redemption. This is a dark adult read...Do you think you are ready?

Her Dragon To Slay by, Julia Mills The detailed description of the large cast of characters really made me " see" and know each of them. Kyndel is a breath of fresh air as a strong woman in her own right. She is not some tall, slinky blonde. She has curves and always felt a little over weight. She has freckles and reddish hair with emerald green eyes. She cares about the people around her and is quick to help those in need. The only thing she is afraid of is walking alone in the dark, which is exactly how she meets Rayne Masterson. He quite literally crashes into her life on her walk home from work in the dark. It's all about the universe and destiny from there......This is a steamy romance of two mates finding each other, a story of the unconditional loyalty of brotherhood and all the laughter, games and fun they have together. This is also a story of unimaginable loss and betrayal......A Love For Somnus by, Nicole GarciaThis is really Somnus and Lailas story,but,  pretty much everyone gets in on the act. Actually, between Olympus and the Underworld, it's turning into a regular Peyton Place.Jupiter, the King, has been keeping some pretty significant secrets that I sure didn't see  coming. ....So, anyway, there are a couple hiccups to cure and get over for Somnus and Laila, but, O.M.G. when they do, hot, hot, hot is all I can say. At the start of this story, I just wanted to cry for Somnus. Then I spent the rest of the time chuckling, sighing, and Oh hell noing it. This book had me right up to the very last sentence..... Again, didn't see it coming at all! I am already wanting the next installment.Conjuring Darkness by, Melanie JamesI was totally captivated by the whole story line of magic, witches, an amulet and a love that transcends time and space.The characters are all well developed and the journey flowed smoothly so it's like I could actually see it play out in my minds eye.The relationship that grows between Lexi and Ryan is a mutually erotic romance, no games, just an amazing love that plays well within the story line as an ancient evil spirit and seven witches battle to open a portal buried centuries ago and recently uncovered that will release hell on earth! It comes down to an amulet. And just guess who has this amulet!!!!Chasing Magic by,  Gena D. LutzThe final trial, what every witch spends years working toward. Freedom to use magic outside the covens watchful eye..... Anika Webb is preparing for her final, and is carefully brewing her spell. ...Her boyfriend Drake, a very powerful Warlock, also happens to be son to the High Priestess. Pretty cool, right? ...... right up to when we get to Tamara, Anika's best friend, more like sisters really.  Well, not so much anymore for Tamara. She has let jealously for all of Anika's accomplishments eat away at her until blinding hatred drives her to sabotage the final trial  There are other things to deal with along the way, such as the Alpha Werewolf, Dante and his Crimson Wolves....An Imp, Cerin, half demon, half fairy, complete with a small side effect, and an accidental fairy who refuses to be human again.This is a quirky, romantic and thrilling read from start to finish, except that I don't think it's over yet. You see, while speaking to the High Priestess, Anika forgot to tell her a couple of things in all the excitement. But hey, there's always tomorrow, right?You need to read this yourself to learn about the result of the final trial, and what became of Tamara?Come and be captivated for a while.....Exquisite Breath of Darkness by, Candice StaufferI really enjoyed this story and being able to journey along with Mia and Joseph. Believe me, it is quite a journey that has you holding your breath with fear and at times, suspense at other times.The last chapter really made me change my mind about Eli and his convictions. I hope we see more of him in the future.This book can be a stand alone read, but I strongly recommend reading this series from the beginning as there are appearances by previous favorites and their stories are too good to miss.Absolutely great adult paranormal romance!Dark Love by Claudy ConnA remarkable tale of murder, lust, mystery, magic, revenge, love and a power so dark it ripples at the edges of reality itself. That said, I'd also like to say, there is just something so enchanting about Ireland which is where Chaz takes a job in order to continue her investagation. Her parents have been brutally murdered by what seems to be a serial killer and she is consumed with the need to avenge them. There is a mystery to be solved if she is going to find their killer.... Chaz is also coming into her own as a witch. All these stirrings of power and lust she is feeling are the last things she wants to be focused on. Then she meets Lord Jethro McBain..... dark and dangerously handsome. He is un like any other man she has ever encountered, He makes her feel things she has never felt before. She can feel the power, it almost sizzles around him. ....The scene in the study is sinfully erotic. But Chaz is determined to stay on task, so she must avoid Jethro, who she just knows is hiding something from her. Can she trust him? Hell, can she trust herself?

Freaking WOW!....Could there have been any more twists or surprises? I am just floored, this is such a deep, emotional, and sinfully erotic story. Emily and Chris both are so true to life, so well developed that I felt like I knew them personally.... Emily works for a PR firm. Chris King is in desperate need of her services, but not just to clean up the mess that is his public image, he wants,... no, he needs her in his bed, or anywhere eles he can have her. These two have a history, and it's not very pretty. It goes all the back to high school. That's where he ruined her life. That's why she hates him. He is determined to get her forgivness. She belongs to him and it's about time she knew it.... This story moves along at a smooth pace, things are happening constantly. The sexual scenes are graphic and sinfully delicious.... Emily is forced to face her true feelings when the unthinkable happens and Chris is rushed to the hospital.....and we have a few cameo appearances from other family members, one of whom tells Emily something that changes everything.... This is a stand alone, but you can meet the rest of this family in THE POSSESSED SERIES. I do recommend this to 18+ readers

FATEThis is a fast and enjoyable read! Nikki does it again with brilliantly done characters and story line. Who doesn't like a great love story and hot sexiness with a twist?I thought it was great fun to watch Emily go get her man by changing into Candy. She was so good at it that Paul wanted her for longer than the one night stand she had planned for. After all, he refused her twice before as Emily, his best friends little sister. But he's wild for Candy! Now what's she gona do? She has loved Paul since childhood, this should be her dream come true, but what happens when he finds out who she really is? Oh what a tangled web......I absolutely recommend this to adults who enjoy erotic romance with a side of humourKINKPaul Jarman is a Dom. This story is told from his POV...It is the sequal to FATE but it can be read as a stand alone book.Paul is a man who never dates, there is never a comitment or Love....That was before Emily, Now he is committed and in Love! But can she handle his darker side? will he lose her? He knows he has been a Bastard in the past and thinks Emily is too good for him.So he courts her as per the advice he was given by Andre' Chevalier. he spends time talking with her, for a whole week they talked, flirted and teased each other but never went past second base. He is ready to make love to her and tells this, but he really can't remember ever making love before. He has dominated many women, but not made love to any.They spend time together at Mr. Jarman's store, running things while Pauls Father is ill. Emily has worked there for years but Paul is just back since his fathers illness and things only get better between them, the sex is hotter than ever but when Paul proposes and Emily says no, he becomes like a man on a mission. You will have to read for yourself...Really Cracked me up!But it isn't all fun & games as attemps on Paul & emily's life stir things up...Who & why?......Then Paul's Mother tells him that his biological father wants to meet him. She never told him about Paul and now that he knows (and he is dying) he would like to meet him. It turns out that he is a rock star , His band is famous from the 80's....There is a whole crazy story as to how Paul's Mother hooked up with him back then, again, you will have to read it.Then a brother he knew nothing about comes to his office and Paul stands there looking at his own face on this guy! Turns out they were born 3 days apart.(part of that crazy story)....So Paul is just overwhelmed at this point. What more could there be you ask? How about ......Paul gets shot!Yep, someone is still trying to kill him! I was surpirsed to learn the who & the why of it!There is a lot of Erotic, hot BDSM going on throughout, so Adults only Please.......I totally enjoyed Paul & Emily's story, All the action, mystery and Erotica too!

Natalie Brewster owns a vintage style clothing store and often went to estate sales. She was compelled to buy a jewled box and found a green stone sewn into the lining. The word "Delitas" was etched on it. Then the jewel came alive with light and she swore she saw a face, Jacks face. then it was gone.........Jack Hampton, ex cop. Now a PI, lives next door to Natalie and has been trying to get closer to her and in fact had one date, one kiss that he thought went well, until she kept pushing him away ever since. He wonders if it's because he is white......He is delivering a pakage to her and she ends up showing Jack the stone. They both get a jolt as she hands it to him and just for a second or two he could swear he saw Natalie's face in the glow of the stone. They take it to a jeweler friend of his and then to the assisstant curator of the Miami History Museum. They learn of the history of the stone and that there are two other pieces that legend says will reunite at the right time.....Things from here on out get serious, someone wants this stone and they are willing to kill to get it. Jack is determined to protect the woman he loves....

First, I've got to tell you, the first two chapters left me breathless, and that was just the begining! From there on out It was just raw emotions, any you can think of and some you never thought of.....The one who tricked Evangeline with words of love, lied to her, used her as a sex slave, abused and tortured her, not to mention the one who turned her and then  abandoned her, drove her into a kind of a frenzy that made her search for someone that would love her, belong to her forever. Someone that would not be taken away from her or leave her. But time and time again she is left alone, broken, and tormented.....Now her maker, Bastian, is back and he has someone very special to Evangeline with him. Could this be the redemtion she seeks? Her joy is short lived however when she learns what her maker wants of her. ( and he is sounding more insane by the minute)  Will this new round of torment end with her being forced to meet the sun?Evangeline became more real to me as she continues to develope through the telling of her story.  The amazing detail put into each scene made me "see" it happening, and I could  "feel" her sorrows as well as her joy. I can't remember the last time a story moved me to tears as this one has. Especially for a character I so recently disliked. I do recommend this to adults only. (explicit sex scenes)  Do You Think Your Ready?

This is a story of strength for two people.... one has the strength to ask for the forgiveness from the one she truly loves, taking the chance she could be rejected.... the other had the strength to forgive and believe in their love for each other. Such a touching story and Merry Christmas after all.

I loved so much about this story it's hard to know where to begin.... The first thing for me without a doubt,  It's an adult saga with adult, well developed characters that are as true to life as I am, with the same ups and downs, trials, tribulations, hopes and dreams as any one of us.... I identified with Alexandra in the loss of her father and then her husband. But she is no shrinking violet, Alex is the owner of her own successful bakery. Walter, her late husband also had a good job, so she is more than fine financially. So when she meets Jesse Bond, who is rich by the way, it's not the Billionaire and the poor girl being rescued turned to true love stuff...... Nope, this is a journey of two hearts. One that is ready to embrace "forever" again with someone and one that feels "forever" isn't in the cards at all......This is a madcap world of friends, pranks, relatives that mean well and just about every flavor of sexy and erotic in between...... It is a captivating whirlwind of enjoyable reading.... I for one hope it isn't over yet. This is really too good to be just a one book affair. Well done Sir....

This installment has Daryl and Marigol going to the airport to meet Her cousin Alonzo who is home from the service. .... Valentines Day is coming and Daryl wants to get something nice for Marigold and she is planning something special for him. This could be the perfect time for these two to finally admit how they truly feel about each other.....and Oh my, do they ever! This is the most erotic installment yet! Little miss innocent isn't any shade of innocent any longer!And then here comes Jose..... I swear this animal is relentless as he and his boys once again corner Daryl, and this tome it isn't looking to good for him......have to read the next installment of this sinfully delicious saga. ... Each of these are fast, action packed reads. The sex is hot, detailed and erotic, but that's not all there is. There is a story line here with characters that bring it all true to life. No Billionaire Bull or Barbie wannabes.. Just people like you and me trying to live and love.

After a Wonderful weekend of just being together, talking,  watching TV, and the best sex either of them ever had,  of course the harassment starts from Jose.. He wants Margol back. No one breaks up with him and he is relentless with phone calls. He knows all about Daryl and Marigol. Then Daryl is corned while leaving the store. It seems that Jose thinks he still owns Marisol, and he and two of his boys are going to bring this home to Daryl. .......

THE SPIRIT KEEPERThis is a whole new twist in the paranormal world. Adults and Teens both will find this absolutely captivating...There is a journey ahead, a prophecy to be fulfilled..... But evil lurks in the most unlikely places....... I am looking forward to seeing how this all works out for Sarah Redbird.THE PROPHECYreally enjoyed the rest of this story, I was sorry to see the end of the book.Melissa, you really brought Sarah, Priscilla, Adrian and all the characters to life. They are all so well developed.... I was just so engrossed in the whole story, it was like I was there, I actually cried at their graduation
I just keep ordering this..... I Love it!
Mixed with some red ones and they look great!
Very real looking. I needed something to put in a basket that I really liked, and these are just perfect!
Always happy with Wrangler clothes.

This is only getting 4 stars this time....  the leather lacing on the upper part of the shoe failed..... I don't know if it was an imperfection, but it came apart. I've purchased these moccasins in the past with no issues, and in fact they are the only ones my man likes, so you can imagine how upset and disappointed he is about this....

SEEK..This is a fast reading mind bending erotic suspense !! Is Lillith crazy like they say, or is Sebastian real? Is he really visiting her at night, or is it all just a figment of her imagination? I really couldn't decide what was reality. Something really bad happened for sure that landed her & her friend in an institution, but is it because they saw something they shouldn't have and this is a cover up, or was it something so horrific that the girls are just broken?Lillith is determined to find a way out, track down Sebastian and get the answers she so desperately needs. But what if she does find him? What if he is real? What will he do her? Can she even survive what's in store for her?.......SNARE..Lillith has found him, Sebastian Brand. She found a way out of the hospital and googled his address. But he stands there and insists he doesn't know her. He even walks past her but she follows still talking to him, she won't be ignored. He forces money on her and walks into a building. She follows him in and then into the elevator, all the while telling him about the hospital and what they did together........ He finally grabs her by the throat, up against the wall when they exit & reach the hall way and she is shocked that he would put his hands on her in this way, a brutal spanking. he told her not to follow him, don't try to find him. Now he tells her, " You have no idea what you have done".......Lillith is about to have her life change in ways she never knew it could. This journey will show her that monsters do exsist. They don't hide under your bed and wait for darkness to fall. They come straight at you in the day light, they hunt you down, they are cruel, sadistic and deadly....they are the darkness, they go by the name of the Genisis club..... And then the memory of her return from vacation, comes back, what she and Ashley saw, what they did to her mother and then to Ashley, she also remembers the man who helped them to do this....Sebastian. He was there..... and now she belongs to him, he will never let her go, and she will never be able to rescue Ashley from the institution.....they own everything and everyone. there is no help anywhere.She should have never looked for him, she should have kept going when she escaped, far, far away... but it's too late now because she is trapped and she learns that hell has different rooms & the nightmare has really just begun.Seize....I know you think that your ready for this installment, especially if you haveread "SEEK" & "SNARE." So did I. There is no way to prepare for all thathappens within these pages! It is non stop, mind bending, diabolical dark, and,evil all the way through to the end. No Wait! It doesn't even end, it just kindof stops.... So get comfy because your not going to be able to put thisdownThe nightmare has begun.......Lillithsays, "Tell me. Tell me everything " Sebastian knows it's time to come clean...hesays,...."You want to know? I'll tell you. I'll tell you all about my life.But know this: from now on, you are mine. Forever. No freedom. No way out.This is it. You want to know my dirty secrets? Fine. You'll become a part ofthem."........So we get to see what makes Sebastian the man, (or monster) he istoday. It becomes all about power, money and self-worth. There is no such thingas love: only people with desires and how they fulfill them. He built his empirefrom the ground up until he had the biggest curated library in the state. Hislife is better, he is stronger, smarter, cleaner, impervious. But nothing preparedhim for what was to come...... Four men walked into his library....Their reach goesfar and their power is absolute...... It is true that absolute power corruptsabsolutely. It's totally mind bending to imagine some group as evil as thishaving so much power that they can use, abuse or kill anyone that happens tostumble across their radar. Such was the case for Lillith's family and bestfriend Ashley...He leaves her with the promise that he will not come back with out Ashley or she can shoot him.Lillith moves on, builds a new life, goes to school, and has a new career by thetime Sebastian shows up 5 months later..... Ashley is not with him....So, WillLillith shoot him?....What became of Arthur, Hubert, Lewis, &Patrick?......And finally,...Where is Ashley? Did he at least find her? Is shealive or dead? .......This series truly lives up to it's name!SCORCH....  Man O Man, I hope your ready, because this, right now, is where it all comes together. Where has Ashley been? I was absolutely  floored when it all the pieces fell into place. You really need to be paying attention. The only other thing I will say about it is...... Mirror Mirror on the wall.. (hint hint).

Possessed Part OneFirst I'd like to say how much I enjoyed reading part one from this debut Author. A breath of fresh air... It's about a big woman instead of the ever popular Barbie doll skinny, young and beautiful girls. Samantha Webber is a big curvy fake red head with all the insecurities the rest of us "fat" woman have. She has a job as an assistant to the billionaire and CEO of W Magazine, Leo King. And although he is knock down gorgeous, and she appreciates that, this is not a love at first sight story for Samantha. In fact she can't stand her boss most of the time! He tramples all over her privacy and personal time. He can be obnoxious. He ignores her unless he needs her. No small talk or friendly conversation. But he pays really, really well so she resists the urge to throw things at him in frustration....Instead she goes to her on line friend, Mr. Awesome. No names, no faces just sexual release. People who don't know anything about each other getting each other off. Samantha loves being dominated. They send pictures back and forth as she follows his demands. She never has to worry about a man breaking her heart just because he finds it amusing. This gets real interesting within the story. I just had to laugh, even as I felt for her....Samantha is called into Mr. Kings office. He needs her and what he needs has something to do with the pictures she had to delete from his phone (and hers) from a Las Vegas trip where he got drunk. And I mean Hammered to where he didn't even remember sending those pictures to her phone. He tells her the whole story and it ends with him calling his parents and telling them he got married! So, now he has to go to a family gathering with a wife! I can't even begin to tell you what a fiasco this turns into, it would spoil all the fun and I don't do spoilers. Let me just say that there is more going on here than meets the eye and after the cliffhanger at the end, I can't wait for part two!
