I do believe that I have found a new favorite Author!Part TwoPart Two picks up exactly where part one left us...... the extraordinary truth about the "real wife" comes to light, and believe me, it is a stunning example of what lengths a person's greed and jealousy can go to, and what their willing to do to get what they want, even if it can potentially destroy what that is.There are several different things going on here and watching them each play out, in, and around each other really had me glued to Sam's side..... I wanted to drop kick me some Leo, even as I kind of felt sorry for his dilemma. And there is just no denying the chemistry between Leo and Sam.....so erotic! But so is her on line sessions with mrawesome....Oh My Gawd, Hot, Hot, Hot!!I have come to know that with this Author, the devil's in the details, clues, hints and seemingly unimportant events are anything but, which is why I am so looking forward to part three. Not to mention the cliffhanger we are left with!Part ThreeDrama, erotic romance and retribution all come together brilliantly to finish this trilogy.Marilyn continues with her evil plans to become CEO of the magazine. She believed in that twisted mind of hers, if she got Sam out of the picture, it could all be hers.Sam does something that has dramatic consequences...... Leo fires her.....it looks like Marilyn got what she wanted and she signs the divorce papers, but she will never be CEO, so it looks like it's all good for Leo too, or it would be if only Sam would answer her phone, text messages, or email. Leo wants her, and by God, he will have her... he pulls out all the stops in order to reach her....but Sam is feeling, used, her heart is shattered. Is there even a way to come back from such devastation? She gave it all, all of herself to him, and he callously threw her away. But whats really killing her is the fact that shattered or not, her heart and her body still wants Leo, Sir, all of it...... You have got to read this phenomenal trilogy yourself. I can see a brite future ahead for this new Author. A brilliant beginning indeed.

To Light The Dragon's FireThat Blurb you read for this book tells you about how Terra Heggan is going to sacrifice her own happiness to save the family business. She is going to marry into money....To Terra, it's no big deal as she thinks she is well past the age of finding true love anyway.So she and her younger twin sister Lanni go rock climbing, a last adventure as a single woman.....Man, she has no idea what an adventure they are both about to embark on! Like ending up in another reality kind of adventure...I don't want to give spoilers so I will just tell you that all the different mythological creatures within the five Kingdoms of this reality just boggle the mind. And you remember how Terra said she would never find true love? Yeah, we all know how that goes.....just when your not looking for it, Shazam! Turns out that King Draven, who can shift into a dragon is Terra's intended. But it would seem that someone else wants the throne & all the power that goes with it and will stop at nothing to get it. There is so much going on here, plots within plots, friends that could be foe. This had me from the very first chapter right to the very last sentence, which left me with my jaw hitting the floor having an Oh No No No moment.To Save The Broken HeartIT IS really Arin's story but we see all our old (and some new) friends get into the fray as one rescue mission turns into two.Arin Manus, war advisor to King Draven is to face death in the arena for crimes he didn't commit and his assassin may be his one true mate!Lanni Heggan, Who IS ALIVE after all, but is tricked while on her way to rescue Arin is taken prisoner so Golix can use a power she didn't even know she possessed!The people and creatures of Bak'ra are in danger from the very person who was appointed as King Draven's replacement, but......Is he dead?Absolute chaos abounds!I don't want to give too much away and spoil it for you. But just let me say that the twists and turns and astonishing things that happen in this installment are mind benders!Margaret Taylor Has created a world of five kingdoms, the likes of which I have never experienced before. The inhabitants of these Kingdoms are a mix of mythical, human, and Imagination and any derivative there of! Some are delightful,& scary. Most are magical in some form or another and some are Dark, just pure evil.To Free The Dragons SoulThis is the 3rd installment to a most remarkable series, It follows smooth and true from the first two books where we see some old friends that we learn more about as they continue to develope,as well as new characters, some of which will become friends, comrades and mates. I'm still delighted with the every kind of mythological caracters with a twist,... most can shift to being humanoid. One of the newbies is a little round fur ball called a Ilthe. his name is Tollo. generally speaking, Ilthe's are guardians of the dragons but will go pretty much whever they are needed. Tollo has some unique abilities and I'm not sure we've seen all of them yet......Anyway, Golix, that most vile of Unicorns is moving forward with his plans for the 5 Kingdoms while Draven and company try to gather forces and at the same time figure out what Golix plans are. Why is he going back and forth to the human world? What is he doing? Then, Tyleios Cannis, interin King of Bra'ka turns on the very people he promised to protect. That's all I will say about that except to say, it's only the begining... The end game is so diabolical, the sacrifices made, the loss of lives, all the suffering and it may not have been enough! It becomes clear that this has been years in the planning. Will the five Kingdoms fall? This is one journey you will have to make for yourself. I know I was shaken to my very core more than once, and was brought to tears several times....Maragret Taylor has a talent, she can make you chuckle and then cry in the span of a couple of sentences, and have you thanking her for it, as I am about to do now!... I know it ain't over yet M. but wherever this going, I'm in! This is one fantastical voyage and I thank you for allowing me to on board!

After yet another fight  with her husband, Brandy decides that this is the last time he will hit her. She walks out... With nothing... not even shoes.... then the skies open up and she is drenched in seconds. Perfect.....but on she walks. and walks. and walks..... suddenly, she realizes how far she must have walked because she has no idea where she is, her feet are turning blue from the cold rain and night has fallen. A car draws near and a man wants to know if she would like a ride. He introduces himself as Gary and he is on his way to Boston but right now he is lost. Brandy is lost too but accepts the ride. Follow them on what is to be the ride of a lifetime, or the lack of one if you want to see it that way..... I very much enjoyed this earlier work by this Author, and if you can excuse the boo boo's along the way, you will enjoy it too.

This is without a doubt one of the best series I've ever read.. The action never stops and the missions get more in your face  with danger, mystery, betrayal, and loss as the series unfolds. This of course brings this motley crew together, and we see them bond as an elite special opps,, last line of defense team.......  There are however some religious references throughout,  PLEASE keep in mind this a work of FICTION.I absolutely adored the large cast of well developed characters, but Lopez will forever be my favorite.. He is the " Pull a rabbit out of the hat" go to guy and gets the team away from danger or death on a regular basis. I know you will enjoy meeting Stark, who is the eye in sky computer geek who, along with the assistance of his mother keeps the team informed any way they can, even if a little hacking here and there is needed. They have been indispensable as far as intell on any mission, and my idea of help from above, well, along with the team's sniper on the roof, and that would beDavidson. ( He has a rather remarkable history).....There are so many more absolutely unique team members, it's impossible to tell you about all of them.  If you only read one action series this year, this should be the one!Years in the making put together in one great set! What could be better?

It feels like I have been waitong so long for this third book of the Viper series, but I just have to say, it was worth the wait! I so enjoyed getting back together with the band and seeing old friends....yes, yes, I know this is Saul's story, and what a story it is too! I did tear up a couple of times, but I laughed some too.( I blame Cruz)I highly suggest reading the first two books ( Rock The Viper & Forever Viper) as they are relevant to understanding the  "Then"  that gets us to the  "Now" of what's going on with the Viper band members, who by the way are Vampire!  So......One night at the club, Saul meets Jade, and there is most certainly something there. He swore he could never love again, not after Julia.... As he is soul searching, Saul tells us about his painfull past and how he lost his entwined, his beloved Julia... he knows how he feels about Jade, but can he let go of past hurts and love again?  And I will tell you one thing.... I will never look at an ice cream truck again and just see an ice cream truck! There be magic in them there coolers! ... anyway,... In between we see Jaun, Peppa, and Noah get married, and Peppa has a little someum someum to share with her entwined...... Stay tuned.....

I won this debut book in a giveaway from the author. I am always excited to read " new blood", and I sure wasn't disapointed.Bentley Celeste is an erotic, & dark romance author who hides from the world due to a very dark and disturbing past. She has a mother who hates her. Always has, always will. In fact, if Darla Celeste could find Bentley, it could be the end for her. She has been trying to kill her since before she was even born. Darla did not want twins, and put her all into Cora ( the pretty one) her ticket to grandeur on the heels of Cora's modeling career.Bentley and Cora are twins, ( albeit completely opposite) Cora, thin and willowy..Bentley is short and curvy and has  suffered her mothers wrath, both verbally & physically all of her life which left scars inside as well as outside for Bentley. It's left her a very broken girl who has no idea how it feels to be loved. She lives a solitary life, alone with some very dark secrets, with very few people within her small circle....Then one day she her life is turned upside down when she is almost literally walked over by cover model Tristan Reece. ...Tryst isn’t your average man candy, he has a lot of his own baggage & secrets He is dealing with, including nightmares he still suffers from his stint in the military. He has a face and body that lets him have his way. That is until Bentley goes all hell fire missle on him. She has zero tollerance for that crap, and just wait until you find out why! This chick just can't catch a break in this horrendance life she is forced to live. ... At the same time I was feeling bad for Tryst. The poor guy just can't seem to do anything right where Bentley is concerned. He starts out with the best of intentions and I get my hopes up for them,... they really are magic together, then, ...you know those secrets and stuff I was telling you about?  Yeah, one of those happens...... and, well, ..... I'm still routing for them...The characters are all well developed, and true to life like which really made this an emotional read for me. The twists, turns, surprise and secrets kept me off balance right through to the cliffhanger. I am so going to read the conclusion of this story. I was actually glad it wasn't over yet and had more to come!

This is a quick but delightful read about a middle-aged man, Karl, who carried around the guilt for something that he was blamed for decades ago until something miraculous happens which allows him to see things as they really were then, how things will be in the future, but more importantly, that he, himself can and will change it.I recommend this to anyone who has an imagination and needs a quick read...

I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed this Anthology. I fell in love with Ember Addams a little bit more with each life I watched her live. These talented Authors brought her alive and kept her character developing and re developing right through to the end. I would really like to see more of Ember, after all, like she said herself..... "The universe is infinite"We get to see Ember live the life's of a requisitions expert and then as an FBI agent just to name two..... in each life she has very smexy hot erotic encounters with men who are drool worthy, yep, this action along with all the intrique and drama that she finds every time she is thrust into another life time was enough to keep me reading till the end. This is definately a must read for this summer!

Gertie O'Leary is a witch. .....She has a heart of gold and means well, all though she usually just gets herself in pickle, and this time is no different. She has a new guest on the Plantation and this time it's a rather large pickle. Thank the Goddess for Leigh, Marie Laveau and well, the whole gang because Gertie needs all the help she can get this time! .....Poor Gertie, all she wanted was to spend some quality time alone with her man. He has been away, for work, for what seems like forever, and it's not happening any time soon if she can't get her new guest squared away!

Gwen Shafer lives alone with her daughter Carly and has been training her to be a hunter since she was a small child. They each have the same birthmark, which designates them as being very special indeed. Gwen tells Carly stories about the things she must be ready to fight. But the most important thing is what is called "Shai". She is a sin eater, she eats the souls of people and leaves them as "empties", zombie like creatures that in turn kill anything else it can find.Gwene is relentless about Carly's training and her memorizing certain instructions which includes a phone number.... Carly does not believe in monsters or " The Order", but very soon she will be grateful for knowing all of it because life as she knows it is about to change forever when Shai takes over Gwen's soul and Carly is forced to kill her own mother.......The Hunt is on with a vengeance.This is a fast paced and twisted race against a mythical Greek Goddess, the Shai, who will take any form, devour and over run even the Order itself to get to Carly, the one marked by prophecy to defeat Shai.....This is not another zombie story.  It is however, full of surprises right to the very end. I was totally taken in and captivated by all of the characters, who some held their own surprises, and not all good ones at that!  I was knocked sideways by some that I never saw coming at all.Trust me, this book is worth the read.

First of all.... WOW, HOT DAMN!!!!! Couldn't put this down...... Rose has quite a surprise for Mason, but first she needs an honest answer to a most important question that has been kind of haunting her. This story is all about how she goes about it. And in the end, did she go to far?Be prepared for some truly hot, gritty, down and dark eroticism.  Even I wasn't sure how this was going to play out or how it was going to impact their lives or Ricks job for that matter!  You just have to read this one for yourself. Seriously, only adults please.

This is a fast paced, quick, erotic read featuring my favorite doctor........ Richard Mason, sarcastic, genius, doctor.... he is truly brilliant, but doesn't play well with others, and has no bedside manner at all.Well, this man walks into a bar....... but for Rick, there is no punch line, this is not a joke, and he's not dreaming. The knock down gorgeously  beautiful green eyed vixen sitting at the back table has just bought him a drink. ....Mason, you old dog, your about to get so freaking lucky!

Charm Livingston is a Vengeance Demon who lives in hell. She dreams of escaping, but,  this is not as easy as you may think. You see, her father is the devil himself....... as a vengeance demon she is called on by a furious soul  to exact revenge in exchange for ten years in hell. While on one of these 'calls' an opertunity presents itself. in the form of an angel who says he can help. She could ascend and live as a human, if she can pass the 13 tests of the 13 levels of the underworld.  Can she keep father from knowing what she is doing and keep the angel Zachariah from hm?  What about the feelings she is developing for him at an alarming rate? Her own soul is going to be in danger if she isn't careful... and Oh Yeah!.... Lets throw a Genie into the mix, He is keen to grant her three wishes because then his 10 years in hell are over. This is without a doubt one  funny, romantic, and touching story. I look forward to the next test.

"Killer" is a brilliantly written prequel to the coming soon, " Stalker".. All the characters are really well developed. I could see Phoenix quite clearly in my minds eye...the story line grabs you, holds you, and pulls you in until the end. There are secrets within the secrets and nothing is as it seems. The blurb does not prepare you for this fast paced, dark erotic story, or the look into the pitch black mind of  Phoenix Sullivan..... what really scared me was to watch Vanessa's mind  slowly going over to the dark side. Or has she been there all along?

First of all...... WOW, just, WOW! .....This story is just one revelation after another.  These characters  are so well develped, in fact they continue to develop all the way through as we share their memories, mistakes, and sins....Some believe that people are a product of their up bringing. Others believe that at some point we can choose how we are going to be. But what if that up bringing was so stringent, dark, abusive, never to feel loved,...so terrifing that it truly became the only way to survive?  To do or die...Or to do so someone else doesn't die? ... This is such a story.  We get both POV's from Miles, who later becomes Phoenix Sullivan, a killer,  who has escaped prison with vengeance, his sole focus. and then there's  Vanessa, who is molded into the object that will further the power of her family, and much later, she escapes one hell, only to find herself in another hell, and to top it off, she knows he is coming for her, she is stalked, and hunted. She knew this day was coming, but she's not ready this soon.......There is so much going on.... stories within stories... secrets, deceptions, corruption, greed, and murder... They first  meet as children and become friends. For Miles (a rebellious foster kid) it was love at first sight. He would do anything to protect her. But Vanessa is forbidden to have anything to do with him, her life is planned out and it doesn't include that" dirty boy."  She is going to grow up and marry Phillip so the two families become stronger. Richer. Powerful.... and in the background (just quitely waiting) is Arthur, Phillip's greedy, jealous, brother.She continues to sneek and see Miles, They become very close, and on prom night, he is there to rescue her again. He sweeps her away and in his car they become lovers.... This truly marks the begining of the end for them. The betrayal, lies, and rejection that follows makes an already volatile Miles prime pickins for "The Company".... He is recruited by none other than Mr. X.... He is taught to kill without remorse, it is where he becomes Phoenix.... contract killer.Vanessa is in deep trouble.... She out witted him once. Can she survive long enough to do it again?... because what she doesn't know..... Phoenix isn't the only one who wants to end her life.I recommend this to adults who like a fast paced, dark, read. There is cruelty and violence involved..... I was gifted this copy in return for my honest review.

If you've read the blurb, you know that Kaypahl sacrifices herself. This is the story of a girl with such a pure heart, she continues to love those who only ridicule and reject her. Even her own sister who was once  unattractive also, turned on her when she blossomed into a beauty with womanhood.... all except the princess Leepak, she always had a warm smile and a wave for all, even a peck on the cheek for a child offering her a flower. But she is concerned that her people will starve if the rains don't come soon. Chaac has not been pleased by any of the sacrifices made so far. ...believing that she won't even be missed, she offers to be the next sacrifice...... at least her family will be proud of her then.So she is at the old ruins, at the foot of the temple. These ruins have been her only friend. Where she would pour her heart out and the stone would listen to her. Now she comes to say good bye..... she here's a voice that says..." when the time comes, run as fast and hard as you can, when you fly through the air, stand tall & proud but point your toes, when you sink, spread your arms like a bird taking flight." " when you sacrifice yourself for the sake of your people, I will meet you on the other side."So after they adorn her, get her ready and then parade through the city streets, thousands of people cheering, chanting her name, past the kings palace where the royal family stood in all their regala.When she is in place, she remembers what the voice told her, so she runs as fast as she can and hurles herself towards the water below.....She wakes up confused... there's a woman with her. It's Chaac's daughter. He told her to retrieve you & revive you. It's not your time to die. There is something about this woman, Kaypahl is reminded of Princess Leepak.........There is an amazing journey ahead, lessons to be learned, some surprises, and an absolutely remarkable resolution for Kaypahl.I started this journey feeling sad for Kaypahl, but I couldn't have been happier for her in the end.  I recommend this short, but fabulous story to everyone, of all ages.

This really is a short story, but it's by no means short of emotions. Not a lot to say without this turning into one big spoiler, but I will tell you that I felt bad for Nick. He ran from his tribe, leaving his young brother behind to deal with all the turmoil, politics, and hopelessness that he himself left behind.  Regret, guilt & grief are some of the most daunting emotions known to man. It's how Nick deals with them, leads to a most shocking ending.Well done Carly!

Imagine a world where every day people co-exsisted with witches and vampire. Of course rules and such are in place for the protection of all...... and of course with that comes those who think they don't have to follow those rules, and always there are rogue individuals or even groups that simply won't.Nadine and her husband Rick live in such a world. They live in a nice nieghborhood, in a nice house (left to Nadine) and they are happy. Well, Rick is happy. Nadine, not so much anymore. She misses the man she fell in love with and wonders what the future has in store for her.... That question is about to become moot as the answer knocks on her door. She finds a vampire,......an exstremely handsome vampire, but a vampire none the less.... who is acting for all the world like he should be there. Nadine's world comes crashing down around her head when, upon seeing the blank look on her face, he explains, his name is Baxter. He owns a club. A club that Rick has lost a lot of money in. He said she would pay his dept with her blood! Nadine has to go each night to feed Baxter until the debt is paid in full..... But then Rick does it again and this vampire, Phoenix is nothing like Baxter. In fact, these two have a history. One that did not end well for Baxter, and Phoenix now see's a way to do it again by using Nadine and Baxter's feelings for her......I am not telling any more of the story. What I will say is that there is so much more going on here and I do recommend this to adults that enjoy their vamps on the darker but erotic side.. .I enjoyed meeting the large cast of  well developed characters, they came across as true to life. A few of them actually surprised me by doing the unexpected.  I was gifted this copy in return for my honest review..

This book opens to find Hannah confined to Rick's bed, after her surgery, both legs up in traction, agonizing pain in her straightening legs, and tears running down her cheeks!  Rick is doing all he can to keep her comfortable. He has hooked her up with the internet and she is catching up with the last 30 years. ...but this not just Hannah's story..... Rick is about to take his own trip down the rabbit hole. It's all going to begin with a small boy who came to the hospital in a very bad way. No one could figure out what was wrong, not even the great Doctor Richard Mason...... Soon Rick himself is admitted into the hospital. Hannah is beside herself, she is on a mission. She believes she has had a message from God, and she must find the white rabbit. That is some how the answer as to how to save Rick. .... I was totaly captivated with everything that happens throughout this story. Hannah is just remarkable, she is not the same person who came out of that group home a few months ago. She is learning how to live and Rick hhimself learns a lot from his little Christian Sister.  I don't do spoilers, so your going to have to read it for yourself. This is a story about real love, hope, and redemption. I do recommend this whole series as a must read. i was gifted this book in return for my honest review.

Marsha is devastated. Her husband and father of their young son, Charlie is dead.....She is determinded to be strong for Charlie, but it seems that he is the one trying to be strong for her as he tells her that "daddy isn't dead."  But she soon realizes that Charlie truly believes this just by the things he tells her. He tells her that he talks to daddy. Marsha wonders if maybe she should get some help for her young son... Once when she tried to play a favorite game he shared with daddy by using twin beds and blankets, and the bears will guard the door.. but Charlie gets upset with her, telling her that it's impossible to build a bridge to never never land if you don't believe in fairies..... Then one day Charlie is gone.... Marsha is frantic until she sees the blankets. Has Charlie really gone to never never land? Is it truly possible? Then something absolutely amazing happens and Marsha at that moment finds that she does believe in fairies. This is a sweet fantasy that simply anyone can enjoy. I know I did.

Dazzled By Silver. by, Lacey Silks......This is a Brilliant beginning to what I believe is going to be an exciting and amazing trilogy......Here we meet Samantha Connor who is just out of a dead end relationship. One that she thought she'd be safe in, or at least her heart would be safe from falling in love. She has loved and lost, all at the age of seventeen through a disease that destroyed her, even as it slowly took her love from her. She vowed never to love again.........We also meet Gabriel Silver. He has also vowed never to love again after the death of his wife which he blames himself for. Gabe, his cousin's, Tristan and Julian together own one of the largest securities company and along with being private investigators are owners or investors in many other things. One of them is the new club that Samantha's best friend, Kendra just opened up. It's here, at the grand opening that Sam meets the sex on a stix bartender named Gabe.From here things get quite erotic as Sam is introduced to new and exciting sexual horizons with Kendra while being drawn to Gabe..... this is like her fantasizing all becoming real, and that would have been wonderful except for everything that is also about to overflow into her life, courtesy of the real bad men that Kendra got mixed up in. The very same men that killed Gabes wife. Now Gabe is dead set on protecting Sam, this woman who has broken through his wall, and made him feel again. ..........then the unthinkable happens, not once but twice! ....is history going to repeat itself? This leads us to the second installment as one thing is resolved, another event presents itself! I do recommend this to adults who enjoys mystery, romance, and explicit sexual scenariosSEEK by, Clarissa Wild.........This is a fast reading mind bending erotic suspense !! Is Lillith crazy like they say, or is Sebastian real? Is he really visiting her at night, or is it all just a figment of her imagination? I really couldn't decide what was reality. Something really bad happened for sure that landed her & her friend in an institution, but is it because they saw something they shouldn't have and this is a cover up, or was it something so horrific that the girls are just broken?Lillith is determined to find a way out, track down Sebastian and get the answers she so desperately needs. But what if she does find him? What if he is real? What will he do her? Can she even survive what's in store for her?.......

I am not finished with this set just yet and will be adding to it, but so far......HER ALPHA MATE by, Michele Bardsley is a quick, hot read where Alice learns that sometimes, Love can conqure all. Even for a little werewolf.THE BEAR WITCH PROJECT by,Renee George.... Solange had just turned 21 when the mental wirdness set in, so at her mother's urging she is on her home from college. Strange things are happening that has her wondering what secrets her mother is keeping from her. But things are about to get even stranger when she makes a stop at a casino and meets Ty Wasape.HER DESTINY by, Brandy Walker.... Selena Perry has a stalker. Every night when she came home from work at the morgue "Felix" would meet her at the window where she would give him a bowl of milk. Yep, it's a black cat. But this cat is very special. Selena is about to see just how special when her ex boyfriend grabs her, drags her into an alley and it's "Felix" to the rescue! But he's no longer a tom cat.KNIGHT FORCE 1 by, Sydney Addae ......... Silas Knight created a special task force to assist his 50 Alphas with defeating the opposing factions hell bent on destroying all half breed wolf shifters... so even though there is a war going on there is some hot, smexy wolf, paranormal romance and Alphas galore. these shifters have multi talents which makes this quite a journey.DARKNESS RISING by, Lisa Carlisle ( Chateau Seductions 0.5) ..... Antoine Chevalier is a gargoyle who, while in human form is attacked (even though there is a truce in place) by a multitude of vampire  & changed. They wanted a vampire with gargoyle strength to be their protector. He could not shift anymore, They'd stolen his life and rebirthed him as a monster, the very evil the gargoyles fought against........HER DRAGON'S SOUL by, Julia Mills.....This is Hannah and Liam's story. They each know the other is the one that the universe has made just for them. They each plan to tell the other and then there will be the mating ceremony. But you & I  know that is not how it's going go down. It never does...... Cleland, the Grand Draoi has other plans, and it seems he has a hold on Hannah's mind where as he can control her for spans at a time and all Hannah feels is a darkness that falls over her. Liam though, has noticed her "trance" like stare and has gone to the clan for help. Will the dragon be able to save his little white witch?  Will there be a mating ceremony?

I will add more as I read, but I'm starting with Clarissa Wild's "KILLER""Killer" is a brilliantly written prequel to the coming soon, " Stalker".. All the characters are really well developed. I could see Phoenix quite clearly in my minds eye...the story line grabs you, holds you, and pulls you in until the end. There are secrets within the secrets and nothing is as it seems. The blurb does not prepare you for this fast paced and erotic story, or the look into the pitch black mind of  Phoenix Sullivan..... what really scared me was to watch Vanessa's mind  slowly going over to the dark side. PLEASE...  make sure you heed the warning about this book.

Sonnet Vale by,Gena D. LutzThis is a quick read, but it lacks nothing in the way of erotic vampire romance, mystery, twists, and surprises you never see coming. Sonnet Vale is part of a team, "Fang Squad inc" They hunt and track vampire. Then one day, life as she knows it is changed forever. Nothing is as she believed it to be, not even her own exitsistance....Seductive Solutions by, Brandy L. RiversI love fantasy, erotica and everything in between, so, this sure did it for me with spells being cast, elemental royality, and some sizzling hot erotic action, I couldn't be happier!  Scotty, who is a Nymph, that is, he needs intimacy to survive, had been seduced, trapped and mated to the beautiful, but evil Saressa's spell..... His friend Toryn rescued him from her plain, brought him to the human city of Seattle, but it did not break the spell. Scotty is wasting away without the intimacy of love. Toryn's mate, Isadora is a changeling with some mad skills of her own from her parents. Mom is the Queen of the air kingdom and Dad is the king of the earth kingdom which makes Isa a pretty powerful princess. She believes she can not only break Saressa's spell, but stop any future attempts.... So, Isa & Toryn  go to Scotty and the three of them partake in Seductive Solutions...Erotically Delishious!Her Dragon's Heart By, Julia MillsThis is Jace & Melanie's story. What a story it is. The more time he spent around Melanie, the stronger their bond grew. This in itself is something unheard of. This does't happen until after the official mating ceremony, but, he would catch a glimpse of her thoughts, he started to feel her emotions, so when it just stopped, like a switch being flipped, he knew something wasn't right.  He remembered that lately, she hasn't been herself ever since Kyra announced she had a lead on Calysta,  involving a coven of black witches & wizards called the "Dorcha", descendants of the Firblogs---- the dark aborigines of the 13th century.  Over the next few days she even seemed to be avoiding him. ...But he did catch part of a phone call she recieved, which sounded like she was talking to a family member, and with venom in her voice she used the old dragon language to insult the caller. How is it that she is so well versed in their language?......Now she is GONE!  just the stench of black magic left in her condo and a big mess..... This leads into one mother of a search & rescue senario, which in turn leads to a battle of epic poportion against some of the baddest of the bad from the darkest part of the dark side. And you are never going to believe what they need Melanie for. Her Family history and blood line make her VERY SPECIAL!Gertie's Paranormal Plantation by, Melanie James Gertie O'Leary is a witch. .....She has a heart of gold and means well, all though she usually just  gets herself in pickle, and this time is no different. She has a new guest on the Plantation and this time it's a rather large pickle. Thank the Goddess for Leigh, Marie Laveau and well, the  whole gang because Gertie needs all the help she can get this time! .....Poor Gertie, all she wanted was to spend some quality time alone with her man. He has been away, for work, for what seems like forever. But if I know Gertie.... where there's a will, there's a way.

What can you do when your husband's twin comes to stay? Valerie really loves her brother in law. She is happy to help, even though Greg didn't talk to her before extending the invitation to stay with them until he gets on his feet again. Things just never seem to work out for him for long. Jobs, woman, or, well, anything. He really needs to get it together....soon! Valerie and Greg's sex life is non existent since her brother in law came and Valerie is about to lose her mind. She misses the afternoon delight when Greg would come home for lunch, and the nights are no better with him right in the next bedroom.The loyal ladies of Eveiller Drive, seem to have some pretty good idea's about how to have their loving time together and how to maybe solve the job problem and get their home back.......Holy elevators Batman, are you in for a smexy read. ...

Chapter One picks up where "Abuse" left us.  Renata and Grant are on the way to Dallas..... I will not go into the detail about the "therapy sessions", except to assure you that they are indeed earth shattering smexy.  Andre' certainly knew what he was doing when he put the "little mouse" together with the "monster." It surely seems that as Renata helped Grant, she too learned some things.... but, it's not exactly happily ever after. Not by a long shot. Do you remember that frantic phone call Grant got from his mother? ( at the end of "Abuse")  Well, they did exhumed Chester Wilkinson's body, and after testing, his death is now being called a murder, and guess who the prime suspect is? ... long buried secrets will come to light. this could be bad, very bad....

I jumped right into part two as soon as I finished part one because of the shocking cliff hanger we are left with.... Now, it's ten years later and things certainly are different at Chantelle Grace. Strange things are happening to Billy Blaze who is staying there while in New Orleans. And, it just happens to be Mardi Gras.......There is so much going on here, I was enchanted with this totally different kind of love story, but there is evil lurking, just waiting for another chance to strike out.....secrets come to light, and things are about to change again. This time it's forever!

I really enjoyed reading Strange Magic. It's absolutely named correctly... Thyme is about to turn 21. She lives with her Mamere  ever since kindergarten when her mother dropped her off and disappeared. She met Shane, who was in 5th grade at the time. He was adopted. They have been inseparable ever since and are in love. Leon Johnson, a very creepy man, is trying to get Thyme and her Grandmother to sell Chantelle Grace, which is their ice cream shop where they make homemade ice cream. He is also overly friendly with Thyme, and not in a nice way. So, this is in New Orleans during Mardi Gras with Katrina making her way towards the coast.There is something very special about Thyme. Her Mamere, as per her instructions from Thyme's mother, has a lot to tell her about one her 21st birthday. But Leon knows too and kidnaps both Thyme and Shane.........Now, you have to read it yourself to see all of what he does and what becomes of Shane and Thyme..... I'm going to part two right now, can't wait to continue this.

This is really Andrew and Emma's story but it takes some amazing revelations, and a couple of bonafided miracles to get it told... King Alarick, the first dragon... He is responsible for the birth of the dragon shifters, even makes an appearance. And Shavon, he is the first Elder and was brought forth to bring the spirit of the "Special One" home. And remember that book that Andrew was trying to translate?  Well, this is just one of the things that is going to boggle your mind.Somehow, the mating bond between Emma and Andrew is established, but it happened so fast that she is sharing his pain...On Every Level. She spends days in agony until she is brought to Andrew. Only then do they both find some relief.... but nothing can prepare you for what happens from here on in!  And our sweet, shy and talented jewelery maker, you know, Emma, she makes all the jewelery with the dragon scales that Devon brings her.... well, she becomes one Fierce woman as she stands up to the Clan and Fights For Her Dragon!This is such a remarkable and soul shattering journey of forgivness and redemption, that even my hardened heart has softened. I mean, after all, the Universe doesn't make mistakes and FATE WILL NOT BE DENIED!

Dazzled By Silver....This is a Brilliant beginning to what I believe is going to be an exciting and amazing trilogy......Here we meet Samantha Connor who is just out of a dead end relationship. One that she thought she'd be safe in, or at least her heart would be safe from falling in love. She has loved and lost, all at the age of seventeen through a disease that destroyed her, even as it slowly took her love from her. She vowed never to love again.........We also meet Gabriel Silver. He has also vowed never to love again after the death of his wife which he blames himself for. Gabe, his cousin's, Tristan and Julian together own one of the largest securities company and along with being private investigators are owners or investors in many other things. One of them is the new club that Samantha's best friend, Kendra just opened up. It's here, at the grand opening that Sam meets the sex on a stix bartender named Gabe.From here things get quite erotic as Sam is introduced to new and exciting sexual horizons with Kendra while being drawn to Gabe..... this is like her fantasizing all becoming real, and that would have been wonderful except for everything that is also about to overflow into her life, courtesy of the real bad men that Kendra got mixed up in. The very same men that killed Gabes wife. Now Gabe is dead set on protecting Sam, this woman who has broken through his wall, and made him feel again. ..........then the unthinkable happens, not once but twice! ....is history going to repeat itself? This leads us to the second installment as one thing is resolved, another event presents itself! I do recommend this to adults who enjoys mystery, romance, and explicit sexual scenariosLayers Deep.....This installment leads into where the last one left us. Tristan is bringing the full force of Cross industries to bear on rescuing Kendra. And to that end recruits Allie Green, the rookie cop we met briefly in the last book. She has her own reasons for wanting the job. She needs the available resources to carry out her own agenda for revenge...to kill the man responsible for her father's death and rape of her mother which resulted in the death of the unborn baby girl she carried.What she didn't count on was the draw they both seem to share for each other and how complicated things could get because of it.....This is a no holds barred look at the underbelly of human traffickers and the humiliation and cruelty that the victims are subjected to. Can Allie handle the part of a victim so as to get to Kendra? Especially after learning about the history between her & Tristan? Is what they have together a lie? Is he using her to get Kendra back because he still loves her? How is she suppose to stay focused and not get them both killed? ......this is the one you don't want to miss out on, because you know that what ever can go wrong, usually will! And the cliffhanger on this one, yep....there is one, and it's a definite....Oh. Hell. No. moment.......Layers Peeled..... just so loved this installment. The surprises just kept on coming, some good, some tear jerking great, some not so good and some down right heartbreaking. But I just couldn't put it down, between the non stop action and the awe inspiring erotica, my pulse was all over the place. The whole Cross family is in this one, from weddings to births to,...well, you just have to read this one. I strongly recommend starting from the beginning with Dazzled by Silver, so you get to know this large, truly amazing family. They are a bunch of well developed characters that I'm sure will captivate you too. I can't say too much more without giving away all the good stuff. So Go To It!I will update this review as soon as I read the last installment.

Our fifth visit to Eveiller drive finds us at the home of Jeff and Ashley where she is trying desperately to understand why her life has become such a struggle. You see, Ashley is the step parent to Jeff's teenage son & daughter. Their attitudes towards her have changed drastically since the wedding. They treat her like she's the hired help, only there to pick up after them, do their laundry, keep them fed, and put up with their smart ass and demeaning remarks. In fact, Emily, flat out said as much to her just this morning. But the hardest thing is that Jeff is just blowing it off, telling her to be patient. That it's an adjustment for them, they will come around.  Thank goodness that it's her turn to have the girls over for their weekly group get together, and sure enough a plan of action is formed and it does the trick. They are off to a great start......and, oh yeah, passions are reignited for Ashley and Jeff. Burn Baby Burn!This is a quick read, but just like the previous visits to the group sessions with the ladies of Eveiller drive, I come away thinking there is a life lesson to be had. This one is for any step parent. I can't think of too many jobs that are harder because it involves body, heart and soul.

Burning Touch is a well put together mystery/steaming hot story that is as thrilling as it is erotic.......Devon Wise is a massage therapist who has recently taken on a number of new clients through a referral. She also has a roommate, a gay wedding planner, Chuck, who is dealing with the very definition of "bridezilla". And then we have Ben Stafford, recently divorced, who deals in real estate. He and his partner buys, fixes, and flips properties. Neither Devon or Ben are looking for a relationship, but, there is a definite pull when these two meet, so they agree to a one night, no strings kind of thing. Fate has other plans. When all of these characters come together..... it's murder!Tropic of Trouble finds us at Kelsey Ackerman's book store, where she just found her ageing assistant, Margaret murdered. It looks like a robbery gone wrong until she sees that particular boxes of books have been disturbed. The ones that her best friend Jenna's brother Jason gave her from his Uncle's estate. One of those books, it turns out could be very valuable. And someone else knows it! ..... This is another great mystery with plenty of erotica to keep it sizzling..... Wynter Daniels never disappoints.

Drama, erotic romance and retribution all come together brilliantly to finish this trilogy.Marilyn continues with her evil plans to become CEO of the magazine. She believed in that twisted mind of hers, if she got Sam out of the picture, it could all be hers.Sam does something that has dramatic consequences...... Leo fires her.....it looks like Marilyn got what she wanted and she signs the divorce papers, but she will never be CEO, so it looks like it's all good for Leo too, or it would be if only Sam would answer her phone, text messages, or email. Leo wants her, and by God, he will have her... he pulls out all the stops in order to reach her....but Sam is feeling, used, her heart is shattered. Is there even a way to come back from such devastation? She gave it all, all of herself to him, and he callously threw her away. But whats really killing her is the fact that shattered or not, her heart and her body still wants Leo, Sir, all of it...... You have got to read this phenomenal trilogy yourself. I can see a brite future ahead for this new Author. A brilliant beginning indeed.

Epic has really distinguished themselves as "getting it" as far as what Paleo people want to buy as convenience foods. I started eating Paleo about 3 years ago and I really like the way I feel. I have been able to effortlessly maintain my weight and it is pretty easy to eat in restaurants...but snack foods are another story. I travel a lot and sometimes you are just going to get stuck looking at some nasty airport food. I try and carry some convenience foods with me when I travel. This is a wonderful snack that is 100% Paleo, and tastes wonderful. I probably would have not tought to pair toasted coconut with jerky....but they work well together. I also like that this is already cut into "nibble" size which is far more convenient to eat that a big slab of jerky. Very pleased with the product and will reorder.

First off.....let me just say I am a "lay person" and speak only a smattering of Geek. This is not a super techy review. I travel a lot and always have the "hotel room office" going. Like most smaller laptops, I only have 1 USB input on my MacBook Pro. This has been super super helpful in allowing me to hook several different devices up and do what I have to do. Card readers, thumb drives, even my fitness wrist band. I actually like the size and the fact that it has some "beef" to it. It is stable on a desktop with things plugged into it. I hate the ones that always flip over once a bunch of stuff is plugged in. This reminds me of just a home power strip in it's design....simple and effective. I am very pleased with it and would reccommend.

A great blend of beneficial gut bacteria. I have been using this product for a few months now in conjunction with eating more fermented foods and bone broth to improve gut health. Obviously......I started all three at one time so it is hard to give credit only to this product, but since starting this protocol my bloating and other stomach issues have greatly dissipated. I am very pleased so far.

Nice soft long pajama pants for winter lounging. The pockets are a nice feature (for Cheetos or the remote). They just keep getting softer as I wash them. Great fit and nice color selection on Amazon.

I will personally fist fight you.Best macadamia nuts on the market...hands down. Buttery taste with just the right amount of sea salt. These will make you throw rocks at the grocery store brand nuts. They are also a golden yellow and about 1/3 larger than the grocery store variety. Interesting sidebar.....if you do the helicopter volcano tour out of the Hilo (big island) airport....you fly right over their packing facility. How is that for street creed?

Super easy headlight replacement for my VW CC. From start to finish about a 5 minute no tool job....and that was having not done it before. The oil change place wanted $25 to replace it....I paid less than $9.00 on Amazon and did it myself for free.
Great OEM replacement for my VW CC. Popped them on in two minutes. Super, super easy install. Great quality and can't beat the Amazon price.

These Pods seem to be taking over everything. I was a bit skeptical because my dishwasher has two places to put granular or liquid.....I guess it releases it in two stages? I have just been using one pod per the instructions and my dishes are perfect. Less messy and more space efficient than the big bottle of liquid as well. Very pleased.

Nice cotton blankets. Love the colors.....I bought the beige because I wanted to reduce wear on my brown couch from a lot of pet traffic. The queen size covered the couch perfectly and is easy to take off and wash (much more so than a slip cover). I bought two so I can swap them out, very pleased with the quality so far.

I have been using this almond milk for a while and really like it. I use it mostly in smoothies and protein shakes....as I am not really a fan of just straight up almond milk ( I still love regular milk but it does not love me). It is also great with cereal and subs well for milk in most recipes.
There are...indeed chopped dehydraded onions inside the container. Truth in advertising:) Great price and quick delivery. No complaints.

I frigging love these things. I follow a very low carb protocol, and finding something sweet is a challenge. I recently wanted to drop a few pounds after the holiday. I made a deal with myself....if I exercised that day I could have one of these at night watching TV...but if I did not exercise I could not have one. It provided the motivation I needed to get up and move. As a kid....Reese's Peanut Butter Cups was my all time favorite. They now seem over the top sweet and these taste about right. Still a processed food which I am trying to greatly reduce in my diet....but not artificicially sweetened and a very muted blood sugar response. And don't forget tastes great!
A few new tricks in here.....most I knew some I didn't. Worth what little I spent on it. All in all pleased.
Works good but the product itself is white and it seems to want to stay that way no matter how little you use. Definitely a learning curve to using the product.
really nice product.....good hold and scent. Works well with finer long hair to add some hold. Very please.
Love, love, love these cables. I think they are built better than the OEM cable and at a far better price. Love the FFP box also, makes getting into the product much easier.

Great product. I started taking Curcumin for it's anti-inflammatory properties. I have been pleased with the results from adding it to my supplements that I take. I take one morning and one evening and it works quite well on some minor inflamatory pain I have without having to resort the NSA's constantly.

I bought this toothbrush for myself just before the holidays.....and then someone bought me an Oral B that was twice as much for a gift. Feeling that I must follow the money...I put this one in reserve and switched to the Oral B. Now.....I am switching back. I just like the performance of this one far better. The vibration speed seems to be higher and it does a better job. Small pet peeve on both of them why such a bright d*mn light on the handle to indicate the charge level? I have to close my bathroom door to not see the blinking LED all night. I really don't need 24/7 streaming intel on the status of my toothbrush charge. Otherwise...quite high marks.

Handy as hell little item for travel. Can't find a plug at the airport? No problem. Ipad running out of battery on a long flight? No problem...plug this little bad boy in. Instant releif from phone battery anxiety. 3 thumbs up.

Honestly.....I wanted to hate this razor. I mean, a ball? Has someone finally jumped the shark in the razor wars? But after using it for a week or so....I have to say no, it is a real solid improvement over existing razor technology. Until there is an iPhone app for shaving...I will stick with this.

I take one in the morning and one in the evening during the winter months....and only one in the morning from April thru October. This has moved my Vitamin D levels into the "optimal" range on the European scale (a higher value than the US scale). I am very pleased with these results and am definately less seasonally affected in the winter taking Vitamin D.

Love the smoker.....the cover? Meh. This is a really, really, REALLY thin cover. I would say water resistant as the smoker is always damp when I take it off. I wish there were a better cover available even if it was more. I have too many gadgets and need to store some things outside. I am pretty disappointed in this cover....if you keep it indoors, it is probably fine (but then do you really need a cover). Anything that ranks below a large garbage bag in performance it seems like should be revisited by QC.
Nice DVD for the beginning Yogi. Good basic introduction and even if you are advanced, you could do these routines every day and see benefits. Very pleased.

ok....so they got me. I recieved a free razor in the mail from Schick.  I used it until the one blade included was worn out and then reordered the refills (nice work Schick). I have mostly been a Gillette guy but these are very outstanding razors. I THINK they are also a tad cheaper than the Gillettes I was using with no difference in performance.

Great DVD for Led Zeppelin fans. Obviously....most have seen the movie but many...if not most of the "bonus footage" I had either not seen or had not seen in a very long time. Great for watching with good surround sound.

Outstanding value in a cordless drill. This was a "deal of the day" right before Christmas so I bought one for myself and my daughter who just moved in her first house. It comes with all the basic bits and drills one might need for basic home maintenance / repair. The battery life is outstanding and I found it to have all the power I need. For home owner quality...I don't see how you could do better for the price. Very pleased.

I just received this as a Christmas gift and have used it about 10 times already. It is very well made with very intuitive and easy to understand controls. While pressure cooking has been around forever, this machine brings it mainstream for the average to inexperienced cook. The two main things I use it for are "set it and forget it" during the week meals, and bulk food preparation on the weekends. I have made lentil soup, beef and barley soup, a roast and a large batch of bone broth just this week. It also cleans up easily and is not as big a problem to store as I thought.

I just got this cutting board as a Christmas gift. I have a larger cutting board for larger items...but this one is perfect for daily use. Dicing an onion, garlic, or tomato it is perfect. I like the rubber feet as it creates a no scoot board as you work. This board is also easy to pick up and dump the contents directly into the skillet or pot. Love the bamboo as well.
Nice labels for my jams and jellies. Quick delivery from Amazon.
My wife says she is not crazy anymore. I have noticed a reduction in projectiles coming towards me since we recieved the product.

I feel a lot of reviews of this product are not fair. While I guess there could be genuine issues....the real reason for complaints about this product are almost undoubtedly from product misuse. The company I work for makes residental water heater elements. I have sat through endless meetings with engineers about how electric elements work...so I have a little more knowledge of submersible elements. This item is designed in an identical way to a home electric water heater element. Electricity flows through a copper core in the center of the element producing heat, which is then dispersed throughout the liquid it is submersed in. If the element is not A. fully submersed or B. taken out even for a second while plugged in....it will dry fire. What is a dry fire? The tiny copper wire inside the element overheats in one spot and breaks...stopping the flow of electrons and thus the heat. There is no way to fix it...it is just game over...throw it away. ANY plumber will tell you that tank dry fires are the #1 cause of element failures in residential water heaters. Thus you can see the opportunity to just by a very brief careless moment to dry fire this element. Don't have it submersed to the lip of the cup...congratulations...you just dry fired it, throw it away. Took it out of the cup before unplugging it? Congratulations...you just dry fired it, throw it away...game over. I have been using mine for many months while traveling and have not had an issue at all...however I am quite vigilant about how I use it...careful to fill the cup to the top...even covering the clip on the handle...and then I unplug it about 30 seconds before taking it out of the cup. If you do this...you won't ever have a problem....if you do? You'll be on Amazon venting your anger with a crappy review over your own negligence. Since no hotel in Las Vegas has in room coffee...this little bably saves me $4.00 a day plus an early AM trip to the lobby. This is always on my Vegas or international travel "must take" list, along with some Starbucks instant coffee...mug and sugar. If you are a methodical vigilant person...don't be scared by the bad reviews. If you are scatter brained morning multitasker....save your money.
Nice apple wood chips. Good variety of chip sizes. Great as part of my mixture of Apple, Hickory and Cherry wood for smoking pork. Very pleased with the results.
Nice fatwood. A good variety of stick sizes...some slivers but some bigger pieces too. It helps to have the variety of sizes when starting fires. Good price and delivery from Amazon.

Wow....great coconut oil! We use a lot of coconut oil around our house for everything. Cooking, skin and hair care....ehm....more personal interactions with one another. So we need volume baby! No 12oz jar for $40 from Whole Foods for us! I found this product to be as good or better than any other coconut oil I have tried. Fresh, and clean product with a nice scent of coconut (like it should be). Love the large size and savings from Amazon.

Honestly.....I don't know if the product is working to decalcify my pineal gland....but my dreams are more vivid and it started happening after I had been taking it for a month. Placebo effect? Possibly. To me it is worth the price for what I am getting out of it.

A great source of garlic. No taste (like fish oil burps) and it seems to be working to lower my blood pressure a few points. I take 2 in the morning and two at night as reccommended. I will continue using as I am pleased with the therapy so far.

Who knew that low stomach acid had the same symptoms as high stomach acid? I thought my Dr. was crazy to tell me to try this. I mean, I had taken antacids for years for indigestion. I tried it and was literally blown away by the fact that it cured my indegestion. Supposedly it also makes the nutrients in the food more available to your gut as well. I am please with the product and take 2 before most meals.

I bought this to run an RV heater that was 12V in my Greenhouse this winter. This is a quality built product with easy to understand directions and very simple operations. I am very pleased with the purchase. I was up and running within 10 minutes of opening the box.
A little more technical than I was expecting....but a very, very thorough how to book on Mead.
exactly as described. Checks fit nicely and no problems. I would buy again.

Easier to finger than I anticipated, with tone also better than I expected.  I tuned as recommended, and played mostly open chords with a few bar chords up to the fifth fret.  I even did a bit of fingerpickin', as well as flat-pickin'.  I can ease back in the recliner and play, which was my hope when ordering.  My fat fingers adjusted to it quickly - that isn't as much of an issue as a few claim.  Playing this gem is simply pure fun, and my guitar buddies thought so, too.  We took turns, and "wait, lemme do just one more song" was heard several times.  There's just something about this hybrid that makes you want to play it.  It was delivered a few hours ago, and I love it already.  Happiness for a C-note - what more could you want?  Glad I purchased;  likely will be the same for you.

Due to health issues I sold my guitars a couple years ago, keeping only a Yamaha CG100A classical model.  I have lost some dexterity in my hands, but playing the nylon-stringed classical instrument restored a fair bit - finally to the point where I began to consider a new steel-strung dreadnought.  I have owned an Ovation (decades ago), an expensive Guild, a Takamine, and several others in the past.  I didn't want to spend a lot, even though I could go as high as $1200 comfortably.  For my ability and use, that would be wasteful.  After considering many, I finally narrowed my decision to two Yamahas - either the FG700S or the FG730S (I felt the 720 was too close in price to the 730 to be appealing).So I decided upon the FG730S, and put it in my Amazon cart.  However, I had left messages for two Craigslist sellers - one had a 700, the other a 730.  Pics of both looked good, and the story for each was the same - wife bought for hubby as first guitar and neither ever learned to play.  The phone rang before I could proceed with my order.  The 700 owner was willing to deliver immediately for my counter-offer (which was near his asking) and thirty minutes later I was checking out the guitar.  Natural finish - which is my preference and is what I had put in the cart.  Just a beautiful guitar, with great sound and excellent action, with no fret-buzz or any other issues requiring adjustment.  Thus my review of the 700 is based on my used one, which actually looks new.Boy, I really wanted the FG730S, but I doubt that I'd hear any difference between the two - at least with me being the player.  Nor can I imagine it playing any better as far as its action is concerned.  In fact, this is the best-playing guitar I've owned, despite having spent enough on one to buy at least three of these, new, or four at my used price.  Nor have any sounded better.  Very good guitar tonally.  Us rank amateurs are lucky that Yamaha makes great guitars affordable.Fate sold me a 700, and it is all the guitar I need, and much better than I had hoped to find in its price range.  You need not spend a grand or more to buy a very good guitar, unless you desire a more exclusive name, fancier decorative touches or different materials - or are advanced enough and experienced enough to have developed a set of preferences that preclude this model.  For many of us, a Yamaha FG700S is a great choice which will never become a limiting factor, either from the standpoint of playability or sound.  And you will never have to make apologies for it in rarefied company, nor hang your head in shame.  If you ever become accomplished enough to feel you've outgrown it, then congratulations are much in order.  Buy with confidence.One of the main reasons I wanted a 730 instead of this 700 was appearance, I think the blond, natural top contrasts well with the Rosewood sides.  If you can stretch your budget the 730 is an excellent choice, just as is the 700 at its price.  The buyer is very likely to be satisfied with either one.  I already love my 700.  It is a definite keeper.

Chair back is hard steel, with edges - don't expect comfort as it digs into your back - not a model for actually leaning back, better to stay stooped forward with elbows on the bar..  Comes with short screws for attaching seat, but they are far too short for the padded seat - won't reach wood - so are useless.  (Some finishes come with unpadded wood seat - short screws are for those.) Only two long screws are included, so four more are needed for every order of the padded-seat models, including those with black finish.  Seller pretends not to have figured this out (despite all the complaints in these reviews), so you must either contact him to beg for the rest of the order (more screws) or go out and buy some if you don't have appropriate screws on hand.  Swivel is stiff, not smooth.  I'm not certain that the hard plastic feet are any softer than the metal tubing from which they protrude - be careful when dragging across your hardwood floors.  Better to lift them, but they are a bit heavy so some folks will have trouble doing so.  Good chair for kids in a frat house, but many adults may find them unaccommodating.  Not a happy purchase for me, whether considering vendor or product.  Wish I could return the two I purchased, but I don't want to eat the return shipping, nor try to fit them back into the box.  I still need two more chairs, but these will not do.

Richard Ferris above said it well, fresh, inventive and energetic, yes.  I'm new to this artist - he's a good singer with a voice that fits the style of music, which is a smooth and fun amalgam of Dixieland, swing, jazz, country, bluegrass and blues which he blends cleverly in his own genre-defying way.  The result is a sophisticated, but fun sound sure to please all who love a bit of variety in their music listening.  I am sure to buy more Pokey in the near future.  Very talented artist.

For me, Yes best albums are:#1 Close to the Edge#2 Yessongs (or Progeny Highlights)#3 The Yes Album (1971)#4 Fragile#5 Tales from Topographic Oceans#6 Relayer#7 Yes Symphonic DVDThough I own other titles, the first four of these get the most play, while the first two (now three) get the lion's share.  I have been a Yes fan since 1971.  While I realize that many music fans my age remain stuck in the past, that is not the case with me;  my taste in music has broadened over the years, and I listen to more genres than anyone I know.  My collection reflects that, as it also reveals that I have continued to listen to new artists right up to the present.  I believe every generation has its music prodigies.  So, it isn't because I'm stuck in the past (I'm not) that I prefer Yes's earlier works.  To my ear, they are the best.  The most complex and intricate, with the best songs and the best line-up for the earlier of these.  Of course, that is opinion - what holds true for me isn't gospel.  Those who prefer others speak with no more - nor less - validity than I.Yessongs has been my favorite for decades.  However, that was not the case the first few weeks after I purchased the LP upon its release.  The first listen was somewhat disappointing, the recording sounded weak and flawed.  It sounded that way because it was, and is, both.  It didn't help that the recording level of the LP was very low, requiring the volume knob of my receiver to be jacked up.  Despite its flaws, however, there was a rawness, a truth, and a sense of there-ness emanating from the grooves that kept me coming back.At first I continued to prefer the near-perfection of the studio versions of these songs, but as time passed the allure of the live cuts beckoned ever more insistently, and I came to prefer the Yessongs versions.  Progeny Highlights offers a slightly cleaner window, and I enjoy it very much.  However, Yessongs (now on CD - finally had to let go of all vinyl) has a warmer, if blurred, presentation that is almost tube-like to my ear, so I listen to both these about equally.  Together, Yessongs and PH combine to get most of my Yes attention.For live Yes, either of these is a good choice - you don't really need both.  The Yes Symphonic Live DVD is also a contender for good live Yes, adding the visual element - the best cut on that is CTTE.  I prefer the two CDs discussed but video may be a strong pull for some, and it isn't a bad choice.  When it comes to Yessongs vs PH, modern sensibilities will likely prefer the more detailed sound character of PH.  I lean slightly toward the warmer, fuzzier Yessongs, but am happy to have both.Tracklists:Yessongs:Opening Firebird SuiteSiberian KhatruHeart of the SunrisePerpetual ChangeAnd You and IMood for a DayExcerpts Six Wives of Henry VIIIRoundabout  [end disc one]I've Seen All Good PeopleLong Distance RunaroundClose to the EdgeYours Is No DisgraceStarship Trooper  [end disc two]Progeny Highlights:Opening Firebird SuiteI've Seen All Good PeopleHeart of the SunriseClap/Mood for a DayAnd You and I  [end disc one]Close to the EdgeExcerpts Six Wives Henry VIIIRoundaboutYours Is No Disgrace [end disc two]PH's lack of Siberian Khatru, Perpetual Change, and Starship Trooper vs Yessongs' inclusion is significant in my mind.  Presumably they would be included in Progeny's Box Set for much more jack.  You pays your money and you makes your choice.  In my case, since I like both albums, I'd likely opt for Yessongs extra tracks over PH's slight increase in clarity if I had to choose one, but I can easily understand going the other way.  In conclusion, for those who desire live Yes, either of these choices will likely please, while those who are annoyed by live deviations compared with Studio tracks can pass these by unless feeling venturesome.

The first time I saw a Boxcar Willie commercial on TV many decades ago, I thought he was just some unheard-of wannabe with a hobo gimmick.  It would be a few years later that my dad bought an LP and loved it, but it yet took me a couple years to really listen.  Okay, so his name, clothing and five o'clock shadow were a gimmick - but there was nothing tricky about that voice and his singing style.  He didn't try to rock up a song, or jazz it up, or soul it up.  He sang country songs straight up, just as his accompaniment played it - unashamedly country - but with an effortless vocal delivery which reveals a singer with excellent octave range and pleasing timbre.  He once described himself as Vanilla.Sometimes we want Rocky Road, or Buttered Almond, or Strawberry Cheesecake, but the most popular ice cream flavor - year-in, year-out - remains Vanilla.  It's sort of like hearing the National Anthem at a ball-game;  it's rare to get a straight-up vocal rendition of it these days, and many of us really appreciate it when we hear it.  You can count on Boxcar Willie - and his instrumentalists - not to mess up a song, and, furthermore, to perform it well.  The sound quality of this download is very good - clean and dynamic - and the song selection outstanding.Don't get me wrong, I like many genres of music, and many different styles.  When I want country, I have many choices in my collection, from bluegrass to country, old and new.  But there is no doubt that Boxcar Willie gets as much play as any, and more than most.  Sometimes you just can't beat Vanilla.  Don't even hesitate to pull the trigger on this album whether you are new to Willie or a long-time fan - you won't regret it.PS:  I also downloaded eight more songs and tucked them into this album with my Zune software, which made the collection perfect for me.  I added Orange Blossom Special, Forty Acres, Precious Memories, Teddy Bear, Girl on the Billboard, Blue Moon of Kentucky, My Heart's Deep in the Heart of Texas and Convoy.

My musical taste runs far and wide - various jazz styles from swing to bop to smooth, rock of all stripes from the Carpenters to Judas Priest to Epica with  a good deal of prog, folk, soul, R&B, reggae, zydeco, polka, vocal stylists singing standards, classical of different eras and various styles, and some opera. So there isn't much I don't enjoy, and my music collection reflects the variety.  My love of country music, then, includes old and new and much in-between.  I tire of those who love to hate on new country as much as I tire of those who love to hate on the old.  There is music I don't enjoy, but I never insult those who enjoy it by denigrating the style or type of music;  I simply say that I don't enjoy it, not my cup of tea.  In the end we are only the arbiters of that which we enjoy.  I wrote this in reply to the haters so evident among so many reviewers at this site.  I enjoy the recording under discussion here very much.My dad was a big Jimmy Rodgers fan, as well as loving Ernest Tubb and Hank Williams - so I grew up hearing those fellows, but I never really was exposed to Lefty Frizzell, other than an occasional song .  Probably I heard him some over the years, not knowing who was singing.  Lately I've been adding more bluegrass and older styles of country to my collection.  I've been thoroughly enjoying Lefty's smooth delivery, interesting vocal timbre and the unstrained quality of his voice. Great singer, with a voice reminiscent of Hank - but smoother (I love Hank, but his voice does turn a bit strident sometimes, though recording quality available to him is likely a factor, too).Lefty certainly deserves the accolades his fans have afforded him over the years.  Recording quality here is very good.  Not sure why I waited until my sixties to add him to my collection, but, on the other hand, it gives me more 'new' music.  Yep, great new country here!

Don't let the freebie "price" fool you.  Superb music, superbly recorded.  You will listen, you will enjoy - if you like bluegrass.  It's great!  Obviously free because the label anticipates that we will buy their artist's recordings after sampling.  I'm sure I will.

A great collection of many of the classic bluegrass hits.  If you like bluegrass but aren't interested in putting together an extensive (and expensive) artist-by-artist collection - or if you are new to the genre - then this nine-dollar collection of thirty greats is hard to beat.  In my case, I already had a few bluegrass albums which included quite a few of these songs.  I began by putting tunes I wanted in the MP3 cart, but soon had ten songs and still wanted more, so I bought the whole album since that was more affordable..  Sound quality is excellent - and I'm pretty picky about that.  The duplications I have with other albums don't bother me at all - putting this album on and letting it play makes for a pleasurable and varied listen.  Diehard fans already have all these songs, but for us more casual fans, this hits all the right buttons.  Forget the Redneck moniker and goofy art, this is a seriously good collection.  Highly recommended.
Mentioned in the processor review.  This may be a bit pricey, but is worth the expenditure.

My wife really wanted a food processor, so I surprised her with one as an unexpected gift.  She loves it, and was thrilled to find how quietly it operates.  She gave me an unexpected gift in return, so a good time was had by all.I researched this choice thoroughly, and found this model consistently rated in the top five, but more affordable than most.  Owner satisfaction is among the best, too.  We are changing to brushed nickel fixtures in the kitchen, so that was a serendipitous match, also.  In addition, I anted up for the bread blade and the handy blade holder.  The holder is worth having to prevent the loss of items becoming scattered, and to prevent cuts from loose blades kept in drawers or plastic boxes.  The speed and quietness of this machine are very impressive.  Excellent quality.

Better than I'd expected.  Adds some top for older ears with deficits.  Also adds a bit of sibilance, which I expected.  Best used for those like me with HF deficits.  I did not use the virtually identical models from Radio Shack when I was younger - didn't need them then - but a friend had a pair which I found annoying back then.

"Theme for the Eulipians" includes killer background vocals and a reading, thus tells a story which sets the mood - a great song.  All the tunes are excellent.  In my opinion, this is Rahsaan's best recording.  "Sweet Georgia Brown", "Goodbye Porkpie Hat", and "Giant Steps" are the other standouts, though there are no bad choices anywhere.  I first bought this on LP decades ago, though the recording quality is so good that many listeners may think it newer.  The old LP sounded great, too.

We are remodeling our kitchen, adding a large island which is designed to include three large, deep drawers down low, with smaller drawers above.  My cabinet guy had no luck finding HD slides locally, so after searching many online sites, I decided these were the best value - if they lived up to the heavy-duty claims.  We ordered three pair of these, and when they arrived and my hired man opened the box, all present were highly impressed with the quality.  Exciting for a group of working men, using phrases like badass to describe the slides. They are indeed heavy, and they glide as smooth as silk.  You get a satisfying amount and heft of smooth, strong steel and just holding the rail for a single side is impressively heavy.  At around 450 bucks for the set of three, they weren't cheap, but the high quality is obvious - you can see and feel where the money went. No worries about whether they are up to the task of supporting a fully extended 17"x16"x36" (h,w,d) drawer filled with skillets and other kitchen gear.  Recommended.
Better than you'd think for the money.

I bought this album on LP upon its release in 1973, even though I already had most of it on the albums "Fragile," "The  Yes Album," and "Close to the Edge."  I soon came to prefer these live versions to their studio counterparts and, 43 years later, still do.  This is one of those classic Live albums, like Allman Bros "...at Fillmore," or Little Feat "Waiting for Columbus."  The recording quality is very good, the time is right - in their prime, the line-up is right, and the song selection is great.  If you're a Yes fan you should buy this download while the price is right.
