The whole mystery surrounding Nastya story and who she “really” was…the interactions with classmates and teachers…and ultimately the fight and growth that they each had to come to terms with their pasts and manage to overcome left me in tears by the conclusion.Secondary characters also add to this tale.  Drew and his family in particular are amazing…and to be honest I wouldn’t mind seeing Drew pop up in  a story of his own.  He and Josh have an amazing relationship…one that grows even stronger in The Sea of Tranquility.Bottom line this is an amazingly written story of two extremely broken teens,  who with each other, find solace, strength, hope and eventually the ability to be themselves. No review I write can do justice to this story…all I can leave you with is the strong recommendation to pick this one up.  I promise it will be a stand out.Narration Notes: Kirby Heyborne & Candace Thaxton did an amazing job and I’d not hesitate to pick up another book narrated by one of these two.  They completely captured the voices of our MCs and delivered more than just a straight narration but managed to convey all the feelings as well.Note: Review copy rcvd from Publisher, but all thoughts and opinions are my own.

Cress, the third in Marissa Meyer's Lunar Chronicles, more than delivers. This installment starts off quickly and the pace maintains a rapid speed straight through until the end.... leaving the reader breathless and wanting more. Marissa Meyer's writing style is concise and smooth...giving us just enough descriptives without bogging us down...and thus keeping the reader engaged and unwilling to put this one down.Not only do we get to know Cinder, Kai, Wolf and Scarlet better but we are introduced to Crescent Moon and really get to know "Captain" Thorne in this book. Cress is simply an adorable character...very innocent, very naive and also incredibly brilliant. To top it off she is a true romantic at heart:) A great combination. And then there is Thorne *sigh*. I'll admit that he grated on me a bit at first...but then little by little his true colors came out and I was quite captivated and charmed in spite of myself.The plot moves much further along in Cress and we even get a little bit of a tease for The Lunar Chronicles Book 4 -Winter at the end. I can't wait to see how this tale plays out, can't wait to get to know Winter and can't wait to see more of Scarlet and Wolf (my personal favorites). If you've enjoyed this series thus far, I guarantee that Cress delivers. You won't regret picking it up.NOTE: Review copy rcvd from publisher . All thoughts and opinions in this review are my own.

Zoe travels her home and yard imagining herself a princess and discovers the magic of baking wishes into her cupcakes. Every girl who ever wished to be a princess, or simply to be temporarily rid of a meddling sibling, will enjoy this tale. It is an adorable tale of sibling rivalry and the power of the imagination.No real problems are solved in Pink Cupcake Magic but the tale is fun and the illustrations perfectly delightful. I can't stop myself from flipping through just to view the pictures every time I walk past this book!NOTE: Review copy rcvd from publisher in exchange for an honest review

I’m not sure why I resisted New Adult book and issues books for so long.  From the moment I started listening to this one I was completely invested.  It made my drive to and from work just fly by and many times I’d have to force myself out of the car…I just didn’t want to stop listening. I didn’t know exactly what to expect based upon the cliche title (I have a bad habit of not reading a book’s synopsis before picking it up…just as I hate movie trailers) but this was not it…it was so much better than I expected.Mummert paints a picture that is at once completely believable and yet totally horrifying.  I felt for Cass from the very start and completely connected to her.  As her whole situation was slowly revealed I couldn’t help but weep with sympathy and frustration at all that she went through.  Did she make all the same choices that I’d like to think I would have in her shoes? No…but that didn’t make me like her any less.And Tucker, oh boy! I’ve always had a literary weakness for his type and he delivers –  tattoos, rock, smooth voice  and smooth moves and all.  But most of all…he is genuine…and that is what draws us and Cass in so deep.This book is the perfect combination of sweetness and angst, love and heartache…I couldn’t put it down and I couldn’t wait for more.Narration Notes:  Grace Grant delivered perfectly.  I completely bought into her as Cass and couldn’t imagine a better narrator.Note: Review copy received in exchange for an honest review

After loving the first in this series, I was a little let down by the sequel. I guess after all that Cass and Tucker went through in White Trash Beautiful…it would be hard to top.  White Trash Damaged deals with how Cass, Tucker, the band, and the new manager deal with life on the road.  I felt like we lost a little something from each of the old characters in this one.  The dynamic changed a bit and although it did enjoy this one, sometimes the plot just felt a bit too contrived.  I had a much harder time believing the low level angst here than I did the horror of book one.On the plus side though, we did get to know the rest of the band and some other secondary characters a whole lot better which made for some very interesting listening. I look forward to the conclusion of this trilogy as I suspect that we’ll delve more into some other characters lives and deal less with Cass and Tucker who’s story really could have ended with book one.Narration Notes: Grace Grant delivered yet again.  She is perfect for this series.Note: Review copy received in exchange for an honest review

The Good:-I really enjoyed the gothic feel of  The Book of Blood and Shadow and the mystery that Wasserman immersed us in.-The setting was unique and fascinating...how many books can you name that are primarily set in Prague?-The writing style and descriptive narrative flowed quite well despite the slow pace...I wouldn't say this was a book that I couldn't put down, but it was certainly a book that I loved picking back up.-All of the main characters are nerds and language nerds at that. Even the "popular girl" is really masking an inner nerd:) I could not help but like them.-The glimpses into historic Prague and Elizabeth Westons life were incredibly interesting.-Eli - such a mystery but one that you'll really want to unwrap.The Not So Good:-By the end I was feeling that this was all a little far fetched and had to do my best to suspend disbelief (It was actually very easy to do!)-I never actually "loved" any of the characters or really felt connected.  That said I did really like and admire them even though I didn't have that full connection.Final Thoughts:I thoroughly enjoyed this read...complex characters, a fascinating mystery and amazing setting...all in all a winner! I recommend this to those who don't mind a slower paced book and who love Dan Brown's Robert Langdon (The DaVinci Code) series.  I know I'll be on the lookout for my next Robin Wasserman read.Source: Purchased for my Personal Library from another vendor

Erin Morgenstern paints a picture in black that is so vivid and strong that I can’t but pray to see it developed on the big screen while at the same time worrying that it will never ever manage to live up to the beauty that is The Night Circus. Amazingly complex…this novel spans multiple POVs and multiple time frames to tell the story of  Marco, Celia, and the Circus (which is so much more than a setting…it literally takes on a life of it’s own.) I loved the myriad of circus folk and hangers-on that we came to know and appreciate as well as this timeless love story.The Night Circus itself though wins the show here.  Take a step through those gates, lose track of time and of yourself…smell the sweets and popcorn, hear the barkers call and let the magic wash over you….NOTE:  Review copy rcvd in exchange for an honest review

Captivated from page one, I could not put The Night Strangers down.  It’s no secret that small town New England is my favorite setting…Bohjalian does an amazing job of capturing the essence of the town and distilling it into a character of it’s own. That said we also have a plethora of other fascinating personas populating this family and village.  We are slowly drawn in to the story of the Lintons and then the camera lens starts widening to encompass the whole of their small New England town.  All of the characters are so well drawn that we feel as if they are our own neighbors…so well known and yet..do any of us really know what goes on behind closed doors???And then there are the witches…Incredibly well written, haunting and and quite a bit disturbing, this page turner will keep you up late and you’ll barely regret it the next day.NOTE:  Review copy rcvd in exchange for an honest review

DISAPPOINTED in this book. It isn't really a book about the title at all. It's just a compilation of things said by the author put together by others. I was not moved by it and was very disappointed. I guess I expected something written by the author--not a compilation that does/doesn't go along with the title. It's also a really small pamphlet sized 'book' for the $ paid for it!!!

As someone who has also traveled the other way--the path of white magic and light beings and meditation and ascended Masters, then on to Masters that were supposed to be higher than the mere ascended ones...yada yads....I found this book interesting for the DARK SIDE information it contains and it DID help me have more discernment for ALL paths--especially those that profess to be  LIGHT paths, as Lucifer/Satan both are light bearers, and false light versus true light beyond duality etc. I found that information useful but there are a lot of BUTS:1. He doesn't tell the 'story' in a way that brings you along AS HE LEARNED. He keeps interrupting his own dialogue to insert "Jesus is the only way" into the progression of his story--which totally stops any real perceptions from his then-life view and keeps stopping the story, stopping how we learn through 'errors' and...2. It would have been much better to read of his progression through the dark side and AS HE BEGAN TO SEE THE ERRORS OF HIS WAYS, --as they happened--to then progress WITH HIM as he starts to understand how he has been mis-led, to read the REAL STORY, read  of his misgivings, that progress into insights, to seeing TRUTH etc...THE WAY THIS IS WRITTEN IS SO JUMBLED AND POORLY WRITTEN THAT HIS 'STORY' BECOMES OBLITERATED FROM JUMPING TO THE END RESULT OF HIS JOURNEY OVER AND OVER w/SIDE COMMENTS AND OTHER INFORMATION he throws into the mix RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF TELLING 'HIS STORY'.He decided that Jesus is Lord and he was worshipping a false light in Lucifer--OK...BUT THAT HAPPENED SLOWLY, DOWN THE LINE!I would have much rather read that story uninterrupted by christian diatribe about Jesus interspersed throughout the book.NOW, DON'T GET ME WRONG--I agree with his conclusions in some ways and not in others:He is very prejudiced racially and homophobic, making racial references that are 'tells' to how he sees the world NOT to Christian-like; condemning everyone who doesn't believe as HE DOES--in HIS PARTICULAR WAY OF BELIEVING IN JESUS--is somehow better than everyone else's Christianity...SO HOW IS HIS CHRISTIANITY ANY DIFFERENT FROM ALL THE OTHER DIVERGENT BRANDS OF CHRISTIANITY WHO ALL THINK THEY HAVE THE TRUTH?I would prefer to believe that Jesus is not a judgement hellfire and damnation being and he preached Divine Love--and that is he were here today, walking the planet--He would NEVER condemn anyone, but always show love in all situations.So while this was informative on Satanism and I saw how the path I followed for man years 'borrowed' a LOT of it and put it into a 'false light' path where members THOUGHT they were in the LIGHT...but were being mis-led...I wish he'd told the story as it happened, AS HE LEARNED THE HARD WAY. without 'spoiling' it by all the side notes and judgements and inserted rants.IT WOULD HAVE BEEN MUCH MORE POWERFUL IN ITS MESSAGE!

I'm also in Hawaii and this $$ stuff was recommended by the Habitat rescue birdy folks as THE best. It took 3 WEEKS to get here-by which time the little bitty majero (insectivore/fruit eater)pre-flegling had got his bald body feathered feeding on smushed partially cooked (very soft) eggwhite and a bit of yolk, honey, fruit and whatever bugs and ants I could crunch up in there! By the time the fod arrived he had grown up and flown away. He tried some of it as a 'free bird' still hovering close to feed the first couple weeks he was 'free'--until he hooked up with his own flock...but he would stick his beak in it, grab something and throw it away. Wasted buckaroos.

OK SO ALL THE REVIEWS SAY THESE ARE GRRRRREAT???I used them for bodysurfing to give me an extra push in the water. Trouble is the WEB is too soft, too small to DO anything. I'll stick to the surfing ones made with finger holes. My fingers get cold even here in Hawaii so I opted to TRY these for that full finger coverage BUT even the wrist thingy is loose, so they CAN come off easily. and if you are swimming they pull up/down the wrist due to the loose cuff. NOPE

I use this for epoxy resin to get bubbles out.While its a cheap alternative to the more expensive heat guns-it has some drawbacks too.1. The power of the heat is not that strong--it is HOT, but the 'air' doesn't push very well. On epoxy, it doesn't blend it very well. Burns the surface easily as there is just not enough AIR behind the heat.2. The tip stays hot a LONG time after turned off so BE CAREFUL! (kids, birds, your fingers...pets noses...)3. The cord is rather short so you will probably need a three prong xtension cord.Works...but for my uses needing the AIR push of heat--not so good.
These DO work with lacquer if you work FAST. I use them for epoxy too--FAST. They do eventually melt away....work best for latex.

This is a medium dark blend and it is just that--not acid-y, not too sweet either. I personally like a bit more choco flavor/depth but tried it as the price was right. Its not bad for the $ spent but I won't be ordering another because it needs more depth/aroma/taste to bother ordering it. Hard to describe the taste--not a cheapo Maxwell House type taste but not quite a deep aromatic (oooh smells sooo good!)blend either. In-between.UPDATE: it tastes better if ground VERY fine and use more than usual for a darker brew. Just tried that! :)

Doesn't do anything but SPLAT paint. I got this t paint a ceiling so I could preserve my NECK from permanent looking at the sky...:)Well, it did not spray the primer as another reviewer stated that it does well. I had my pro painter who I hired to paint the ext. second floor (you take the high road while I take the low road...)...He couldn't get it to work right either. Now that its USED--you cannot return this? WASTED money. will update if we figure out the WHY's...

This runs large. I have hip length hair and wrap it and then pile it inside these caps so always order a large. The large on this is too big! I use it for bodysurfing and it really needs a chin strap to keep it on. I am always pulling it back on by the leash I attached (at least there is a divet to attach one!). I put 2 divets on it for water draining too as when it comes off, it fills with water and pulls as a weight/anchor/choke hold. UGH. Needs lots of modification to work well for water active sports. But its the only neoprene hat/cap I could find with a decent BRIM!

GREAT LOOKING, VISABLE YADA YADA BUT THE CHIN STRAP RUBS MY NECK RAW AND IT COMES OFF, AS IN OPENS--EVERY SINGLE WAVE. NO GOOD FOR SURFING. THE VELCRO DOESN'T STAY CLOSED AT ALL! IT ALSO SITS VERY HIGH ON YOUR FOREHEAD, MAKING EVERY WAVE KNOCK IT BACK, THEN IF THE STRAP DOESN'T LET GO, YOU CHOKE WITH A HAT-FILLED WATER CHOKE HOLD. NO GOOD.

There are NOT as advertised. If you look CLOSELY at the pictures, you'll see why. The way it is made is awful. The finger pockets are wide and there is NO WEBBING SPACE SO NO NET 'PULL' between fingers which is what these are FOR!!! so, HOW will it work?DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!But the more $$ ones with true webbing between the fingers. I use these for bodysurfing swimming out in outside breaking Hawaiian surf and these would not work AT ALL--since they only cover the hand and add NO thrust to the stroke. The pocket for the palm is POORLY designed too, bulky and not confooming properly.***NEVER have I ever bought a pair of swim gloves so poorly made!!!I returned mine! Listed them as 'defective' so Amazon would cover shipping return because they ARE!!!!Aloha

I was dubious about this cheapy thing but it actually works! I placed it over my front door after spraying it with white plastic adhering paint very carefully to not get the on off keyhole or the sun parts so it would match my house trim. I went out and when I returned, after just hanging it several hours ago-- it was ON in the 'dim light mode' and was just great. The motion of me walking to my door turned it on bright mode--but even the dim was enough to SEE the keyhole in my door. EXACTLY what I needed it for. Electricity is highest rates in the USA in Hawaii, and I wanted to SEE my lock on my door well if I came home after dark w/o having to turn on lights in the daytime. The LED light is BRIGHT! It doesn't span that wide an area but it is great for what I needed it for. you'd need more than one for a walkway instead of a 'spot' light.CONS: Only thing that could be better is the on/off key is weird as you have to use a teeny metal piece sent with it I almost threw away...and the MODE has no identifying markers so you have no idea WHAT modes its on until you see it work. The little 'key' you poke into it to turn it on is a hassle. Wish it came in white too! THERE IS NO PEEL AND STICK FOR THIS ALTHOUGH IT STATES THERE IS! Many other reviewers noted that as well so the ad itself needs updating to be accurate.All in all? Great little contraption. Will add on if it doesn't last.22JAN 2015***DOESN'T LAST. STOPS WORKING IN A FEW HOURS AND DOES NOT STAY ON ALL NIGHT!!! GOOD FOR COMING HOME KEY LIGHT BUT NOT FOR SECURITY!!!!Aloha

THESE RUN SMALLI ordered a medium but they shipped a small/med size since there doesn't seem to BE a size medium. It barely fit my head. I have long hip length hair so when put up--it would not even go ON. I returned it for a size large which went on but the fit seems a bit off. The chin strap should be PADDED as it cinches right under your jaw and is VERY uncomfortable against the neck, especially the hard plastic snap. I padded mine and it is ok by threading a rubber diving hose over it and then finding a soft tube that worked better.This is one of the FEW neoprene hats with a DECENT BRIM, and here in Hawaii, we need all the shade we can get out there. I use it for bodysurfing and the waves knock it off a lot and the strap chokes me as the hat fills with water. So--ANOTHER  design change--this time I cut 2 small slashes over the ears so water has an EXIT. I put glue around the cut edges (wetsuit glue) to try and reinforce the raw edges so time will tell...It's a POOR DESIGN that needs work, but there just are NO hoods out there with straps that cover the BACK of the head (Most are skull-cap design) with a brim so ya take what ya can get!**Someone needs to design a better version with a leash divit too, padded strap, and ear vents with a REAL brim, not the floppy tiny thing most of these have. This one HAS a brim but the design really needs work..

MORE COMFY FOOT POCKET THAN OLDER VERSIONS BUT MUCH SHORTER THAN STANDARD DUCKS--SO GREAT 4 BODYBOARDING AND JUNK FOR BODYSURFING UNLESS ITS SHOREBREAK AS THE THRUST IS LESS!!!**The reviewer who used slasher fins (Churchill type, see below) didn't realize you kick differently with a longer fin to achieve max thrust--it is a slower kick with a longer fin. Doing flutter type kicks won't work with longer fins. He needs to adjust the kick, not the fin! Ducks have BETTER thrust than slasher type churchill design type fins made for bodyboarding--you just need to learn HOW to kick with them if you are used to short fins!First off: I have 'duck feet'--from 40 years of wearing bodysurfing fins. When neoprene fin socks came out--(highly recommend) the blisters and rubbed craters stopped. Lots of OLD scars and NO new ones! Yay!*****Buy up a size for a fin leash with pad on the ankle strap and fin socks if you are a SERIOUS bodysurfer, bodyboarder or diver.*****Fins get torn off in surf and the ankle pad type leashes (the pad velcroes around the ankle STRAP, not your ankle. The secure strap is padded also. worth 10.00 they cost. The leashes that just go around your ankle are OK too, but the pad on the back of the fin ankle strap is great. Going up a size helps the thrust too as the fin is a bit bigger.1. Duckfoot red and black version: These are more for bodyBOARDING because they are shorter than standard ducks. Foot pocket is MUCH softer and comfy than the older version but so is the fin--it is not as stiff as the older blue ducks but still works well. I had a lot aof waves the first time I wore the new version from the extra thrust of the fins over Dafin in an outside overhead break. 5 stars for the comfort changes! Ideally,BUT THEN THEY GOT SOFT--AFTER ONLY A FEW USES!2. Da Fin--a great fin too and really comfy but more for smaller waves or shorebreak thrust wise. My all around fav but not for bigger outside breaks because of the amount of kicking needed with such a short fin. GREAT thrust but only for smaller waves some people wear em in big stuff but mostly lifeguards who run with them on so a short fin is a must. All the Hawaii guards have em.3. UDT fins: now are almost the same price if you ankles can handle them as they are STIFF blades and take power to kick with--for serious people with strong ankles and calves. INCREDIBLE thrust. My bro still wears these and he can power thru sections and come out into the face of the wave after getting covered in whitewater. Cannot do that with a 'normal' fin. I USED to wear them in the 1980's but they are too much for me now at 60. I've been bodysurfin 45 years.4. Hydrotech 2 ocean fins: I originally liked the design but when I tried these, the thrust was just NOT there. They'd be great for bodyboarding or shore break but nothing bigger outside as the kick was flimsy and the fin too flexible. VERY comfy, esp for WIDE luau hawaiian feet like mine but not enough kick for bodysurfing in deep outside breaks where you really need thrust to even get out there!5.Body Board fins and Churchills: *Almost all the other stubby or churchill type fins are for bodyboarding NOT bodysurfing if you are serious because of thrust needed. Churchills are old stand-bys we all used in the 1980's but there are way better designs out now. They are OK for bodyboardin or playing around in shorebreak.Aloha!

MORE COMFY FOOT POCKET THAN OLDER VERSIONS**The reviewer who used slasher fins (Churchill type, see below) didn't realize you kick differently with a longer fin to achieve max thrust--it is a slower kick with a longer fin. Doing flutter type kicks won't work with longer fins. He needs to adjust the kick, not the fin! Ducks have BETTER thrust than slasher type churchill design type fins made for bodyboarding--you just need to learn HOW to kick with them if you are used to short fins!First off: I have 'duck feet'--from 40 years of wearing bodysurfing fins. When neoprene fin socks came out--(highly recommend) the blisters and rubbed craters stopped. Lots of OLD scars and NO new ones! Yay!*****Buy up a size for a fin leash with pad on the ankle strap and fin socks if you are a SERIOUS bodysurfer, bodyboarder or diver.*****Fins get torn off in surf and the ankle pad type leashes (the pad velcroes around the ankle STRAP, not your ankle. The secure strap is padded also. worth 10.00 they cost. The leashes that just go around your ankle are OK too, but the pad on the back of the fin ankle strap is great. Going up a size helps the thrust too as the fin is a bit bigger.1. Duckfoot red and black version: These are more for BODYBOARDING due to these are SHORTER  than standard DUCKS--which the ad doesn't state!!! Foot pocket is MUCH softer and comfy than the older version but so is the fin--it is not as stiff as the older blue ducks. I had a lot aof waves the first time I wore the new version from the extra thrust of the fins over Dafin in an outside overhead break but then the softness made it HARDER to catch--like it was stiff from being NEW only!!!??? whatsupwiththat?. 5 stars for the comfort changes2. Da Fin--a great fin too and really comfy but more for smaller waves or shorebreak thrust wise. My all around fav but not for bigger outside breaks because of the amount of kicking needed with such a short fin. GREAT thrust but only for smaller waves some people wear em in big stuff but mostly lifeguards who run with them on so a short fin is a must. All the Hawaii guards have em.3. UDT fins: now are almost the same price if you ankles can handle them as they are STIFF blades and take power to kick with--for serious people with strong ankles and calves. INCREDIBLE thrust. NEW VERSIONS ARE SOFTER AND GREAT--JUST GOT A PAIR! BROWN AND GREEN. My bro still wears the OLD BROWN ONES-SUPER STIFF and he can power thru sections and come out into the face of the wave after getting covered in whitewater. Cannot do that with a 'normal' fin. I USED to wear them in the 1980's but they are too much for me now at 60. LOVE THE NEW MODEL! I've been bodysurfin 45 years.4. Hydrotech 2 ocean fins: I originally liked the design but when I tried these, the thrust was just NOT there. They'd be great for bodyboarding or shore break but nothing bigger outside as the kick was flimsy and the fin too flexible. VERY comfy, esp for WIDE luau hawaiian feet like mine but not enough kick for bodysurfing in deep outside breaks where you really need thrust to even get out there!5.Body Board fins and Churchills: *Almost all the other stubby or churchill type fins are for bodyboarding NOT bodysurfing if you are serious because of thrust needed. Churchills are old stand-bys we all used in the 1980's but there are way better designs out now. They are OK for bodyboardin or playing around in shorebreak.Aloha!

PROS:1. These fin socks have a seam along the toe-line, NOT ONLY down the middle of the foot like most fin socks. The others eventually wear out at the toe area because there is stress from having the seam ONLY in the midfoot instead of around the toe-line--the toes poke thru eventually. NOT THESE BABIES.2. BECAUSE THESE HAVE A TOELINE SEAM, they don't wear out, don't shred in 4 months like the others do.GREAT!3. I wear them bodysurfing because they go over the ankle and help me not get any more scars from fins eating my ankles over the past 40 years! YAY! The usual bodysurf style fin socks are open heeled and the heel part slides up and down and still rubs.These are GREAT fin socks! no more scars!4.They stay on too. Some stretch out imediately and come off at the heel. These LAST.CONS:Run a bit small though. I wear a size 9 female shoe and a large fits my foot. The M was snug but did stretch a bit; the new pair are L and fit. I do, however, have luau Hawaiian WIDE feet! aloha
useless, didn't work at all, came while I was OOT so not returnable. They just did not cut cleanly. Crushed, not cut. Other reviews say they are great so perhaps I got a bad pair?

I USE THIS FOR BODYSURFING HERE IN HAWAII WHEN WATER GETS COLD IN WINTER. I hesitated because of the 5/3mm but it is SO SOFT FLEXIBLE AND COMFY that I forgot all about even having it on. The shoulder cut is really hard to find and frees up the shoulders for paddling or swimming well WITH NO CHAFING.The only caveat was I think this runs small, as I'm a size 3-4 and took an 8 in this wetsuit  because of chest compression. It is made in china which steered me away at first--and perhaps sizing is different because of that, but order a larger size if you have breasts. The size 4 would not zipper up the chest (back) without compression that was almost painful. I ordered an 8 in an eBay auction (25.00!!!!) on a whim and it fit! SHOCKER!It has lasted over 2 years with continuous use from September-June and finally I poked a nail thru the leg when pulling it on so it has a puka that leaks now. So be CAREFUL of pulling it on because it is super soft stretchy and does tear. I pull up the legs to just below the knee so when I pull the body up, it has plenty of play so that will not happen again.I think the sizing is NOT uniform because some people say it is loose in the belly or chest--whereas mine was snug snug snug even in an 8--when I take a 2-4 size pants and have a 36" bust. USUALLY smaller sized fit fine as they are stretchy on top--for some reason this one was way too tight in my usual size! good luck--its worth ordering because it is THE most comfy wetsuit I've even worn. The velcro on the neck wore out fast and i had a sail ship replace it for me--works fine.

ONE OF THE BEST BODYSURFIN FINS OUT THEREWhy? Because they provide thrust and propulsion in big waves. You MUST KICK DIFFERENTLY AND GET USED TO THAT or you will think they are no good if you are USED TO SHORT FINS. These have length and you slow the kick as divers do to an in'between kick--slower than the flutter of short fin kicks and faster than really long diving fins. If you try and kick like you do with Slasher fins or short fins--you'll have NO power at all. So adjust your kick before you judge these! They have MUCH MORE thrust--you just have to learn how to use them properly. Go UP a size and order fin socks and the ankle strap pad type leashes too. FINS COME OFF IN SURF. Can't tell you how many freebies we find on the beach after someone goes out with a great pair of fins w/o a leash and loses them, never finding them until they wash up on the beack and some lucky finder gets em! worth the 10.00 extra!***Here's a comparison if you need one, since no one has written this. I've bodysurfed 40 years guys so I know what I'm talking about here in Hawaii in big waves too.1. Dafin: total comfort, smaller fin lifeguards here in Hawaii use (they can run in sand with them on)and are great on shorebreak breaks. I love Dafin COMFORT, as they don't tear up my ankles like duckfeet do. They are not as thrusty in rips in bigger surf. Although I've worn them in big waves, I prefer the thrust of the longer fins like ducks and UDT. but Dafin is still my favorite fin for comfort, and great performance in nearly any wave. I just need a longer fin in rips and bigger waves to do my best.2. Duckfoot fins:  I have VERY strong legs from many many years of bodysurfing here in Hawaii. We used to say ya haf to be a duck to WEAR them because we all have ankle scars from duckfeet. So Duckfoot changed, making the pocket softer but they are still NARROW. I wear a LARGE when I wear a 8.5 womans shoe--which is a 7 mens. I wear straps/fin socks to prevent the blisters that I have MANY scars all over my ankles from so that makes the size needed bigger---waaay back in the 70-80's they didn't make fin socks so we just wore old socks. We used silicone gel too. STILL tore up the ankles. Ducks used to be solid blue and REALLY stiff, then 2 tone, then 3 tone, then made in Mexico (trash) and now back to real rubber from Malaysia. The  softer foot pocket  of the ones made today--IF MADE IN MALAYSIA AND NOT MEXICO-- are good quality. Rubber is a commodity now and fins cost $$ because of this. The black and red version is good too but for bodyboarding as its shorter than regular models.3. Hydrotech2 fins: These are silicone fins that are good too (Tech2 fins) which are like Dafin in design with a bit wider foot pocket for all us barefoot luau footed people.They do NOT float so wear ankle padded straps--which make the fin smaller so keep that in mind size wise. These were too flexible for me and lost the thrust needed to get out swimming to outside breaks. I borrowed a pair from a friend after already ordering mine so sent them back. They'd be GREAT for shorebreak surf or bodyboarding but the thrust in outside surf was not there.4. Churchill fins, Slasher fins and similar models: These are shorebreak fins, with little thrust in bigger surf. We all wore them when we didn't have a choice, but there are better models (see above) out there. They are OK for bodyboarding, along with similarly shaped models made for boogie boarding and not bodysurfing unless you are a occasional bodysurfer who really doesn't get into larger waves or serious bodysurfing--because they are cheaper and comfy!5. Voit UDT fins:  The UDT ones are great for big waves too IF U CAN FIND THEM--the black and blue models, not the green/brown ones. The black-blue changed the foot pocket so it doesn't tear up the feet as much. They are the ultimate for big waves if you are strong enough to wear them. Makes your ankles thick and calves muscled. I don't have delicate ankles and I'm not fat--I have bodysurfin ankle  muscles (which I used to get teased about before it was 'cool' to be a strong athletic woman. Times have changed!!!)***As for the ducks made in Malaysia? Buy em while you can. Just buy UP a size and spare your ankles and WEAR FIN SOCKS. These work in rips and outside breaks better than Dafin! I'm 60 and still bodysurfing. aloha

This is one book that caused quite a spiritual-stir in 1939 when it was first published in France. Johnson had his racial views (those of the 'civilized world' of the day and quite prejudiced) and in later years these comments were edited out by the Bea group. I purchased this dilapidated cover 1st edition because I wanted to SEE EXACTLY what was removed--besides the racial slurs, i wanted to see if spiritual things were 'revised' to better reflect the yogic particular group he followed. I also wanted to compare the 'plaigerism' of Paul Twirtchell in the 1960's--as he (published by Eckankar, the religion he started) has been accused of plaigerizing this book verbatim for paragraph after paragraph--and I wanted to SEE the original edition, which David Lane, his main detractor who researched this, stated he used as source material.The book itself is an excellent treatise on the yoga of the Sound and Light--which Twitchell lifted for his soul travel Religion of the Light and Sound--Eckankar. Or, the sufi word: Ek ONG Kar.THIS BOOK IS A CLASSIC AND WORTH READING if you can get around the racial slurs and see the light in it! Those are gone in later editions... It makes you smile at how the world has changed--racially at least!Will let you know how it goes!

LOVE OF ANIMALS, RESPECT OF LIFEAmazing stories with animals and showing how EVERYTHING has a presence, a spirit--and we CAN communicate.I WISH THESE WERE REQUIRED READING IN SCHOOL.KIDS WOULD LEARN EARLY ON TO RESPECT LIFE.Classic works I will re-read many times. As an adult!

Hicks public 'expose' after all their books is a financial disaster for them I bet but the books are still good. Just don't get caught up in the hype of the channeling crappola. To turn your life around is MORE than just visualizing etc but these books help you at least realize that your mental FRAMEWORK must be renovated to get to the point of reworking your life. It takes WORK--not just wishing.THIS BOOK?I liked the way it shows emotional power and how it can either wreck or restore your life. We all carry around a lot of rubbish and most of it is from the PAST. We lose the present that way. This is a good start to get that going in our lives--just don't get caught up in the guru hype. Use it as a practical reference and realize ya gotta do the WORK to get that piece of pie!

Hicks public 'expose' after all their books is a financial disaster for them I bet but the books are still good. Just don't get caught up in the hype of the channeling crappola. To turn your life around is MORE than just visualizing etc but these books help you at least realize that your mental FRAMEWORK must be renovated to get to the point of reworking your life. It takes WORK--not just wishing.THIS BOOK? It makes you take a look insnide--map of your mind and how it thinks--good way to clear out rubbish and get going with your life. Just realize it takes a lot of work--no instant pie. You DO attract into life what you put out!I like this one.

Hicks public 'expose' after all their books is a financial disaster for them I bet but the books are still good. Just don't get caught up in the hype of the channeling crappola. To turn your life around is MORE than just visualizing etc but these books help you at least realize that your mental FRAMEWORK must be renovated to get to the point of reworking your life. It takes WORK--not just wishing.This book is a good start to seeing what you want in life but the easy peasy stuff is bogus americana instant gratification blather. BUT it does help you SEE how much negative junk you crowd your consciousness with and start to get it OUT and SEE what you truly desire. This is NOT as easy as just repeating affirmations with emotion. You must CLEAN your closets and this takes WORK--really getting your hands dirty and clearing out to SEE what you truly want.This book helped me get myself honestly assessed and clean da garbaje. But you must do the inner WORK too--not just instant grat. And then go for it in your OUTER life. Like, 'knock and the door opens'...aka WORK for it and see it and the after YOU do the work, the REST is the miracle. Don't just sit on your okole and expect that because you do all the affirmations with gusto everything will change. Thats da blather!Aloha

As a physician concerned with nutrition I thought i'd supplement the yogurt I eat with this product after researching different brands. I only have one caveat: WHY take this EVERY DAY? Once the good guys are established in your colon--you do not need to take zillions of the little buggahs EVERY DAY. How about 1/week? Unless you are on antibiotics (take them at different times) or drink to excess, eat a lot of splenda-sucralose (sucralose is hidden in many things and is artificial sweetner shown to kill intestinal flora)--the colony should be just fine w/o adding more every day--BUT it does make the COMPANY money since you dish out EVERY MONTH for a new bottle.Tink bout it!aloha

GREAT PROPULSION FOR BODYSURFING AND SAVES THE FOOT BLISTERSI'VE BODYSURFED FOR 40 YEARS IN HAWAII WHERE I GREW UP.I'VE TRIED VIPERS, UDT, DUCKS AND THESE ...DAFINS ARE COMFY (fin sockls still help but no awful deep rubbed raw places on ankles with these)Propulsion--GREAT. (Would be great to have a little longer version for better thrust on BIG waves. They still work but you do a LOT of kicking in outside breaks)I have had my original orange ones for 5 years, used at least 3 times a week in surf and they still work great. I would buy from the Dafin company directly as they readily replace them if they break within a reasonable amount of time from purchase.

SHORT AND SWEET: EVERY PICTURE IS COPYRIGHTED SO YOU CANNOT USE IT IN ANYTHING EXCEPT PRACTICEI was looking for a bunch of pictures that I could change around a bit to make a figure for a dramatic painting--BUT, copyright means that ANY copying is illegal. If you use a composition, evenm if you change it, you are liable if you ever sell the work, print it to sell, etc. NOT worth it.So--next!

gesso is exxpensive now! I use a int/ext Zinsser primer from the hardware store-not the art store one! You can use acrylic over the oil based one! it comes in either acrylic or oil and is bulletproof. Use it as the first couple coats and end it with a gesso coat. Works fine and is sandable with a fine sandpaper, producing a great painting surface with a lot less moolah. Zinssler dries FAST. Thin it with a product called penetrol made by Flood. It thns it and makes brushstrokes not show. (only for oil based one) a pro painter showed me this and I now use penetrol on ALL my oil based paintings as well as furniture refinishing. It is like turpentine except thicker and makes oil washes gorgeous.I'd never heard of it so included this tip here!aloha

ONLY A LITTLE STRONGER THAN POSTER BOARD.PROS:It took erasing a fine line without shreddingIt took water color even if it did soak it up FASTCan draw and paint w acrylics on it OK.CONS:It is only maybe 2x poster board--VERY thin, barely able to stand up--must have a backer board to work it.It shredded after applying a glazed watery acrylic wash in nubs. GREAT PRODUCT TO GLAZE WITH ACRYLICS BUT IT DOES NOT KEEP!!! IT MOLDS---STINKY KINE MOLD!!! Does anyone know how to prevent this? i waste half of it scraping out the thick mold top layer. This is a teeny little book 7" x 4" , 108 tiny pages not including the 50 odd paged 'glossary'!!! It is varied 'Christmas messages' in print. There are many stories copied from other sources (Beezulbulb's tales)so not worth paying for reprints in his format. He does have one point that was a unique take away--that of not thinking of your 'higher self' and lower self' as seperate entities, alwaysasking that higher self to take over during meditation. He stresses getting quiet, still within to let that 'arise'--as it has nothing to do with the concept of two parts of ourselves and has to be experienced to be understood. Since I was always asking my higher self to 'take the reigns' that made sense to me to try and just shut up long enough to let IT rise within. INTERESTING, still experimenting with this in meditation/contemplation. One Pearl.He's a Christian so everything relates to Christianity, "The word", the John 1:1 quote over and over. Sorry---would rather read something else. There really isn't anything to learn here about the 'sound'--as he never really tells us anything except basic meditation ideas told in frilly overly long twisty sentences.Example: opened the book at random: page 84: VERBATIM, as written!During profound inner meditation, when the mind is totally quiet and in an absolute silence-within and without, not only in the superficial level, but also in all the different corridors, subconscious extracts, zones and lands-then the Essence, the precious element, escapes from within the bottle and fuses with the Being, the Innermost, in order to experience reality.As I said, REALLY flowery language. While interesting to read, I'd rather download it from a website where this is free than pay for it. I enjoy spiritual books , deciphering hidden meanings etc., but was disappointed in this one considering the price. It has good in it--just a high price tag. will try the library instead. Except for One Pearl-which I guess is a good one--so...hmmm- 3 stars.Aloha

MADE IN TAIWAN, THESE ARE NYLON AND NEOPRENE--THIN! NOT LIKE MOST NEOPRENE FIN SOCKS. SIZING RUNS WAY SMALL. A MEDIUM IS TIGHT AND I TAKE A 8.5 WOMENS SIZE. THEN WITH ONE USE THE HEEL COMES OFF AS IT STRETCHED TO A MUCH LARGER SIZE. MY TOES ARE POKING THRU IN THREE USES SO THESE ARE POOR QUALITY AND TOO THIN TO LAST.  IF YOU NEED THIN SOCKS--THESE ARE OK FOR A FEW USES. IF YOU BODYSURF--YOU'LL STILL GET BLISTERS. OUCH. NOT THICK ENOUGH, NOT STURDY ENOUGH TO LAST LONG. I WASTED MY $ HERE FOLKS!

I am interested in any history of Eckankar and this author, David Lane--although much maligned by Eckankar--did some incredible research into this religious org.That said, I was disappointed in this because it is only a few PAGES of a back and forth in letters between Darwin and Lane. Okay this is a 1 star item unless the user does 3 mods or at least one mod and learn two procedures, then its a  star item. Anyone that says otherwise simply doesn't use the machine very much. I have gone through 3 of these, combined with all the other reviews of the same issue proves this is not a QC issue but simply a design and part issue from the get go.Do this at your own risk. These are just my experiences, nothing more.1) The overload protection switch on the front that Jet uses is the wrong size. Everyone know this sander constantly turns off. If you ask for a repair they will send you more switch and they will still stop the motor without taking off a 1/32" . Simply bypass this overload protection switch. It's not needed. I have tested the current draw of the machine and the overload switch they use cut the machine out at less than 3 amps, this is a 7 amp motor!  After taking the switch out of the loop I can never get the sander to pull 7 amps anyhow, but if I really push it(like forcing an 1/8" which no drum sander can ever do)the motor can stop. I thought oh crap I fried it, but the motor was not hot. I turned the machine off and on and it fired right back up so the motor itself must have some kind of protection! The last 4 months my house 15 amp circuit never blew(and I use a 12 foot cord!), the motor never gets hot and I never stalled the motor again becasue I simply dont need to take off that much at one time. I stick to a 1/4 turn at a time.. So after 4 months of use I can say its a safe mod FOR ME. Why in the world this doesn't have the sandmart system like the 16-32 and 22-44 (I won both) is beyond me.2) Learn to use the curved pliers technique as described in another review to tight the sanding belts or they will never stay tight. Or go to Woodmaster and purchase their sandpaper Velcro system and make the machine hook and loop. I just use the pliers.3) I have never had an issue with tracking of the conveyor. I know from my other Jet drum sanders that you must make super small adjustments and then run the machine for 5 minutes, then adjust again. Yes, it take that long for the tracking belt to adjust to the screw turns. After the conveyor was adjusted straight I have not had to pay with it since, for 4 months.4) The dust collection really should be on top like all the other drum sander, that in itself could warrant a star being taken off, I dint take one off for that only becasue I wanted people to understand that this is a good sander with user intervention and get their attention with the 4 stars. In other  words if there were zero issues just the placement  of the dust collection port could make this 4 stars.If you do the 3 things I mentioned this is a 4 or 5 star sander in in it's category. Off the rack one star. Now I know many will say I shouldn't have to do this and I agree, BUT there is just nothing as good on the market in this size right now. I have tried the Grizzly and the clones and this is the best if you do the mods. So much so its worth doing the mods.Jet add sandsmart and move the dust pot to the top and you would have a heck of a tool here!

I had the Nighthawk R8000 and had nothing but issues.  I hooked up this router and it instantly worked and is ROCK solid,I really wanted to love that Nighthawk, but this router though rated AC1900 and not AC 3200 like the Nighthawk blows the Nighthawk away in every respect.I used to  think my Nighthawk extender was bad as well, well it's not, it was always the Nighthawk R8000. Now the extender works great and both the 2.4 and 5Ghz get a fantastic signal all over the 3000 sq foot house.

This saw is better in every respect than the old version. It cuts hardwood easier and I believe this is due to the increased RPM, it produces far less dust and the stand is better. The rip capacity is so much Superior to any other portable table saw and though the metal appears to be thinner for the saw body itself, it makes zero difference. And the rack and pinion on this and the flip fence, though at first glance seems flimsy, work perfectly and are actually quite solid! I don't understand the miter slot comments at all. There is no seam and the miter slot is perfect. I use an incra miter gauge and there is zero play and the slot is perfect in every way.Okay The saw is a 5 star, but after weeks of use and side by side with the Bosch, Rigid and other on the jobsite this saw has one annoying flaw. Sp 4 stars it is.It is just so unnecessarily loud. It is definitely notably more loud than every other table saw and any other tool on the job site for that matter. Anyone within 100 feet knows its this saw running and not any of the other brand table saws on the job site. Actually, my crew cant tell the difference between all but the Makita( which seems to be the most quiet) and this that screams like its in pain.There is just no reason this should be louder than my older version, it is loudest in class.Lack of accessories could have reduced this to a 4 star as well, but I still gave it 5 initially, until I got it o site next to the other saws.. But this noise issue is so sever it should be  factor in your purchase.

Great bit and I don't have to make such a deep initial plunge. Many compression up/cut buts have such a large up cut portion on the bottom of the bit an initial plunge of more than a 1/4" is needed or it will burn the wood. With this bit you  barley need more than an 1/8" initial plunge and no burning!

This is the only true flush cut saw I have purchased off Amazon. This does not scratch the surrounding wood at all and there is no set on the teeth . I purchase other various brands claiming to be flush cut here on Amazon and all had a slight set to the teeth.  Though nice the shark saws are nowhere near as good as this as far as flush cutting. After using this I would not even consider the Shark flush cut saw a flush cut saw at all.This saw is a bit expensive but worth every penny if you want to cut a peg off a finished piece. Every other flush cut saw I have used in the less than 25.00 price range required sanding of the peg or plug, not this one.

I owned both Festool saws. The Festool TS55 was so underpowered I was unhappy. Then I sold it purchased the TS75 and I was very happy with the power, but it was  heavy for many applications. Then I purchased this Makita. WOW, this saw is so much more powerful than the TS 55 and so much more quiet. Yes I know about the Festools TS and why adn how they make that sound, but I hate it!Dollar for dollar and over all this saw blows the Festool TS 55 away, all versions. I only wish they made a larger Makita model and I would get rid of my Festool TS75 as well!This works great with my Festool rails. I use the Makita splinter strips and DeWalt rail clamps, the Festool versions are overpriced and for me not as good.

This head is great at my dads home where there is city water and the pressure is good to begin with, even then I had to remove the o ring though. So I give it 4 stars as it seems to indicate this head is for low pressure, but its actually more a so called high flow  then actually adding the feeling of pressure.I compared this Speakman unit in the amazon listing and compared it directly with the Fire Hydrant Shower Head, the Fire Hydrant head seems almost twice as powerful in my home. For me the best head on the market for low pressure isTHE FIRE HYDRANT SPA SHOWER HEADGoogle this term and you will find the company Water Management using the web site name "take a shower" that makes heads especially for low pressure. Take a look at You Tube and search for this Fire Hydrant Shower Head as well. A person tested many of the best designed heads for low pressure and the Fire Hydrant Head won by a huge margin over every other unit.THE FIRE HYDRANT SPA SHOWER HEAD is the way to go if you have low pressure, this Speakaman unit is fine for people with city pressure.

Perfect in every way and IS 100% covered under warranty not sure why people keep saying its not.This bow rocks. When we opened it it was not ready to shoot, so I dont suggest taking it out and drawing on it or you probably will break it. Our had to be set up first. Once it was set up , just like the first unit this has p[roved to be an amazing bow for any price let alone 349.00! We didn't need the warrant on the first and I dont feel we will on the second so I would jump on this in a hear beat.Another thing is a couple people claim the bow broke like the first day and then they called to find out there was not warranty. Who would call the manufacturer if it broke the first day when Amazon will send a brand new on out for 30 days? Between this black op and the camouflage a few people claim it broke right away, then why in the world even call the manufacturer. One guy claimed it broke after 30 days, calling the manufacture at that point makes sense to me. My point is if there are  lemons and are breaking out of the box and you get one send the thing back to amazon free and get a new one dont bother with the manufacturer. These are worth going for a second unit to get a good one. And if it does not break in 30 days odds are it isn't going to break under the warranty period. If for some reason you need warranty work and they claim there is no warranty becasue it as purchased on Amazon scream and yell until they do smoothing becasue that is simply not true. I called, talked to the right person and it is covered!

For the first time ever I can go out all day and never worry about having to charge the phone.I use full brightness and have Bluetooth and GPS on 24/7. I use apps, email, surf the web and watch hulu etc. I can leave at 6am and come home at 2am and the phone still has charge.I think some people got lemons, just return and try again. PLUS, sometimes the numerical charge number on the phone jumps down fast, but then it stays at that number for hours. Some people may not be giving it a chance. I suggest letting it run out of charge all the way instead of thinking that once at 20% the phone is going to conk out fast, like with most other batteries. So give it a chance and let it run down to 5% or even let it turn off before you make the determination it does not at least double your charge rate. Even the heaviest user just has to get 50% more.Charge it new out of the box until its 100%, then wait another hour, Now start timing it and le run it down to 15% or even to 5%, if you dont have 20 hours then do it again. After that you will see if you dont look a the charge number you will get an entire day and then some. I say dont let the charge number worry you because at 20% I used to worry. With this I can go another 4 hours depending what I am doing. Basically you get double what you normally would. The 100% number on the phone will not change to 200%, how can it? You will get twice the charge time though.. Again, if you dont get the performance I am getting then just get another because mine is awesome. And it is no thicker than two other cases I tried!The only drawback is I dont feel that this is a really good "protective" case. Still better than stock, but its no Otterbox.I am so happy I an thinking of getting another stock battery and another one of these in white.And I agree with one other reviewer ignore the one star reviews they got lemons or didn't initially charge and recharge correctly. Or [possibly the one star reviewers really understood the S5 was very bad at holding a charged to begin with. Or they may even have a stick battery thats not good. This depends on a 100% functioning real SAMSUNG S 5 battery to work. SO if you dont get 8 hours on your S5 battery maybe get a new one before you try this . Remember, this uses BOT batteries at the same time.What I am getting at is my S5 battery was BRAND new, the phone phone was 1 day old when I started using this. Possibly the people with poor results are using batteries that are 5 or 6 months old or faulty in some other way to begin with. I recommended using this as soon as the new S5 battery goes through 2 or 3 full charges.I am going to try the competing product similar to this that also includes the wireless charging, I will post on how that works. The only drawback is that required an additional charging base. It has a cool factor but really what the diff then just plugging it in?  will soon find out.This is what I am trying next: Dyconn X5 Protective Power Case with Additional 2800 mAh Battery Extender and Wireless Charging Pad for Samsung Galaxy S5 - Retail Packaging - White

I wont get into a detailed review becasue there are so many good ones. I will comment on my experience comparing my 7D against a Nikon. I tend to agree this camera is a 4 to 5 star, that might not be enough for me anymore.The still photos are simply not near as good as the Nikon 5100 and I assume up, but the camera overall has been good enough for me because the video is so cool with the STM lenses. I use the vid for the kids concerts! After almost a year using the 70D if I was going to do only still photography I might pass on the 70D and get the Nikon. Because I am starting to take a lot more stills I am now on the fence with this camera. If someone is going to do both stills and video this camera is a no brainer. The video on this is great for a camera.I have missed some shots and under certain conditions I just couldn't get good shots(different lighting inside) or it took a lot of work to get shots I could actually use. I love the camera, but still shots compared side by side with the Nikon 5100(discontinued)the 70D leaves a bit to be desired. If you dont see 8x10's side by side I doubt anyone would see a difference under most conditions. I was proved wrong by a Nikon owner in my home studio, I had to eat crow and that was difficult because I paid so much for the camera.My Canon 70D just does not take the pics the Nikon 5100 takes, I assume the 5200,  7100, 7200 are that much better. The still photos are not as sharp nor alive as the Nikons . Sometimes I have to take 50 pics of my products just to get 5 good pics with the 70D and I have to work at it. With my friends Nikon I basically press the shutter and 98% of the stills are useable. The Canon has about a 75% keep rate on average for family pics(far less for my product pics where I need be more picky) becasue many photos are out of focus. I am sure a pro could make of the difference in manual, but it's a whole lot of work. If the Nikon requires less manual setting control for the same shot that tells me this particular Canon is lagging behind. In short the Nikon just takes better stills, easier. On automatic the Nikon kills my 70D. I  wasn't happy about those results. No matter what, under perfect or non perfect conditions, for me at my house, the 70D at best only took stills almost as good as the Canon 70D, never better. And most often not near as good.Had my friend never bragged and come over and proved this to me I might be a lot happier. At least now I know that some of the poor shots I was(and am still) getting with my 70D are not be totally due to my inexperience(that's what I was attributing it to) because his Nikon gave me far less trouble and better results. He paid a whole let less for his camera as well. So many times I heard or read it's the user, that might be, but using the Nikon I produced better shots more often, it is what it is.I am not a pro so someone really good could probably get a lot more out of the 70d, but for now I am thinking of selling. It's hard becasue so many people want to pay me 50% and I will never sell it for that. I have all the STM lenses and am happy using those the most. The L glass lenses are basically crap with this camera, I am glad I didn't buy any L glass and just borrowed a few from a friend to try out. I have the best luck with the 135 STM lens by far.For vid this camera is great, no complaints at all. Tracking the kids faces for plays and staying in focus without a lot of noise is great and may be reason enough to get this camera if you dont want a separate camcorder and DLSR. In my opinion and after using it almost a year for straight still photography this is not the best choice of DSLR.

Unlike one reviewer this DOES work on a 15 foot, you need to stretch the living heck out of it and in return you get a tighter feeling trampoline(in conjunction with 12 trampoline stakes). This wrap and the stakestogether really firmedup the trampoline And of course no dogs or  small kids go under.It was really tough getting it on the 15 foot, but I am glad I did it. Just start at tramp leg and ties the net to it. then have a second person help pull it around and really pull tight to get the other end to the same tramp leg and tie off that end.Really use a lot of ties to get this seam together then go back and attach the ties around the top and bottom. When completed it will be as tight as a drum. Its tight enough to toss a ball at it and the ball will bounce right back to you. Will it rip in the future, not sure I will post if it does.The only uissue woth this is the shoebags and target lay on a support instead of in between so looks are not perfect,but I lovenot worrying about the dogs,

Unlike one reviewer these ARE needed.First if you get a wind storm there are loads of stories of how their trampolines were damages by blowing around.Second, when my kids are jumping hard they could tell the difference after I had 12 stakes in tight.  Actually, the bottom wrap I purchased to keep the dogs out strethced super tight(some people say the under wrap is to small for a 15 foot- no just pull it tight!)around put 15 foot in conjugation with these actually a made noticeable difference in the tightness of the set up. Both visually when watching the kids and testing it with my wife the tramp is more stable with the 12 stakes and bottom wrap together. Do these things  make it any safer, maybe not for jumping, but definitely for keeping little kids and animal safe from the unit moving or anything going under the unit.4 stakes is simply not enough, 8 is required and 12 givesme the pices of mind this tramploinwillnever go anywhere!

Overall these are nice, but they are pretty large in size for the sound they give I was expecting a lot more. For the size that these are both the Bass and the overall volume are lacking. Using the same exact computer I get far more bass and volume using speakers I got on sale years ago for 8.99At full volume there is zero distortion and they are far better than the built in speaker in the desktop, but these speakers must not be very efficient because I have other rated 10 watt that again are much louder.(I latter discovered these are actually 5 watt RMS speakers - I guess I did not read close enough). These are awfully large for 5 watt speakers!I rate 3.5 stars, but I must round down. I see a lot of 5 star ratings, I am wondering how many of those people actually have other speakers to test side by side, Since I am testing against several sets of old speakers I have no advice for purchase here on Amazon today for this price point and configuration, but I am going to buy a few other sets and I will update at that time.If you are willing to spend about 12-15.00 more(only 11.00 more today) I can highly recommend these, they are better to my ear and have a higher volume than this set and like these very little distortion They do take up more space as there is a third speaker.http://www.amazon.com/Cyber-Acoustics-Subwoofer-Satellite-CA-3602a/dp/B0027VT6V4/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1393011629&sr=8-1&keywords=computer+speakers+2.1Okay these broke now after 3 months of use. We never moved them after 3 months they just stopped.
I received more than I thought. In the past I paid triple for a few pages, this was both vol 1 and 2 in their entirety! 5 star to the seller!

5 star for now, its tough to rate something like this when new as its over time that matters. They are solid, the senor is attached nicely and they fit perfectly on the frint of my 2000 Monte Carlo SS.I looked to get the Timken as they generally have a better reputation only to find at least 3 people here on Amazon alone had them fail in 3-6 months. I guess Timken is not what they once were, at least not for this specific part.  These GMB actually get better ratings overall than the Timken, again from the comments I can find on Amazon and other forums for this particular part number.I ordered two of these and from appearances they seem good. These are of great quality and have perfect welds on every single unit I have. I purchased two sets of the 6 ton and one set each of the 2 and 3 ton. ALL, every single unit, has perfect welds.These are safe and I highly recommend them. To the people saying they are not safe, you simply received a bad run, but as of today 02/18/2014 all 8 individual units I have are perfect and I have been working under them woth peace of mind for the last week. Why not re-order? Every product has a few bad apples. Actually, even if the weld on these were not perfect(they are on mine) unless you went far over the rated weight I just cant see how these could possible fail, they are solid and stable.It's simple, if you do get one with a bad weld just replace it free using Amazon. These are as good as my older 80.00-100.00 units and I will not spend 80.00 on jack stands ever again!I will re-rate these in several months, but I don't see anything changing. For now 5 stars6, 3 and 2 ton preference:Without question my favorite are the 6 ton, they are so beefy and are always my first choice. They are a bit too tall for the sides of my 2000 Monte Carlo though.If the 6 ton are too tall as they are for my 2000 Monte(on the sides at least) and you are trying to decide between the 2 and 3 ton 100% go for the 3 ton. In my experience, at least for this jack stand line, there is nothing the 3 ton won't fit that the 2 ton will and the difference in build quality is substantial. Since the price difference is only 4.00 pass on the 2 ton, the 3 ton are far better and only 1.5" total taller. I am not sure why they even make a 2 ton, I guess for the people who want to save 4.00, but the diff in price is not worth the durability difference. I suggest to pay the 4.00. Or maybe there are cars where the 1.5" does makes a difference, but any jack I have ever used goes higher than the lowest setting on the 2 and 3 ton jack stands by several inches, even on the sides of a low vehicle. I consider my car very low and the 3 ton work fine. Obviously I prefer the 3 ton over the 2 by a far margin. Only use the 2 ton if you are forced into it they are simply not the value of the 3 ton stands.

NOTE***Okay today(12-24-2013) I was experiencing an issue with the lens, well I finally figured it out to be an issue. It seemed sometimes I had to take the lens off and put it back on to get it to focus again. The focusing issue turned out to be caused by putting pressure on the lens when attaching it that made the difference. I thought I would check for an update before I returned it and and sure enough there is an update listed on the Canon site. Even though I just got this lens 3 weeks ago and it was new(not a refurb or used) it shipped with the original firmware. So I suggest anyone buying, even if today, check and see if it is firmware 1.1.0 or 1.1.1 or anything other than 1.2.0. - 1.2.0 is the current firmware for this lens and fixes the issue I described.FROM CANON: If pressure is applied to the lens barrel while the lens is mounted to the camera (pressure can be applied even while attaching the lens cap while carrying the camera with the lens attached in a bag), the auto-focusing function of the lens may stop working.This is EXACTLY what was happening to me. I almost sent the lens back because of this. Today I did the firmware update and the lens acts like it should now. I can't get it to stop focusing no matter how many times or how I attach the lens, so the update worked. You can find information on this issue here:[...]The info states the only Cameras that can be used for the firmware update are the Canon EOS-1D X (*1), Canon EOS 5D Mark III (*1,*2) or Canon EOS REBEL T4i, but I used a 70D and it worked fine. I believe anything from a T4i and newer(meaning T5i and SL1) can do the update as well as the 5D III and the 1D as stated. Anything else you can try, but I don't think it will work. Canon is supposedly doing firmware updates for the older Rebels(possibly they are already done) that will allow the STM lenses to be updated from them. You will have to contact Canon on that. I  would update the firmware on ANY camera to the most current before trying to update a lens anyhow though. It makes sense, the STM's came out about the same time as the T4i.Also, when you go to the firmware update page it only will list an update if you choose windows 7 in the drop down menu.I have Windows 8 and Windows 8.1 both 64 bit and thought I would give it a shot. The firmware update I downloaded listed for Windows 7-64 bit worked fine under both Windows 8 flavors and the lens now works perfectly.ORIGINAL REVIEW:At first I did not like the lens, but after learning about the camera more and when and how to use this lens I love it. Unlike the other STM lenses this is not internal focusing, of course at 40 mm there is little room for that. I bring this up becasue this may be why out of the other two STM lenses I have this one is the loudest. It's still not nearly as loud as any other non STM lens I have heard and the lens is not heard on video playback.  I think it's simply because the focusing is not internal. I may be wrong of course.This lens seems to me to be a bit sharper than the other STM lenses. Maybe on a full frame this could be a walk around lens, but on my canon 70D I prefer the 18-135 as my walk around lens and use this for portraits, close ups and inside the house family gatherings.If I am doing portraits in front of a drop background this lens gives me better pictures in its range than the 18-135 STM. But I still like the 18-135mm for full body shots if I have restricted space for me to move. For me being an amateur  I really need to find a sweet spot for my body positioning in relation to the subject and backdrop to get the most out of this lens(especially for a bokeh effect). But when I find the sweet spot the pictures sure are nice with this lens.

I abuse mine and use one everyday. They last about a year and I don't care! Out of all the similar products I have tried I like these best and every year I buy another one. Actually, I have two on back up at all times to give to my kids or friends as they need them for school ID's etc.They get 5 stars becasue I like the style best, but one star off becasue they do need to be replaced due to a rippage on the interior pocket after about a year of use. But this rip does not allow things to fall out and the cord has NEVER broken on me, it just lets the cards from one section get into another section.I gave one to my son and since all the kids want them for their school/lunch ID. They can put cash in the zipper and the ID/lunch card in the clear side and hide an ATM card in the last slot. Put it around their neck and then slip it in their shirt so no one can see it and they are good to go. Being able to safely carry a few bucks and ATM card so no on can see is really nice piece of mind, plus they have used these the kids have not lost an ID!  In the past I have always lost wallets, but becasue of these in the last 3 years I haven't, plus I love not having anything in my pockets!For the price they are probably a 5 star value, but that rippage issue has to be mentioned. I would  pay 5.00 or 10.00 for these, but at 2.00 another Amazon steal!
