This is an EXCELLENT brush.  It is made for water to be channeled up the extension.  The water is then channeled through 6 or so spray nozzles built into the brush.  I need a brush that can clean my soffit and edge trim of my standing seam metal roof.  It is about 20-25 feet up to do so.  I purchased a 20 ft aluminum extension pole.  All the water pressure extension poles were only 10 ft or less.  I purchased 20ft of 3/8" clear water hose and a hose and connector fitting.  This setup was absolutely the Cat's Meow !!  Hope to post a photo showing the mod.All in all this is a great brush.  It is soft enough to use on a car.  It is thick enough to hold soap.I highly recommend !!Thanks,Gadget

Well I have tried several inexpensive DVRs in the past weeks.  Trying to get an IPC NVR solution that costs less than $250.  I found this solution as the best so far.  The best part is the company actually responded to my emails.  I have several ideas that will make this baby "The Best Bang for the Buck".  Since I have quite a few emails form them already I think they will be very responsive.I was able to get it up and running quickly with my nine Onif 2.1 profile S cameras. The DVR found all of the cameras (Onvif) but only setup 2 of them. I had to manually enter the RTSP data for the rest of the cameras. The firmware was 20150124 just as reference. Packaging was great.  It even came with a mouse, black to match NVR.  It had a bigger Power Supply then any of the others.  Make sure to get a hard drive that is made for surveillance.  I am using a  WD Purple.  WD Red should also work well.I am a retired computer scientist from the USAF so I have background in this area. The real data on this unit is that you are able to get 1280 x 800 size videos at 2 mbs. The frame rate drops down to ~15 fps on my cameras. I have tested the unit with Vivotek FD8361, Vivotek FD8134v (2 of these setup with Onvif), Vivotek IP8336W and a HD Foscam.  The recorder function I needed was just always record all channels and it was very easy to setup.  If you setup a trigger (motion) to record you should be able to get a bunch of days more on the hard drive.I  tried the playback function and it was good.  I will have a couple of things for their wish list.Hints:  If your cameras don't setup you might need to try RTSP instead of Onvif.  Your can verify your RTSP connection using Quicktime URL:  Keep your streams at 2 mbs or less.  I use 1 mbs for the wireless cameras.  The manual stays it can go up to 6M mbs in HD modes.  I used 1280 x 800 resolution and Constant Bit Rate (CBR).  Tried 30 fps and after reviewing data dropped down to 15 fps because the 30 fbs was not buying me anymore data with all 9 cameras running.  You should not have any problem if you camera is Onvif 2.4.  Mine are 2.1.Cons (these could be important).  With this revision I did not see that you could record to a NAS Server.  It seems you can record to a USB (I did not try).  You better have skinny HMDI and USB connectors, not much room there.  There is no custom window configuration so you need to select one of theirs.  Also the viewing window has some limitations on how any camera show video at one time.  For instance the 3x3 window only showed video on 5 channels.  The other 4 were blank, but if you double clicked on the blank ones they would go to single window and show video from that channel.The websites of interest are www.brovotech.com & www.ezvis.net.  The company actually answered a few of my question thru Amazon email connect.I will keep this thread current for a while since I just had the DVR one day.  More to come.  Ask question if you would like.Update (4 june 2015) - I have nearly a month of camera (9 cameras) recorded.  All is still working well.  Hopefully a new firmware will come out soon with a couple of minor bugs fixed.  I have recommended this recorder to a few folks.  Quite sure there is not a better ONVIF recorder for the money.Best,GadgetBTW - I am the guy whose wife won't let him run for politics because I have a bad habit of calling a "turd" a "turd."

The frame rate drops down to ~15 fps on my cameras.  I have tested the unit with Vivotek FD8361, Vivotek FD8134v (2 of these setup with Onvif), Vivotek IP8336W and a HD Foscam.  I all the best part of my product experience was Amazon who handled the return superbly.  I also ordered in a different brand recorder and it seemed to work much better. Hope the title got your attention.  I ordered this popcorn machine in last week.  Had a big function and needed it overnighted to me.  The packaging was ok, not quite as heavy as I would have liked.  No damage from shipping so I still gave it a thumbs up.  The visible damage on the machine was the SS bottom of the door.  It had a couple of dings.  Nothing  could have damaged it in shipping so I guess it was packed with dings.  I plan to take a photo and ask company if they can replace for free.So the only slight negative items have now been identified.  I want everyone to know that this is a fantastic machine.  Assembly was about 15 minutes.  The machine did not come with any free popcorn so I also purchased a 12 pack of GNP from amazon.  Followed the directions on the pack and made our first batch,  it was fantastic.  The next night we made 5 batches for the crowd attending our back yard movie night, and it was a big hit.  Many folks said they wanted to borrow it for an event they were having.Some tips for buyers:* Don't get clean happy on the kettle.  Every batch seemed to get better and I think there is credit in all the suggests to treat the kettle like a cast iron skillet.* Remember that the machine separates into 2 parts.  It takes a lot less room if set on a existing table top if the area is cramped* When cleaning out, take a piece of thick paper and use it to clean out the bottom window area where corn residue gets between glass and bottom rail.  THEN take out bottom panel (2 small screws) and VACUUM out all residue before wiping clean.* When making corn preheat for 4 mins then add ingredients.  Make sure to turn on rotator immediately.  Listen to the corn pop, when the popping starts to slow down turn off heater.  When it is barely popping turn off rotator and immediately dump kettle.  We did not have any burned corn following these simple instructions.I hope all buyers find this helpful, enjoy the popcorn !!Gadget

0:10 MinsVery surprisingly this item was basically, put into ziplock bag and taped.  Stuck into A0 box and glued shut.  Big question here is this a new product?  Where is the original manufacturing packaging.  Not satisfied that this was a new product. Also I received no invoice in package.  Ours broke so I actually paid for overnight shipping.  I will say this has been the exception to Amazon's great performance.I just got the item, so I will edit my comments after using the product for a couple of weeks.EDIT- I would like to say Amazon made good on this transaction.  I will give AMAZON 5-stars.email :I'm  so sorry to hear about the condition in which you've received your order for "EZ-DUZ-IT Deluxe Can Opener with Black Grips." I understand the disappointment this has caused and it's certainly not what we want for our customers to experience.Please be assured that this is not a typical Amazon.com experience and we'll make sure to investigate the origin of this problem.I wish I can replace the item but I've checked your order and see it was placed with ToysNGamesEtc, a seller on our website. Because ToysNGamesEtc' inventory is constantly changing, we can't replace items sold by them that are fulfilled by Amazon.Instead, I've requested an advance full refund of $11.72. This refund will appear as a credit on your Credit Card in the next 2-3 business days. Once completed, you'll be able to see the refund request here:I don't want to cause your further inconvenience so there's no need to return the original item to us. You're welcome to keep or dispose of it--whichever option is most appropriate and convenient for you.Gadget

0:10 MinsWell, read all the great reviews and decided on this Simmons Handgun Scope.  It was delivered on time.  It was well packaged.  When I went to open the manufactures box I noticed that the flaps and inter box were ripped up some.  Checked out the exterior and all look ok.  I went on line the internet to see if any pointers on install were available.  I immediately found the scope for $20 less.  I checked with Amazon to see about price match.  They said NO, but I could send it back.  I then decided install scope on handgun after ordering the correct rings from Amazon.  Decided the $20 wasn't worth all the fuss.  When I went to adjust the scope I was livid.  No adjustment collar or knob was on the side (see video).  The was the deal breaker, sending this puppy back !!I feel kind of bad that my last few reviews were negative.  But this might have been a return from someone who needed a few parts so I can't blame Simmons not knowing.Sometimes honesty hurts.  Sorry Amazon this was a dud.Mike

Very good coverage, easy to setup.  With the 5 external ports I was able to get rid of 2 USB wireless network adapters.  I can now go down to the dock which is 100 ft away and have a great wireless connection.Only downside is I have not found a way of turning off or dimming the blue connection lights on the front of the unit.  Since this is in bedroom it is a small issue.This is a five star purchase.Thank You !!

2:34 MinsI purchased this unit from amazon 4 days ago.  I even made a video because hearing is believing.  First of all this unit works very well.  It has filled the bucket 5 or 6 times in an air conditioned Florida home showing 53% humidity.  Since we turned on this unit we are down to 44% inside humidity.  The construction observed is very good (we did look at Lowe's and Home Depot units which were poorly constructed), features are good but the thing sounds like a freight train passing by.  Also remember that the air coming out of the unit is warmer than the air going in 72.8 deg in and 91 deg out, another problem with the unit in the living area.  A good modification would be a dual gauge showing both the setting and the room humidity level.  Truth be told we will probably have to return the unit because it is just too loud for a living area.  This unit would be great for a garage or basement.  That is a shame because it works great, just not indoor living friendly.Gadget

0:01 MinsWell folks, price & quantity where right.  Here is a photo of blue bungies in this purchase.  The red bungie I have had holding tarp for 9 months.  The blue bungies where this product after 2 and a half weeks.  Judge for yourself.

This mirror was not as bad as most all the reviews I read.  I put 2 of these on in 10 mins.  Not sure why you need instructions.  Put a dab of loctite on the bolt holding mirror to bracket.  I did not know I could do a video.  Maybe next time.  Good product at a very reasonable price.  I uploaded a photo install.

This is the toughest reusable bag I own.  I have been using a few bags I purchased from Whole Foods but they didn't machine wash very well and the straps could not withstand heavy items.  These bags are awesome.  I have washed them a couple times already and of course they held up because they are made of 100% cotton.  Other bags I have are not made of natural fabrics.  I use them at farmers markets because they don't do so well at the grocery story with boxed items like cereals, crackers, and canned goods.  The bags just aren't that wide, so you will likely need all three bags if you buy a lot of these items.  I use them to carry books, clothes, craft supplies, and fruits/veggies.  They are also very handy when traveling. The baroque patterned bag is my favorite and I get plenty of compliments.

I have a Australian Shepherd and she is very well behaved.  She has been through agility and obedience training, however, she does have issues with walking too fast on the leash with my elderly parents.I got this training aid in hopes of correcting my dog from pulling on the leash.  I used static correction at first - at a medium level - and she learned quickly.  I am now using the tone button and my Aussie responds very well with the commands.I was hoping that my dog would be able navigate the agility course without me running next to her using the push-to-talk feature.  Unfortunately, it didn't quite work very well.  She first thought that it was cruel ventriloquist act and she would stop and look around to see where the voices were coming from.  She eventually learned to ignore my voice altogether.This unit is quite effective when used with positive reinforcements. I have also used as a less cruel bark collar and my dog responded positively.I don't have a second unit to pair it with, but that feature would be amazing to have for multiple dogs.The Training System is very easy to use after you read the instructions. I tried to use it without reading the directions and I that is how I found out the intensity of the stimulation to my dog.  :-)  I also agree with a previous reviewer in that the remote is fairly large to keep in a pocket.  The remote isn't rechargeable so keep the AAA batteries handy.I feel the price of this unit is too high and would be better priced around $50 less.

I am not very handy, but I have installed a few fans in my day. Even so, working on fans is always a pain, and always harder than I expect it to be. That being said, I installed the programmable control without too much muss or fuss, and I lived to tell the tale.Now that the product is installed, I am really excited. Just being able to control the light and fan with the remote control is a BIG advantage. Once the weather warms up, I envision programming the fan to shut off in the middle of the night after I have fallen asleep, and the house has cooled down. In addition, I will make good use of the program to randomly turn the fan light on and off at night when I am on vacation.This product is way cool.

I have  a much larger Adidas bag that I use when I play tennis as it holds rackets, shoes, etc but it is just too bulky to take to the gym with me.  The much smaller Defender II is a great size.  Small enough for an outfit and shoes and perfect to fit in a locker.  If you had younger children this would be a great overnight bag for them.  It has a shoulder strap, or you can carry by the handles.  Two side pockets that zip up .  It really is the perfect day use bag.

This was really easy to put together and took about 15 minutes.  It looks great in toddlers room and is study enough that will not be easy to pull down by accident.  Takes up less room than the picture suggests and not much larger than a typical small bookcase.  The books are easy to slide in and out and they display the books just fine.  This is the kind of unit you will find in most pre schools.  Very happy with this product.

This is pretty small and I am pretty big thus my clothes are big.  I don't think  I could fit very much of my items in either the clear or dirty side.  However my wife is a size small and she could easily fill up a side with a weeks worth of under garments and a shirt or two.  Each side is a small mesh so your clothes can breathe.  I was surprised that there is some give and the bag will expand an extra inch or two without fear of it ripping at the seams.

My first thought this is a pricy bottle of cologne for the size.  I kind of thought that Calvin Klein was less than scents I have been using (spice bomb and tom ford).  Once I put the Euphoria I realized I had misjudged and that this scent held up to what I perceived to be more expensive scents.  First off this is a case of a little goes a long way as there is some serious holding power with Euphoria.  The scent to me is a perfect day scent and comes across as very clean and crisp and makes me think of outdoors.  5 hours later when my Tom Ford scent as faded the Calvin Klein is still going strong.  Like I previously mentioned the scent is fresh and clean (perhaps the smell of freshly washed linens?) but still manly enough.  My wife noticed right away that I had on a new scent and she merely nodded her head and said "I approve" which is like a thumbs up for her.

I still snore but per my wife not as loud as I used to.  Once on I do not notice that I am wearing the breathe right strip.  They stay on some nights no problems and other nights one side is off, I have yet to lose one.  The stickum is just enough that you can put on once and for any reason you need to take off or readjust they will not restick.  They look just like bandaids and you could easily fit a few more in the box not sure why they chose 26 a box.

You can never have enough car chargers and I am happy to have the Aduro Power UP.  I use it to charge my Samsung Galaxy phone.  It takes just a tad longer to charge my phone than when I use my Samsung charger purchased from the manufacturer.  I have used this charger for about 2 months no problems at all.

This product is much better than Bumble and Bumble Surf Spray.  My sister has wavy hair and this spray gives her locks that beachy, wavy look by just scrunching her hair after spraying the product.  I, on the other hand, have very straight hair.  I use this too to give my hair the beach look.  I twist clumps of my hair and use a hot iron to give the curl.  The spray helps hold in the waves and works great.  Yes there is oil in this as stated in the name, but it doesn't give my hair any greasy feel.  The scent is light and very pleasant.  Although this is a very small bottle, it is worth the price.  Very few products are able to put a wave in my straight hair.Get it on Amazon while you can.  It is sold out or available in limited quantities on other sites.

I received this in exchange for a review.  This is a total score for me as I already use the Art of Shaving products.The first thing you should ask yourself is....is it worth it?  Do you want a great shave, do you need a badger brush and do you want to smell nice?The next is can you afford it and if you answer yes than you need to pull the trigger.I currently use a twezzerman badger brush its nice but I lose bristles every time it is used.  The art of shaving brush takes a beating and does not lose a hair.  Even tried to pull out a bristle and they are packed in tight.The cream will last you at least 4 months of regular use.  Its really a case of a little goes a long way.  You will lather up better than you ever have.The aftershave makes you feel nice and smell nice.  My wife loves it after I shave.Shaving with these products will produce the best shave of your life (as long as  you have a nice blade).  You will also smell nice.I prefer the Lemon scent over Lavender but that is a matter of choice.Is it worth it...yes.  Its cheaper to buy the pack than to buy each item individually.The product is top notch and sold at plenty of high end stores in fact Art of Shaving even has their own store in Las Vegas.

Although my skin has yet to show major signs of aging, I know that I must start thinking about preventing mother nature from taking control.  The SKII Essential Power Eye Cream is a good choice.  The cream comes with a spatula for easy scooping from the cream pot and it absorbs quickly under my eyes and over my lids. The cream has a very faint but pleasant scent and it is lightweight when applied.  It is not greasy and has a luxurious feel.  After the first week of use, I have noticed some firming of my eyelids and the area under my eyes look less sunken in.  I truly believe that over time and consistent use of the product, that the early signs of my crows feet on the corners of my eyes will diminish.  This is one of the best eye creams I have used.

I would like to start off with the packaging, the box looked like it had been through the war.  It was tattered and torn.  It was a bit difficult to maneuver the rolled up mattress in the plastic bag to get the mattress situated.  Once opened, the mattress began taking shape.  I searched and could not find any instructions. I have friends who purchased memory foam mattresses and they had to let them rise and air out for 24 hours.  I assumed the same applied to this bed as well.  The odor isn't too bad but definitely needs to be aired out.  After the 24 hour period, I noticed there was still a dip in part of the mattress that hadn't quite risen.  I figured it need longer to rise.  After a week, the dip is still there.  It feels like part of the mattress’ foam core is missing.  You can feel the hole.  The mattress feels cool to the touch, but once you lay on it there is nothing cooling about it.  After you place the mattress pad and fitted sheet on the bed it was as “cool” as any other mattress.  It was too soft for me, I would have preferred it to be a bit firmer. The mattress does have a zippered cover which is nice, so you can take it off to wash it.  The mattress does come with a 25 year limited warranty and probably would have fixed the defect in the mattress if I wasn’t so disappointed with it.  I am sure this mattress would be good for those who like a softer mattress, but it wasn’t for me.

I recently had back surgery and picking up anything from the ground is near impossible. I thought that grabbers were for the old people turns out I was wrong. I have at least 10 grabbers in various rooms, cars, and work and can say that the Vive Grabber is as good as they come. Able to grip a one liter wattle bottle no problem. Can pick up two shoes at the same time with no issue. Also can get smaller items like dropped keys on the first try. This is a very durable gripper that I am happy to have.Note that this was given to me from VIVE in exchange for a review.

I recently had back surgery and picking up anything from the ground is near impossible.  I thought that grabbers were for the old people turns out I was wrong.  I have at least 10 grabbers in various rooms, cars, and work and can say that the Vive Grabber is as good as they come.  Able to grip a one liter wattle bottle no problem.  Can pick up two shoes at the same time with no issue.  Also can get smaller items like dropped keys on the first try.  This is a very durable gripper that I am happy to have.Note that this was given to me from VIVE in exchange for a review.

I received this from Vive in exchange for an honest review.Ever since I had back surgery I have trouble picking up items.  Grabbers have become a way of life for me and I have several other styles form VIVE.  The suction cup grabber is my least favorite as I have trouble getting heavier items and the sides somewhat collapse when you squeeze it to get a wider / heavier item.

While I don't believe this Soundbar will replace my main TVs current sound system, I do believe that the speaker really packs a punch.  I put it in my bedroom because my flat screen TVs speakers were barely audible and the sound quality is poor.  This system is great because I can use it with with Bluetooth or when connected to my TV.When taking it out of the box, it seems like is it is big and bulky, but when you set it up, it doesn't seem as cumbersome.  The Orbitsound also comes with a subwoofer, whereas most other quality speakers have you buy it separately.  I am not tech savvy and I can attest that other reviewers are correct in saying that the set-up is sooo easy!.  There is a quick set-up guide and it is simple and all you need to know to work your speakers.  It also comes with all the wires needed so no need to buy 'em.I didn't try the speakers on my laptop, tablet, or computer, but I am sure you will find it just as easy to pair the Bluetooth or use the auxiliary cords.I HIGHLY recommend this Soundbar.  Great price, great sound and everything is included.  You can't beat it!

Took this to the family cabin to pass away an afternoon as there is no tv.  Puzzle was moderately difficult (the tree pieces) the birds were pretty easy.  It was a great way to pass the time but was not the most challenging puzzle I have done.  Color is very nice and the completed puzzle came out very nice.  Pieces fit together very easily.  Its a well made puzzle

I suffer from carpal tunnel and thought this would be a good exercise to strenthen my grip and wrist muscles.  These are a very low tension so i can do tons of reps.  I keep at my desk and use while taking phone calls.  Foam handles are a good quality.  Will move up to stronger tension on next set.
Nice chrome spice rack.  I have used McComirck and Trader Joe Spices and they fit perfectly.  Holds 5 bottles of spice very nicely.  Easy to mount on the wall and seems very sturdy

I had no idea what Tupelo Honey was except that I had heard it in a Van Morrison song.  This lead to a lieftime quest to find the honey that inspired a song.  I could never fine Tupelo Honey in the local grocery stores including Whole Foods.  Finally tried Amazon to get my honey.  Wow this honey was like nothing I had ever had it seemed so fresh with the such a sweet taste.  Hands down the best honey I have ever tried.

I was going out of town on a trip and wanted a light ashtray that I could pack.  This ashtray claims to hold two cigars but it seems too small for this.  It is lightweight which was easy to pack and the plastic was solid enough that it would hold up to the elements (I left it on the deck of a seldom used cabin).  Only complaint is that it is not big enough for two cigars.

I love beers and lately my hobby is trying to see how many beers I can review in a year.  So I purchased a beer guide of NorCal, SoCal and San Diego.  San Diego was the biggest disappointment.  It is very small and the paper quality is lacking.  It is nice that the beers are listed by region and each brewery has a list of breweries that are nearby.  San Diego has alot of breweries and each one has a very short blurb with a best beer.  The author assigned a ranking in several categories to each brewery which allows for a cummalitive score (however this seems to be very subjective).What does come across is that the author knows his stuff and it does seem like he did the research for this book I would just like a little more info on the brewery and beers available.

My family swears by Mentholatum as a vapor rub and ointment for dry/chapped noses from using too many tissues.  This soothes your nose and helps strengthen your skin from too much blowing.  I must recommend this product and getting it overseas.  I am unable to find the Decongestant-Analgesic Mentholatum in stores near me.  Check the label before you buy it because not all of them soothes burns, abrasions, insect bites while also helping colds and muscle aches.  Spend the extra bucks to purchase this one.Shipping may take longer but came 2 weeks sooner than quoted.

I am an avid Febreze consumer and I have tried room deodorizers, air fresheners, soaps, cleaners etc  and all are great products with great scents. When I saw Febreze was paired with Unstopables, I knew I had to give it a try.  I use the Unstopables in my laundry and I have had compliments on the fabulous smell coming from my clothes.  I thought the scent would be similar.  Unfortunately, the Fresh and Flirty scent of this Air Freshener was not quite the same scent as the Unstopable in wash scent booster.This freshener comes with a double oil glass container. While the warmer's design is more attractive than other Glade or Airwick dispensers, it makes the scent super strong.  I first put this in a smaller living room connected to the kitchen.  The scent was indeed overpowering at the lowest strength setting.  I had to move it to a much larger room with vaulted ceilings.  It is still very powerful.  I have only had the warmer in the wall for a few days.  If the scent continues this strong, it is hard to imagine it will last the 60 days as stated on the box.  If it does, then this item is amazing and well worth the price tag.  If it doesn't, then definitely not worth the purchase.  I will update my review when I am out of oil.

I used this at our family cbain which is away from the city and gets really dark at night.  Hung it from a tree and sat on the deck drank a beer and watched the colors of the ball.  It was much brighter than I would have thought.  I would love to order more in the future.I would like to note that I received this product in exchange for a review.

My father in law is on the older side and is impossible to shop for.  I know that he is a die hard Republican and thought this would make a great gift some Retro 1984 socks from back in the glory days of the Republican party.  He loved these and wears them with pride.  They ran a bit on the smaller side.

This is heavy duty paper.  Well made and difficult to tear.  Went with Duck Brand as they also make duck tape and I am very happy with their products.  Tried to ship a box that I wrapped with this at UPS.  UPS told me they would have to charge me more for a wrapped box than an unwrapped box.  Asked if it would matter that the box I had wrapped was not a plain box they said no they slap a sticker on it and will get shipped.  So just a FYI wrapping a box may cost extra when shipping with UPS.

I wishi I did not need this product but I do.  Not sure why I get shocked more than most people but I do and I hate it.  For example the metal file cabnets in my office shock me every single time I get a file.  As I get files up to  up to 10 times a day which makes me almost afraid to open a drawer.  Since I have been using the static discharge I have not been shocked.  It seems to work well for me.  Going to buy a second one for the car as I tend to shock myself there as well.

I did not realize this was a Disney movie not that it would have made a difference.  This movie starts with Hero who is a lost soul (he is a genuis who parents are dead) with no direction who is wasting his brain on hustling robot fights.  His brother shows him the way be more creative by attending the univeristy.  Than like all good Disney movies tragedy strikes and Hero hits rock bottom only to build himself back up.  This movie may not be for younger children as death and redemption as well as revenge play key roles, but as an adult I found the movie to be enjoyable and well made.  Worth 90 minutes of my time.

I had the privilege of reading and reviewing Melissa Spoelstra's "Jeremiah: Daring to Hope..." study book and it honestly set a high standard for me as far a faith study books so when I saw this book become available, I grabbed it up. "Joseph" isn't as intense for me as "Jeremiah" was but as it is about "The Journey to Forgiveness" by using Joseph as the core focus for teaching, it seems right that it was a bit gentler on my senses. Spoelstra doesn't skimp on the reading and exercises which I love but overall, it just seemed to have a more natural flow for me. I still have one more week to complete the six week cycle and I look forward to when I can start again.

Gena Showalter is a hit-and-miss for me. When I love her books, I really love them (and hat tip to a commenter from a few years back who told me not to ignore her earliest work because that has some of her best work). But when I'm not crazy about a book, it isn't dislike as much as ambivalence. Still, when I saw that this book, I figured "Why not?" because there are other paranormal adult fiction writers whose YA work I enjoy consistently (Kelley Armstrong is the strongest example).I expected to be a little behind the ball when I saw "A Mad Zombie Party" was a Book 4 of a series but a little research showed me that it is a spin off of sorts. It actually seems a mix of side story, spin off and sequel in that it features character(s) of the main series in lead roles where the antagonist (Anima Industries) that has been defeated stirs up again. Some of the teen speak did throw me off a bit because it did seem a bit forced  and maybe a little too cute sometimes for me. That said, there is still a nice charm to the proceedings and I did like the premise that it is an action adventure story that is also about moving forward. I liked Frosty, Milla and Kat. It was an interesting dynamic of a triangle that was and wasn't since Kat is deceased and that there is a bigger problem in that they have to battle Anima again.I liked the story enough to throw the first three books of the series on my wish list so maybe with the holidays coming up, I'll start the series from the beginning.

I was so quick to select this item that I didn't realize that it was a Lenox piece. I love Lenox. I received the item on Thursday and ended up taking it into work. It has been admired by many of my co-workers so far and I think I'll leave it at work for the holiday season since it is one potluck and party after another. It is pretty and vibrant. Love the red cardinal and the Christmas vibe. It is a simple design which is perfect for me. I don't like fussy graphics because they can look tacky after awhile. It is a nice size so we can put in the extra tongs and can opener as well.

I won't know for sure how effective this book is because my niece still has to take but it is Kaplan and they put together really great reference tools for test preparation. In going over the book with my niece and based on her feedback, it is a good supplemental tool. It doesn't take the place of the class but it does bolster the learning that takes place in the class. I'll probably check back in later in the school year to update the review once she takes the exam, but so far, so good.

"Ninja Slayer Kills" Vol 1 was a fun read. I hadn't heard about it but my son had so he gave me the head's up what to expect. Basically, it is just rock-em-sock-em good fun. A little ridiculous but if it isn't a little ridiculous, then why read? It is pretty violent and it is definitely an intro volume but I'll be looking out for more.

Whimsical and interesting, I feel like I read Trish MacGregor's "Unlocking the Secrets to Scorpios" more lightly than I was meant to. It was interesting though and I learned a lot about the Scorpio sign and compared to the previous book that I read on political determinism, it was the light read that I needed. Author MacGregor definitely covered every aspect possible and it makes me want to find out if she has a book on Virgos.

I give my 3-star rating with a grain of salt (more like a silo) for Richard J. Perry's "Killer Apes, Naked Apes and Just Plain Nasty People" because I think I just wasn't in the mood to read this because I honestly didn't get much of it. It wasn't exactly what I was expecting and it just went over my head.

"CliffsNotes Parents' Guide to Paying for College and Repaying Student Loans" is a solid reference for students and parents on looking for ways to plan on how to finance a college education. Thankfully concise, it doesn't have a lot of fat to it. It is a no-frills, here's-the-info book and then use it.

Although it was noted as still to be shipped, I actually received the copy of Tess Vigeland's "Leap: Leaving a Job with No Plan B..." and it is an interesting read. I was more curious than anything because even after reading, I still have trouble with the idea of not having a plan B for anything that has to do with my finances (once burned, twice burned, how many times does it take to get burned is my motto), but Vigeland does lay out some interesting ideas that are within reach. There was some parts that I skimmed on (like the entire chapter called "The Eat Pray Love Thing") but  others I paid more attention to. I don't think I could do what Vigeland did or outlines, but there are aspects of it that are worth thinking about and for that, I found the book an interesting read.

I wish I had something like this when I was in high school. It was so hit-and-miss back in those days but if I had a book that cost about $12 to help me figure out how to plan for college admissions starting from Freshman year, I would have considered it an investment worth making. What I like about this book by Kaplan, in addition to its affordability, is that it isn't over-written. It stays concise and pointed. The suggestions and advice are practical and therefore, it can be used over the 4 year span, because it isn't 'trendy' advice but workable, usable advice with no extra fat.

I am a hit-and-miss reader when it comes certain types of fantasy novels set in a certain century of Britain. Simply put, I hated "Jonathan Strange and Mr Norrell" and I've never understood its popularity and it scarred me so I always gingerly approach historical fantasy set in Britain, save for a few authors.So it was that I selected Zen Cho's "Sorcerer to the Crown" with some reservations.And I ended up loving it. Witty, intelligent and deceptive in its social commentary, it is the kind of story that one hopes will be good but rarely hits all the notes that you want, but for me, this one did. Zacharias Wythe is a former slave who taken in by Sir Stephen Wythe, who was England's Sorcerer Royal. Upon his death, Zacharias inherits the position. Due to his color and status, Zacharias has few allies and must prove his worth more than he would have otherwise.Then there is Prunella Gentlewoman, whose birth and status is shaky as well. She is staying at a school for young women who have magic but must learn to suppress their magical abilities because women can't handle such things. When Zacharias speaks at Prunella's school, an incident occurs and he becomes a de facto guardian of sorts who will take her to London under the pretext of helping her to land a husband but also so she can become his apprentice.The premise is great as is the world that author Cho builds. It is a lived in world that is both familiar and fantastic. The themes woven in the story are present but not too heavy handed with room for wit and charm without sacrificing intrigue. I'm repeating myself, but I loved it and I want to read it again already.

I selected Billy Coffey's "The Curse of Crow Hollow" for the title alone. I was a little confused that it was in the Christian section but while there is faith elements, the author blends several genres to tell an engrossing thriller of a story.Told in what seems a mix of first and second person, there is still a definite narrator who is probably unreliable which sets the right tone of the story. It is set in Crow Holler, a small town in the Appalachians. Living up on the mountain near Crow Holler is Alvaretta Graves, an old woman who may or may not be a witch but whose 'curse' upon the town at her husband's death still affects the folks who live there. When a group of teenagers inadvertently cross her path, they become ensnared in the curse and after that, it seems to be as present than ever before.It is a psychological thriller as well as a folklore supernatural one. It makes you wonder if the curse is self-fulfilling or an actual curse or maybe a bit of both. Coffey does a fine job of setting the place, the people and the plot on a path that is creepy and atmospheric. The pace can drag at times but overall, I found it to be engaging and eye catching.

Rebecca Alexander's "The Secrets of Blood and Bone" is a book two of sorts in the story of Jackdaw Hammond, a woman who seems to have a life that is entwined with the supernatural. I didn't read the first book and I didn't feel too handicapped by that, it still felt a little like I may have had a better understanding of Jack's situation.After the events of the first book, Jack is looking for a place to hide and she thinks she's found it in a seemingly isolated home. Of course, that isn't going to happen as she still has others who are interested in her in the worst kind of way. It seems that a way out may lay in the long dead Edward Kelley and his path in the 16th century that led him to Venice.Told in two viewpoints that alternate between present day Jack and 16th century Edward, it was an interesting back and forth. I liked the pacing that Alexander laid out. There were a few things that raised a brow but nothing that tripped up a read that had a good sustained tension and an ending that was pretty well done.If there is another book to follow, I think I may pick that one up on the strength of this book.

I selected Kaplan's TOEFL for two reasons: 1) curiosity and 2) my English skills are rusty (even if I am a native speaker). Prepping for this test seems like the same as the citizenship test in that if you don't have to take either, you don't know how hard they really are. While going through the various sections, I realized how weak my English skills had become, especially when I got to the chapter on "Listening". That chapter kicked my ego to the curb.I went through the book with a neighbor who had taken the test some years ago and she said that if she'd had a book like this, it definitely would have helped. She went to classes to prep for the test and she'd still recommend it, but the book provides extra guidance that she would have preferred to have.So whether you need to prepare for the test and you want to bring your English skills back up to snuff, this is a great book to have to practice.

Rae Carson's "Walk on Earth a Stranger" has a great setting (1849 California Gold Rush) and a pretty good heroine in Lee Westfall. It is a mix of historical fiction, alternate history, and fantasy (paranormal) so that was intriguing too. Yet, the pacing was somewhat uneven so it made it hard to get into the rhythm.Lee is a loner but okay with her life until her parents are murdered. Her subsequent guardian is, of course, not the best person to be a guardian which sets her off on her own. The gift of sensing gold is part of the story but seemed more for flavoring. There is a familiarity to Lee's story (and the end is left open given that this will be a trilogy). I'm not that picky about familiar stories because that's just the way it goes and presentation can make up for a lot, but with the uneven pacing, it didn't quite grab me as I thought it would.

This author, Cynthia Ruchti, came to my attention because of a fictional book she wrote ("As Waters Go By") that I recently read and enjoyed very much. So much so, that when I saw her name on this book, I picked it up in spite of it not being a fictional story. I'm so glad that I did because I loved how Ruchti uses the metaphor of repairing arts and crafts (quilts, tapestries, painting, etc) to illustrate the art of mending a soul. Engaging to read, thoughtful in presentation and inspiring in both faith and creativity, it is just a wonderful read. It soothes and invigorates which is often what I need. Definitely will try to find more of this author's works.

Levi Lusko's "Through the Eyes of a Lion" is a beautifully written memoir and lesson for surviving loss and finding strength in the aftermath. It is both inspiring and instructive with practical advice and then words to ponder to go outside the familiar box. I will definitely be reading it again.

There were parts of Karin Slaughter's "Pretty Girls" that I liked. The premise isn't new in that there is an old case of a young woman's disappearance which wrecks a family and brings it back when a new incident of a missing young woman causes some of the family to come back together, in this case, it is the sisters of the first missing girl.Claire is the lead and I found her problematic. Pacing of the story is great. Plot isn't new but it is still done well and kept me engaged. But Claire can cross the eyes. There is much to recommend in this book and I think the rest of the novel can overcome the lead character's annoyances.

Matthew Dicks's "The Perfect Comeback of Caroline Jacobs" was a nice read during a stressful time. Light but with a message of sorts, it is about a woman who finally speaks up and how it triggers her to take that trip home to face some old issues.Caroline Jacobs is a quiet gal. The kind that sits and nods and keeps her thoughts to herself. her story opens with her doing something out of character. She snaps at a woman at her daughter's high school PTO meeting. This leads to a confrontation which brings her daughter, Polly, into the fray when she backs her mother up by getting physical with the principal. A bit of convoluted shenanigans (which I didn't mind at all) and the mother and daughter set off to Caroline's home town where she will face up to the friend who dumped her back in the day. I love that it isn't a guy that she is going to face, but a female friend because man, friendship break ups are hard to articulate in getting over yet they leave scars.It isn't an overly deep book but I liked how easy it was to relate to Caroline. Some of the culture nods by Polly was a bit annoying but it is easy to pass over and focus on the parts that were enjoyable.

"Rocket" wasn't what I expected but it was interesting in how it was pragmatic and readable. Some lessons aren't really new but the presentation and content helps the reader reassess concepts that are familiar while taking in concepts that may be less familiar. It was more about branding but almost every business now has to have some kind of branding whether it is a physical product or a 'how it feels' product. In that sense, I had a bit of push-back but eventually, I pushed aside my bias and the ideas became easier to digest.

Like most people of a certain age, I lament that Christmas just 'isn't the same' as when I was younger. It often just seems like another holiday now. I often feel like Superbowl Sunday gets more attention than Christmas. So it was with that in mind that I selected Rob Burkhart's "Five Questions of Christmas". Although I'm reviewing it now, it was really meant for me to start reading on Thanksgiving Day to remind me of what Christmas (and the season) is about. I enjoyed it so much that I'm still sticking to that plan.Burkhart writes with a mix of theology and narrative so it is both easy to read but it isn't empty reading. It challenges and makes you think. I could stop reading to take time to go over a point and then pick up later. It also stayed on point for each question which is always nice.

I will probably never use the bright yellow marker but I do appreciate it just in case that I do end up using it and overall, I love this set of dry erase markers. We used them for a brain storming meeting rather than the regular markers and everyone was commenting that there was no odor. We liked the amount of colors available so everyone got their own color to use to add info to the board. Honestly, for the price, this may be our new go-to dry erase markers.

I like the size of this stapler more than anything. It is just the right size for my hand. It isn't the smoothest stapler but it gets the job done. I like the color as I won't lose it on my desk. I have another stapler that is very good for my office, but it also cost quite a bit so for the price on this one, it isn't bad for a home office where you just want to staple a small amount of items.

Ellen Byron's "Plantation Shudders" is an easy going, charming murder mystery read. Maggie Crozat has returned home to the family's bed and breakfast Louisiana plantation. With a houseful of guests, a few meet their demise which puts Maggie and her family under suspicion. To help clear her name, Maggie starts to investigate and of course there is a handsome detective, Bo Durant, to help her out.The most violent that this book gets is that some characters will die because this is a murder mystery. Otherwise, it is the kind of murder mystery that made for enjoyable tv watching on a Sunday evening like "Murder She Wrote". The mystery isn't too mysterious but I really didn't mind because the characters were likable and the reading was easy.

I like Coffee-mate's French Vanilla the best. It is my favorite coffee creamer for coffee. I actually started to like coffee because of this flavor. The squeeze bottle is nice but I will still take any version of the French Vanilla whether the small portions or the pour bottle or this squeeze bottle. The main thing is "Does it make my coffee taste how I like it?" and this item does.

This is my third Adam Hamilton book. I enjoyed the first two that I read so I swooped up this book as soon as saw he was the author and Hamilton does not disappoint. I have another book to read on Paul but "The Call" will be hard to beat. Thoughtful, historical and written in a way that makes the message stick. It isn't just a biography but rather an example of a life and message that should and can still inspire today.

This book is a nice to have book with author Sheila Walsh providing bite size anecdotes to ponder with selected scripture to accompany. It isn't heavy stuff. Not even really daily devotional. It is just something nice to read and ponder at lunch before eating or after when the meal is done. Or if you need to calm yourself before a tough meeting. I liked it because it is thoughtful and gentle and sometimes that is exactly what I need.

I am a sucker for the girl who went away but comes back home to lick wounds just to find that home is probably not the best place to have gone to.  In Brenda Novak's "The Secret Sister", Maisey is home to Fairhairn, North Carolina. It is an island so everyone knows everybody. Her first love is also back on the island and Rafe has a daughter. Her mother is not a very nice person so Maisey doesn't stay at the family home. Her brother is also back and he's a bit messed up himself, but Keith (the brother) being home means that when Maisey finds some pictures that trigger memories of a sister, Keith can corroborate this memory. So there is the 'secret sister' of the title.I honestly went into this book with some high hopes but the writing is a bit clunky. I didn't warm to any of the characters. I didn't really find the romance between Rafe and Maisey particularly compelling. It isn't a bad book or story, but I just didn't take to it.

When Hannah Arendt passed away, I didn't know anything about her but I remember my mother speaking about her because my mother was going to college so Arendt was a topic. As I got older, the name would come up from time to time wo when this book came to my attention, I thought I would try it. I've read a few of the books in the Icons line and I liked them so that was more incentive.Anne C. Heller's "Hannah Arendt" is the kind of biography I like when I am not familiar with someone but need to catch up quick but Wikipedia won't do. This is why I like the Icons line. It starts in Jerusalem when Eichmann was brought to trial and would be the subject of Arendt's "Eichmann in Jerusalem". It then goes into her early life and key moments to the post-publication time of the Eichmann book.This is an easy, quick book to read. Just enough depth to get a good feel for Ms Arendt although not so much that it'd overwhelm. I got a good idea on how contradictory Arendt's life could seem. I think if I were younger, I'd be more judgmental but being older, I think I understand better how contradictions can exist for someone like Arendt.I'm not sure if the book makes me want to take Arendt's writings, but I would recommend this book to anyone who is curious about Arendt.

I was doing great with the Samsung Galaxy Tab S that I was using to go over "Samsung Galaxy Tab S for Dummies" but the one thing that the book can't help you with is when someone takes the device away from you. BUT while I did have the device, the book really helped me learn how to use. Simple (and colorful!) is the best way to go with learning the basics and author Gookin really focuses on that which is how to get to the settings to social media to working the camera to posting some thing online. There is a chapter on maintenance as well.As always, the "For Dummies" line strength is in its simplicity. If you want complex, this isn't the book for you, but if you want to get started fast without a lot of useless instruction cluttering the pages and brain, this is the book for you.

I received this item yesterday and started using it right away. Generally, I'm not fond of earbuds because they irritate my ears. I do like the sound from this particular product and it doesn't irritate my ears which is unusual. The only thing that I'm not too keen on is that earclip is too big so the clip slides around some. Maybe it is meant more men than women. Otherwise, they are pretty comfortable with good sound.

It is rather humorous (sort of) that I selected this item with a niece in mind but while she thought it was nice, she dropped the 'you are old, auntie' bomb on me that the lockers are her school are mostly for show because they are encouraged to not use the lockers (thefts, security, etc). So now I know why she and her friends lug bags of books to and from school.So I ended up scrounging around to find someone who might be able to test it out and voila! a friend of mind who uses the local Y and has a locker there said "Hey, I'll try it out for you!" and while it is a just a bit big for the locker, she was able to slide it and she loves it. It really does help organize and maximize space. I thought the little drawer was unnecessary but she likes it because she puts her swimming goggles and cap in it.When I asked for a rating, she said 5 stars and wondered why she never thought of getting something like this sooner.

I enjoyed "Star Wars: The Clone Wars" when I watched it some years ago, so when I saw this come across my dash, I figured "what the heck?" and selected it. Truth be though, I'm not a Star Wars aficionado so Christie Golden "Star Wars: Dark Disciple" is my first Star Wars book that I am reading.It was quite enjoyable. A solid 4 star for me in this story about how a former Sith/now bounty hunter Asajj Ventress is brought in by the Jedi to help get close to a Sith Lord. In doing so, she and Jedi, Quinlan Vos, are paired up on the mission and the adventure heats up in more ways than one.I don't remember all the details of the Clone Wars but I didn't feel it was necessary that I needed to in order to enjoy this story. Pacing was good; characterizations were great; and the action was just the right amount. I like the moral gray that surrounds the mission and the Jedi in particular. To be honest, this book actually makes me want to delve a bit more into other books set in the universe.But even if I don't go further into the Star Wars universe, I'm glad that I was given the opportunity to read this story.

I read this book way too fast. Peter Scazzero's "The Emotionally Healthy Leader" is not meant to be read in a week. Not for someone like me because the chapters were intense. The second chapter alone ("The Emotionally Unhealthy Leader") was a lot to take in.The first part really gets into the inner self and if you go too fast, you miss a lot which sets one up to miss a lot in the second part. In short, the first part breaks it down and the second part builds it up. Scazzero gets into uncomfortable places in the first part but it is necessary in order to build oneself back up again.

I am not sure why I selected this book to read because I have never read a Robin Hobb book before and by admitting that, please take the rating with a big gulp of salt because I am sort of at a loss on how to review the book properly. I did like it but I believe to fully appreciate this story of Fitz, an assassin, and his old friend, the Fool, the reader has to read, at the very least, the first book of this trilogy (Fool's Assassin) and also to have time to read it properly than rush through it as I did. Hobb's writing is beautiful and that was enough to keep me going even when I sometimes felt completely lost.So I guess that would be my recommendation: Read the first book in the series first and then decide whether to take this one on. It is beautifully written but it is a dense, layered world so it helps to come into it with a certain amount of foreknowledge.
About the only thing my son was not quite keen on for these shoes was the low back for the ankle. Otherwise, the shoe fit perfectly and was easy to wear right out of the box.

I selected "Days of Awe" because I kept thinking that the author's name seemed familiar. Lauren Fox also writes like someone that I feel like I've read before. It is almost eerie the deja vu that I felt while reading this story of Isabel "Iz" Moore and her time of mourning and growing.The story opens as she is dealing with the death of her best friend, Josie. There are layers surrounding Josie's accident that comes from the layers of closeness that Iz and Josie. Having lost a dear friend, this aspect of the novel had resonance for me. The story has a time skip to a year later and Iz's life is in worse shape. She's separated from her husband; distant with her childhood friend, Mark, who was also Josie's husband; and her relationship with her soon-to-hit-puberty daughter, Hannah, is hit-and-miss.It is her mother, Helene, who nudges Iz to come back to the fully living again.As noted before, there is a familiarity to Fox's writing that made me feel like I was dropped right into this woman's life. Iz's ambivalence; her awkwardness; and her coping mechanisms to what happens around her read very real for me. About the only part of the story that I wasn't as keen on was the ending which seemed a little too neat and tidy, but otherwise, it was a solid read for me.

My little microwave came in today (super fast shipping at a really good price) and it is exactly what I needed since my old micro was on its final leg (only the express defrost was working). It is a small microwave which helps me save space. It is a perfect size for my home because there are only two of us and we use the microwave for prep work and/or small meals to warm up. It is a light item so it needed to have something placed on top to keep it from sliding a bit when I opened the front door but I had something on my old micro so it isn't a change for me.So far, I warmed up my corn chowder soup from lunch with ease. My son used it to make popcorn. We haven't had micro popcorn in a really long time. The front panel is a bit small so I think people with not great eyesight may want to consider that. If you look at it straight on and in good lighting, it isn't so bad but if it is at an angle with low lighting, the panel labels are a bit hard to discern. That's about the only thing so far that I can say against it. Otherwise, I'm pretty happy with it and it was a solid price.

I wasn't able to use the suction attachments because of the way the shower head is positioned but aside from that, the Zenna Home 7401AL, NeverRust Aluminum Shower Caddy is nice item to have. It fits snug around the pipe; it is just deep enough to hold two shampoo and two bodywash bottles or a body wash, shampoo, and 2 shaving cream canisters. The lower shelf is great for the razors. It is just really nice to have items off the corners of the tub. I like the finish on the caddy as well in that it has a matte feel. It isn't fancy but it looks clean and neutral.

A few moments after I selected Brian Hiner's "First, Fast, Fearless", I went into a "Oh man, why did I do that?!" There is so much Navy SEAL stuff out there that it is getting to be almost a parody and I wondered if this would be the same.It isn't. It is a very well done, focused book on leadership that is readable and relatable. Yes, author Hines has worked with SEALs and that influences his points. It is neither rah-rah stuff nor theories that go over the head. It is a practical guide in which the word 'practical' actually means something. While it is focused on leadership, I felt that a team person would also find good advice in the book. I'm not a natural leader, so I often look for ways to be a better teammate and in that respect, I found a lot to admire here.Some may quibble about the lack of gender neutral terms (Hines uses 'brotherhood' a lot), but I didn't mind and I am a woman. For me, it is the ideas and advice that matter and how useful it can be because to me, that's the part that matters.

Like other reviewers have noted, this cotton blanket is not the ivory shade marked on the package and noted in Amazon description. Luckily, I prefer this almost-white shade so it works for me.I love everything about it and am pleased that it is a more medium weight, rather than heavy because I like to use these as spreads in summer and spring. I like the little diamond pattern and love the perfect hemming on all four sides. Another big plus is that it has no loose threads or flaws that I can see.I notice that when I've been to ER at Kaiser, they use cotton sheets, very light-weight but comfortable. I get the same comfort from this fine Eddie Bauer blanket. I do not feel smothered as I do with other materials such as flannel or polyester weaves.I am very happy to have this blanket in exchange for an honest review. I honestly love it and feel very comforted when pulling this up around my neck and drifting off to sleep. I wish pleasant dreams to all who get this fine Eddie Bauer blanket.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 30, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Fear" (with Barbara Watkins)

When I got these professional Kimberly Clark towels I was planning to use them like paper towels, but once I received them I saw what an injustice that would be to these fine, heavy-duty, more absorbent towels.I am saving these for tougher jobs... and I'm finding there are more of those tasks in our household than one would think. For example, my daughter and a few of the grand-kids enjoy dabbling with various arts-and-craft projects that use "messy" materials. Thus, we have used these professional towels to clean up paint spatters, paint brushes, spilled drinks, grease-spots on the driveway, etc. Those were previously clean-up jobs for old "rags" made from discarded clothing or bedding.  (Or for paper towels that are meant for lighter jobs, thus requiring too many for the  tougher work... not to mention  they tear too easily.)My favorite use of these towels is to clean little hand-prints off the sliding-glass door... in between visits from our regular window cleaner.I received a 100-count box of these sturdy, helpful towels in exchange for an honest review. I hope this review helps customers make up their minds. I know I will be buying more in the future because I want to keep a supply in the kitchen and in the garage. Can't imagine how I managed before!Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 29, 2015Author of "Millennium Babe: The Prophecy"

Every kid loves Thomas and yours will love this unique Holiday Train. I know my grandson loves it. It's so different from the usual flat-track. He squeals when it goes up and down like a roller coaster.This set has the cutest station and the colorful Christmas decor is perfect.I just received this yesterday and couldn't wait to set it up to show Devon... and play with it myself. It was easy to set up and is a lot of fun, believe me. To see Thomas's face on front of the engine is as much fun as opening a Christmas present.Talk about Christmas in July... Well, this is it... Fisher-Price does it again...Special Note: I received this in exchange for an honest review, and I couldn't be more pleased with this sturdy, well-designed, unusual train set.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 28, 2015Author of "The Toonies Invade Silicon Valley"

Now that we are getting older we no longer go to the trouble of preparing our meals outdoors the "rough" way. We wait for the kids to come over to deal with the bbq coals, the fire, cleaning the grill and all that "hard" stuff. :-)We admit we miss the "tang" of the grilled burgers at times, but our new George Foreman grill serves up some mighty tasty food... without the mess.As you must have surmised, I love this grill and wouldn't trade it for the world. The convenience of having it in my kitchen is priceless to me. So we have to tilt the pan a bit to clean the grill, and wish the grill were removable, but that's nothing compared to the previous fuss of working with our old-fashioned grill.Now don't take me wrong, I love getting outdoors for barbecues with the kids when they are here; wouldn't trade those memories. I am speaking only of convenience for when one reaches a "certain" age. :-)This grill with the ceramic grill plates and easy timer is adequate for our needs at this time in our lives. And it's quick and efficient.Like other reviewers, I felt the stand was a bit wobbly (too light for the heavy lid), so we removed the legs and now use it on a wrought iron table that fits very nicely at the end of our counter. If you decide to do this, be sure the table you use is fireproof...One more note: When cooking fish that can smell-up the house, it's nice to be able to take this outside for those special occasions.All in all, this grill is so perfect for our needs that I will not delete a star because of the "leg problem."I appreciate receiving this as a gift in exchange for an honest review.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 27, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Blood" (with Barbara Watkins)

I love this backpack; perfect size for me. Not too large, not too small... But what I like best about it is that I can also use it for a purse, thus getting double use from it.It's very up-to-date with the popular nail-head design; not gaudy with too may nail-heads like some products I see.  I think it's classy looking for a casual, everyday look.On top of that, it's well-made inside and out... The lining and extra pockets make it very convenient, so I won't lose smaller items. All my friends think it's real leather; it's that good! I, personally, prefer faux leather because it's easier upkeep.This is my second product from Winkine and I am very pleased.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 25, 2015Author of "1106 Grand Boulevard"

I am very pleased with the features on this new selfie stick much better than my previous one. I like both of them but this one has a remote release button that enables me to snap a selfie from the handle rather than necessitating a timer.  The camera is easily attached and secured to the stick and recharging is simple.I also enjoy the sturdier, easy-to-lengthen wand. This Bluetooth selfie stick is very well-made...I love it and am having fun taking more photos to share with my Social Media friends.End note: I received this fine product in exchange for an honest review, and this is my honest opinion.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 23, 2015Author of "The Search for Bobby McGee"

This is a super refreshing deodorant, like nothing I have used before. It's a firm base like the others, but with a few twists of the bottom you are treated to sprinkles of clinical powder which is super absorbing and fragrant. It reminds me of the talcum powder I used to sprinkle on my babies when they were newborns. However, it is not messy like powder...I really like this Dove product and it keeps me dry much longer than others i have used.Highly recommended.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 23, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Fear" (with Barbara Watkins)

All I can say is WOW, what a beautiful and convenient handbag. I absolutely looooove, love, love it! The style is so "in" and the size is perfect for me. I have always taken a lot of "necessities" when venturing out and about, and now with my trusty Kindle always with me, this size is even more appreciated. And before I forget, it is very well-made inside and out; the lining is attractive and there are many little pockets for holding your smaller items like lipsticks, cell phones, etc. Very convenient and well-designed...I carried it with me when shopping yesterday and got a lot of compliments. When asked where I got it, I told them to check Winkine on Amazon.I received this very chic purse in exchange for an honest review and HONESTLY, I love it! Pardon the gushing, but I just can't help myself. You know women and their purses and shoes. :-)Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 22, 2015Author of "The Search for Bobby McGee"

I had a hard time finding a foot stool the proper height for use when I'm at my computer. I had been getting cramped upper legs due to pressure from sitting so long. After using this stool for only a day, I notice a lot of relief.  I placed it under the desk and use it from time to time in order to change leg positions which is important when sitting so long at computer.I tried step stools but most were much taller than this one; even an inch makes a difference...  I also thought about children's step-stools but the step was too narrow for adult feet.Absolutely delighted with this... and it's pretty too. Love that fun shade of green. :-)

Burt's Bees does it again!  I'm very pleased with this product because it's convenient, easy to use and each sheet is larger than expected. This extra size makes it possible for me to not ony cleanse my face but my front and back neck areas also. Due to typing so much, my neck tends to get still and sore. You'd be surprised how refreshing these cleansing towelettes are.As for the exfoliating towelettes, they certainly do a good job getting the deeper grit that somehow develops on our skin. My skin feels better already and I've only used them two days. I feel CLEAN...So they take a little getting used to as you learn how to best remove just one at a time, but that is a minor inconvenience for a product that makes me feel so refreshed.Scents have never bothered me, but since my daughter visits often and has sensitive skin, I thoroughly appreciate that these are odor-free. This makes it possible for me to leave a package on the bathroom sink for all guests to use. How convenient and thoughtful is that? :-)Thanks, Burt's Bees for another helpful addition to my skin-care regimen.I received these free for an honest review, and I will definitely keep myself supplied with them. Awesome sauce, as my daughter would say.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, July 22, 2015Author of "1106 Grand Boulevard"

Like many other reviewers, I jumped at the chance to get these liquid chalk markers. And I'm so glad I got them in exchange for an honest review. It was my lucky day because my very first film screened at a film festival in Florida last week and the director had given me a movie clapboard as a memento.  I tried to write the film name and scene on it in white chalk but it didn't show up at all.Well, the first thing I did when I got these was write film details on the clapboard and it worked perfectly. I have the clapboard leaning on some books on my bookshelf and can now read it clearly. It looks great beside the DVD of my film.I plan to have fun with all the colored markers when the grand-kids come over. We will draw pictures on a blackboard I keep in the spare bedroom.Happy in California...Reviewed by Betty Dravis, June 23, 2015Author of "the Snack" short-film

This gorgeous and dainty necklace just arrived today and I love it! It is so well-made, it looks like fine jewelry. The stones are stunning and resemble real diamonds and rubies. Looks much more expensive than the price on Amazon.This is the perfect gift for my son's fiancee who is a national champion soccer player. Can't wait to see her face when she sees this.I received this in exchange for an honest review and can truthfully say: I love, love, love this adorable necklace.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, June 23, 2015Author of "The Search for Bobby McGee"

I love these absorbent cloths. I was going to use them only for washing dishes in between dishwasher runs. I especially appreciate that they're so absorbent and easy to use. But then my housekeeper came and decided she had to try them for dusting, wiping down the patio furniture and a number of other household duties. Needless to say, I kept a few for the kitchen, but put the majority of them with her cleaning supplies.She loves them and so do I.It's the little things that make life easier... and these cloths are one of my little things.Highly recommended,Reviewed by Betty Dravis, June 17, 2015Author of "The Search for Bobby McGee"

I truly enjoyed this fine movie. It had a moving message that is important. Family values are held high in this film. What really struck me was the graphic visuals. Wow, amazing and so realistic. Loved this movie and highly recommend it. Look forward to many more from Director Russell Emanuel.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, June 16, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Blood" (co-author Barbara Watkins)

These earrings are perfect for me. They are a simple, classic, elegant design. In fact, I am so pleased with them I call them "exquisite."I love the combination of pink, pearl and "diamonds." I also appreciate that I can wear them with blue-jeans or with special occasion gowns. Just my style!Every woman loves compliments and I certainly get more than my share when wearing these. I don't need to recommend them to my friends; just wearing them does the job.Thanks, for these "Sweet Rose" earrings. I am so fortunate to get them in exchange for an honest review.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, June 13, 2015Author of "1106 Grand Boulevard"

These bluetooth wireless stereo earbuds are the best I've tried yet. They live up to their reputation and do credit to their designer.As advertised, they are stylish and user-friendly, lightweight and comfortable. I can't testify to the sweat-proof feature as I am not one to work up much of a sweat. :-) But I do enjoy the quality sound of the music while on my daily walks. Great sound makes for a happy woman... I do so-ooo enjoy my music.I also use them when viewing movies I download to my Kindle. It's nice to know my listening pleasure doesn't interfere with others in the household.All in all, these buds are 5-star all the way. Highly recommended.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, June 13, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Blood" (co-author Barbara Watkins)

This two-port charger delivers what the manufacturer promises... super-fast charging in a compact design. I love the fact that the prongs fold inward, making it easy to store and to travel on trips with me. I just toss it in my purse and away we go.I also appreciate that my friend can charge her phone at the same time I charge my tablet.Very convenient...This is by far the best wall charger we have had. The quality is above par.This is my true opinion as agreed to with the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.Highly recommended.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, June 13, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Fear" (co-author Barbara Watkins)

I have been thinking about this pen for quite some time, so when offered it in exchange for an honest review, I grabbed it up. With 3-D trending now, I just had to have it.I like it a lot, but must admit it took a lot of practice for me to come up with something decent at first, but after I got used to the feed-line and feel of it in my hand, I could finally show one of my enhanced drawings to family and friends... with a sense of pride.I am an amateur artist who enjoys the creative process, so this is a lot of fun for me. My grand-kids tried it out and they like it too.Recommended for those who have patience while learning to handle something new.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, June 6, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Fear" (with Barbara Watkins)

These place mats are wonderful for our casual dining. The colors are pretty and cheerful, brightening our mood considerably. Makes for a fun dining experience.I love the variety of colors, and the larger size makes them very special.Love, love, love these. Perfect for summer's more festive get-togethers.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, May 6, 2015Author of "1106 Grand Boulevard"

This is one of my new favorite necklaces. It's perfect for when I wear something simple and basic but need a bit of show in gold... I love the gold color, the huge rhinestones and the pretty colored flowers... Just the right amount of color for me.I deducted one star because the rhinestone was missing from one of the earrings. That's not a huge problem for me because I like larger ear-rings anyway and found it easy to match it with earrings from my collection. However, it could be a problem for others, so needed to emphasize the damage.I really love this necklace.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, May 28, 2015Author of "1106 Grand Boulevard"

I love this product because it makes my face feel so clean and healthy and I feel it will keep occasional blemishes under control. After only three uses, my skin feels better already...I admit I don't use all the attachments and my favorite is the rotating brush. It cleanses much better than a wash cloth... but that's an understatement.In addition to cleanliness, I appreciate the modest price. I recommend getting more for each of your children. It's a great starter for them to learn the basics of keeping their faces really clean.I have no idea why the manufacturer lists "electric" in their description... It is NOT electrical, which is a good thing to me. I prefer battery-operated small products like this because the cord on other products often becomes unwieldy, tending to edge too close to the running faucet.I haven't had this facial cleaner long enough to guess about its longevity, but the little motor seems powerful at present.Highly recommended... at this fair price.Reviewer, Betty Dravis, May 19, 2015Author of "The Search for Bobby McGee"

This fine quality set is a wonderful addition to our BBQ supplies. The mats (yes there are two of these useful items) are awesome for cooking vegetables and other foods besides meat. Like other reviewers have said, every BBQer should have them when visiting parks and campsites to spare them cooking on messy, generally unclean, grills.Most every reviewer has stated the warning not to use the mats over an open flame, but this can't be repeated often enough. Safety first!I've never had a nicer set of skewers, either.I appreciate getting such nice products in exchange for an honest review. Couldn't be happier...Reviewed by Betty Dravis, May 15, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Fear" (co-author Barbara Watkins)

Not only is this little green lantern handy to have around, it's also light-weight and quite attractive.I mainly accepted the offer to receive this free in exchange for an honest review because I wanted to use it on our patio on pleasant evenings when we sit outside and enjoy the balmy evenings. It's much more cozy than electric lights. But I soon found my son borrowing it for camping outings. It seems he had misplaced his big, red lantern and was in a hurry, so I loaned it to him.I missed it, so was a bit grumpy when he returned it a month later. But all ended well because he ordered two for himself. :-)This Star-light is wonderful; I enjoy the smaller size and am surprised that it lights up an entire room and has three settings: for bright, for dim and a third one for blinking. I have ordered another one to keep in the car in case of a roadside emergency.This practical lantern has already come in handy during a power outage. I live in an area where we only have one or two outages a year, but as luck (bad luck) would have it, we had an outage in the past month since I've had this handy lantern. Must say that we appreciated having this around. We keep it in the den where we usually play games or read during outages. Yes, it sheds ample light... And it certainly beats the hand-held flashlights we used before. We still keep plenty of those around so we each have one in order to navigate from room to room when needed, but this lantern is our first choice for the main gathering room.As you can tell, I'm sold on this lantern, and recommend it highly.Reviewed by Betty Dravis, May 15, 2015Author of "Six-Pack of Blood" (co-author Barbara Watkins)

I love this sassy color. It's perfect for showing off on FaceBook.
