Wasn't sure how warm these little socks would be given how thin they are. I had *nothing* to worry about. They are toasty, and yet, they breath! They also keep their pretty colors well in the wash. They have fast become my favorite socks!

I was pleasantly surprised to find it was as nice as the picture. The colors are vibrant, and it appears to be sewn well. It is also the first women's boho hoodie I've purchased that's actually adult-woman sized versus Junior. I'm a medium sized in women's clothes and an XL in Juniors, but found I was swimming in both the XL and L. Medium fits with plenty of room for a short or long-sleeved shirt underneath. Considered even going down a size from that. Overall, I'm extremely happy with it--especially considering the amazing price.

Love, love, LOVE this bag! I have been looking for one that works for forever. Although I've enjoyed the style of other Kavus (I have their ropebag and Keeper) this is the best one.First off, it's very ergonomic. I have narrow shoulders, and straps usually slip off easy. This one stays put. It is also very lightweight (like most of the cotton bags).Second, the style is very nice. It's unique and very compact looking--which is a plus if you are a petite woman like me as most sizable purses look like duffel bags when I carry them. I took a chance on the Rose Garden pattern as it was on sale, and the pictures do not do it justice. It's way prettier and more vibrant in person.Finally, for a compact bag—the Seattle Sling holds A LOT of stuff! Pockets, pockets everywhere! There's even enough room left over for my over-sized wallet and keychain. The strap pocket has plenty of room for my iPhone 4s (which is inside a gigantic Otterbox case).What can I say? I may have found the bag I love for life. I'll probably buy a second one long before this one wears out, because I like it so much.

I bought this to possibly replace a lovely Columbia plush fleece hoodie that is lovely but will be worn out after this winter. It's okay, but not at all comparable. It's not worth the price I paid--even on sale (maybe $15). The fit is correct (I wear small/medium women's clothes and a medium fit okay). The arms are too long if you are petite (I'm 5'2").The material is soft, but because of the type of fleece it is it looks a bit bulky when you put it on. The inside seams are rather thick so it takes away from the comfort. The cut is okay, but not particularly fashionable nor anything I couldn't already buy locally for half the price. While it is warm, it doesn't breath. Fine if it is super cold out, but not a good choice if you are concerned about sweating/acne. Definitely not a good choice if you want to be active in it. Back it goes.

This is a cute decoration and I bought one, but it is NOT worth one hundred dollars!!!!Walgreens carried it for 1/8 the price and while it was fine to pay that much for it, it's sure as heck is not worth as much as it's sold here!!!! The fabric that makes Jack's suit is very cheap and thin. The head is cheap plastic. He will not hang from a door properly as his feet are too long. This means he needs to be hung inside as the only place he should go outside is on a door (he is not very sturdy for weather).

Love, love, LOVE this treat pouch! I have the smaller version (which I also adore), but decided to go to the Pro size because we go through so many treats during flyball class. It's also nice to have the extra space for long walks—especially when I take multiple dogs. I considered a different brand that my dogs' trainers and some of our dog friends use (Doggone Good), but was tickled pink to discover OllyDog offers this Pro Version for less. I looked at them both, I think that while this pouch may hold the same amount of food, it is deeper than Doggone Good. I also prefer the way OllyDog looks (the colors and designs are very vibrant), though they are both great treat pouches when it comes to functionalityThis has many pockets, and the magnetic enclosure is easy to access but snaps right shut to keep treats in and opportunistic dogs out. It is also very stylish and I like the bright colors (fun and very easy to find if I misplace it). It also comes with a belt option and is less expensive than other big brands—even ones that don't come with belts. What a fantstic tool for training! I like it so much I put another color on my wish list in both sizes.

The picture for this wonderful toy does it no justice. It comes with the softest shaggy fur, adorable feet with embroidered toes and pads, and the most soft nose. It is a fairly large bear—yet is still super huggable. The feet are weighted which makes it fun to hug or pose on a shelf or the bed. The eyes are a soft blue with lids—giving it a calm but not goofy appearance. Beautifully put together with so many details from the pads on the feet to the soft greenish muzzle. I found this wonderful bear at Tuesday Morning for over half the price on Amazon. It was a steal, but even at Amazon's current full-price (which is still well below retail) it is worth buying as a gift for a child or an adult teddy bear fan. My daughter loves this little guy, and if she ever bores of him, I'm totally stealing him from her. ;)

They have a very weird taste—almost like chemicals. It's in the cheese flavorings—not the corn part of the snack itself so other flavors may be okay. My daughter wouldn't touch these, though. Such a shame as the dinosaur shapes are really cute and have a great texture (why I added raised it from one to two stars).

Perfect! Purchased for my daughter's ice skating class. I wanted her to have a headband to keep her ears warm, but allow heat out of the top of her head as she will be wearing a helmet at first. These really fit the bill! Given the price and great reputation of TurtleFur it seemed like a no-brainer to buy this set as headbands and hats are too often lost, and this 6-pack cost about as much as 2-3 Turtlefur headbands elsewhere. They are very soft, well-made and will last a while. They fit well on my daughter's head (she is a 5 year old with a slightly larger than average noggin), but can stretch out to snuggly-but-comfortably fit me. I use fleece headbands often for distance running during the winter and can tell these will be great as winter activewear (warm, but sweat-wicking). The colors are great and exactly as pictured. While it says they are for girls, boys can totally wear most (or all) of these, too.
The black one may look okay, but the tortoiseshell is just an ugly printed sticker. Totally a waste of money and time. Either most of these reviews are for the black one or are fake reviews.

These strings have a really decent sound—considering they run $10-15 a set. They are clear, rich, but not twangy--as frequently be the case with steel strings. The color coding is great, too. Makes installation very easy. They are good beginner strings for a child or beginning adult student. Much better than spending $50+ a pop to replace strings every 6 months.

I'm new to ukuleles, but somewhat seasoned with other instruments as I own a couple violins, a djembe, a couple blues harmonicas, and a very nice rosewood soprano recorder. What can I say? It's adorable! It is bright-colored and playful all over—including dolphins behind the pegs.It seems to be sturdy and well-made, too, has nice strong pegs that stay put, and carries the sound well. A very good deal for the sale price I paid of 27 clams.As a few people have said, it'd be wise to invest in some decent strings. Will be replacing ours soon. You can get a good set from just under $5 to $8. Haven't tried the DVD yet (will add to this review when we do), but we're planning to buy a book and a couple extra picks, too. The gig bag and pitch pipe are worthless. The pitch pipe was seriously out of tune and will end up becoming my daughter's plaything for her music drawer. :) The bag is just plastic. So really the only extra that may be worthwhile is the DVD, but even without the DVD the uke is a good deal when it's on sale.Invest $10-15 for a good padded bag and a good electric tuner—or get a tuning App for your smartphone (there are a few good free ones for the iPhone).Overall, I'm actually happy with this little instrument. A unique and playful first ukulele for someone who's a beginner or has a child who might want to learn strings. A nice little purchase. Will update as I learn to play.
Had a very nice smell out of the package, but once it got wet, the smell went away and it became a block of mush.

While I really want to educate my daughter about life and reproduction, I feel this book fell very short. Part of the problem was they tried to fit too much in at once, and over-played humor/cute characters--probably in an attempt to make parents feel more comfortable. To me, it just seemed really dumbed-down--even though the authors used the correct terminology and attempted to include all subjects about reproduction and relationships (almost to a fault).The result is I ended up with a headache trying to read it to my 5 year old.  It's a shame. The illustrations had potential to be decent, but there's just so much squished in it, and too often there are jokes where jokes really shouldn't belong.For instance, the spread on conception was a horrible overly cartoony mess. Strangely, my daughter found the personified sperms and egg were terrifying (which I found amusing but still respected her need to skip it). Even if she wasn't scared of them, I'd probably skip it, though, as I find personified body parts to be the type of thing that can be confusing for younger children. I really don't want my daughter growing up believing sperm and eggs have eyes. :)The only pages we really found useful were the ones that showed the similarities and differences between boys and girls (if only I could white out the stupid bird and bee cartoon characters). The other chapters (the ones on good touch/bad touch and friends) were okay, but really needed to be their own books--and they were also very much cheapened with the bird and bee cartoon characters. Molestation and boundaries are not something that should be joked about like that at all.For reproduction-and only reproduction, I like this book for small children: http://www.amazon.com/How-Babies-Made-Andrew-Andry/dp/B0018JVVPK/ref=sr_1_3?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1405026426&sr=1-3&keywords=how+babies+are+madeIt's harder to find, but even a used version is worth owning.It's doesn't dumb down the subject, but it is not terribly over-descriptive/graphic either. Still looking for a decent one about the similarities/differences boys and girls. For Good/Bad touch types of subject, we like "Your Body Belongs to You.""It's Not the Stork," however, will be returned. I appreciate what the authors are attempting to do, but it just doesn't work for us.

Cheap looking. Horrible off-gassing--even after a week. The smell would stick to my hands. Who knows what this is made out of. It seems pretty toxic and I don't want it touching an instrument that I handle on a regular basis. Into the trash it goes.

They cost a little more than I usually spend on PJs, but were well worth it. They are my favorite pair now. So cute! They are Juniors so I sized up. I'm usually a women's Medium and bought a Large. They shrunk a little in the wash so they now fit very well except they are a bit long on me (I'm 5'2"). So if you are taller, you won't be disappointed. If you petite and don't want to hem them, the bottoms actually look cute rolled and seem to stay put. They are funny, different, hold their color very well in the wash, appear that they are going to be very durable, and are very comfy (but not baggy). They are 100% cotton and very breathable to sleep in (something I look for in PJs). My only complaint is technically the "toads" are frogs, but I knew that buying them. ;) An amphibian is an amphibian. I love them! Will definitely buy Lazy One brand again!

Normally, I'm not too picky about offgassing plastic, but these made me gag out of the package. I also noticed that there were scratches and peeling on the design right away. The paint/dye doesn't look like it's bonded well with the plastic. Those issues aside, they'd probably look good on a narrow-to-normal foot (I have wide feet and the edges of my feet overlapped a little), and they seemed comfortable for the very brief time I had them on. But back they go! Too stinky and I don't trust the design to stay on. Too bad, because the designs are very pretty and the shape of the shoe is nice (aside from being a little narrow).

These are okay. It's wonderful they are made from recycled material and are environmentally-friendly, and the colors are nice. That said, I'd never ever choose to pay retail price for them—and even for the clearanced price I am sending them back. I have had $5 drug store flip flops that fit more comfy. I sized 1/2 a size up, and I'm glad I did. They fit small. The heel is very narrow, and I feel like the back of my foot slips off. They are also very thin so there is no support of any kind.

Aaaaarg! It's a dog--not a baby!!!! And while I'm a firm-believer in great baby carriers, I wouldn't even use an outward facing carrier like this on a baby (dangling legs are bad for their hips and it's bad for their brains not to be able to turn away when they are overstimulated or afraid). Too many people treat little dogs as babies instead of canines--a big reason a lot of them end up on Craigslist and the shelter. But I digress.This product is not good for our canine companions. It is especially bad for small dogs--including ones who are shy (and many small dogs are). It doesn't allow them to retreat if someone approaches them (and *lots* of people want to approach cute toy breeds--including those who have no clue or care about your pup's personal space). Also, a dog will not be able to use body language. This is bad because it can lead to fear-biting.And not only unhealthy for socialization, but it's unhealthy for a dog's skeletal system. Dogs are not built to be carried around vertically like humans are. You run the risk of compressing the spine--and as reviewers have mentioned this puts pressure on the neck--which is extra bad for littles dogs as it can lead to collapsed tracheas. Another issue is over-heating. Unlike human babies, dogs do not sweat through most of their body and are covered with fur. They are much more prone to overheating and a lot less likely to show it as animals hide feeling ill.Instead of buying a "cutesy" gimmick product like this, find a good harness for your little pup and invest in good positive training classes. Positive training classes are truly the best way to bond with your little pup, and both you and your furry love will be happier (and healthier) in the long-run.Grew up with 20 dogs. Have had 5 great dogs in our family--including 3 pomeranians (two of whom were 7 or less pounds).

Very surprised by these reviews. Wondering how many of them are actually from people who have owned Moving Comfort bras. Or perhaps the quality has drastically changed?The design of this item is maybe a little like Moving Comfort (like the velcro bra straps), but the quality is not comparable. It's made from very cheap itchy nylon-like material. There is also no way it's properly a high-impact bra as it's very stretchy like a swimsuit. Maybe appropriate for a yoga class--NOT for running or aerobic activities of any kind.Go buy the real thing on sale. It may be more expensive, but is totally worthwhile compared to wasting money on something that is of extreme low-quality like this.

Super awesome sweater! Very well-made and cute, but make sure you either try one out from Chilly Dogs locally or order from a place that has free returns. These tend to be sized very small (go up one—preferably two—sizes to be safe). We have a 11 pound pom/sheltie mix who ended up in a medium after we went through a couple exchanges from a local store.  He is very long and fluffy so these are things to take into account.I bought this sweater in an extra large for our 31 pound 9-month old Whippet-lab mix. He tends to be tall and broad-chested for his size (IOW - he's easily mistakable for a 40+ pound dog) and will be growing a little more so I sized up even beyond what I thought would fit him. It fits him very nicely and will still look great if he puts on 5-10 pounds. Because they have no sleeves and are very high cut on the bottom (perfect for male dogs) you can't go wrong getting one that's a bit bigger.It's a great sweater otherwise. Nice, soft, and thick. Definitely wash it in cold and delicate (if not hand-wash) as the red will probably bleed. The hoodie is adorable, and Chilly Dogs are probably the only pet apparel I've had that actually have hoodies that stay on the dogs' heads. It's also very comfortable for our dogs. The seams are nice and thin (though still well-sewn), and the wool isn't scratchy—even to me (I'm a little sensitive to wool). This one has a cute design on it. Definitely a must for any fan of monkeys or sock monkeys. A nice comfy way to take goofy dog pictures that is well-made enough to actually be useable and enjoyable for the dog during a cold winter walk.

When I first saw this coloring book, I knew that I had to buy it as a surprise gift for my adult daughter.  She really loves fashion and is now enjoying adult coloring books.  Once, I gave it to her, she was extremely pleased with all the pretty designs inside.  I really like Majorie Sarnat designs (as I have her Owls and Cats for my own use) so I knew the quality of the artist's work to be superior.  All 35 designs are a mix of trendy today fashions and look like they would be a joy to color.

My human servant purchased this for me. I guess he thought that I needed to mellow out a bit. The vet told him that the diffuser was being changed, new diffusers would not be available until the end of this year and they would not be compatible with the old ones. So he purchase this batch to last through the end of the year.I am snotty the cat and I approve this review.

This is a very interesting anthology of over 100 different artists work in one coloring book.  The designs and themes are varied with all sorts of types of subject matter and artistic styles.  Some are will be fairly easy to color while others appear to be complex.  I like the book because it is so different from any other coloring book that I have seen.  On the back of each page is the name of the artist and their website.

"The Time Garden" is a beautiful and unique (to me, at least) adult coloring book. This book is the story of a little girl and her journey through a clock integrated into an intricately designed coloring book.  The words of the story are intermingled with the designs but don't distract from them.  What is really fun about this book is that you get to color the story as you go through the book and you can make the story what you see of it by the way color the pages.

This is my third book by Miryam Adatto and each one has been a joy to color.  I like this book because of the abstract and wild floral and garden designs that she brings to life on the page.  I especially like being able to add my sense of color to the designs and either make them wilder or tone them down depending on my mood.  As with her other books, each page is unusual and inspiring when I am coloring the design.  It makes for a really great way to relieve stress at the end of the day because I can go wild with each pattern and color I choose.  Creative Haven books are an excellent value and are among my favorites.  The book contains 31 surrealistic designs printed on one side of each page with perforations to make removal easier.

I really like all of Marty Noble's adult coloring books.  This one is especially pretty because of all the flowing and elegant lines in the each of fashion designs.  It's also a bit on the edgy side due to the Steampunk theme.  I really like the genre in books and am happy to see another adult coloring book that explores Steampunk. There are 31 designs in the book and as with all Creative Haven books, the paper quality is excellent, the pages are perforated and the designs are printed on one side with the back side left blank. I plan to use a variety of different coloring techniques because of all the fun and wild designs in this book.

This is the beginning of a series that I really enjoy.  It tells how the postal detectives in the Dead Letter office get together and start solving the cases behind various missing letters that arrive in their office.  Oliver heads the group and is a man whose faith is very strong and is evident to all those who know him.  Norman is the quiet and nerdy guy who is unexpectedly filled with common sense from time to time.  Rita is a brilliant young woman who has the ability to remember anything she has ever read.  She can tell you the town associated with any zip code in the blink of an eye.  Shane is the woman who is accidentally transferred into the group.  She is a techie and spends a lot of the show trying to figure her way back out into the real world instead of being stuck in the dead letter office.  I really like the show and the cast.  I have watched every show so far and plan to watch anymore that come out in the future. It is a great family movie series.

I've never had a coloring book where the background is pre-filled in black.  It is a really interesting concept and should save me a lot of time in coloring.  The book includes 31 flower designs with a lot of hearts included and each perforated page is printed on only one side.  Because the background is black, it is fun to use really vivid, bold colors to create a midnight garden that I can actually see.  I am enjoying this a lot and hope that Creative Haven makes more of these books with the reverse background.

Having grown up in north eastern states I have spent many years hiking, camping and canoeing in the woods and nearby lakes and rivers. These are some of the best memories I have. This book of beautiful designs reminds me of those days and some of the animals I have seen on those adventures. Many of these designs are intricate and very fun to color. I am enjoying coloring and reminiscing about those fun times.

Bird watching is a fun part-time hobby that I have enjoyed most of my life.  This book has many different artistically designed bird scenes of all sorts.  Many of the birds will be very detailed and I am enjoying coloring each of the designs.  I like the stylized technique the artist uses and to me these birds need to colored in bold bright colors. I enjoy combining both coloring and birding and this is the perfect book for that.

All of the designs in this book remind me of flowing water and calming imagery.  Some of them look almost mathematical in their design.  Some of the designs are really complex while others are less so.  I plan to color these with a lot of bold colors because I think the designs inspire that in me.

This book is interesting because it is different from others I have.  Those have black ink on white while this one uses multiple colors on each design to drawn out the pattern and inspire me to coordinate or contrast against what they have printed.
The 31 designs in this book are all kind of cute.  They remind me of sweaters I have seen (or even had) in the past.  Some are more complex than others but they are all crazy fun designs.

I love that I got my human to cough up the big bucks and buy me this tree.  It is very high quality and made in the USA. I average about 10 to 15 hours of sleep a day on it, when I am not sleeping on my human servants lap or eating.

The designs in this book are really interesting.  I can imagine that I am outside amongst the wildlife while I am coloring these pages. I like all 28 designs and especially because they are all printed on one side and have fun hidden objects to look for.  This book is especially great for relieving stress after a long day of work.

This coloring book puts me in the Christmas spirit.  There are 31 design and some are traditional and some are more fun and abstract. I'm really enjoying coloring these pictures.  Since they are one-sided it is easy to remove them to share.

This book has 28 different and very interesting designs. Each one is a random doodle and includes a number of different hidden designs in each one. Each design is printed on one side of the page and there are perforations so the pages can be removed.I am going to have a lot of fun coloring this book and relieving stress.

This is a nice sorter but the yellow lid is off the container more often than it is on.  It doesn't encourage our grandson to put the shapes through the lid but rather just in and out of the container.  There are other sorters that don't come apart as easily which I would probably buy today.  The sorter is nice but doesn't do all that I hoped it would.

We have used this on our Whirlpool front loader since we bought it 2.5 years ago.  This, along with leaving the door open to let the drum dry out between uses, appears to have kept away any hint of mold or mildew.  We use this every two months or so and that seems to do the trick.

This is yet another great book in the series by Leslie Patricelli (though my favorite so far is Huggy Kissy).  My grandson is starting to get interested in eating so it is a good time to show him what is yummy and what is yucky - but really too much ice cream?  Can it ever be yucky?  Very cute book with fun illustrations.

I read this book when it first came out (2001, the same year I moved to Cathedral City) and I enjoyed the read.  I sold my copy at a garage sale shortly thereafter, and recently I thought it might be fun to read again, so I did a search, and found one for sale by a private seller in Colorado.  I bought the book, and when it arrived, it was a little spooky to find my original garage sale price tag sticker still on the front of the book (cue Twilight Zone music).  Anyway, I read it again, and enjoyed it probably a little more than the first time, because some of the landmarks in the book are more familiar to me now (as well as some of the events, like the new civic center and the tearing down of much of the lower Cove with invocation of eminent domain).  I know some original reviewers compared this book to the incredible Tales of the City; as an original HUGE fan of that serial and later Armisted Maupin's string of books, I think the comparison is overly kind, but then, aside from this book's easy-flowing, easy-to-read style I don't think that's what the author of Cathedral City was going for.  Note: I also remember there was a sequel, but the only thing I remember about it was that it wasn't as enjoyable to me as the original book.

I first moved to Cathedral City in 2001, but I have been visiting the Palm Springs/Cathedral City area for about 45 years, so I've seen a LOT of changes. Mr. Hillery clearly spent a long, long time and a lot of effort putting this little book together, and for a tiny little town like CC, I'm certain there's not a lot of historical information to pull from; clearly much of his content was gleaned from photos and stories he worked very hard to compile.  The book is dry, without a bunch of superlatives, reading more like minutes from town meetings than a history book, but it's full of little bits and pieces of homey information that are fun for someone who has been around for a while.  A few maps showing some of the locations he refers to would have been helpful; when he refers to certain locations and buildings, I'm not always sure where they fit in.  Mr. Hillery makes it clear that his book ends in 1981 when the city was incorporated; what would be really nice is if he or someone else were to continue on from 1981 to the present.  Cathedral City has a really interesting more recent past, and it would be fun to read more about the buildings, companies, people and politics that have gone into making it what it was in 1981 to what it is today.  Well done job by an author with passion.

Bought this as a gift for my boss, who spends a month each year in Italy.  It arrived very safely packaged with the promised documentation of authenticity and several other pieces of information.  The piece was in perfect condition, exactly as advertised, and this company's website is full of fun stuff...I'm sure I'll be back for more.  My boss loved his gift, and is planning a trip to the framing store.  These lithographs (various subjects) are a great gift idea for someone who's really hard to buy for, as well as a stylish and unique accessory for your own home or office.  Be sure to pay close attention to sizes, though.  Note: Some of the pieces I looked at were very small (e.g., 4" x 5").  If I had ordered them without noticing that, I would have assumed them to be 9" x 12" or similar.  The company's website is very accurate, but you do have to read the descriptions.

Kind of amazing how easy and how well this thing works.  So far we've made a number of recipes from the slim recipe book that comes with it, and everything has turned out really well.  Nicely made, feels like it will last a long time, though with all of its newfangled electronic sensors and settings, only time will tell.  Easy to clean.  Our favorite so far is to cut a pork loin roast or thick chuck roast into 3-4 pieces, pour a big can of enchilada sauce (green for pork, red for beef) over the meat, and hit the 'meat/stew' button.  It automatically comes on and cooks for 30 minutes, and it's delicious.  Dump it in a tortilla, pour some of the sauce over it, a little cheese, and BAM!  Easy and delicious.  The old crock pot is heading for the next garage sale...this one's a keeper.  Very happy with this purchase.

Had this about a month and so far, very happy with it.  I bought it to replace a Cuisinart model of the same basic type, and I must say I was bowled over when I unpacked this and found the burr part (the section that screws down into the base) was EXACTLY the same as the Cuisinart.  EXACTLY...the heads were interchangeable with the bases.  Which worries me a bit, since it was somewhere in the gearing that the Cuisinart burned up after being used just a couple of times a week for 4-5 years.  I'm going to keep my fingers crossed that this one lasts longer.  But on to the good stuff:  for those who hate the way the ground coffee chamber gets static electricity and you end up with ground coffee all over the counter, the chamber here is smoother (or something) and the problem is probably 10% of what it was with the Cuisinart.  Also, I love the way the ground coffee chamber slides into place with a satisfying little click, as opposed to the Cuisinart, which had to be kind of finessed in and never felt really nice.  I know, weird, but sometimes it's those little indefinable things that make a difference.  And third, I love how this unit can be turned off simply by pushing the power button again.  Say you want to make a slightly stronger pot of coffee.  You can run the setting you have it set for, and then when it shuts off, turn it on for another 10 seconds (for example) and then hit the button again to turn it off.  On the Cuisinart, you had to slide the cups setting all the way to the left, and then pray you put it back in the right place when you wanted to run it again.  I'm very happy with this unit.

They came on time, simply packaged, and exactly as advertised.  They're lightweight but appear to be made well, with the tang going through the handle, unlike the cheaper pairs where the handle tends to break if you try to cut something thick like heavy cardboard.  Check around; I've seen the same set at Costco for less, but they're definitely worth the price here.

Emily West has been on the verge of big-time success for years.  I first saw her when she performed her song, 'Blue Sky' on an early season of The Apprentice.  Bought the song and then never heard anything about her for a long time, but she resurfaced on America's Got Talent where she placed second, and I knew she was here to stay. She's got a bunch of YouTube videos, and she's got one of the most beautiful voices around; her style brings very fond memories of another favorite singer, Jane Olivor.  I also love her 1940s movie star glamor, and the stylish way she carries herself.  This album really showcases her voice, and I really hope her star continues to rise.

Works beautifully.  Have used the larger bricks available in pool stores and other places, but once their corners wear down, they're difficult to use in a sink or toilet.  The shape and size of these makes them ideal for any porcelain fixture.  The four-pack is perfect for us...one under the sink in each bathroom, and an extra one to spare.  Note: I've never tried using this on those plastic one-piece tubs, and I don't think it would be a good idea; even if they got spots and hard water buildup out, they'd scratch the finish and it would stain even easier.  And check around for price; you can sometimes find these at the dollar store.

Found this completely by chance, and it sounded interesting.  Tom Hardy is a personal favorite, and though this film can't possibly be for everyone, it sure was a rollicking ride for me.  Violent, but in kind of a classy Baz Luhrmann way.

Works exactly as advertised.  A nice solid stainless steel metal bowl which does slow down the Lab, though not by a huge amount.  Nice rubber mat affixed to the bottom so if you use this on the floor it won't scoot around (we set this bowl inside the other bowl which fits into an off-the-ground stand, so sliding around isn't an issue).

Just needed this to pair with a Sony monitor used with our computer in our conference room at work.  We only needed it to control the power to the monitor, so this review only applies to that.  It was super easy to pair with the monitor, and it works perfectly for our needs.  What a great price, and though we haven't tried the other functions of this inexpensive little remote, it's certainly worth the $6 we paid for it.

Perfect for my needs.  I bought two of these for the check-in counters in two of our medical clinics for patient satisfaction surveys.  Know that these are made of very lightweight metal (one corner of one of the boxes I received was bent from shipping, but I easily bent it back).  If just left to stand on a counter they are easily moved around (and carried away, if someone wanted to). But for our needs, they're just fine. They come with screws to mount to a wall if desired (we didn't), and the lockable front door is a nice touch, though again, the box provides absolutely no security, so don't think of using it for a dropbox for carkeys or money.  That being said, a standard piece of 8-1/2 x 11 paper, folded in half, fits easily into the slot, as would 4x6 cards and similar, and we're very happy with these boxes for our purpose.

I needed a long runner for the area between my kitchen and dining room to protect the threshold where the linoleum meets the carpet. I found this runner for a very fair price.  I had a very difficult time comparing colors, because each runner from this company (House, Home and More) is a separate Amazon page, so it's literally impossible to compare colors side-by-side as you can for, say, a pair of slacks.  I ordered this runner, and when it was received (very timely, I might add), the color was far too light.  I sent the manufacturer an email asking why their products don't make it easier to compare colors, and DeeDee, their representative, emailed me immediately, explaining that when they began selling on Amazon, a company could only show variations of one option, either size OR color.  She went on to say that if I was unhappy with the runner, I could return it for full credit, and order another color more to my liking.  SHE ALSO, WITHOUT ASKING, INCLUDED A MATERIAL RETURN AUTHORIZATION, ready to be printed.  Amazing service!  I have packaged up the runner for return, and I've already ordered a different runner in a more suitable color (and 2 feet longer).  I can't speak to how durable these runners are (though other reviewers have noted they hold up very well) but I can say that the quality, weight and appearance of the runner was very very good, and I'm looking forward to receiving the new one in the new color.  I'm frequently surprised by exceptional customer service from Amazon sellers, and DeeDee from House, Home and More has impressed me a whole lot.

It's difficult to buy things like t-shirts online unless you become familiar with a particular company, because sizing and the amount of shrinkage varies from manufacturer to manufacturer.  I bought this as a gift for someone who likes large t-shirts that hold up well.  This one is a heavyweight cotton, similar to a polo shirt, rather than a thinner t-shirt weight I'm used to.  I ordered XXL and it truly is XXL; what's more, it didn't shrink at all, so it's STILL XXL.  :)  Though if I were to buy it again for the same person I would go a size smaller, I certainly think the shirt lived up to its promises.  Good quality, good service. Feels like it will last a very long time.

This is a good little vacuum.  Haven't had it more than a couple of months, so don't know yet about battery life, but so far it's been a really good unit; lightweight, well-made, and versatile with the on/off brush, which not only saves on battery when you don't need it, but makes use on both floors and carpet much easier.  Another bonus to the on/off carpet brush is being able to turn the brush off to vacuum throw rugs, which often will be snagged and the yarn pulled out when cleaned with vacuums with a rotating carpet brush.  Another plus is that it comes with its own stand; many of this style do not.  A negative is that you must remove the handheld 'dust buster' style part of the vacuum to empty the dirt cup, but definitely not a deal breaker.  The price compares with similar units at both Costco and BBB, but this one is the higher voltage (14.4) with the stand; the units I checked at the other two places did not.

Works perfectly. Received timely and in original packaging.  If you're replacing your Moen single-lever faucet cartridge, this part is a must (either the original one you removed or a replacement) or your shower knob will just spin all the way around rather than stopping at full hot and full cold.  (This piece doesn't wear out, but a replacement piece is nice if your old one has become corroded or just dingy.)

First of all, I'm a baby boomer, so my most formative years were spent listening to the music featured here.  I had the pleasure of seeing this documentary about 3 years ago at a live screening in Indian Wells, California during the fundraising leg of the journey, where several of the musicians from the 'Wrecking Crew' group toured around the country previewing the film and then hosting a Q/A and autograph session afterward.  For the last 3 years, I've been waiting for these guys to reach their goal of bringing this film to public release and DVD; I've been checking their website monthly to follow their progress, and now I'm thrilled beyond words that I will be able to order a copy for myself as well as copies for a number of friends who also grew up on this music.  The reason for the fundraising drive and the delay in release was due to the huge expense of buying the rights to every single music clip in the film (and there are LOTS of them).  As music can do, the clips of each song brought back very specific memories of my life.  What a great ride this is, to learn how so many of those songs came about.  This documentary is a genuine treat, and will bring a newfound insight and respect for the music we grew up with.As an aside, and in agreement with the other (first) reviewer, I don't understand why Carol Kaye so clearly has a vendetta against the film, which gives her the credit she deserves for her very substantial part in the creation of some of the most memorable songs of the time.  (If you aren't sure what I'm referring to, hunt around a bit on Amazon and you'll see her many, many comments and responses to posts regarding this film.)
Works great, far better than my older Sharper Image model.  Very happy so far.  Isn't any louder than any other model I've seen.  What is that about, anyway?  :)

This shirt cracks me up every time I think about what it says.  I bought it for a friend who is a huge AC/DC fan (he has their pinball machine).  He's a pretty big guy and wears X-Large t-shirts all the time, but this shirt ran a little small and shrank a fair amount with one cleaning.  I should have purchased an XXL.

Our Labs go through periods where one or both of their ears get pretty nasty and cause them to scratch intensely.  This product is one of several we've tried, and the Virbac is the best we've found.  Not only is it effective at cleaning out the black gooey crud that seems to just appear spontaneously; it doesn't have a strong, offensive chemical smell like some of the similar products; it also clearly doesn't cause pain.  I just reach for the bottle and the guys sit patiently and wait for me to use it.  Here's how I do it:  Shake the bottle well, lift up his ear and squirt a tablespoon or so into the ear, then rub to get the Virback into the bottom of the ear.  Then I use gauze pads to wipe it out (and that's where I can tell how well it's working).  Some instructions say to let the dog just shake his head to shake the stuff out, but I like to wipe it out so I can see the result of the medication and gauge how clean the ear is.

I always try to make sure I've got Krew Comb in my bathroom cupboard for when I'm wearing my hair short (crew-cut or flat-top style).  There are periods I totally get away from those styles and wear my hair longer, so I can tell you the stuff doesn't go bad; the last tub I bought was probably about 6 years ago, and I recall I had to buy it from a beauty supply place, so glad it's available here on Amazon.  For those who've never used it, it's a pink paste, about the color of Pepto Bismol and the consistency of a paste car wax.  I put a small bit (about the size of a pea) in my hands and rub them together, then run my hands through my hair.  Krew Comb doesn't dry like a gel, it's dense and makes the hair kind of stiff but still flexible. It's ideal for making a flat top or crew cut stand up, and lends itself well to the 'bed head' look. You can brush it if you wish, but I can't imagine trying to get a comb through it.  It's scentless and washes out with shampoo pretty easily, but without shampooing it can build up in your hair.  I wouldn't recommend it for use with long hair, but for short styles that don't need movement, it's great.

Fit perfectly in an unused doorway in my kitchen; have all my pots and pans out now, no more rummaging through cupboards for pans and their companion lids.  Went together exactly as designed, well-made and finished.

Bought this as a gift for one of the doctors I work with, but I cheated and read it first.  Very enjoyable, short (1-2 page) chapters. Clever and thought-provoking at the same time. The perfect bathroom reader.
Came beautifully and safely packed, and went up very easily.  It's gorgeous, really nice quality and very sharp design.  Highly recommended.

I bought two of these carts with the intention of stacking them extra tall (by adding 4 of the 18" legs from the second cart) so I could stack two microwave ovens in our breakroom.  Once the carts were received (quickly and well-packaged), I realized this wouldn't work, as the leg pieces aren't threaded at both ends, so I had no way to extend the length.  Plan B:  Buy the separate item, a set of four 36" Alera legs...which I did.  These arrived, and luckily, they ARE threaded at both ends, so I made 54" legs by connecting the new 36" legs with 4 of the 18" legs from the original cart...perfect.  But now comes the reason for my review (and for the 3-star rating).  As other reviewers have noted, the trays on this cart are upside down from every other 'metro'-style wire rack system I've ever owned, which is a fair number of them.  On this particular cart, it's an especially important issue, because when I put the cart together with the microwaves on the shelves, the doors don't open (because the microwave sits down in the 1" recessed shelves, rather than on top of them).  And no, you can't install the shelves upside down because the corner holes where the poles go through are tapered to be larger at the bottom (a necessary design...the tapered shape keeps the two-piece plastic shelf brackets in place, which give it the strength this type of shelving is noted for).  Yes, I knew this was the design, from reading a number of the other reviews which noted the same issue.  But since this is the only cart which otherwise met my needs, I went ahead anyway.  So now, I have a great 54" tall rack with 3 shelves, and I've addressed the sunken shelf issue by having some 3/4" wood shelving cut to fit in the bottom of each of the two shelves; now the microwaves fit nearly flush, and the microwave doors will open without dragging.  Not very elegant, but it works.  Now yes, the reviews (and the photos) showed the shelves mount upside down from every other shelf of this style, and I bought it anyway, because it's the only shelf with these dimensions I could find, but I've given it 3 stars instead of 5 stars because I see the upside-down shelves as a design flaw. I hope Alera takes a look at this issue and corrects their design...it would actually be worth it to me to buy another cart if the shelves were of the more standard design.

We've tried a lot of methods for getting our wild 3-year old yellow lab to 'rein it in' a little when walking him.  I'm happy to say that this product actually does the job it claims to do, and Buddy didn't even fight it when we put it on him as many reviewers (and the instructions) warn may happen.  I'm very impressed so far with this head collar; it appears to be comfortable and it certainly has me enjoying our walks a lot more than with any other product.

I purchased these legs to go with the Alera 'Wire shelving 3-tier rolling cart in black anthracite' microwave cart.  I wanted to expand its height and stack two matching microwave ovens for our break room.  (I first bought two of the carts, thinking I could combine the legs together to make one taller cart, but the legs that come with the carts, formed from two 18" legs which screw together, aren't threaded at the top ends so I was unable to add a third 18" length).  I purchased this set of 36" legs on faith, since the vendor I emailed couldn't confirm these were threaded at both ends, but when they arrived today, I was happy to see that they ARE threaded at both ends, and also come complete with the double-male threaded couplers as well as black rubber caps for the tops, and both leveling feet and heavy duty rubber casters for the bottoms (use whichever you prefer).  Two of the casters lock.  Note that these legs are regular matte-finish black, whereas the microwave carts are something called 'Anthracite', which is a two-toned black and gunmetal gray slightly bumpy finish, but when the two finishes are screwed together, not bad looking.  I'm now good to go with 54" tall legs with casters, and my extra-tall stacking microwave ovens rack is exactly what I was looking for.

I bought this extended length shoehorn for use in our neurology clinic; it makes it much easier for our patients to put their shoes back on after their exams.  Good quality, nice weight and well-finished.

Update 1-2-15Because of the issues I note in my review (below) I requested a return authorization, which Amazon forwarded to the company providing the juicer.  I must say that though my personal concerns kept me from loving (and keeping) the juicer, the company's response to my concerns was quick, respectful and very impressive.  After making a few suggestions for adjusting the juicer (which I tried), I replied that I still would prefer to return the juicer for credit.  With no further delay, they processed my credit.  I am very impressed with the seller, and would certainly recommend them if this juicer (or any other product they sell) fits your needs.  Good customer service these days warrants a "WOW!".---------------------------------------------Just received this today.  I really wanted to like it more than I do. It has the heavy, industrial look and feel that appears it will perform well and last forever. After squeezing a dozen or so Palm Springs ruby red grapefruit, here's my first-day's review.The good:1.  It does a good job of squeezing all the juice out of these grapefruit.  It lets a lot of the pulp through, where the description says it eliminates pulp and seeds.  (I like pulp, so for me that's a plus, but if you don't like pulp, this might be a negative.)2.  A full-sized grapefruit (cut in half) fits into the hopper, unlike many of the others I checked out on Amazon, most of which noted you would probably have to quarter grapefruit to make them fit.  Grapefruit juicing is one of the things I require in a juicer.3.  Very easy to clean.4.  The rubber feet seem to be protective; no exposed metal to scratch your countertop.5.  A standard 2-cup Pyrex glass measuring cup fits under the spout. Not sure why some other reviewers complain that it only has room for tiny cups.The bad:1.  It's terribly awkward (and I think a little dangerous) to use.  As you bring the lever down with the necessary pressure/weight on it, the juicer tips forward.  The only body mechanics you can use to avoid this is to hold down on the back of the machine while at the same time pressing the handle down.  I'm a pretty big guy, and this ended up being really exhausting after the 12th grapefruit.2.  The end of the handle is not rubberized, it's the same cast iron as the rest of the handle, which is very uncomfortable on the hand.3.  The cone that comes down over the fruit to press it onto the strainer started out centered, but as I used the juicer, the mechanism shifted or torqued somehow so that after the first 6 fruits or so, I had to press it in to align toward the center as I brought the lever down; otherwise, the top piece (the part over the fruit) hit the side of the chamber on the way down.  I used the included allen wrenches to make sure all the fittings were tight, but that didn't help.Considering those three negatives (and the fact I think it's an accident waiting to happen with its tipping-forward issue), I'm not impressed with this juicer and I'm going to return it.Regarding shipping and packaging, its box was squashed in the center, but the juicer itself was fine, protected at each end by styrofoam packing.

Bought these as a Christmas gift for my boss, a very snappy dresser who occasionally sports shirts with French cuffs.  These cuff links are handsome, appear to be well-made, and arrived timely in the expected velvet-covered jewelry box emblazoned with  'Cuff Daddy' on the satin liner.  The cuff links are exactly as described, a nice gun-metal gray finish with inlaid mother-of-pearl strips.  Recommended.

Excellent price and quality.  I get claustraphobic in a sleeping bag, so this is ideal.  I have two now so i can double them up when its colder.  One is plenty for summer camping, but when it dipped into the 50's i found myself becoming a heat leech off my camp mates.  So i got a second one.Great smooth fabric, feels nice on the skin, slides over clothes well, lightweight and warm, but seems to be breathable.I can't recommend this enough.  Would be perfect for kids for sleepovers, for the car, to take to events, packs small, its great.Cons: If it's cold you do have to keep your feet tucked which can be a challenge.  The newer model of this has elastic around the bottom so you can tuck it around the bottom of your sleeping pad.  Great idea.  I, however, was cheap and got this one because its half the price, so i must remain vigilant about keeping the toes tucked.I'm 5'6" and when it's cold enough the you must keep the toes tucked, this is just long enough for me, so if you're like 6" you may not want to use this  by itself for cold weather.

If you loved the other books in this series, don't read this one.  It's disappointing.  Not what you want to read.  Too much time had passed and the writer lost her feel for the characters.  They don't seem like the same people.  When i read it I couldn't even imagine the same people in these roles.  I got almost halfway through propelled only by my desire to like this one because I liked the other books in the series.  You're better off just re-reading the other books.
Not comfortable.  Fun for the novelty, but that's all.

This is a very nice comb.  Solid wood, and beautiful.  Each one is different.  I know this because after i got one, I needed more so i could have one in my travel bag and one in my car.  No static.  I use this instead of a brush because i have wavy/curly fine hair, but not curly enough to use a pick.  It helps me avoid the frizzies.Perfect comb for men or women.  Anyone who wants a nice wide tooth comb.
Perfect.  Works just the same as apple brand.
These work perfectly.  Heavy duty cables.

Nice dual usb charger.  Works well.  I like that it doesn't have a light on it like some of these do.  I got a quad charger that had a bright blue light on it that lights up my room at night.  Charging seems to be just as fast as single chargers.
Very nice quality.  Smooth rubbery palms, not textured like some.
Very nice chair.  I use it in my booth at art fairs.  Comfortable, sturdy. and high quality.

I've used it once.  The table top is designed to be removed completely for take down, and one of the little clamps to attach the top to the base has broken.  It'll still work with just three, but the little clamp was made of cheap brittle plastic.  I'm not even sure when it broke.That said, it's inexpensive and lightweight and pretty decent considering.  Was still bummed about the clamp breaking after one use, but I'll still use it for years I'm sure.

Lovely and festive, highly recommended.  Would be apropos at an elegant event or a children's party.  Received many compliments on them.  They take a while to unfold and fluff, so leave yourself enough time and recruit help if you plan to use a lot of them.
Works perfectly at a fraction of the price of the Canon brand.  I've used thee for years.  Highly recommended.

Lovely and festive, highly recommended.  Would be apropos at an elegant event or a children's party.  Received many compliments on them.  They take a while to unfold and fluff, so leave yourself enough time and recruit help if you plan to use a lot of them.
Works perfectly at a fraction of the price of the Canon brand.  I've used thee for years.  Highly recommended.
Great balls.  Hard to find squash balls.  Plus, as a female, I had no balls before so getting these was very helpful.  Thanks Amazon, for having everything!

This is a great device.  Use it to watch on your tv anything you can bring up on the google chrome web browser.  Use it to watch you tube and vevo and netflix and hbo and a variety of other things.  Control it from your phone or tablet or computer.  A great way to modernize your (or your smart phone literate parents) tv.  Also good for making your semi-smart tv a fully smart tv.Easy to use, easy to set up, just plug into your tv's hdmi port (also has to be plugged into a power source with the ac adapter unless your tv has a power providing hdmi port which most lack).Great for travel too.  Just plug it in and show movies to your friends and boring relatives.  Use at hotels.  Fun for amazing folks who have no understanding of technology.  ("But where's the movie coming from?")The one flaw, which I think google will fix eventually, is that you can accidentally (or purposely) log on to other chrome casts.  So if you have several of them in your house you can change other people's movies while they're watching.  (Was I ever annoyed when my roommate turned off the game of thrones season finale) You can also do the same to your neighbors.  But google is smart and the google cast gets operating system updates.

Well designed, well balanced, sturdy comfortable handle, easy to clean.  Perfect hole size, your noodles won't escape.  I liked it so much I bought it in two sizes and got rid of my other colanders.  Will last a lifetime.
Better quality than expected.  Awesome looking
Works perfectly, excellent quality, more sturdy than some, plus nice colors.  You'll be pleased.
Yup, it's a desk calendar.  All you expect.

Excellent sound quality, especially for such low priced headphones.  Plus they're lightweight and double as a headset for talking on the phone.  I love the fabric insulated cord, rarely tangles.  I have two pair.

I have two decks on my house and bought one of these to try it out, with the intent of buying a second one if the first one worked well.  I won't be buying a second one, but I'll keep using this one.During the day with no breeze this works pretty well.  However, at night when the bugs can see light in the house they find ways around the screen and get in.  If there's a strong breeze the screen curtain can billow some.  Easy to install and easily taken down and put back up.  My cat eventually figured out how to use it but then kept leaving it open.  The magnets self seal after a walk through about 1/2 the time.A fine choice for when a screen door isn't a practical option, but not an equal replacement.

They're long, cheap, and plentful; so they fit the bill.  However they're weak where the cord joins the plug, so like many iphone cables, eventually the wire will come away from the plug and the cord will quit.  However, at this price it's forgivable.

Durable, well designed hard drive, just plug in and its ready to use.  If you have a smart tv with a media interface you can plug this right into your tv and watch movies or listen to music or view pictures.  Comes with 2 usb cables, one short one that tucks into the side of the hard drive so it's always with you, very handy.  Highly recommended, trouble free drive.  Very impressed.
Reasonably priced high quality sturdy cable.  I'm using it to charge several different devices including battery packs and a samsung galaxy note 8, works well for all.  Very pleased.

Broke by the volume buttons after 24 hours.  Thinner than the ones i usually get.  To be fair, you should know I break my cases every few months.  However, they usually break from repeated droppings, this one was never dropped.  I didn't have a chance to drop it!

Great price, nice quality, highly recommended.  I've been a full time professional jeweler since 2000 and I'm picky about my display materials.  These look good, and are high quality.  I wish they offered a larger size, but these will do the job.
Cats love these way more than any other catnip toy I've ever seen.  You will be amazed at your cat's reaction.

While these work they're great, but I came on here today because my 3rd pair has just died.  Interestingly enough, the last reviewer said exactly the same thing I was going to say.  After a little over a year of use these things crap out.  The company has a 1 year warranty.  This time the tip of the plug fell off.  I've never seen that happen before.  Usually I just start losing sound to one ear, but last night the plug fell apart.  I could just barely remove it from my headphone jack.This really sucks because while they work they are really great headphones.  Lightweight, comfy, foldable, great sound quality, double as a phone headset, they stay on without being tight.  Now I have nothing to use while I workout!  I'm going to try to get the company to replace them, but I doubt I'll have any luck.
No one is ever disappointed when they receive this thing as a gift.  I just keep giving them out as Christmas gifts.

I bought this book because it got such great reviews, but the style just isn't for me.  Hard to explain, the style is very attractively done with nice drawings, but I'm here to learn constellations and this book goes on and on about other things.  Artistic though it is, it just isn't giving me the cold hard star formations I want.  It does have many other interesting points, would be good for sharing with children interested in the stars.  ore fanciful than most star books.

I'm 31 but my hair is still baby fine and tangles easily.  I can't use very many shampoos, they're all too harsh, but this is more gentle than baby shampoo.  It smells better, it doesn't leave my hair all tangly or dry it out.  It's priceier than some but it's a good sized bottle and you only need a single squirt to wash your hair.  A very good gentle body wash, too.  I'd recommend it to anyone who likes a mild pleasant almond scent.  My roommate hates almond scent, so she can't stand it, but everyone else give it a try.  Would be great for children.  I have sensitive skin and it's great.  Try this product.

I am an adult using these and the foot pads don't seem large enough.  I have a size 9 women's foot and I feel like I'd have better footing and control if these had a bigger foot pad.  Also, maybe handles would be nice.  It's not hard to walk on these but they want to rotate and handles would allow one to keep them straight.  Otherwise these are durable, work well for someone at about 150 lbs, and even for heavier people.  They raise to be quite high, and go very low as well for people of all skills.  Still, bigger foot pads would be very nice.

I had a laptop back around 2000 and I didn't like it.  It always overheated, the battery life sucked, and it had other problems.  This little notebook has nothing in common with that pricey clunker.  This thing has been great so far.  Lightweight, so thin and small, great full sized keyboard, love the silver/white color, the battery lasts forever, 6 cell makes such a difference from 4 cell, also picks up wireless very well.  My only comment to those of you thinking about getting one of these is unless you know a better way, go ahead and get an external CD or DVD drive.  I got it and didn't even think about this issue.  I can't load my previously acquired antivirus software due to the lack of cd drive.I plan to update my review later on when I've had it longer, but I wanted to put this point out there.  I thought maybe I could plug it into my desk top and use the cd drive on it to load the software, but I couldn't get that to work.  I was told to try loading the software to a thumb drive or pen drive or whatever you want to call the little portable memory devices, but I couldn't get it on the drive.  I got a cheap drive from amazon, it ended up being under $20 with shipping for the external cd drive.  It's only cd not dvd, but all I plan to do is upload software with it, so it's fine.

I have a '93 Chrysler town and country with leather squishy seats.  The leather is very hot and then the seats are made too soft so you kinda sink in creating humid and breezless conditions for the crotch and the booty.  Most unpleasant when combined with no air conditioning.  I may be traveling in northern Wisconsin, but a hot summer day in an unairconditioned vehicle with leather seats is the same no matter where you are.  So I ordered 2 of these.  They are very nice, but those two shoulder straps on the cover did't work with my van because my seat has a single head rest bar rather than two small poles holding it.  I think this will work if your headrest is the two metal poles style and it's removeable.  Mine is neither.  So I cut off the straps and luckily they were put on seperately so it didn't fall apart.  I then wove more string into the giant holed beads and tied it to my seat.  Worked very well.  Took a couple hours to do it all, but the job is done and the booty is much cooler.  The beads a comfy to sit on with the exception that I have semi-long semi-curly hair and thesae beaded seat covers pull out long hair, so I've put thin sheet material over the backs of the seats and now all is well.I'd like to say here that leather car upholstry sucks.  If you're considering leather upholstry just don't do it.  It scratches up, it dries up and cracks, it feels terrible whether it's too hot and buring you or not aloowing your backside to breath or freezing you in winter.  Fabric is the way to go.  Also, the leather they use today is much lower quality than what they used in the '93 sweatmobile mentioned above.  It's thinner and much more easily damaged and if you have dark clothes on a light colored leather the color rubs off onto the seat and doesn't come off.

These are nice big straws, but considering how they shipped in an envelope and weighed as much as well, let's say, a bag of straws, $5.00 shipping seems excessive.  The page lists the shipping as $3.95, but I was charged $4.99.  Either seems high, I'd say $2.50 would be right.  Still, nice straws, big, pointy on one end, mine are clear with red stripes.

If you have psoriasis stop eating nightshades now! Doing that one thing has made my psoriasis go from red, itchy, scaly, painful, spreading, to flat and smooth and receding.  Recently I went to a Panera resturant and had a bread bowl with brocolli chedddar soup, absolutely delicious.  A day later my psoriasis was back to its' old self and when I checked their website to see the ingredients there were cayenne and paprika proving my nightshade allergy.  Avoiding nightshades is a big pain in the butt, but slack off and your psoriasis will remind you.  Also certain red food dyes (red #40, etc. . .) are made from peppers, so you have to avoid them also.  Tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, tobacco, eggplant.  Potato starch is in everything!  Tomatoes are in everything, paprika is in everything.  And the few things that don't have one of the above have food starch or spices or natural flavorings so you don't know if they have it or not.  I did just find a mayonaise that has no paprika Trader Joe's organic.The book itself is confusing and offer a thousand possibilities of why you might have psoriasis.  However, it's defintely got some things right and I don't know of a better book on the subject (because psoriasis research leads to drug companies offering us drugs with side effects including death and cancer).  It's nearly impossible to do everything it says, and even doing as much as you can will be hard, but food allergies of all kinds are hard.  I've lived with psoriasis for 18 years (since I was 12) and that has been hard.  So as tough as it is avoiding certain foods, it's easier than having psoriasis.  Mine hasn't cleared yet, but I'm certain that it will eventually.  Serious improvement, though.  More than I've seen with anything else.If nothing else wean yourself onto the diet slowly.  If you're like me, you've had it for years, so if it takes you another couple years to clear, at least it's not getting worse.  The book is worth buying.  Give it a try.  Leaving behind all those foods you love will be unpleasant, but when you see clearing and make a mistake and see the damned psorasis start coming back you'll realize just how much you love not having psorasis and you'll sacrfice those foods, not gladly, but you'll do it.Update: November 2009I am still using a few of the tips in this book to control my psoriasis and it's the best it has ever been since I got it.  A note about the book is that what it is is a bunch of ideas of what could be causing your psoriasis.  If you try to do everything it says you'll go insane.  I suggest reading it over then picking one or two things to start with and trying them. Always remember that the healing process takes time.You really do have to stick with it.  I've been avoiding nightshades since before I left the first part of this reveiw, almost a year now.  It's really hard to do, especially if you eat out.  I also did a liver cleanse which was truly awful but worthwhile I think.  I am allergic to nightshades and maybe peanuts and these things were building up in my body for the entire 30 years of my life.  The cleanse made my posriasis much worse for about a month while the toxins released into my body from my dirty liver.  I used milk thistle and apple juice.  Very effective.  Read about milk thistle on wikipedia if you want to learn more.  I did it for 2 weeks, but next time I'd stick to a week at most.If I cheat on my diet my psoriasis tells me about it.  I have not had full clearing, but it is smooth to the touch (unless I get into the cayenne or paprika which is in everything), it's not red, not scaly, rarely itchy.

I've used incandescent reveal bulbs for years.  Because I'm a jeweler I need very good true color lighting.  This bulb is the best compact fluorescent I've ever used.  It really looks like an incandescent reveal bulb.  I'm still using it with reveal incandescents, and haven't moved entirely to this reveal compact fluorescent style yet, but I'm pleased with it thus far and intend to switch over.  I'll update this reveiew if I cahnge my mind about them, but at this point I am pleased.

Poor quality.  The lighting is so dark that at many points you're taking it on faith that the people are still in the shot.  Boring and oddly graphic (a man slices a woman's naked breast and other such things).  I ended up fast forwarding through much of it.  The plot is weak and very boring.  The Candy Tangerine man is not a good actor (neither is anyone else in the movie), and he's not as good looking as the script pretends he is.There is a preview for a movie called Dolomite before it that looks potentially at least a little better than this one.  That preview was my favorite part of this movie.  Dolomite has an army of ladies who do his fighting for him.  There's also a sex scene in the preview that looks very real, like maybe he just set up a camera in his bedroom at home with his gf/wife.  Don't get me wrong, Dolomite looks a lot like this one with a poor plot and such, but I'd see it given the chance.Don't let the kids watch this.

The necromonger plot is not really my cup of tea.  What is my cup of tea is Vin Diesel as Riddick quietly and calmy killing a prison guard with a tea cup.  I own this movie and watch it for things like that.  I love the character Riddick which I can't imagine anyone playing better.  He's not cocky, he's just confident.  I love how he kills the prison guard sitting on his chest.  So quietly and quickly, then gives a little shrug to the mercenaries.  Very cool.

I wouldn't have thought a book about stoves would be such interesting reading, but this really is a good book.  I bought it in hopes that I'd be able to attempt to build a stove myself.  That did not happen, in fact I'm not even sure what type of stove I'd like.  However, the book has increased my faith in a wood stove keeping my home comfortable, and be environmentally sound.  I liked the writing style, which is pretty rare for a book of this type.  There were times when I couldn't put it down. Honestly, I was on this page again to sell my book, but now I find I'm not ready to let it go, so I'm writing a review instead.While it is old and could probably be updated, the art of the wood stove is also old, so much of the most valuable information may be old as well.  Certainly, history has a lot of lessons to teach us about masonry stoves.  Also, the book talks about past mistakes of masonry stoves, so if you're thinking about building your own, this would be good reading.Update: I am now building a house and will be having a masonry stove installed.  The book says it's hard to find a master stove builder but now there are many throughout the country, I've found one right here in my small town.  Also a masonry stove has benefit over a wood stove because you can get insurance if you have a masonry stove because it qualifies as a fireplace and thus is less risky to an insurance company than a wood stove.
This game would probably be fun to little kids, but I really disliked it.  Very boring and no practice of free will.  If you're 12 or over, don't do it!

This is an excellent game with a lot of replayability.  It's good for any age so long as you like craziness.  It's hilarious, with a good story line.  By far the best Wii game I've seen as of yet.  You are Rayman, a prisoner of the Rabbids who put you in a Roman colleseum style environment and make you play games to entertain them.  Though the Rabbids are rather violent and use a wide variety of scary looking blunt weapons and yell a lot I wouldn't really call this game violent.

It's a fairly fun game, but I'm going to have to play it muted.  The drivers and the passengers say things constantly, like every two seconds and they each only have like five lines, so they reapeat themselves about every ten seconds or so.  It's very annoying.  The constant advertising for levi's, pizza hut, KFC, and others is disturbing.  I can't belive the game designers thought that was acceptable.  Also, the music sucks.  I do get some enjoyment out of driving crazy.  The first time I played this about 3 years ago I drove home and hit the garbage corral behind my house driving crazy in the snow.

I bought this to play on my new Wii because I never did buy a gamecube, and man was I ever let down.  I have a SNES system pretty much just for the original mariokart.  It's great, it's something that challenges everyone and can be enjoyed by kids and adults.  Double dash is so infantile it sickens me!  The battlemode options are terrible!  Who wants to play on top of a gamecube?  That's the most uninspired thing I've ever seen!  And other venues such as cookie land?  I wanted to see sequels to the original, advances in the game but the same basic concept.  This game is for kids much like the N64 version, look toward the gameboy DS for a better mariokart. A serious let down.  If you liked the original at least rent it before you buy it just to see if I'm telling the truth here.

This was a hard to find title, for a long time it was only available on Noel Paul Stookey's website.  The other music on the disc is pretty good, but it doesn't come close to the unique beauty of The Wedding Song.  It's worth it to get a copy of that song!  I found other versions of the song, but other artists never did it any justice.

This is not an appropriate gift for your schizophrenic uncle who has trouble telling reality from fiction.  Max Brooks has written this book like it's a true threat that we should all be getting prepared for.  His phrasing is both unsettling and hilarious.  It's not often I've felt those two emotions together.  I keep telling myself the threat isn't real, but still I think it's time to get started building a reinforced concrete wall 10 feet high around my property so I'll be ready for at least a class two zombie attack.  But every night I'll lie in bed worrying.  What if it moves to class three and the bodies of my former friends and neighbors who have now become zombies pile up until they form a wriggling undead ramp.  Then I'll wish the wall had been twenty or thirty feet high to give me more time.  Maybe I could add a metal framework and weld a rebar mesh over the top.  Then I'd sleep soundly with my earplugs in so the moans of the undead as they hunt won't drive me insane.  I'm lucky to have received this book from a caring friend before it was too late.

Lovely pictures of everyday activities of humans and the birds that inhabit the land with them; including gathering eggs and hanging laundry and life in a small full house and hunting and having fun.  Also illustrated mythological/religious events.  Nice size pictures with good color.  Paintings are whimsical and are not realism, but there's a realistic feel about them.  They really portray feeling and atmosphere.

I've had trouble sleeping because of background noise for years.  I finally bought this because I live in a duplex and my neighbors are loud and erratic in behavior, arguing and moving furniture around at 3:00 am.  I was afraid to even try to sleep at home after several days with little sleep and my roommate made me buy this because I was ready to move out.This product is great.  It makes a very fan-like sound, but with no mechanical or cycling sounds, or rattling.  This is just a constant whoosh.  It has two speeds and you can change the sound of the whoosh by changing the postition of the vent holes on the device.  It has a switch right on the side of it, not on the cord so it's easy to use.  It's even padded on the bottom to make sure it doesn't vibrate.I used the low setting last night and slept through the night for the first time in the month since the crazy animals downstairs moved in.I've been relying on ceiling fans and box fans for background noise for years, this is much better.  It's a fuller sound, it covers more, and it doesn't make me cold.As many others have said in previous reviews, this is unlike those pre-recorded white noise sounds.  This cannot repeat, because it's actually making the sound as you hear it.I travel for a living and stay in a lot of hotels.  I look forward to taking this thing with me and blocking out the sounds of neighbor's TV's and talking and vehicles, etc. . . It's very small and lightweight, and seems durable.I don't know why I didn't buy this sooner. Shooting my neighbors is the only thing that would help me sleep better, but this is legal so perhaps a better choice.

I'd like to rate this negative 5, but 1 is the lowest Amazon offers.This movie seemed very pointless.  Boring.  It has almost no plot and goes nowhere.  The characters are unlikely and poorly developed.  I turned this movie off 3/4 through it.  I can only say that about maybe 5 movies in my life.What finally made me turn this off was a very sick scene involving rape, torture, and murder.  I've seen movies that are rated X that were cleaner.  I'm no prude, but this was a disgusting movie.Save yourself some time and watch a porn video.

This set of books blew me away. I didn't expect a Harvard MBA education so yeah, the title is hyperbole. The usefulness contained the books as a set of business reference materials makes it invaluable. The book goes beyond trying to imitate what you'd get in a classroom to touch on the things that aren't being taught yet.Fast Education in Megatrends would be a more accurate title. Motivation of yourself and others, whether clients or workers, is a big topic in this book with cutting-edge information. I would recommend this book to anyone who is in business or starting out in business.

This book on perception run through the basics of childhood and the ideas about the world which are implanted into us. Then it does something which I thought was very unique and helpful. It gives detailed scenarios of how these perceptions rule our lives, and interfere with our progress and growth, both personally and professionally. When I finished this book I found that I had the ability to watch my own behavior closely and that I didn't need to be ruled by a thought process that somewhere in the back of mind I always knew was doing more harm than good.I'd recommend this book to anyone who feels compelled to look at the world a different way, and those who look at other people who have a large amount of claity and purpose and wonder how they can do it. The positive perceptions that this book helps guide to are essential for anyone looking to make a change in their lives.

Merl Miller has the makings of a top level funny and original financial guru and coach. If there is a next wave on the next financial paradigm, this guy will be a part of it. Find Money is a joy to read. The information is accessible as well as made me laugh.
