Oh, and it got me up of my butt to put into practice Miller's excellent advice on creating my own successful future.

Young people and smartphones seem inseparable, so it's about time young adults get a book that explore life without a device. In a tale in which a group of early teens are deprived of their technology and dumped on a remote desert island, P.D. Quaver spins a story for young adults that works on all cylinders. As a novel for young people from late elementary to middle school, she manages to tell a unlikely story of a school which is supposed to help kids free themselves of technology and a group of kids who have been put in the school. The school is a front and the kids are kidnapped and taken to a desert island. Quaver pulls off the suspension of disbelief part perfectly, and the get that thrill going in the young reader. If you do get this book for a young person in their life, don't let it be lost on them that they are reading it on a Kindle. Perhaps Quaver will offer a paperback edition. That would make an extra emphasis on the life-without-technology-angle.

I tried the Bro supplements and liked those so much I tried these. This is a great workout line. I feel recovered after a long workout faster, feel like I can push myself harder. Muscle looks like its getting bigger and tigher faster. These guys know what they're doing, and if you just picked up this or any of the Bro products on your radar try them out. I've tried many and this is what I'm going with right now.

A book from a person perfectly tuned in to what a CEO can offer any and every business owner. The book takes a range of more than two dozen top CEO's and asks them to answer the questions most relevant to a business. I appreciated that this book wasn't aimed at those fascinated with the lifestyles of CEOs, but came from a perspective where the nuts and bolts of business is the key to the value of the information. This isn't a book for entertainment purposes. It's for those who have or are going to start a business, and should a part of every workday.

I can fully recommend Akdeniz's book for anyone who is just starting out in the career either out of school, or after finishing school and bouncing around dead-end jobs waiting for the economy to improve. More importantly, the book is useful to those making a career change. The most important thing the book does is guide your path so that its holistically inclusive of fulfilling the individual on many levels throughout his or her career.

As I get older, Carpel Tunnel is something I struggle with. I found Johnson's book to be the most helpful of found for understanding and modifying my behavior and uses of my hands. His book is veers into the technical sometimes, and he quotes numerous sources which while it goes a long way to the integrity of the book, makes it a little dry. There's also a bit of Carpel Tunnel trivia. All in all you'd be hard pressed to find a more complete book on Carpel Tunnel Syndrome.

I have been a convert to the alkaline is better than acidic water content for some time. Just the way it makes you feel is enough evidence. What this book did that was magic was take that into food, which I'd yet to consider. The book does a wonderful job of charting the different foods that are highly acidic vs the ones that are higher in alkaline.This is a book on the cutting edge of diet and health and I'll be keeping ready on my Kindle whenever I'm at the store.

Wow! I've tried green coffee bean, etc. but these are the BOMB! I take one in the morning before my workout and the energy I have after is about 3 fold and lasts until late afternoon. These are my new favorites!

This is a great science fiction novel about multiple universes, the present day and the near future. Stuck in the middle of Lebanon in the middle of war, the main character, James Pollack, finds himself between universes. In this world he faces war, in the alternative universe he faces a landscape full of mutants in which he is one of the few remaining males of the human species.The novel mixes alternate reality and pulp style themes of last-man-on-earth in a clear and well-written narrative.

This novel has a well written narrative and interesting devices which make for a pleasurable mystery. Foxy, aka Lord Foxbridge, is a British Aristocrat who comes to London from his family manor. Told in the first person, Foxy begins the novel by explaining how he got into the "amateur detective business". He comes to London after his inherits money from in uncle. The uncle left him money instead of his father out of spite. Foxy is gay, comfortable and in London. He has lots of time to investigate crime and cause other trouble.

Alice is a woman who is tired of her life. She owns a business but struggles to keep up. She is in a relationship with a guy named Robin but the pair are mostly annoyed with each other. Combine this with a secret past and a person from that part of Alice's life coming back into the picture, and thus comes together the plot of this romance novel. Much of the beginning focuses on the dynamics of Alice's relationships, especially her relationship with her twenty-two year old daughter Skye. One of the sub-plots of the novel revolves around her daughter and whether there was a mix up at the hospital. Alice isn't sure Skye is her biological daughter. However, the two are close and Skye tries to get her mother to open up and try news things.This is how Alice makes it onto a cooking game show which is where the real romance and plot twists begin. There she meets someone who helps her expand her business and also offers her much more. But Alice is torn between several men and her struggle with her past. Not to give anything away, I'll say the story becomes an engaging exploration into the conflicts and passions of a woman with much potential she need to discover for herself."Dawn Any Minute" has a solid narrative, distinct characters and a creative plot. It's rich on dialogue which in the first part of the book can sometimes devolve into more bickering than is needed to show the family dynamic. The novel is far better than most of the $1 Kindle books out there, so if it's on sale or giveaway, definitely get it. It's worth the cover price at $5.

If you like stories and characters out of New York City than this book will be a great little find, in fact the whole series will be super find. Maggie and Odessa are two amateur detectives. Odessa has a catering business and her best friend, Maggie, is a student. In this novel, they need to help a friend out of a murder charge by finding the real killer, but a music producer stands in their way. Full of fun, attitude and adventure, take a chance on Jill Brock's series.

Forever Girl has an interesting twist on the paranormal romance theme. A Wiccan of some talent, Sophia can cast spells but they often backfire an go wrong, causing an annoying static to become voices in her head and bring forth unwanted spirits. Through this she is trying to find out about her families history. She meets a man who may be able to answer her questions, but getting involved with him brings its own dangers, especially from the political body responsible for immortal creatures. This was an interesting read that has a little romance, humor and horror.

I found this a very useful tool in teaching myself and others the qualities of good leadership. By using examples from various success stories of today, the book demonstrates the skills and styles that make for successful guidance of a business and it's employees. I'd recommend this book to anyone teaching leadership skills or wants stories that will inspire others and make clear various qualities of leadership.

Even though the novel does follow a well-worn path of addiction and recovery, it runs that ground with original and real characters and a straightforward narrative. One doesn't have to discover drug addiction in order to write about it. It's a tale that is time-worn but always engaging when told well. This book tells its story in a captivating way.

From Haiti in the seventeen hundreds to today Vamphora covers a unique history of vampire culture. The plot centers on events today surrounding "Fat Jack", a corrupt cop who extorts money from local club owners. One club own in particular, Anastasiya, turns out to be a vampire.When Fat Jack decides to take over Anastasiya's club he bites off more than he chew, getting himself involved in a vampire culture conflict that goes back to Haiti and its revolution.I agree with the other reviews that this has a touch of James Ellroy, but it also does its job as a horror novel, with a dose of Clive Barker and even a touch of Lovecraft.

A great book on what women need to get a younger man. Many younger men are curious about older women, but what they don't know is how easily they can fall in love with them too. Older women have more power than they realize and this book brings it to their attention. They can not only have a younger man, they can have him any way they want him.

This is a depraved and trippy novel! The author began the book back in the 80s and put it down a number of times over two decades. I'd say it contains about the most graphic scenes of sexual related violence I've ever read. Edward Lee would blush. So take heart that you are going on this adventure into human darkness with a writer who for years at a time found this material too sick for himself, but in the end has created a work of sickness that reaches the higher atmospheres of literature.

A powerful read that explains why the fallout from the mortgage collapse five years has not finished and may only be just beginning. As if putting off the inevitable, the author outlines how hidden have been the practices of many banks, and much of it is only now being discovered, putting the government in a position of unwittingly helping disguise the level of fraud while not understanding how the banks operate. The book shows that we may just be at the beginning of the effects the mortgage banking industry will have had on home-ownership.

This brilliant romance with clear and crisp characters who are simple but its easy to get inside their hearts. Jeromy is consistent in his quest for Stacy's heart, but Stacy is torn between him and another. This is terrific and heartfelt romance with a touch of spicy heat.Stacy makes her way toward success in her own right, and in doing so has the option to pick her soul mate in Jeromy or his friend, and lead singer in a band, Billy. This novel invades lots of relationship situations and makes the reader feel the same yearnings as its main character, Stacy.

Rani Manicka places big stories inside her settings, from the human nature to the nature of reality, Black Jack is a novel that is both unique and through-provoking. In Black Jack, we see an alternate vision of reality occupied by beings from the "zero-sum point". A young girl who was abducted many years go hold the key to a secret society and secret reality.

This mystery thriller has a great premise which puts it well above most ebook detective stories that come close to the formula of a television show. "Time Killer" creates a psycho who will reflect the raw animal instinct we have all felt standing in a long line, waiting in traffic or having time wasted by a salesman.Max and Jesse are two partners who don't get along, but they have an insane killer who they must catch. The tension builds and sustain, and the story is well written. This a unique thrill worth a read.

Kelly, Scott, Austin and Zoey are back again, and the spirit radio is still connecting them with the past. This time it's the 1920's. The Golden Era. But not Gatsby's Golden Era, the kids travel back to the site of a traveling circus and embroil themselves in the fun and danger of the Show folk's scene. This book in the CUL8R series is as vibrant and interesting as the other I have read. The characters are regular kids, well fleshed out and realistic. I'm reminded of the Trixie Bell series of my childhood, but the kids in THIS series are fresh and updated for today's generation. You will love reading this book to it's exciting conclusion. All the kids came through their last adventure with bruises and scrapes and indeed, Kelly got shot!I wasn't let down in the drama department with this installment either! These are no wimpy kids stories, but fast paced and well written adventure stories for everybody! I love them!

Both my son and daughter enjoyed this book very much and it was great family reading. Magic comes alive in Grandma's garden, and Sophia and Matteo are enchanted by what the see around them. The twist of how things can be other than what they see, and the illustrations that went with them, made this a fun and exciting read with an important message. We all had run reading it.

This book has a lot to say that sidesteps the usual debates adults force on young people about sex - abstinence or a life of STDs and unwanted pregnancies? A young woman with a passion for accurate information, Sharice Jones focuses her conversation, meant for other young people, early teens and up, on the factual information about risk and responsibility. Simply stated, a young person should get the facts and get something going in their lives before thinking about participating in something that factually speaking, will be going on a lot more often and lot longer in their own lives than most young people imagine.

My girlfriend wanted this book so I got it on my Kindle and loaned it to her. After she read this book I noticed she made changes that made her look really hot. I can't comment specifically on one thing or another since Halloween and a few inebriated capitulations to girlfriends have been the only times I've had first hand experience with make-up. Still, I did notice after she got this book.

If you are considering teaching in Asia this book makes for a great primer to what to expect from work hours, living conditions, required background and paperwork, cultural expectations and everything to do with the pros and cons of taking a teaching job in the orient.The book has a detailed section on health care in the Orient and how to protect from the flu and other common diseases, plus what to try for yourself of in the realm of Oriental medicine. Seems showing up for work is expected short of being on your deathbed, so this section is very valuable.Overall this book has all the information anyone will need who is looking to work in teaching in China or Korea.

The nuances of special techniques of public speaking get covered in this book by looking at the style and body language of top speakers. I found the book a buffet of styles and communication techniques to choose from. There is something to be drawn from the numerous examples in this book for someone new or someone who wants to refine or add style to their current technique.

Nicely made, but has no provisions for adjustment on one end. This means you are stuck whether the threads happen to tighten down. Also, with regard to the end with the female threads, it seems the threads are cut too large for attaching to typical bathroom hardware. Even with the little silicone washer, the seal was less than desirable.Ended up having to return it. Looks nice, but you better have threads that stop right where you need them or you will have alignment and adjustment problem at least on one side of this fixture.I'm attaching some photos to show how nicely made it is otherwise.

Ugh.. these guys have really F'd up Boraxo hand soap. Can't any company leave well enough alone anymore? I've used Boraxo soap to clean my hands after working in the garage for over 40 years. Luckily, my Dad had a couple of large boxes of the original Boraxo hand soap that I used as a teenager and he was kind enough to give me one last time I visited him. Oh man, it brought back so many fond memories. I used it around the house to wash my hands every day and even turned my girlfriend onto it; she loved it and started using it in the shower in place of her normal body wash.Okay, so I thought, "terrific", I will just switch over to this soap. So, naturally we ordered some from Amazon. They showed a normal hand soap and also a "pro". I didn't want the new "pro" version, so I placed an order for the regular one. Nope, amazon sent the pro one. Ugh, it was awful. Horrible perfume smell and small "rocks" that don't dissolve when you wash your hands. WTF?I went back and compared it against the soap my Dad gave me. It completely dissolves when you apply water. Leaves your hands spotless - removes any odors and doesn't leave any scent of its own. Compared to the new stuff by Dial, it's no contest. The new stuff is horrible. It leaves grit, which you have to rinse away and leaves some godawful smell.Okay, okay, no problem. I'll just check out the local hardware store and find the old stuff.Nope...So apparently Dial has the market sown up on Boraxo soap I guess. So I call them and ask if I can get the old stuff? Nope, sorry. They explain they added more perfume to it, blah, blah, blah. The woman on the phone said I was the second call that day complaining about it. Yeah, great.. maybe they can change it back. I explained to her that they are missing a bet, because natural is in and this soap is amazing stuff - if they would just go back to making it how they did back in the 60's and 70's. Who know if any of that information will get up the food chain.All I can tell you is they have taken an amazing product and messed around with it until it's so terrible that I don't even want to have it in my home, under any circumstances. I sent it back to amazon. I did visit the store hoping I might find something; I found the Boraxo laundry additive. At least it doesn't have the horrible perfume, but it leaves grit that is just as bad as the professional version of the hand soap.Someone at Dial needs to get on the stick and realize that people no longer what perfumes and chemicals all over their homes, clothes, hands and bodies. Make your product like you used to and I will buy it. This new Boraxo hand soap blows...

Really like this stuff so far, wow! I was a little hesitant to stain Suede but I'm impressed with this dye. A few years ago, I made a custom Suede seat for my Yamaha R1. After a while, it started to fade, so I decided to buy this stuff to dye it a darker black. I'll attach some photos to show how it came out. The main seat received two coats (even though really 1 coat was plenty). The rear luggage cover got one.From what I can see, it doesn't rub off or transfer. As soon as I put it on the Suede, it went right in. The next morning, it was dry no problem and even rubbing your fingers across it didn't leave any residue.

Wow, loving this little guy. I have the larger TM26 with the extended battery and absolutely love it. I purchased this MH20 to keep in the car. It's sort sort of a baby version of the TM26 almost. The switch function is very similar. I like that I can recharge it using the USB in the car also, which is super handy (or on the computer).Brightness is good. Lights things up nicely. The switch feels very high quality and I like that it has low power modes in case I need to conserve power for some reason.Very compact and very well made. The only thing which was a little tricky was getting the lanyard through the hole - had to use the end of a paper clip to thread it through. However, once that was done, everything else was fine.Best price I have seen for just the flashlight was around $52, but having the extra battery from Nitecore makes this a very good deal.

Stem broke after just a couple of weeks. I haven't taken a close look at it yet, but it didn't last long. Overall, it's a nice little watch and looks pretty, but having it break in such short order was a bummer. Would not buy again.
Super nice! Matches the color of the iPhone 6s pretty well. Has a nice heavy feel to it. Seems to work fine.

Wow.. for the money, this thing can't be beat. I ordered one to hold my girlfriend's shoes. I was redoing the closet and I figured it would be nice to help store shoes until I built something else. I have to say, even though it's fairly light weight as far as construction, it does the job well. I ended up attaching it directly to the wall using some cable loops from Home Depot and this made all the difference in the world. By being attached to the wall, it really made the rack feel first class. The dust cover that zips down is a super nice feather. All in all, very pleased with this purchase and can highly recommend it.

Didn't function correctly as near as I could see. I opened it and read the directions. Inserted a 9volt battery and went to scan some stuff. Yes, the scanner did buzz and beep when it got close to metal, but it never stopped. Even when I pulled it far clear of anything metal, it just kept buzzing. The only way to stop it was to turn the power switch off. The high and low settings made no sense. I tried it with several different batteries, same results. Also, the compartment where the battery goes doesn't accept all 9 volt batteries. It's a super tight fit. One brand of battery I tried wouldn't go in at all and if I had forced it much, it would have never come out.Overall, the scanner has a very cheap feels to it. It's very light weight and plastic feeling. There is a sensitivity adjustment on it, but I didn't change it from the factory setting. Just didn't seem to work correctly as near as I could tell.

I wanted to like these, but... there were some things which resulted in returning them. I actually ordered 4 sets (3/8 and 1/2, each in SAE and metric). Returned them all to amazon for a refund for the following reasons:1. Finish is sort of dry and rough, not black and smooth like some of the other impact sockets I own. Feels very "made in china"2. While the sockets are clearly marked, they only have what appears to be surface ink or silk screen sizes. There is not imprinted size on the socket itself, so I have to wonder what would happen when this paint or ink is warn off through use? You would be left with sockets that have absolutely no mark. The sizes are not etched, only printed.3. A couple of the sockets had printing that wasn't straight; it was crooked and looked terrible.4. While it was nice to receive a plastic case (and the case itself is rather nice), I noticed that the sockets didn't fit back into their areas properly. They were too close, so if you removed one socket to use it, then went to put it back, it nudged the two on either side and caused them to bump up and out of their holders. So the only way to correct this was to then take every socket farther down the line out and put it back in without the one to the right present. This finally corrected the "not fitting back into its spot" problem, but as you can imagine, it would be time consuming when using the sockets.Overall, this kit is fair value for the money. However, the quality just seemed a little sub-par to me. The number imprinting could have been etched or something, as just the painting on that was done didn't look like it would last long to me. I think also having a case which accepted the sockets without interference would have been nice as well.Normally I buy Neiko brand, but decided to try Tekton for a change. Probably won't do that again based on my experience here as compared to the very nicely designed Neiko stuff.

If you are hoping to find the Boraxo from the 70's and 80's, this isn't it. The smell is different and so is the consistency. This stuff has a faint perfume smell, which is irritating to your nose. The old stuff had a nicer smell, which seemed more natural and less chemical. Also, the consistency of this soap seems like it's cut with something other than pure Borax - the original soap that I was used to using was very consistent as far as granule size, while this stuff has very large particles which don't work as well in my opinion.

This ratchet is just okay. The operation/feel is decent, but the quality of the metal used on the ratchet switch seems a bit low budget to my eye. If you compare the overall design of the head on this ratchet to most others, it seems way over-sized and thus cheap feeling. The ratchet action is acceptable, but nothing high quality feeling.If I had picked this item up in a store, where I could see and touch it first hand, I doubt I would have spent the money on it. Since I ordered it via amazon, it arrived and it's decent enough to keep, but I am not exactly jumping for joy over it.I think if I had it to do over again, I would buy two ratchets at the hardware store and then do some cutting and TIG welding to fashion something a bit more sleek and slim than the Motion Pro item here. Also, it's worth noting that the T-handle really feels more like it's a 3/8 size and then they have inserted a 1/4 drive in place of the 3/8 size. I'm not sure if that's really the case or not, but it seems like it's just a 3/8 size ratchet with a 1/4 drive swapped into place.Overall, I would give it 3 out of 5 stars. This tool certainly won't be winning any design awards any time soon, but if you are accustomed to buying your tools at Harbor Freight, then you may be happy with the purchase. If you are used to higher end stuff, don't get your hopes up too much on this one.

Out of all the Illy iperEspresso capsules I've tried, this is by far the smoothest of them all. In fact, I would say it's probably one of the smoothest espresso shots I've ever had. The favor isn't very intense, but it's a very enjoyable and balanced shot. Whatever they are doing over in Ethiopia with their coffee beans, it's working! Highly recommended.

When I was a kid, I used to watch this TV show called "Land of the Giants". As I recall, it was about this group of space travelers who left earth in their space ship, then returned only to discover that they had some how magically been shrunk down to a few inches tall; as a result everything in the world was now super sized to them.When I received my Neiko 36" bolt cutters in the mail, this is exactly how I felt.When I say these are huge, that's exactly what I mean. I had previously had a set of 24" H.K. Porter bolt cutters from Home Depot, which these replaced. I thought the HK cutters were pretty big, but I could probably use the Neiko 36" cutters to slice right through those. The Neiko 36" one are massive and well made. When they are totally open, the jaws look like they are over 3/4" wide at the tips. And the jaws are just huge, like the size of your hand huge. I mean, seriously heavy duty and massive. As soon as I finish this review, I'm going to have to buy a set of these same bolt cutters in the 24-inch size, just to have something more rational in size to use for day to day stuff around the shop.But if an M1A1 tank ever breaks down outside my house, these will definitely come in handy!So when people say in their reviews that these bolt cutters cut through a master lock "like butter", they are't joking around. The jaws on these bolt cutters are so large it looks like they could cut through not just the shackle on a master lock, but probably cut the lock itself in half without too much difficulty.

I ordered this stuff because I used to like malt tablets as a kid. I was hoping it would be a nice drink (or at least powder) for the kids. Ugh.. it's bland. I followed the directions and made some by mixing milk. Hmm... nothing to write home about. My first thought was maybe elderly folks would like this, but it really had no other redeeming flavor qualities that I could see. Even by adding additional powder to the milk - still not much luck.

I didn't think I would like this measuring cup as much as I do. I purchased it for use with my espresso machines - specifically for pulling shots which then have to be poured carefully into milk, etc. The cup is a very nice size (smaller than I expected, which is good actually). It's about the size of a traditional ceramic espresso cup (think Peet's coffee). It's a touch larger and can easily hold two shots.I like that it has marks on the size and have actually started using it to calibrate the shot volume on some of my machines. It's not very good to drink directly out of (due to the pour spout), but it's great when it comes to pouring shots or any small volume of liquid, etc.I wish it didn't cost $13 via Amazon Prime, but what the heck; you only live once :) It works great and is a well made, classy little addition to the coffee cups, etc.

These lights are going right back to Amazon. They put out less light than my current Osram H7 65W Rallye lights, which they were to replace. Color is warm/yellow, so if you are hoping these will match your 4300K HID's or something like that, no way. As near as I can see, they put out about average light for an H7 bulb. The color is identical to the OSRAM 65W rally bubls, which can be found for much less.In my opinion, not good value for the money.
An absolutely brilliant tool. So nice I hardly even wanna use it :-) I just like knowing I have it in the garage :-)

This oil was recommended by a local race shop for my Yamaha R1. I had been using Motul 5100 and liked it. I contacted Motul directly and spoke with their service department. I ended up going with 10W40 300v during a rebuild of the bike. After having used the bike on the road with this oil, I'm really impressed with how smoothly the gear box shifts. Also, this is a double ester oil, which helps the oil stick to the surfaces; this helps protect the motor at start up, etc. As long as you don't push the oil much past 3000 miles on the street, I think running 300v is worth the extra money for the protection is provides.

I purchased the Tachyon OPS HD camera via Amazon to use on my motorcycle helmet while riding. The camera is nicely made, but does require you buying a separate MicroSD card. I purchased a 32 gig MicroSD card - each 4 gigs is said to record up to 1 hour.The camera and accessories supplied are all very nice. I powered up the camera and did a test recording or two. I immediately noticed the sound was not there - only very few seconds I would hear a faint blip of sound. I tried resetting the unit and powering it on/off - no luck. A few more test recordings and the same thing. Oh well...One thing I did notice (at least indoors) is that the video quality is really poor. It looks like something out of a 7-11 security video or something. Granted, it might be better outdoors in direct sunlight, but due to the camera having an audio issue, I didn't get that far.Thankfully, amazon prime makes returns easy to deal with. I boxed the camera back up and returned it to amazon for a refund.As much as I like the size and construction, I think I'll probably avoid going with Tachyon again. For one, their website is a bit confusing and after a negative experience (as well as the poor video quality), I think I'll probably look for something else. The price was right, but the quality of the video and audio problems give me pause.It's a shame too, because I really did like the one button operation of the camera.

I purchased the arrow T50 staples in both 1/4 and 3/8 inch sizes. Unfortunately, my staples were put into a box with little thought to the journey ahead. With very little packing and no means to keep the staples from sliding out of their boxes, my shipping box arrived sounding like it was full of marbles. When I opened the box, I discovered that both packages of T50 staples had come open; this resulted in all the staples breaking apart and mixing up during shipping.I was able to separate the 1/4 size from the 3/8 size, but it was a little disappointing that so many of the long staple rows broke into smaller sections. I ended up having to throw away about 5% of the staples ordered, as the broken sections were too small to really load into my staple gun. I also ended up stepping on one of the loose staples that fell out of the box, but luckily it went into my shoe, instead of my daughter's bare feet or something.If Amazon could do something to help keep the boxes secure during shipping, I think that would be a great help - perhaps some tape or maybe shrink wrap or something alone those lines might be helpful.If you do order this product, just be aware that there is a potential for the boxes to slide open during transit (and be careful of loose staples if you have kids or pets, etc.)

I used a set of these in a fix-up project guitar that I plan to sell. The heads are small and they have a bit of a plastic feel, but they turn smoothly and they stay in tune so they will work. For a guitar I plan to keep, I would probably spend a little more and get a higher quality.

UPDATE: There are actually four jaws in this tool, and one of the jaws will fit every bit in the set. I hadn't noticed the other two before, but the handle comes apart and flips around to access the second set of jaws. This pin vise has worked out great to make small holes for guitar screws without chipping the finish. Great investment. I am upgrading my review to five stars.Original review: It is a nice complete set, but they really should have included a third jaw for the middle size bits. The large jaw won't hold the middle size bits and those bits are just a hair to big for the small jaw, so you have to pry the jaw open a bit to put them in. Otherwise, the set is just fine.
What more can I say about a cable? It just works. It has a very sturdy feel to it, and you just can't beat this price. I will always look for Hosa cables for my guitars now.

I used this fretboard oil on a brand new Les Paul, and the effect is just amazing. The rosewood soaked the oil right up, and it now has a very rich and dark color. I was going to put regular lemon oil on my guitar until I read in a forum that lemon oil penetrates too deeply and can cause the fretboard to separate from the neck over time. Now, I am sold on F-ONE oil and that is what I will use on my guitars from now on.

I bought this bridge in hopes of solving the intonation problem I was having with the stock tune-o-matic bridge on my Epiphone Les Paul Special II LTD. I have Ernie Ball Classic pure nickel .009-.042 strings on it, and the intonation was always sharp on the first three strings, even with the tune-o-matic saddles all the way at the end of their travel. I also had a problem with the G string sounding flat and squawky, and I believe that was related to the saddle because I could loosen the string, wiggle the saddle a little, then re-tighten the saddle and the string would sound normal again for a day or two before going dead again.So, first things first. This solved my intonation problem. I know I probably didn't really need a roller bridge to get more travel on the saddles, but I figured that I could also help lengthen string life by taking away the sharp edge of the tune-o-matic style bridge at the same time. It works for that purpose, but it took some extra work.The first problem I had was that some of the rollers wouldn't actually roll! I used a bit of tri-flow and a pair of needlenose pliers to get them going, and they now work for the most part but I really had to crank on them with the pliers to get them moving and a couple of them still don't spin as freely as I would expect. I discovered that the rollers are not black chrome, but actually just painted brass. This begs the question, why did they bother painting them? If you want a roller saddle bridge for use with some kind of tremolo, I would strongly encourage you to look elsewhere because these rollers don't work well. They are working for my non-tremolo guitar just fine, but I won't be actually using the rollers much.The next problem I had was the post size. Now, I know that Gibson bridge posts are smaller than those by Epiphone, but based on some of the other reviews I was under the impression that the included posts should screw right in to the threads in my guitar body. That is not the case. The threaded portion of the included posts is a larger diameter than those on my Epi. As a result, I was left with two options. I could either try to pop out the original thread inserts from the guitar body or I could pull out the Dremel and chase out the post holes on this bridge to make it work with my original posts. I chose the latter because I couldn't justify hacking into my guitar and risking permanent damage for the sake of this experiment. So, I chased out the holes to fit my posts and it is working but if you look closely it is fairly obvious that I am not a machinist.With all of that said, I am giving this bridge three stars because of the problem with the rollers and not because of the modifications I had to make for it to work on my Epi. The rollers are their primary function, and that function does not work well.

So, I just got this game a couple of days ago and I will come back and update this review after I have more time to play it. However, I wanted to note some things about installation and my first impressions before they slipped my mind.INSTALLATIONIn my case, I already had Steam installed on my computer from an Age of Empires game I used to play years ago. I had not used it in a long time, so I opened Steam and updated it before even messing with the Rocksmith installation. After that was done, I installed Rocksmith from the CD. It seemed to install fine, but it only took about 20 minutes, which seemed much shorter than what I had read about in other reviews. I also noted that the desktop icon and the program information in Steam said it was "Rocksmith Demo." It also only had three songs available, no guitarcade, and lots of missing features compared to what I had read in other reviews. As it turns out, the way I did the installation I actually did install a demo version that needed to be activated to get the rest of the features. There is an activation code printed on the insert inside the game case, and you have to go into the Steam program and find the menu option to activate a game. Then, just enter that code and it will download the full version of the game. The download took almost three hours on a hard-wired cable internet connection with a download speed of about 600kbps.GAME PLAYI have a real limited experience here so far, but my first impression is that the game is going to be both fun and educational in time, but right now it is a little overwhelming. I have only rehearsed a couple of songs so far, but I have done them several times and the game automatically makes it more difficult every time you rehearse it. I have to try to figure out a way to turn down the difficulty or turn back the progression because both of those songs have now become completely unplayable at their current difficulty progression. I also messed around with the Ducks game, which just seems like a creative way to exercise scales and fretboard memorization. I think this is going to be a great tool, and it is also fun to play. However, the mini games of it are short and just like the song rehearsals it seems that the difficulty progresses too quickly if you keep playing. It would be nice if you could pick a difficulty limit for that game or select a longer game time to use it as more of a repetitive exercise tool. I still have a lot of work to do to find my way around in the game and figure out all the features, but again I want to mention that it does seem overwhelming at first.UPDATE 5/16I tried playing the game again last night. Once again I was stumbling and getting lost, especially when the notes were moving up the fret board. I decided to just erase my previous progress and start all over with a new profile. Then I discovered a valuable tool: the Riff Repeater. It is in the song menu, and it gives you several different options for playing portions of songs at various speeds. I chose free speed, which means that the song will go full speed until you miss a note, then it stops completely and waits for you to play that note. I also discovered something very important that the game is not entirely clear about. On the noteway (area where notes are coming toward you), there are four highlighted blue tracks. These four tracks correspond to where you should have your fingers stationed above the fretboard, and when the highlighted spot moves to a different area that means you should also move your fingers to the corresponding frets. To play along with the game properly, it seems really important that you should use all four fingers in the correct positions according to which tracks on the noteway are highlighted blue. This made a HUGE difference, and changed the game from impossible to merely challenging. I actually discovered this, along with some good tips about strumming and hand positioning from a Youtube Guitarsmith tutorial. So, if you just get the feeling that your hands are not in the right position or it seems impossible to keep up with the position changes, I highly recommend going over to Youtube and watching the Guitarsmith tutorial by Andy Schiller.By the way, just to warn others, if you buy songs from the store it seems that sometimes they will not have the same single note and chord playing options that the stock songs come with. I downloaded the Santana song pack, and from what I can tell it seems that chord playing is the only option for those songs. If I just looked at it wrong or missed the single note mode somehow, someone please let me know.For now, I am leaving my review at four stars because I still think the game is lacking in that it doesn't give adequate instructions about finger positioning.UPDATE 5/22After a week playing this game, I have noticed a HUGE difference in my guitar skill, both in and out of the game. The game successfully challenged me and took me out of my comfort zone. It forced me to learn things that I had just assumed were too advanced for my skill level (slides, bends, hammer-ons and pull-offs, double stops). This game was less than the cost of one private lesson at the local guitar shop and it was money well spent. I am upgrading my review to five stars.

I recently opened up my guitar case for the first time in seven years. The Elixir strings that were on it were still playable, but they sounded dull and the G string was starting to show some corrosion. I can't remember if it was a forum comment or the reviews here that gave me the idea to try these strings, but I like them. I also can't remember what gauge my old Elixir strings were, but these are much more playable and they give off a nice warm tone from my old Epiphone guitar. I think I will stick with these from now on. One thing I should note is that the high E string broke when I was trying to stretch it the first time. That is not the string's fault, I think I just overdid it with the stretching. I replaced it with a plain steel string and that is working fine.

What can you say about a pack of Fender picks? Getting them this way is a much cheaper alternative to paying a dollar a pop at the local music store, and it gives you the opportunity to experiment with various thickness. Very nice.

To put it right out there, this is a nice looking coffee maker and that is what you are paying for: looks. I wanted a coffee maker to match the other red appliances in our kitchen and this thing is gorgeous. However, you are paying a lot extra for a bare minimum of functionality with this unit. There is no timer. The on/off switch feels clunky. The LED to let you know it is on is very dim and hard to see. The water chamber is narrow and you have to be careful when pouring water in to avoid spilling elsewhere. About the only thing extra you get with this is a permanent filter, but I don't think that really justifies the extra cost. If I had the choice again, I would probably buy a more sturdy and better-built coffee maker for less money instead of just paying for high-priced clothing on something that should only cost a third of the price.

First of all, let me say that I have exceptionally high water pressure in my home, so maybe that is the thing that killed these filters. The filter that came with my faucet mount was supposed to be good for 200 gallons. When it hit 8 gallons, it automatically jumped up to reading 35 gallons and the water started tasting like regular tap water. I really liked the look and feel of that faucet mount, and I was just hoping that the included filter was just a dud. I decided to give it another chance with these replacement filters. Unfortunately, I had no better luck with these. One of them only lasted 3 gallons before the water started tasting unfiltered again, one only lasted 13 gallons, and the third one actually cracked open. I am very disappointed. I have since then switched to a Tap Master unit that sits on the ledge of the sink and only attaches to the faucet by a hose. It has worked much better.

We moved in to an all-electric townhouse recently, and I felt the pain of that all-electric setup when I got the $300 electric bill for our first month there! So, I was on an immediate mission to save energy wherever I could. One of the things I noticed was that both the intake and output pipes on the electric water heater were hot to the touch. Those hot pipes sitting out in the exposed air translate to wasted energy. So, I wrapped them with this tape. The tape sticks well and does a great job of insulation. So far, in the three weeks since I got that monster electric bill, I have managed to trim our usage by about 30%, and I am sure that insulating those pipes was one of the factors that helped.

I used the 500-light set of these along the back fence of our small townhouse patio. The fence is probably about 15 feet long and 5 feet tall. I ran the light string from top to bottom going along the whole fence, with about six inches between each lap. There was enough length to cover the whole fence in this fashion, and even a few feet extra to string through a small tree at the corner of the fence. Instead of putting the solar charger in the ground, I tie-wrapped the stake to the top of the fence and that must have been a good location because the lights stay on all night. They come on as soon as the sun goes down (around 7:00 right now), and are still on at 6:00 the next morning. In fact they don't go off at all until the ambient light sensor sees sunlight. They don't provide a whole lot of light. In fact, it probably wouldn't even be enough light to eat or read by, but they do provide a nice atmosphere on our patio.

First and foremost, it works. My 18-month-old daughter has a problem with thin hair that gets dry and frizzy very easily in our climate. This stuff solved the problem. As other reviewers have mentioned, it is just too greasy to use as a leave-in conditioner but it works well as a rinse-out. If I had to complain about anything, it would just be that it takes a whole lot of this conditioner to work on a small amount of hair. The amount I have to use is probably about 1/8 cup, and my daughter's thin hair is only down to her shoulders when wet. However, I don't mind using a lot of this conditioner to prevent the Phil Specter hair style she was sporting before.

The speed of this modem is just fantastic, but I should have learned the lesson from the first Motorola Surfboard cable modem that I had some ten years ago because this one has the exact same problem. Sometimes it just loses its connection for no reason. According to the lights on the front, it is sending, receiving, connected to the web, and passing traffic OK, but my system shows that there is no connection. I unplug BOTH the power and the cable connection (just unplugging power never solves the problem) for about five minutes, and then plug everything back in and it usually works fine. I have been using this modem for about two months now, and I have had to do this unplug/reset at least four times now. Other than the times it loses connection, it works fine, but I can't see giving more than three stars to something that has to be reset so often.

This thing is huge, so I recommend that you take measurements before you order it and make sure that you want a cross this big. In our case, we did take measurements but it still looks bigger in life than we expected.In the case of the star at the middle of the cross, it is much more prominent in life than the pictures would have you believe. That wouldn't be a problem for us because we ordered this piece for decoration in a celestial themed guest bathroom, but unfortunately the star has more of a "bless Texas" look than a celestial look.Anyhow, the cross will fill the wall for now, but I suspect that we will be looking for something more fitting for our application, and this thing will be taking a trip to the thrift store.

Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice...fool me twice...fool me twice you can't get fooled again!I have been through two of these units and I will never buy another Pur product again. The first one sprung a leak within the first month. The leak was around the connection point where it attaches to the faucet. It started as a small trickle that was no more than a nuisance, but within a week the trickle turned to a spray that was too big to ignore or even work with.Since this was the only faucet filter offered at the local OSH store, I made the mistake of getting another one. The second one started locking up within the first couple weeks. It would occasionally stop flowing water from the regular aerator side, like a valve was locked up. Of course, the locking up problem continued to get worse until it got to a point where it wouldn't flow water through the aerator side at all. I could still get filtered water, but for the regular faucet we would have to completely disconnect this unit.That is enough, and I feel like a complete sucker for buying two of these cheap units. I should have come to Amazon and read reviews on all of them first. I just ordered the Dupont 200 gallon faucet filter, and hopefully I will have better luck with that one.

My original intention was to mount this on the back of one of the bathroom doors. However, I tested it without mounting it first and it turns out that it would just get in the way too much when opened. So, I ended up mounting it out in the laundry closet instead. It seems sturdy, and it will be out of the way when it is folded up, but we will have to hang our drip-dry stuff outside now. My advice is to measure first and check your preferred mounting location before ordering.
What can you say about a spoon and fork? They work well and they hold up in the dishwasher without fading or cracking. The fork is a good starter fork for a toddler because the tines are not sharp.

We recently moved into a rental townhouse that has very old in-wall radiant heating. After receiving a $300 electric bill for the first month, I realized we would need to come up with some other solution for heating. I ordered two of these for the bedrooms, and they are doing the job well. I have not received another electric bill yet, but we have a smart meter and can check our usage daily through the Edison website. So far, it looks like we have cut our electric usage in half by using these heaters instead of the radiant heating. I give four stars instead of five because you can only set the temperature in five degree increments. 70 feels a little cool and 75 feels a little warm, so I wish there was a setting in between those two temperatures.

Just like other reviewers, I had a wireless doorbell button that came with inferior mounting tape. This solved the problem. The only thing I feel is worth mentioning is that this tape is thinner than most foam double-sided tape. Because of the geometry on the back of our doorbell button, I actually had to use two layers of this tape to make it thick enough, but it is holding up well and even went through a recent rain storm without budging.

We had a crisis in our home. I could never close our bedroom or bathroom doors because my wife always had her bras hanging on the door handles. And then, every time someone was coming to visit, there was always a mad dash to put all the bras away. I hung one of these on a bathroom hook behind the door, and the problem is solved.

We moved into a rental townhouse that has tile floors throughout the first floor. They are beautiful floors, and they were even part of the reason that we chose this unit, but the problem with them is that furniture slides around too easily. Every time I closed my recliner, it would slide back instead of closing. These solved the problem. My recliner stays put now. If you have some kind of hard floors, you need these to keep your furniture from sliding. Highly recommended.

I don't know why others have had so much trouble with this caddy. I was able to put it together and position the shelves with no problem, and they are all straight. I think the key to getting the shelves straight and secure is to ensure that the entire bushing is under the collar. If part of it is sticking out, the shelf will sag or slip.

The original doorbell in our rental townhome had been plastered over, obviously broken years ago. However, it is a two-story unit and if someone is knocking on the front door it would be difficult to hear in the back bedroom upstairs. So, I put one of the receivers in the living room and one of them in that back bedroom. It has worked well. Both receivers ring just fine. I originally had the ringer mounted on the wall where the original switch was, but the paint peeled away from the plaster job and I ended up moving it to the door frame. It still works fine there. I give four stars instead of five just because it would look better if it had some kind of stainless steel or brass case on the ringer. The white plastic just looks cheap but it works well.

The price seems a bit high for what you get. It is a simple frame with plastic roller guides and a very cheap trash can, but there doesn't seem to be anything equivalent in this size with a lid, so I guess some of the price is for availability. Anyhow, it works well, and it got the trash can out of the way in our little townhouse kitchen. I recommend thoroughly checking all measurements and making sure that there will be no pipes or anything else in the way. By the way, there is about six inches of storage behind the trash can on the platform that could also be used for storage. In our case, we keep a box of Swiffer refills there.

My trailer hitch receiver had been nothing more than a decorative feature for the last eight years that I owned my pickup, but I finally got a chance to use it during a recent move. Lo and behold, I had no trailer ball to hook a U-Haul trailer to. This served the purpose perfectly. Some of the chrome did rub off the top of the ball, but I didn't buy this for decoration, so I don't care about the missing chrome. If you need an inexpensive and sturdy ball hitch for occasional use, I would recommend this one.

I ordered the XL size to fit my half and half (half charcoal, half propane) grill, and I probably could have done just fine with the large size, but it is a nice looking and sturdy grill cover that I am sure will keep my grill well-protected for years to come. The only reason I give four stars instead of five is that the elastic cinch cord is rather useless. Because the cover is so thick and heavy, the cord just stretches without forcing the cover to tighten around the bottom at all. So, I don't even use the cinch cord. Thankfully, I live in southern California, where we are not likely to see much challenging weather, and I do believe that the cover will stay put just fine without using the cinch cord. Overall I am happy with it but I would recommend a design change to put several sections of cinch cord rather than one long one that is not capable of bunching up such a thick material.

The original crib mattress we had was the only one available at the local K-Mart. It cost about half the price of this memory foam mattress, and it worked ok for the first year or so of our daughter's life. It was just a cheap spring mattress with a plastic cover, and it was noisy and lumpy.Fast forward to 18 months. Our daughter was tossing and turning a lot, waking up at least once a night, and getting up very early in the morning, knowing that we would bring her in to our memory foam bed to sleep for a couple more hours.This mattress has solved that problem. We have only been using it for about a week now, but she doesn't wake up in the middle of the night anymore, and she doesn't get up an hour or two early anymore. Those two factors equate with a happier, better-rested baby, which means that mommy and daddy are also happier and better rested. This was money well spent. Five stars.

I must include the disclaimer that I haven't actually sat on this seat yet, so if it somehow ends up being uncomfortable I will downgrade my review later.The primary reason that I was ordering this seat was to accommodate a poorly designed toilet. When the toilet tank lid is properly aligned, the lip of the lid is directly above the seat mounting holes. That means that the seat can never be raised to 90 degrees. As a man, this presents a unique problem that my wife would never notice. The cheap plastic lid that we had on there just wouldn't stay up unless I slid the tank lid back to create more room. That, of course, looked ugly, and was something that my wife just wouldn't tolerate. So, she kept putting the tank lid back to normal and I kept sliding it back so the seat would stay up. We had a real battle of wills going on in the bathroom!Anyhow, this seat solved that whole problem. The seat still doesn't lift all the way to 90 degrees, but it doesn't matter. It stays put at about 85 degrees, and won't close without a little tap. Then, it closes softly and quietly. I also like the lift-off hinges that will make cleaning easy.Five stars!

If you are planning to actually use your body pillow for sleeping, I would recommend against buying this pillow case. The material doesn't seem to be something that would breathe very well or feel comfortable to sleep against. Also, the zipper openings are substantially smaller than the sides of the case, which means that you have to squeeze the pillow down to even get it in the opening if you have a body pillow with any kind of thickness to it. In my case, I actually ended up ripping the stitches on both sides trying to pull the pillow in to the case. Thankfully, this body pillow is only being used as a decorative piece on our king bed, so we won't be sleeping on it and therefore I won't be returning it because it shouldn't have to come off for cleaning very often.
We are moving out of an apartment, and rather than try to clean the old range pans, I wanted to just order new ones. These were a perfect fit and they will save us a lot of work.

As other reviewers have noted, these suction cups don't stay attached to the bathtub tile very well. It looks like I am going to have to use other suction cups to hold up the bag, but then it will just be a red toy bag because the two Elmo figures are attached to the original suction cups. So, this ends up being an overpriced red toy bag with two useless Elmo suction cups.

Our living room is is decorated in earth tones, and I ordered this area rug just hoping that it would tie in without the dark brown being too overwhelming. I was pleasantly surprised! The picture does not do justice to the color variation shown in this rug. The tan stripes are much more prominent than the picture would have you believe. It ties in to our living room perfectly, and it is also a very sturdy rug. When it is rolled up, it stays firm rather than collapsing like some of the K-Mart and Ross rugs we have had over the years. If you are thinking about buying this rug, do yourself a favor and look at the zoomed in view. That will give you a much better idea of the overall look of it than the picture of the whole rug. Also, on our computer screen the picture of the whole rug makes it look like the lines are wavy. Thankfully, that is not the case. They are straight lines. This is one of the best purchases I have ever made of an un-reviewed item, and I think it probably deserves many more good reviews especially at this great price!

It took about a week before my 18-month-old daughter could gather the courage to touch this Yoda doll. The claws on his hands and feet make him look a little scary. But, she finally warmed up to him and all my geek father friends are jealous that my daughter knows how to say "Yoda."

This case has saved my phone from at least five drops so far without even a scratch on the case or the phone. The kickstand is also very useful as well. I downloaded the iHandySoft Alarm Clock Free app, which makes my phone screen look just like a regular alarm clock. With that app running and the phone propped up on my night stand, I now have no need for an alarm clock.

My wife loved every piece of this, including the keychain. So, she got the perfume that she wanted for Christmas and a few bonus items. She especially likes the small purse size bottle. This gift set is highly recommended.

It works great to keep my toddler daughter from hitting her head on the faucet, but it also covers the pull handle for turning on the shower. This wouldn't be a problem except for the fact that we also have a child's shower head extension that has been rendered somewhat useless when we can't get to the shower valve without removing this faucet cover. It would be five stars if it had a cutout for a shower valve.

Wow, you would think that a product labeled as "Valentines Day Long Stem Rose Boquet" would arrive on Valentine's day. Not so! This is the only time that Amazon's amazing shipping speed has been a negative factor. Valentine's day is on Friday. I ordered the roses on Monday. They delivered today (Wednesday, February 12th). So, my wife got a "Happy February 12th" rose boquet instead of the Valentines boquet.

It looks like it was made with an inkjet printer and a hobby button maker, but what should you expect for this price? It will do the job, but it is very cheap looking. You get what you pay for, I suppose.

I stumbled on to this box and to XBMC quite by accident. I was simply searching for a low-end HTPC to get us by while we wait for the homeowner's association to approve a satellite antenna. At this price, I had to at least try it. So far, it is working for its intended job, but the use is just a little cumbersome. Details below. Overall, I would recommend this box if you need an entertainment solution and you cannot afford one of the slim-profile HTPC's that are now available. I would also recommend it if you need portability. If you can afford a true Windows HTPC and don't mind leaving it hooked up to one TV, I would say just go that route and install the Windows XBMC version on that HTPC.HARDWAREThis works out pretty well most of the time, but a couple of times I have had to unplug and re-plug the G-Mouse II receiver because it failed to pair with the mouse, even after going through the pairing procedure in the directions. Also, when the mouse goes into sleep mode it automatically re-enables the air mouse function when you wake it back up. This is a bit of a pain because much of XBMC is easier to navigate with the directional button instead. Also, it seems that you have to turn off the air mouse to get the video menu to go away while you are watching a video. Otherwise, it will keep popping back up. Even with the mouse function disabled I sometimes have to hit the "back" button on the remote three or four times to finally get the video menu to disappear. The mouse pointer does not disappear with the mouse function turned off, so you always have to wait for it to fade out on its own. Also, the keyboard side of the G-Mouse doesn't work well. It sometimes misses key clicks, and since it is not in a true QWERTY layout, I end up having to look up at the screen after each key press, then looking back down at the remote for the next letter. I may just end up switching to a good old logitech wireless mouse and keyboard setup, as I think that would be easier than this compact solution. As far as the actual box goes, it is nice and compact (probably about 6" square by 2" tall), and I like the fact that it has both HDMI and composite outputs. Because of that, I can use it on the big LCD tv in our living room, or any of the old CRT televisions in our bedrooms and it is very easy to move around. It also has Wi-Fi so I can literally use this box anywhere in the house, or I could even take it to a friend's house if the occasion should arise.XBMCI had never even heard of XBMC before I found this box, but since it took about a week to arrive I had some time to play with it on other devices. I installed it on my Android phone, my daughter's Android tablet, and my Windows 7 desktop. If you have also never heard of XBMC, do yourself a favor and watch some of the tutorials on Youtube, as those have been a tremendous help. The overall concept of XBMC is great. If you are a patient enough person to find good working sources for your regular shows and the movies you would like to see, and if you know the schedule of all your shows well enough to know exactly when they air, then you could very well use XBMC as a cable replacement. I am not patient enough for that, and I have been using a DVR box for so long that I don't even know when most of my shows air, so I don't know when to look for a new episode on XBMC. I guess I still miss the convenience of having a DVR box that automatically records my shows and puts them in one place for me, and I will be looking forward to having my satellite installed so I can get back to using one. I will still use XBMC to look for movies and older TV series after that, however, and it may very well be a true replacement for Netflix. I have been able to easily find any shows that Netflix carries on XBMC, including Netflix original series. As far as the difference between the Windows and Android versions of the software, they are functionally the same but the Windows version does seem to run more smoothly for some reason. Perhaps because this software was originally designed for a Microsoft system?ANDROIDI have not used much on the Android side of this system, but I can verify that Netflix and Gmail work. That being said, the Android version of Netflix is meant for a touch screen and it is a pain to navigate on this system. I probably won't ever use it, and I really don't have much need to surf the web or check email on my television, not when I can already do all of that on my phone. I think I just convinced myself to set this box to always boot into XBMC. If you want to use Android apps on your television, then this box is definitely the answer for you. Just be aware that Android apps are designed for a touch screen and navigating some of them with an air mouse is going to be clunky.OVERALLMy overall impression of this box is three stars. It works as a way to get free entertainment if you don't mind the cumbersome nature of navigating it. Ultimately, I think it is going to be relegated to occasional use for a movie or show that I cannot find elsewhere, and if I had the decision to make over again I probably would have bought a slim HTPC and installed XBMC on that instead.

This is the most basic thermostat on the market, and I bought it to replace the very same model that the landlord had in our condo. I would have waited for the landlord to replace it, but at this cheap price it was faster and easier for me to take care of it myself. The problem with the old one was that the relay had stiffened up with time and we had to turn the temperature way above what we really wanted to get it to even come on, then the condo would get way too hot because of the high temperature setting. That means that, to avoid waking up in the middle of the night in a pool of sweat, we basically didn't use the heat at night. The new one works as it should, but because we already had a problem with the same model I am not convinced of its longevity. If this were my house and not a rental, I would put in something better.

UPDATE:We took a road trip from the California coast to eastern Arizona with this thing, and it held up ok enough that I don't feel like I need to lower the rating on it, but there are a couple of things I should mention. The plastic support piece to use with narrow bars slid loose a bit over the course of our trip and made a constant noise. I probably won't be using that piece again. Also, the mounting plates all bent, so I know that I had the carrier mounted down tight enough. The plastic support pieces are just another example of poor design work. Also, since the mounting plates bent I am going to have to reinforce them with unistrut or bar stock before using this carrier again. If I had any kind of plans to keep this mounted for any kind of regular use I would return it and get a hard case. We only take one road trip a year, and with some modifications I can make this work for that. However, I would NOT recommend this carrier to others. Just get a hard case or a rooftop bag. This attempt at a hybrid between the two was a great idea, but poorly implemented.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I have not even taken this thing out on the road yet and it already only gets three stars! I don't do this lightly, and I usually write decent product reviews following well-researched purchases. I am sorry to admit that this thing fooled me.First of all, let me say that I bought this for two primary reasons:1. It is cheap.2. It can collapse down when not in use.It still passes muster for those two items, or I wouldn't even be giving it three stars. I can also add that it does look nice and tidy when it is folded down. I was able to tuck all the straps under the cover, and that is nice.However, there are some serious problems with material design and quality control at this company. Here is a list of the things that are already wrong before I have even gone on the first road trip:1. One of the plastic clips to connect the front of the wind screen is completely missing. I don't mean they just forgot the plastic part, but they never sewed the nylon strap in at all. I am sure the velcro will be enough to hold it, but it is an inconsistency, and it will leave the receiver for that clip free to just flap in the wind. It looks like this will have to be a job for duct tape!2. They include plastic support pieces to put under your roof rack if you have a roof rack with narrow bars (which I do). That is a nice concept, but the problem is they sent two of the short-sized ones, one of which is not long enough to fit the rear mounts. So, I was able to reinforce the front mount and that is where the most force will be felt, but I wish I could have done the same on the rear.3. There are eight mounting nuts (two at each corner) with molded plastic knobs to tighten them down. Of those eight, five of the plastic knobs broke off of the nuts while I was tightening them down. I might have gone too tight on some, but two of them cracked in my hand before they were very tight at all. I was able to finish the job with a crescent wrench, but that plastic also serves to hold the mounting bracket, and the nut underneath it is too narrow to grasp the bracket securely. I am going to have to add some washers to make them work properly.4. When folding it down, you are supposed to clip the top of the wind screen to some plastic clips on the side to hold the wind screen down. The problem is that the nylon straps on those side clips are not long enough to reach the wind screen. Again, this is poor quality control, and it renders those side clips useless! Another job for duct tape to at least secure those useless side clips.5. Don't believe the picture of this thing when it is fully expanded. It looks nice and rigid in the picture, and that might have been how it looked off the factory floor before it got folded into a box, but because of the way it is packaged it has big creases along the middle. It might fill out to look something like this when it is full, but it is not nearly as rigid as the picture would lead you to believe.6. It sags on the bottom. You would think that the bottom of it is rigid from the picture, but in reality the only rigid areas of the bottom are the areas where the aluminum frame is. Everything else is loose fabric and that is going to mean that it is going to sag down and touch the roof of the car when loaded. This is not necessarily a functional problem, but it will look ugly.If I had the time to do so, I would just return this thing for a refund and look for some other solution. Unfortunately, today is Saturday and we are leaving for a road trip on Tuesday. So, we are stuck using this for now. If there are any more disappointments after this trip, I will be returning it and downgrading this review.

These racks came in one day earlier than the projection, so I was able to get an early start on something that was supposed to be a weekend project. I was able to mount these on my wife's Kia Sorento in the dark with no problem. It only took about ten minutes to put them on, and they seem to be very secure. I will come back and downgrade my review later if we have problems, but for now, they were well worth the reasonable price and they arrived quicker than expected. Five stars

I wanted to put up a review for others who are wondering about this product but I must confess that I have not even used it yet. It is the correct purge solenoid for my 2003 Dodge Dakota 4.7L, but I ordered both this and the NVLD at the same time while I was chasing a P0440 and P0441 MIL code. The NVLD solved the problem, so I have never had to change the purge solenoid yet. Since I already know this is the correct part I am just going to keep it for use at some later time.
Time will tell how well this screen protector holds up, but it was very easy to put on and did not diminish the functionality of the touch screen one bit. Five stars

This case was for my wife's phone. Usually she would leave it to me to install this kind of thing, but to my surprise she was so excited when it came in that she opened it and put it on the phone for herself. She said it was very easy to install and it is a nice looking case.

Well, there is not much to say about this book because there is not much to it. You can make up a story or explain the pictures to your child, but there really is no story to read. It just says "Hug" on every page.

It is a nice looking shirt, but the fit is kind of tight. Particularly in the neck, this shirt fits tighter than other tshirts of the same size. I was able to stretch out the neck to make it more usable, but now the neck has that wrinkled look.

It works just like it is supposed to. Some time ago I had upgraded to a DVI cable for the Wii, and I guess I threw away the original A/V cable that came with it. So, when I wanted to move the Wii to an older television I had no choice but to buy this replacement cable. I am so glad that it is still readily available.

I ordered this for my wife, figuring she could at least use it to sleep in or while she is cleaning, but unfortunately it is just not a comfortable fit. It is tight compared with other tshirts of the same size.

The Anti-Inflammatory Diet & Action Plans book is filled with informative sections and tips on reducing inflammation. Part I is filled with Actions Plans – understanding inflammation, empowered eating for healthy living and the Anti-Inflammatory Action Plans. There is a Vegan Action Plan, Paleo Action Plan, Mediterranean Action Plan and the Time-Saving Action Plan.Part II are recipes from smoothies to breakfast to soups to desserts and snacks; it’s all covered. There are a ton of recipes that look delicious. The one downside is that I like pictures of what things are “supposed” to look like and this has a few pictures here and there. I can tell you I wouldn’t follow one of the action plans to the T because I have such a hard time with strict, stringent diets. I need the tips to keep inflammation down, though as well as some food ideas that I can incorporate into everyday living. I felt like there were some delicious recipes, particularly breakfast recipes, as that’s one of the hardest meals for me to prep and eat. The Coconut Rice with Berries looks delicious and easy; it’s on my list of things to try, as well as the Buckwheat Waffles, Coconut Pancakes and Sweet Potato Hash.I honestly can’t attest to the reduction of inflammation from eating a strict diet from this book, but I do that avoiding certain foods and eating whole, healthy foods is generally better for everyone, no matter what the ailment.*Book received for free in exchange for honest review*

I was a little disappointed in this NutraWork ULTIMATE Travel Coffee. I don’t feel like it insulates hot or cold beverages very well at all. The cold beverage was not cold in less than 1 hour…and my coffee felt too cold within about the same amount of time. I’ll keep with my go-to super insulated mug I’ve been using!*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

Got Me Tipsy's "What Night?" is such a nice addition to my wine glass collection (I am obsessed with wine glasses). The glass is a great gift! I'm buying a second one for this year's White Elephant at work to add to the bottle of wine. Any wine drinker would love to add this glass to their collection. Dishwasher safe, this is a nice quality glass and makes a great gift (if you don't end up keeping it for yourself!)*Product received at a promotional price for honest review*

I can only give this 3 stars because the pods themselves came busted. I wish they'd look into a better way to do the pods because the cleaner itself was pretty decent. I cleaned my engagement ring and it really did sparkle. However, the fact that you don't get the full 10 Power Pods because they come broken makes this a sub-par purchase.*Product received in exchange for honest review*

These were pretty disappointing earbuds. I was looking for something to play music while at work and I work in a very loud atmosphere. While my original iPhone earbuds do a good job, I'm always looking for extras or something different!Well, these didn't fit inside my ears well and they didn't block outside sound very well at all. The sound quality of the earbuds themselves were also pretty poor. I wouldn't waste my money on these and I cannot recommend them.*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

I was really happy to see how beautiful this was when it arrived! It's so pretty! I got this for my niece for my wedding. At first I was worried it would be too "pink" because my colors are coral and aqua but this could not have been more perfect!!! I'm not sure if I'm keeping the flower or adding something more nautical yet, but the flower is cute. I cannot wait to have her wear this!!!*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

I really like this Zen Rock Garden and I was prepared to not receive as many rocks as shown in the photo, so I wasn’t disappointed. I was not missing anything and no parts were broken when it arrived. It comes with a shallow wooden holder, sand, rake, a few rocks and even a cute little cauldron for incense.I have this on my desk, to try and keep me as de-stressed as possible; so when I can’t color, this is a great alternative to calm me down. I loved that it also came with a meditation e-book! Great to help you relax and it's the perfect size!*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

I honestly didn’t read the description very well and was expecting something more substantial.
