This is super lightweight plastic and even with 2 iPad Airs, an iPad mini and a Kindle, the organizer moves. I worry about this with 3 cats, so ours is placed someplace they don’t play near (and is also not far off the carpeted floor, in case it does fall).  It is a good price, but I think I’d rather pay a little more for something heavier and sturdier. Not a bad purchase, just know that this is not as heavy or sturdy as some other brands.*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

I've used a few wrap products on the market and most do tend to have some sort of result...even if it's just a little skin tightness. I really liked this wrap although 6-8 hrs is long for me to wear something. I wore these on work from home days with a shaper tank to hold it in place. Drank lots of water and had tighter skin and lost a few inches (1.5") to be exact. I'll take whatever help I can get! Results do seem to last only a few days but I'm using while dieting and exercising, so I hope I am also permanently losing inches!*product received for free in exchange for review*

My office moved into a temporary, makeshift space while our new office is being completed so we are without our good chairs (we sold the old ones and the new ones don't get delivered until we are in the real space). Needless to say, my back has been hating this office situation and the temporary chairs. This Lumbar Support cushion made quite a difference once I brought it in.The outside fabric is super soft and the memory foam inside has just the right amount of firmness to give that lumbar support I need while sitting 12 hours a day. I suffer from chronic back pain, following two car accidents in the past 2 years. Without lumbar support in a chair, i suffer all day long AND all night as well. There is nothing that helps my back completely, because of the damage that has been done but little things like this make life much more bearable. I am definitely very pleased with this product.*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

I am a huge Lip Scrub fan since my lips get chapped something wicked once fall hits. This Marshmallow Cream Organic Lip Scrubbing Balm is great! It exfoliates and also moisturizes. It made such a difference when I had my first "episode" of dry lips this year. What I really liked is the fact that I didn't need to put another moisturizer or lip balm on after this. It is delicious, too. My lips look and feel amazing. No more icky chapped skin! I also have the Coconut Cream Lip Balm by Treat Beauty that I use almost daily and adore. Great products and I love that they are organic!*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

I LOVE this Aroma Digital Rice Cooker and Food Steamer!!! We eat rice, probably once a week and this is so much better than throwing it in the microwave! I love that the rice cooker can be set to delay start, up to 15 hrs ahead!Okay, so this thing is AMAZING…Brown rice is so difficult to get perfectly cooked and this thing does it! While it may take longer than other methods, it’s worth it! It was easy to use but I definitely used the directions that came with the cooker, as opposed to what the package of rice said. It came out perfectly, not undercooked or burnt! I put the rice in, then rinsed it before adding water and turning on. I love that I set it before I left for work to start before I got home since I ended up working late that night.I also loved the extra veggie steamer that was included in the box…I’m a sucker for kitchen gadgets, what can I say? The one thing I would change is the volume. I wish it was lower (or at least adjustable). The first time it went off, I thought there was a fire in my house!*Product received in exchange for honest review*

Well, the first thing I noticed is that there weren't pictures...it's a cookbook! I NEED pictures as someone who is "new" to the kitchen. So, it loses a few stars for me. I'm new to Korean food and truthfully, I expected to not find any recipes I was willing to try. I did find a few that I would like to make and I think I even found 2 that my picky-eater fiance will eat! I'm pretty sure I already mentioned this, but I really would have loved pictures to make sure I was on the right track. I'm waiting for my next non-Nutrisystem meal to make a few of the appetizers and rice dishes. I did find the background information provided very interesting and informative. Again, pictures in a cookbook are a must!*Product received in exchange for honest review*

I was really excited to check out The Acid Reflux Escape Plan. I am overweight and sometimes suffer from bad Acid Reflux…so bad, that I take Protonix regularly to help deal with it. I am always looking into non-pharmaceutical solutions and this book is definitely a good alternative.The Acid Reflux Escape Plan helps explain acid reflux and GERD as well as including a 2 week meal plan and includes over 100 recipes!This book has a lot of tools for helping manage reflux/heartburn. There are lists of foods to avoid (and ones you can eat!), shopping lists of foods to help combat reflux/GERD symptoms and even tips on immediate relief from heartburn! I really liked the chart they included to help you keep track of triggers. I think paying attention to causes is really important in managing reflux. I know that personally, one of my biggest triggers is eating too much food at one time. Almost every time I don’t stop when I know I’ve reached my limit, my stomach lets me know.The recipes look delicious…I admit, I haven’t tried them out yet but I am currently on NutriSystem and only eating a few non-plan meals a week.*Product received for free in exchange for honest review*

These Primed4U Bluetooth headphones are pretty nice. These are my first Bluetooth headphones and I have to say, I love the lack of cords! I work in an office and do have to get up to walk over to the files and the cord of normal earbuds is the one thing I can’t stand!I love that the earbuds are equipped with controls, too; I love being able to change the song or volume without needing the phone out of my pocket! They charged super quickly and lasted a decent amount of time on a single charge! The sound quality was great. Seriously awesome for a relatively inexpensive Bluetooth headphone set!I didn’t use these for calls. Honestly, I don’t talk on my phone very much at all and when I do, I make sure I am some place where I don’t have to use hands-free. So, I can’t attest to the quality of phone calls. However, the mic location does make me think that it may be difficult for the person on the other side of the call to hear you.*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

This is a really nice herb grinder, especially for this price point. It’s much bigger than my current herb grinder and quite a bit heavier, as well. Made from zinc alloy, durable is the first thing I thought of when I inspected it. It was packaged very nicely and even had a velvet drawstring pouch.I love that this is a three-chamber grinder. The top grinds the herbs, the middle filters out the pollen and the bottom is for pollen collection and even comes with a pollen scraper. Now, for the real test....it works great! the grinder teeth are razor sharp and this grinder is so easy to use (and clean)! Highly recommend!*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

This laptop bag is a decent enough looking bag made out of dark brown PU leather. I decided to give this to my brother who was looking for a new bag and well, he gave it a 3* out of 5 rating. He said it looked to “feminine” and more like a man purse than a men’s briefcase. Obviously, the shoulder strap is removable and you can use it as either but he just didn’t love the design of the bag. Not masculine enough. He did like the pockets; there is a large pocket on the outside as well as a large zippered pocket inside and two small pockets, just like you see with a large handbag or tote.All in all, if this is what you are looking for in a bag, or this is your style, then this is a decent bag. For him, he was looking for something more distinguished and masculine. I couldn’t use it since I don’t particularly love this style bag for the transport of my work laptop. My personal rating would be a 3* as well, just because the price is a little high for the overall quality. I don’t love the “lack” of protection the inside zipper pocket provides. I need something that will pad and protect my laptop.*Product received at a promotional price in exchange for honest review*

I love scarves, particularly because I tend to wear all black and people always say I look like I’m going to funeral (I wear all black because it looks slimming). Even when I’m not wearing all black, a scarf can dress up any outfit. This infinity scarf by Sexyinlife is a nice, lightweight chiffon scarf with a chevron pattern in hues of red, white, black and gray. It looks really nice on as well. The scarf is big enough to wrap 2 times (maybe 3 if you have a tiny neck). While I’m not usually a red person, this really does add pizzazz to my outfits and I got numerous compliments the day I wore it to work. It's a nice quality scarf for a nice price.*Product received at a discount in exchange for honest review*

I use these after a long day of being on my feet. I have been suffering from foot pain for over 5 years now and these do seem to help. While my primary foot pain tends to be under my toes, these compression socks don't really offer a lot of support but these do wonders for heel pain! They are made well, of high quality materials and they fit nicely. Not too tight at all! I actually wore this into work, when we were moving the office because I was experiencing a lot of foot pain and swelling after being on my feet running around all day for a few weeks. These were also great for reducing swelling.*Product received at a promotional discounted price in exchange for review*

I actually practice myofascial release with a lacrosse ball to relieve the back and shoulder pain I have from 2 car accidents in the past 2 years. I also occasionally use a foam roller, after a hard work out. My favorite are the balls with spikes. They get in to spots where nothing else can.The quality of the materials used are definitely good quality and it is well made. However, I felt like it was difficult to use for pretty much everything except the legs and I really just like what I was using already a lot better. Maybe it was the weight; it seems heavy, especially compared to a foam roller. It made using it cumbersome to use.I was excited to get this to review, thinking that it could be another thing to add to my repertoire. I did a little research and I think that this would probably be great for someone who no longer got the relief they wanted from the foam rollers but this seems too hard to me. If you're looking for a pvc solid roller, this is for you. I'll stick to my lacrosse balls and foam roller.*Product received in exchange for honest review*

These curtains are very sheer, but look beautiful on the door. I have odd sized windows in my house and all the windows are either super wide or super short so this was the best place for these beauties. The set would be perfect for a single window measuring between 30-40” (they measure 38” wide each panel), in order to give a little fullness. I’d recommend 2 panels for every 30-36” of window to give a nice fuller look. They are 84” long so in a room with standard 8” ceilings, these are almost to the floor if hung right above the trim.These look super cute in my dining room! Thinking about getting more so that I can use these in another room!*Product received in exchange for my honest review*

This purple sea urchin light is really cute. I have it on a small shelf with some other knick-knacks because it was underwhelming where I had planned to use it; to be honest, it is quite small for the price. It’s too small to be really useful as a light so I’d recommend if you are looking for a cute little decoration.Mine did have a small nick in the candle holder so had I purchased this, it would need to be returned or exchanged. It’s small but at almost $17, I’d definitely be getting a new one if it arrived damaged. All in all, while it’s cute, I’d only really recommend this if it dropped to a $10 price point for the quality of the items. And the size…or lack thereof.UPDATE: I was given a little background on the process to make these things and the pricing is driven by the expense of having to ship delicate urchin skeletons and the time to hand make each one. This makes me understand the pricing a little more and while a true sea-life aficionado will appreciate the time and effort put into this but an everyday consumer would not.Customer service was wonderful; they contacted me about replacing my damaged candle holder but truthfully, where it sits, no one will ever see the small chip missing. I did appreciate the offer however and would recommend SeaThingz for all the sea life lovers out there!*Product received at a discount in exchange for honest review*

I have been battling insomnia for years and have been using lavender scents to help calm me before bed.The Sleep Balm by MIG Soap and Body Company is easy to apply; just remove cap, twist like chapstick and apply! It looks like a large chapstick. It’s chemical-free and organic and is comprised of olive oil, beeswax, castor oil and 6 essential oils (lavender, chamomile and ginger are the ones listed).I don’t love that the entire list of EO isn’t available, as I like knowing exactly what is in the product I’m using. However, I do love this sleep balm. I apply to my wrist and inhale deeply a few times. It’s a pretty strong scent so only a little is needed! It’s much easier to use than straight essential oils so this has become my nighttime routine.*Product received at a discount in exchange for my honest review*

XTAVA Define Lashes Volumizing Waterproof Mascara was a bit of a disappointment for me. I was excited for “volumizing” and “waterproof” but it certainly lacked in the volume department; it took 3-4 coats to even look like I was wearing mascara!  The formula was very light and thin and didn’t really volumize my lashes like other mascaras. It did stay on all day and my lashes did look okay after several coats, I just prefer one (maybe 2) coats. It didn’t clump, which was another benefit. I think I’d just rename it and not make the emphasis on “volumizing” when that doesn’t seem to be the real focus here. It’s a bit expensive, considering how many layers you need to get the right look.*Product received in exchange for honest review*

This doll is adorable, although it is a bit freaky how real she looks. I didn't leave her in the car, for fear that someone might break the window to get her out of a hot car! I like how the baby is weighted, to make it "feel" more realistic. The head and arms and legs are plastic, while the body is a soft cotton. You can move the limbs and my doll's head comes off super easy; was considering gluing but then she would always have to look one direction. Another thing I love is the level of detail, just in general. The doll comes with a diaper, onesie and outfit including headband but she can be re-dressed! I have a 7 year old niece who loves to change what her dolls are wearing so this is awesome.While I personally wouldn't purchase this doll for a child to play with because the price is just too expensive to just get dirty and destroyed. Instead, these are meant for collectors, who will preserve and display the doll for many years to come. While I am not a doll collector, she does look quite pretty in my glass door bookshelf! I will be gifting to my niece for her birthday in a few days, but with the instructions that she isn't a play doll but instead a "special" doll that sits on the self looking pretty!*Product received at a discount in exchange for honest review*

I love these Riverberry Women's "Chloe" Faux Suede Ankle Booties. I was very impressed with the quality when they arrived; they are well-constructed and cute. I ordered the camel and am in love. They are faux suede, but really look like the real thing. The 9 fit perfectly but I did have socks on, like I always do when breaking in new shoes. They weren’t super uncomfortable like some boots are when you first receive them. I have plantar fasciitis and don’t wear heels very often, except to work when I know I’ll be at my desk for the majority of the day. I wore these once and managed to survive the day. They are pretty comfortable.I can’t wait for all the other outfits I can pair these with! I’ve worn with my capris so far but I’m about to pull out my fall wardrobe and they will look adorable with some of my dresses, too! I’m thinking about ordering the black as well!*Received this product at a discount in exchange for honest review*

I am hard on my personal phone so this wouldn’t be a good case for me (I use the Speck CandyShell cases). However, I have an iPhone5 for work, that doesn’t get used and abused like my personal phone. It mostly sits in my purse while I am at work…and in my purse at home. Work didn’t provide an additional case so I had to get my own and this was perfect. It’s a little, lightweight silicone case that protects from scratching. It fit the iPhone 5 perfectly and has holes for the ports and they were all perfect fits and the phone doesn’t lose any functionality. Of course, the phrase is PERFECT for my work phone, too. Everyone has been asking where I got it! If you don’t need a lot of protection but want a nice, affordable phone case, this is the one for you!*Product received at a discount in exchange for honest review*

I’ve never had a pepper grinder/mill so I was excited to get one! The design is a classy, simple stainless steel finish; it is 8 ½” tall and 6 ½” in diameter. The top of the grinder has a button that works both the LED light and the grinder. There is a small screw on the bottom to adjust the coarseness of the grind. It uses 4 AA batteries (not included, of course). Now, I have nothing to compare this to, but it seems to work fine. Loading the mill was a bit cumbersome and took a bit to get used to. It seems to work as advertised but I honestly don’t know if I’d use something like this regularly.*Product received in exchange for honest review*

I love avocado but I hate pitting and slicing it; it’s just too much work! Well, not anymore! This Avanchy 3-in-1 Avocado Slicer splits, pits and slices! No more risking of being rushed to the hospital after stabbing yourself with the knife (I came close, way too many times). I can’t believe how easy it was to use, either. I was a little cautious at first, since it is just plastic but the plastic is actually made from super durable, FDA approved materials. It’s dishwasher safe and is easy to clean. You can’t beat that.You also can’t beat the bonus Strawberry Corer! I love fresh strawberries but hate the prep work of them, when I’m on the go and trying to make a quick smoothie. I end up using frozen ones because they are already stripped of their stems! The design of this thing is pretty cool, too. My 6 year old niece loves using it. Just push the green button on top and cool stainless steel claws come out. Insert into the strawberry and pull!*Product received in exchange for honest review*

These are a great idea but sadly, they were too big for my Mazda3. They worked well in my sister’s crossover but when we tried my car, they didn’t function as intended. Wish they came in multiple sizes! They were nice quality.*Product received at a discount in exchange for honest review*

I really like these tattoos. With over 75 designs, there are a lot of choices! I love the look of them against my tanned skin in the summer, too. They are very easy to put on but they aren’t very long lasting. The good thing: there are a lot of them. They are $13.95 right now, or about 19 cents a tattoo. Not a bad price but some of the other brands out there last 5-6 days. I guess it depends on how quickly you want it to come off.*Product received at a discount in exchange for honest review*

The AquaCare 4-in-1 Rainfall Combo with Hand Shower & Rotating Hydro-Brush/Massager has a lot of really cool features. The shower head comes with 2-way Water Diverter with angle-adjustable Overhead Bracket, Plumber's Tape and Extra-long 6' Stainless Steel Hose with dual Conical Brass nuts for easy hand tightening for easy installation. This shower head is replacing one that did not have a removable handle so I’m pleased with it. I looked at fancy ones at Home Depot but I really didn’t want to pay their prices for my spare bathroom that I rarely use. This shower head has a bunch of cool features that the others didn’t have, too.  Not bad for the price.*Product received at a discount in exchange for honest review*

This is such a great product/idea!!! Sometimes I have to leave a key for my cleaners, if I have an appointment or have to go into work that day and I always HATED leaving it right under the mat, for fear that that UPS man would pick the mat up to "hide" my boxes delivered and someone would have free access to my home. I was pleasantly surprised to see how large the inside of this was. It could easily hold a key ring with a few keys!With this, I no longer have anxiety when I do have to leave my key for them and it is “hidden” in plain site.*Product received in exchange for honest review*

UPDATE: After 2 days of "heavier" use (i.e. left it running for the whole 6 hrs), the unit stopped working. Pretty sad that it only seemed to hold up when I used it for 1-2 hrs at a time. When I went to make this my primary diffuser, I got 2 days out of it before it broke!ORIGINAL REVIEW (4* rating)I am an essential oil fanatic and actually own SEVERAL diffusers to spread throughout the house. This Bloomsure Diffuser has a very simple, sleek design and this particular design is in my bathroom, as it’s the perfect shape and size for one of the shelves. With the lights and some lavender oil, my bath is super relaxing and all I need is that glass of wine! I really loved the colors when I first used this (and still do). It’s so relaxing to just sit and watch as I’m chilling in the tub. You can set it to just one color, or have it cycle through.The diffuser is simple to use, just fill with water (be careful not to overfill), add a few drops of essential oils, plug in and turn on! The button on the right turns the unit on/off and the left button controls the light. The machine has an automatic shut off when it runs out of water. I generally run it about 2-3 hours at a time (no, I don’t have the luxury of taking a bath that long. I usually turn it on 45 mins before the bath to get the scent going in the bathroom, 30 minutes for the bath and then 30-ish minutes post bath time, as I’m washing my face and getting ready for bed.I’ve been using for a few weeks now, about 3 times a week and so far I haven’t run into any issues. I truly haven’t tested the automatic shut off, though, since I only run for short periods of time.*Product received in exchange for honest review*

I have these little tiny windows in my dining room (96” wide, 24” long) and I’ve been looking for something that accented the dark gray walls, white trim and gray mini blinds since it is my “dining room.” These curtains looked like they would be just what I was looking for!The set comes with (1) valance (56”x18”) and a pair of tiers (combined width 56” w/ 36” length). They are a cotton/polyester blend, with a canvas feel and appearance. They really are quite thick and definitely durable. Totally different from the normal, dainty kitchen curtains that you find in department stores. I did have a little crooked stitching on the bottom of one of the tiers, but I'm not sure how many people would ever be that close to my curtains to analyze.I think the valance looks great on the door. I’m actually thinking about using the fabric from the “too-long for my window” tiers and having short valances made for the big window because I do really love the way they look on the window but they don’t just sell the valances (and I need shorter than 18” since the window is only 24”)!!! I do really like the look and wish my house had normal windows!*Product received in exchange for honest review*

I have been trying to improve my flexibility with some stretching, per my trainer’s advice. This strap is so helpful in helping me in achieving that goal. The FiveFourTen Thick Yoga Strap / Yoga Belt with Steel D Rings is super durable, with a reinforced design and thick, rugged straps that are 8 ft long and 1.5” wide. It’s also lightweight and easy to carry, although I have only been using it in the privacy of my own home. I’m really glad that I got this!*Product received in exchange for honest review*

I take loads of Naproxen (generic name for Aleve) to help manage my inflammation issues. This GoodSense brand is a great price and seems to work just like the "real" stuff. I was getting prescription Naproxen but this price ends up being cheaper than that!

Can't complain, these are a great price for generic Tylenol. Works just like the real stuff but without the brand name price, and that's win-win for me. We go through this and other pain relievers like candy in this house!

I am a big fan of both Jeff Gold and Janet Montgomery. Their CDs have been so helpful in managing my anxiety and helping get me relaxed and to sleep. I was ecstatic to review this CD, as I am currently struggling with my weight and I’m getting married in 7 months!!! I need to drop 50 pounds and I’m looking for all the help I can get. Sadly, I got this CD a few weeks ago and misplaced it until a few days ago. I am a stress-eater and I can honestly say that I think this CD will be helpful in stopping me from turning to food in times of sadness, happiness and even despair. I have only been able to listen to it once so far but my goal is once or twice a day for the next few weeks. Janet’s voice, with Jeff’s melodies really can put me in a trance-like state. I’m excited to see what the next few weeks bring and will update my review with results!*Product received in exchange for honest review*

This voice recorder from iGearPro is a neat little device. It comes with the iGearPro voice recorder, a mini USB cable to charge/transfer files, an adapter to record landline phone calls as well as the headphones and microphones. The device itself is lightweight, very lightweight… almost “cheap” feeling, compared to some others I have tested.However, this voice recorder does work, just fine and it is definitely more user-friendly than may other models. It has 8 GB of memory and the battery seems to last around 10-12 hours. You can record and listen to the recording, right on the device. No need to download to a computer first!There are 3 speakers on the device and while the quality of the recording/speakers is not top of the line, it does work sufficiently. The quality of the recordings is 128kb, which is a lower quality but for the purpose of voice recordings, it’s fine! I would definitely not say “it sounds great” because it’s just not “great” quality so it’s not really possible but it does work. I used it in a class, to record the lecture because I was unable to take notes that day and it was exactly what I was hoping it would be! I was able to playback and take notes a few days later.It is easy to operate, charge and playback. While it is not the most impressive in terms of quality, it does do the job and for the average user, this is a perfect little gadget. It's not a bad price, considering...and I would consider purchasing again if I lost mine, simply because it is easy to use and gets the job done.*Product received in exchange for honest review*
Crayola Crayons are the only brand I will ever buy! Love the built in sharpener, too.

This is a great book if you’re looking to get your babies to eat healthy from the start! While I am not a mother, I have a few friends who are about to become first time moms. One of them is highly allergic to a few foods herself and wants to be as clean as possible with the baby’s foods!The first section has a lot of info and even includes a list of foods to avoid, and “how to.” It teaches you how to make your own baby food with clean, non-processed ingredients. You have better control over what you are putting in the baby’s body that way. I think if you teach kids young to eat fruits and veggies, they will always eat them. My niece is a perfect example. She’s six, loves fruits, smoothies and veggies and doesn’t like candy!The second part of the book are the recipes. And there are a TON of recipes. The recipes are simple and are even broken down into age groups! This book will get your baby eating right from the beginning!*Product received for review*

I’m going to be honest, I hate to cook. I work a demanding job, often not getting home until after 7pm and I just don’t want to cook when I get home after a long day. But my fiancé doesn’t want to be in charge of dinner every night either so we recently agreed I would be responsible 2-3 times a week.I’ve got no experience in the kitchen but can seem to follow a recipe okay so I’ve been trying to get my hands on as many cookbooks as I can. Fiancé is a little picky with food so I have to make adjustments to most things so he’ll eat it Dump dinners are super easy meals. Dump the ingredients and go! The Absolute Best Dump Dinners Cookbook has 75 recipes, along with tips for prepping meals in advance (I need to start trying to do this as well!). It provides a list of ingredients that you should always have on hand when you’re short on time and need to throw something together.  I have to say though, with a picky fiancé, I can’t really use a good amount of these recipes. There are delicious meals, don’t get me wrong, but just not kid-friendly meals, unless you have kids that will eat anything.I think this is a great book for the adventurous eater, in need of a few ideas. The two recipes I did attempt were really good though and something different. I have a feeling Taco Soup is going to be in our rotation.*Product received in exchange for honest review*

I LOVE this Ninja Master Prep! I’ve just gotten back “on track” and started making green smoothies and protein shakes (I’ve got 50 pounds to lose before my wedding in 9 months!). While I have a Nutribullet, it’s very loud and is sometimes too big for what I want to do. This Ninja Master Prep is PERFECT for those situations! It is awesome for chopping up ice for my smoothies, is easy to clean (that is a PLUS to me) and isn’t too noisy either! Blades seem pretty sharp since it does a nice job chopping ice. You might want to upgrade to the higher wattage if you’re the type who REALLY uses a blender. For me, this little guy is perfect. I can’t wait to try the salsa recipe that was included!*Product received in exchange for review*

I bought these on sale since I was running out of windex. I decided to try the wipes, since I am a huge fan of Lysol wipes for the kitchen and bathroom. I was pretty disappointed in the streaks they left behind on my sliding glass door. While they are easy to use, streaks annoy me as much, if not more, than dirty windows. Not sure I’d spend the money again since they do leave ugly streaks but for someone who wants clean but not perfectly clear windows or mirrors, these would work for you.

These straws are awesome for a “Girls Night Toy Party” or a Bachelorette Party. There are 15 in the pack, a mix of pink and purple. I love that the straws are BPA & Phthalates Free & Non-toxic AND they are made from recycled plastic. They are pretty sturdy straws, much thicker than most plastic straws! These are sure to be a hit at my bachelorette party!!! Will definitely be buying more!*Product received at a discount in exchange for review*

I bought this case at the suggestion of my IT fiancé. He owns the black poetic cases for his iPad Mini2. I had the sky blue one first and LOVE it but it randomly broke at the corner and I couldn’t keep it on anymore. I decided it was time for a switch so I picked the "lavender". The lavender is really more of a pink-purple color; I wish it had come in a real purple color. The fit is perfect and it doesn’t add much bulk or weight to the iPad itself, which I love. I also love the magnetic on the front of the case, which turns the iPad off when closed. Good for saving battery power!If you drop the case or have kids who play with your case, I wouldn’t necessarily recommend it, since my mom’s has broken each time my niece has dropped the case. Would definitely recommend something more like the Otterbox for those type of users. However, for me, this is perfect so I would buy this again.

This lock by the BicycleStore is really nice. I could tell as soon as I took it out of the package, that this was a quality lock. It's made of steel,PVC,ABS material. I love the added nylon, to keep it from scratching the bike!!! I also like that it's a 5 digit lock, as most bike locks are 4 digits. My stepdad can finally keep his bike outside of the house with this lock!*Product received in exchange for review*

I love grumpy cat so I jumped at the opportunity to get this shirt! The t-shirt itself is nice quality and the fit was as expected. It washes very nicely and hasn't really shrunk a lot in the wash!*Product received at a discount in exchange for review*

It's thicker than I expected it to be but it is a bit revealing. Super comfortable, I actually wear this around the house because then I don't have to worry about how revealing it is :) I ordered a large and normally wear a 14. Fit was pretty good.*product received at a discount for review*

This little guinea pig is so charming.  It will be a stocking stuffer for a family member who is fond of guinea pigs.  It is a zipper pull, and so quite small.  That could be a problem for very small children, but just fine for anyone past that "put everything in my mouth stage......"  Pig fanciers will be delighted with this pull, and it would also serve the useful purpose of making a zipper with a small tab easier to manage.

This is a bright, cheerful outfit.  The stretchy material makes it easy to put on and take off the doll.  All the seams are finished with zig zag stitching, so they wont fray or come loose.  The price is quite reasonable.  The velcro closure could snag the fabric, but with minimal care that can be avoided.  Most little girls would be able to manage it.  So, this is an attractive, reasonably priced outfit that should hold up well under use.

What can I say....Yorkshire Gold is my absolute favorite British Tea.  I was introduced to it while I was working and traveling in Scotland and Yorkshire.  At our home we drink only Yorkshire Gold, and even carry the tea bags with us when we travel.  It is a lovely balanced blend that will start your day off right and chase away the chill on a damp day.  I wouldn't be without it.

I had done a large needlepoint designed to be a piano bench cushion, and had not been able to find suitable, high quality foam to finish it.  This foam is just what I needed,  It is just the right width and is  very sturdy.  It should last for years to come.  The cushion is longer than I need for the bench cover, but the remaining foam will be handy to have on hand.  I am sure it will be useful in some future project.

I am quite pleased with this sturdy storage box.  I am using it to organize and keep safe a collection of old postcards that I have collected over the years.  They range back as far as the early 1900s and have great family and sentimental value.  It is so nice to have them safely filed where they can be easily located and are protected from strong light.

I have a fondness for these old travel posters and so ordered it straight away.  Unfortunately, the print is grainy and a bit out of focus.  The image appears to have been enlarged too much, leaving the poster blurry.  I will have to put it in a place where people can't get a close look at it...... I have wonderful memories of visiting Oban, so I had hoped to showcase the is poster.  Too bad.

This is a sturdy, reliable staple gun.  I use it for mounting needlepoint canvas on stretcher strips, but I am sure it would be equally useful for a wide range of art, craft, workshop and woodworking activities.  When I use this, I know that the canvas is going to stay firmly anchored to the frame until I am ready to take it off.  It is quite sturdy and easy to load.  Please note that if you have children, you will want to store this away from their reach, and preferably with the staples in a separate area.  It is not a toy, or a paper stapler.  It is a serious workshop tool.

This is a handy little shelf that allows me to stack kitchen wraps and other similar sized items in a slide out storage drawer that is tall, but only has low sides.  The rack measures  10 inches long x 7 1/2 inches wide by 9 inches tall.  Depending on what sort of boxes, etc you put on the shelf, you will need to allow additional height and or length for clearance of items than extend beyond the frame.  It is sturdy enough, although I do wish it had solid or  mesh shelves, rather than just the two curved wires to hold the boxes.  the open work limits the type and size of items you can stack on it.  It suits my purposes and helps keep the stored items together and within easy view.

This is such a charming little card.  If you have a guinea pig fan in your family, this is sure to please.  It is a lovely card on printed on good quality stock and blank on the inside, so you can write your own sentiment.  This card would also be  perfect to thank a pet sitter or kind Vet who has cared for you little pig.  It is bound to make anyone who loves guinea pigs smile.

These folding crates have been the solution to organizing my various hobby items.  I do a wide range of  handcrafts, sewing and collecting.  These attractive crates, (10 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 101/2 inches)  fit nicely on a book case or closet shelf, keeping  all sorts of bits and pieces together and in order.  They fold up easily when not in use, it is easy to store them out of the way, unlike bulky plastic bins.  I use them for handwork supplies, fabric, yarn, doll clothes (my dolls have way too many shoes) etc.... I will note that these crates are not suited for heavy items, as they are of light, fabric and "paste board" type construction.  So, they are great for clothing items, fabric, hats, etc. but won't work for mechanic tools or a rock collection......  But, that being said, they have held up well under daily use and the light weight makes them easy to carry from closet to work table, etc.

This is a cute little cross stitch pattern for anyone who is interested in learning to do cross stitch or wants a quick, fun project or gift.  It works up easily, and who doesn't like cupcakes?  It's small size means that it slips easily into a purse or bag for travel.  When finished, it would make a nice pin cushion or card, or could decorate a pocket or tote bag.  I am making several that will then become part of a doll quilt.  All you need to do is open it and start stitching.
A very handy and useful supply of cards for recipes, etc.  It saved me a trip to the store, which is a big plus for those of us who live in rural areas.

With this collection, your doll will be all set to explore jazz, ballet and modern dance.  Each of the garments are well made and fit an 18 inch doll and easy to put off and take off.  I particularly enjoy the included dance tee, and leg warmers.  Lots of fun at a very reasonable price.

I bought this a a gift for a friend who has connections to Nottingham.  It is a compact, well put together history of that very interesting city.  If you are interested in the topic this book is a fine starting point.  It provides a useful telling of the history of the city and is an engaging introduction to the place, without swamping the reader with footnotes and minutia.  There is a good deal more to Nottingham than Robin Hood and those Merry Me.  A good read.

I sorted through a number of ballet outfits before I settled on this one as the best at a reasonable price.  It is lovely, well made, and fits my doll quite well.  I particularly like the included matching panties, which are a needed finishing touch.  The ribbons on the slippers may be a bit fussy for children to deal with, but if they are a bother, you can just cut them off.  All in all, this is a real bargain at the price and a lovely addition to any doll wardrobe.

As their special needs son approaches adulthood, parents faces hard questions. This is a thoughtful book that will be of interest to many readers.  How does a family prepare for the changes ahead, and cope when even the best laid plans go astray.......

I am so pleased with this book.  It is a clear, straight forward workbook on how to finish needlework projects.  You will find clear illustrations and written directions that are easy to follow.  Finishing your own needlework gives you lots of options to personalize your work and saves money as well.  Happy Stitching.

First, this swimsuit is easy to put on and take off the doll.  the tie straps work like a charm.  And, I love the surf  board.  It is all ready for beach fun.  The beach towel, is not really a towel, plain and just a sort of small blanket really.  But, it serves the purpose and  so that is fine.  The shoes are also nifty, as every girl can always use more shoes.

This is just a perfect princess dress.  The train is long enough to really flow.  The sequins are well applied and are an interesting square shape, which creates a lovely pattern on the bodice.  The sewing is well done, especially considering the reasonable price.  (I have paid more for some less well finished doll clothes....)  The zipper closer at the back makes it easy to put on and off.  And, there is not the worry of snags and runs that velcro can cause.  All in all, I would order this again in a minute.  Lots of princess fun ahead.

This handy little pen lets you turn any drawing into a transfer for hand or machine stitching.  Follow the directions, trace the design and with the help of an iron, you will be able to create your own, personal stitched monograms, designs, emblems, etc  .  (And, if you don't stitch, you can use permanent ink markers to color in your transferred  designs.  Lots of creative fun for a small price.

This book is a lovely introduction to the woman behind the childhood classic Peter Rabbit books.  Beatrix Potter, one learns, was a complex woman, whose love of gardening saw her through a restrictive Victorian upbringing to find her own unique place in the world.  One of the best things about this book are the wonderful illustrations, many by Beatrix herself.  They include some of  her scientific works as well as her children's book illustrations.  This telling of her life will leave you with a real respect for the woman and her work.  Well done.

This book is an excellent, detailed Atlas of the lovely state of Michigan.  You will find it a great help in exploring the highways and back roads.  The atlas is 11 x 15, so the maps are large enough to be easy to read and contain useful details.  It is very handy for day trips and weekend excursions.  It is well indexed, and the listing of campgrounds, and suggested trips are quite useful.  Well done.

Another fine entry in the Maisie Dobbs series.  The stories continue to explore the era between the First and Second World Wars, providing a complex and absorbing mystery along the way.  Well done and thought provoking.

This book delivers a wide range of flower charts; modern, retro, a flower alphabet, numbers, days of the week, and more.  There are also garden themed charts and  a good number suitable for children's clothing, bibs, etc.  This is a sturdy, well bound book that should hold up to a lot of use.  These charts lets you turn small gifts into special treasures.  And, if you like larger projects, combine charts  to make lovely pillows, table clothes, etc.  I am using them as blocks for a lap quilt.  This is a fine collection that you will go back to again and again.

It is great to be able to buy these cartridges without going to the big box stores and waiting around for a clerk to show up eventually to unlock the case.......  And if you live in a rural area, a trip tot he store can involve a long drive.  This is much more convenient.  The cartridge was just fine and I am quite pleased.

These biscuits from the U.K. are a family favorite.  They are a not too sweet treat, perfect with tea or milk (or coffee if you must.)  I put them out when my adult sons visited and they disappeared like magic.  As an added bonus, the carb count per biscuit is reasonably low, so if you are counting carbs, you can still enjoy one or two without guilt.  The taste is simple but lovely., perhaps a little addictive........

It is wonderful to have this much loved series available at last.  It is going to be the perfect Father's Day gift.  We look forward to watching it together as a family and it is bound to evoke lovely memories of when our kids were growing up.  The gentle, realistic portrayal of this family is funny and yet touches the heart.  We are planning to watch one episode a week and enjoy every one.

This is a lovely design and the quality of the materials is quite good, but this is not a kit for beginners. First, the chart/stitch guide was in black and white.  That meant that it was very difficult to sort out what color went where, especially in areas with multiple colors in small areas. And it was not actually a chart, just a line drawing that suggested general areas for colors.  I just took my best guess.  So, be ready to improvise.  Second, parts of the design are worked in embroidery floss.  I actually like working with floss, but it is trickier to use than wool, and so not a good choice for beginners.  It is a bother to strip and separate floss and you have to stitch carefully to keep the stitches smooth and regular.  That being said, it is a lovely finished piece and a good way to practice shading if you are up to the task.

Yorkshire tea is my hands down favorite British tea.  And, I like the 80 bag size, as we go through a lot of tea at our house.  Yorkshire Red and its companion, Yorkshire Gold are my firm choice.  Give it a try.

As a new comer to Michigan, I am delighted with all the information in this book.  It gives one a real feel for the various towns and areas, as well as interesting bike rides.  This is an older book, and I gather out of print, but the information is still quite good.  And the small size makes it handy to carry along.  If you can find a copy on offer, I would encourage you to buy it.

Iron on transfers are an easy way to personalize any fabric project.  Follow the directions, iron the image onto fabric (cotton and other natural fabric work well), and then embroider.  Or, if you don't stitch, you can use permanent markers to  color the images.  The designs have a charming, retro look to them .  I am thinking of making a cloth travel story book for little ones with mine, but you can decorate towels, clothing, table linens, or whatever suits your fancy.

I quite like this little kitty, However, if you are looking for an American Girl doll accessory, this cat is about 1/3 larger than the kitties from AG.  So, it is really too large for 18 doll collectors.  That being said, it is an adorable little cat, with soft, fluffy fur.  And, of course anything that encourages people to donate to animal welfare is a good thing.

This sturdy little crate ( approx., 6 inch cube) is attractive enough to keep out on the counter or fits easily on a pantry shelf.  I am using mine to hold small dishcloths by my sink.  (They save on paper towels.....)  And, it is also great out on the deck for napkins, condiments, spoons and forks, etc.  Crafters will find the size handy for rounding up all those little items that are prone to go astray on the work table; thread, small tools, beads, etc.  And, whatever you store in them, the clear bin makes the items easy to spot on the shelf.  I am going to be ordering more of these.
I was very frustrated as the download was impossible to open and I did not receive any help whatsoever from the seller or Amazon.

The Maisie Dobbs series combines fine mysteries in the British tradition with an interesting portrayal of the history and cultural changes in Great Britain in the years following WW1.  Readers who have experienced the aftermath of more recent wars will feel a kinship with the characters trying to find or create a place for themselves in a changed society.  Well done.

This robe is soft, thick enough to be cuddly and just feels like a hug when I put it on.  I am a small framed person, and this size small fits me very well.  I also like the length, below the knee, but not all the way to the ankle.  It feels warm and cozy, which is much needed during this long winter.  I am very pleased, and look forward to years of comfortable mornings in this robe.  Miss Elaine is a brand I depend on.

These little cookies are just so charming.  They are perfect for 18 inch dolls, and the darling little box makes a fine way to store them when not in use.  They will be  on the nightstand for bed time snacks and in lunch boxes for school.  ; )  Lots of fun play as dolls and little ones make cookies together.

This is a nifty mystery.  It will keep you guessing and the characters are interesting and well developed.  The story goes back and forth in time as a young woman ,a structural engineer by trade, tries to sort out a puzzling little mystery she comes across as she works on an assignment in a deserted bank building. ( If you know any engineers, they are all about resolving questions.)  The characters are  diverse group that you want to learn more about.  The twists in the plot kept me guessing and eager to read the next chapter.  This author has an original style, and I am looking forward to her next book.

This seed is going to take care of a bare spot in my yard.  The price is reasonable, and it is so convenient to be able to have it delivered right to my door.  (It is a long trek from my home to a big box store for seed.)  Now, all I have to do is wait until the mountains of snow melt.........

This is one of those books well suited for an airplane trip or to pass time on a rainy day.  There are enough twists in the plot to keep one turning the pages.  The "Nancy Grace" style reporter adds a bit of satire to the plot.  But, in the end, there isn't much for the reader to take away, or ponder.  And, I think that small town Midwestern women are a bit more in touch with the world than this book would lead the reader to believe.....  So, the writer shows promise, and  perhaps her next book will show the reader a bit more character development.

I recently purchased a Brother HL-L2340DW Compact Laser Printer with Duplex Printing and Wireless Networking, so I feel that I have a good vantage point as to how difficult this item was to set up in comparison. Supposedly this Epson supports wireless printing - but after about an hour of fiddling, I wasn't able to get that to work and gave up. The only way I was able to get anything printed was with a direct USB connection. The Amazon listing says " Built-in wireless - print from tablets and smartphones". Well, that doesn't seem possible for iPhones or iPads. Not sure what other tablets/smartphones they're talking about.The print quality wasn't great, either - it didn't provide crisp black text, but more of a gray. The color was ok, but print quality was just really low. I assume this is an ink-saving strategy. If you want high quality color printouts, this isn't the printer I'd choose. Personally, I don't ever NEED to print in color, but thought it would be great to have the option. Well, now I'm still not convinced. I've definitely used really high quality color printers before, and this thing is nowhere near impressive enough to justify the extra cost involved.The ink comes in crazy plastic squeeze bottles that you use to fill reservoirs at the end of the printer. There are many warnings about carrying the printer ONLY UPRIGHT when moving it, lest the ink spill all over the place. I'm just ... not sure who made that design decision. Apparently the ink is a lot more environmentally-friendly than buying a ton of ink cartridges and replacing those over and over again, so that's good.The way this printer loads paper is crazy, too. It's not shown in the photo here on Amazon, but there's a pop-up plastic bit on the back that slides up and you put some paper in there. It's always sticking up and ends up curling and falling over. This is why paper trays were invented! This printer has no paper tray. There are just too many annoying things about it for me to give it a decent review - even with the built-in scanning functionality and eco-friendly angle, I've decided to give it away and will stick with my trusty Brother HL-L2340DW. I just don't want to have to deal with a "PC LOAD LETTER" rage incident every time I want to print!

This is a really nice tea towel, but EXPENSIVE! Full disclosure, I received this towel (just one) for free for reviewing purposes. It's nice and thick, and has a convenient bit on one corner so you can hang it from something, but $10 for ONE tea towel? The stitching isn't amazing. My cat likes to sleep on it. You can definitely get tea towels that are just as nice for a lot less, but probably not ones that are made of organic cotton. So that's a good selling point for this towel. I've bought organic cotton items before that are a lot less money for a lot more fabric, though.

This thing is great! Not as sturdy as the Belkin MIXIT cable, but that think is another $7. For $10, this thing is great. It's SHORT! But that's all I need - I wanted a cable that I could plug into my laptop to have my phone right there, but charging. It actually feels a lot more rugged than the lightning cables you get with your iPhone and iPad, which is crazy.
No stinky perfume scent, and it keeps my white towels, sheets, etc. looking bright.

My only complaint about these is that they are too short - if you're prone to burning your arm due to insufficient oven mitt coverage, look for some that are longer. Other than that, though, these are great mitts! Nice grippy substance on the tops to help you keep hold of things that are going to/from the oven, and some nice colors to choose from.

Heavy duty foil is the only way to go. It may be more expensive, but by the time you've used 2-3 sheets of less sturdy foil just in case it rips (it will) you'll be spending more anyway. This stuff is great for grilling, camping, lining sheet pans. Really, there's not much more to say.

OK, I LOVE Kate Beaton, and was excited to see that she'd published a book! It's very inspiring for little girls who might feel out of place. Don't worry, girls - those awesome superheroes are just jealous of your goofy-looking pony and handmade sweaters!

I want to love Burt's Bees skin creams, but have been unimpressed with how greasy they end up being (clog pores) and have too much scent. I've also read a lot recently about how using moisturizer constantly, day and night, makes your body stop producing its own moisturizing oils which leads to even drier skin, ironically. I've been happy just using a day cream with SPF and then spraying some Dr. Hauschka toner on after washing my face at night.

I was expecting the leftmost color to be more of a pearly white but it's actually more light pinkish. and that's on a VERY bright laptop screen. That said, there's a good range of options in this - good bang for my buck, in my opinion. this product is great if you're indecisive because it gives you a lot of complementary colors to choose from, and you can even blend them together to get more of a range than that. The light colors are subtle and don't provide a lot of coverage, just a hint of color/sparkle. The darker colors are very rich.

I'm seriously impressed by this thing. It's much improved over the previous version - you can now use it in landscape or portrait mode and still type, which is a nice touch. (Perfect for some of those old apps out there that haven't been ported to ipad and are still just iphone apps)Having this keyboard/case really makes it much easier to travel with an ipad. Without one, it's hard to send many emails (too much typing is just a pain in the butt), leave reviews of hotels and restaurants (I like to Yelp on the road before I forget my experiences) or do anything else that involves a decent amount of typing. The material is really slick-looking, too, so that's an added bonus. This thing definitely does NOT feel cheap!

I downloaded this and was told that updates were available. After installing the updates and restarting the Rosetta Stone app, it complained that I hadn't inserted the installation CD. Well, uh, it's a download. And my laptop doesn't even HAVE a CD drive. What worked for me: quit the app and reinstall. When it asks if you want to install the updates, say NO and it will proceed with installing the language levels that you've downloaded. This takes a few minutes. Once this is done, the app will run normally without asking for a CD. But now I'm afraid to install any updates :)Now that I've gotten over THAT hurdle, I will try out the software itself and update my review with that information as well.

You get what you pay for with these things. This thing is pricey, but it's basically two in one - you'd pay more than half this much to get a chair cover, and this is like two chair covers (for a bench). I got it to cover two side-by-side chairs and it's really good quality. Plus, I've made the mistake of buying cheapo covers for my grill before and regretted it. Don't buy some junky $15 cover and expect it to last more than one season. This one, on the other hand, will clearly last for years.Though you can't tell from the pictures (they make it look like this is just a glorified tarp) there are actually cords and cord locks on all 4 corners so you can fasten it tightly to the legs of the bench (or whatever) that's under the cover. That way it won't flap around or blow away if there's a REALLY big gust (and a REALLY light bench :)Hope this helps!
I got this for an Ork Posters Seattle print and it's the perfect size. It comes with a very glass-like (but plastic!) insert and the frame itself has a matte black look that looks really good.

Seriously, it should NOT be that hard to find a shower curtain liner that doesn't require keeping the window open for the whole day to let the horrible plastic smell dissipate. I was happy to receive this one and not be bowled over by the smell when I opened the package. It's held up so far and seems pretty sturdy as far as these things go. Good price, too!

This is a pretty great case other than the big opening so everyone can see that you have an iPhone. I actually would prefer to downplay the free advertising, so I wish the back of the cover were solid (other than the opening for the camera and flash) but so far this is the most comfortable and functional case I've tried. I had one before that you had to press down so hard to to push the power button that half the time it didn't work because you ended up pushing the volume up/down buttons on the other side while you tried to press down. This one works a lot better. The black surround works well with the color on the front of the phone, too - I had one that was gray and white partway around and black on the other half which just ended up looking silly. This looks pretty slick. I don't really like the gold color on the back, though - I'd rather have the black or silver colored back.

This is a nice cleanser - doesn't smell much (I hate overly scented products) and really cuts through the grease. Actually a little bit TOO much for my skin, so this might not be a great choice for you if your skin is easily dried out. I tried creamier cleansers but wasn't happy with how they felt - almost like you couldn't really tell if they were doing anything. This lathers up a little bit, but not too much so you don't feel like it's stripping every single thing out of your skin. Definitely leaves my skin feeling very clean and requires moisturizer after using.

The biggest reason that I don't use the shared iPad in my house is that it's too much of a pain to type anything in. If you're exclusively browsing websites and not typing anything, then great - but this keyboard makes it WAY easier for me to log in to various websites and apps, comment on things, post on twitter, compose emails, etc. It's MUCH faster. It's also nice to use as a stand so you don't have to hold up your iPad for an extended period of time: particularly useful if you're using the Kindle app or reading something longer. There are 3 different positions you can angle your screen at. I found it really convenient for cooking with, actually - prop it up in the lowest position so you don't have to stoop over to see what's on the screen, and easily follow along with a recipe while you're cooking.One thing  I do NOT like about this is how the iPad itself snaps into it. I feel like I'm scraping the side of the iPad with the volume up/down buttons, and it's basically impossible to put the iPad into the case or take it out of the case without turning the screen off/on, messing with the volume, or otherwise interrupting the flow of whatever it is that you're doing. Maybe most people put their iPad into the case once and never take it out again, but I've found myself removing it from the case a couple of time and it's definitely awkward. Also, there's no way to bring up the on-screen keyboard once this thing is connected via bluetooth. You have to either turn bluetooth off in settings, or physically disconnect the keyboard. So if you want to access any characters that aren't on the keyboard (such as ` or emoji) you have to jump through some hoops.Otherwise, though, it's a pretty nice-looking case: smooth metallic bottom, just like the back of the iPad, a flexible gray leather-ish hinge that takes up a good portion of the top cover (where the camera and volume up/down buttons are) and some cheap-looking white plastic (it's matte, at least...) around that. I don't know why they didn't use metal in place of the plastic, especially considering the price of this item.

Be warned, this stuff has a really strong smell. It smells like I accidentally dumped too much perfume on  myself, and that's after using a PEA SIZED bit of the stuff on the back of my hand to try it out. I wish they offered an unscented version of this, because it DOES absorb very quickly and is very lightweight after applying. I just can't get past the smell. So if you're at all sensitive to that, or just don't want to smell like you just got doused with perfume, I'd avoid this.

Love these things! Super absorbent, and the big towel has little grippy dots on the bottom so it doesn't slide around on your yoga mat or the floor (if you're using it without the mat). I like the small one for the gym or to bring to soccer or hot yoga (when it would actually be nice to have, like ... FIVE of these things :)

We don't often get extended periods of freezing weather in Seattle, but it's happened a few times this winter, and it renders this chicken waterer useless. Though the water in the cooler I have it attached to doesn't freeze, this thing sticking off the cooler's spout is completely uninsulated, and froze overnight every time it got below about 30 degrees. During those times we would just go out and give our chickens a bowl of water to drink from.I think the cold snaps may have caused the plastic to become brittle, though, so I would only recommend this product to people who live in an area that never goes below freezing. OR, only use it in the summer if you do. I went out to the coop this morning and saw that the britetap had sheared off the front of the insulated water cooler it's attached to. And this is when it's 60 degrees out - nowhere near freezing! I bought another one to replace it because it's the least messy option out there and ours may have just been a fluke. But if it happens again, I will be finding another water solution for our chickens.

This book is the latest installment of The Austen Project, which "pairs six bestselling contemporary authors with Jane Austen’s six complete works: Sense & Sensibility, Northanger Abbey, Pride & Prejudice, Emma, Persuasion and Mansfield Park. Taking these well-loved stories as their base, each author will write their own unique take on Jane Austen’s novels" (Google "Austen Project" to check out the website for more details.)I find McCall Smith's style very enjoyable, and it comes through splendidly here in his modern retelling of Emma. I've read almost all of his other books - No 1 Ladies' Detective Agency, Scotland Street,  Professor Dr. von Igelfeld books - and this one was like putting on a comfortable old pair of boots. If you've read McCall Smith's Scotland Street or Isabel Dalhousie books, the content of Emma is quite similar - It's easy to get drawn into the stories of everyday people and their everyday problems. If you're not familiar with his work and are just enjoying the different retellings of classic Austen works, then I think you're in for a pleasant surprise in discovering the work of Alexander McCall Smith!

I thought I'd try these in baked macaroni and cheese for some extra protein, but I wouldn't recommend it. The pasta ended up kind of rubbery and didn't absorb the cheese sauce as well as traditional macaroni does. It ended up being kind of "nonstick", like separate pasta and cheese sauce. I'd recommend cooking your pasta a bit longer if you're going to use it for this application and maybe it would meld together a bit better. I was definitely surprised, considering this noodle is probably the top choice for making macaroni and cheese. Not really sure what alternatives I'd suggest using it for. Pasta salad might work better?

I know many people prefer gas chainsaws, but I live in the 'burbs and this is a-ok for the light- to medium-duty tasks I would use it for (cutting tree limbs that have fallen in the yard, breaking down this year's Christmas tree, etc.) I won't be cutting down any larger trees or doing anything too crazy with it so it suits my purposes just fine.One thing to know: before you use this thing, you must remove the chain and guide, add some oil, then put the chain back on. You'll probably want some help for this task, but once it's done you'll be good to go. I can't speak to the sharpening functionality since I haven't used the thing enough at this point to need it, but I will update this review at a later date for information about how long the blade stays sharp and how the sharpening works.

This is TP-Link's top of the line wireless routerThe provided instructions are very helpful - to set it up, you can either connect it via USB and set it up using your web browser, or use their Tether app. I tried the app on my iPhone and recommend that you use the USB/web browser setup option. Otherwise there's a lot of connecting to one access point, disconnecting and connecting to another one, etc. etc. It was a little bit frustrating.Range hasn't been a problem in my tiny house, so I can't really comment on how it would work for a larger space other than the fact that most reviewers seem very happy with the coverage they get in larger homes. The router itself has got kind of a large footprint - we have a Netgear that has a much slimmer profile than this and frankly looks better (sleek, black with subtle yellow green lights). This one kind of looks reminiscent of an iMac from 2001.I've been really happy with speeds for the web browsing, video streaming, Netflix, and music streaming I typically use it for. I can hardly tell a difference between using the 5.0 GHz and the wired ethernet port, so I'm really happy with it! As an added bonus, it doesn't seem to be vulnerable to the Misfortune Cookie exploit.

I got a Seattle print from Ork posters as a gift and when I went to their site to buy one of their poster frames (same size here: 16x32) was a bit shocked to see the total for ONLY the frame came to about $80 including shipping. Yikes! I got this one instead at about half the price, and am very happy with it. It came SOLIDLY packaged with a ton of really sturdy cardboard. No way this baby is going to arrive broken. Although it's not made with glass, the hard plastic that sits over whatever you're framing looks really nice. Definitely not one of those cheap, wavy plastics you get for some frames.

This is a great little light! Nice, inexpensive solution to a dark gate into my yard. Anyone who shows up at night has to fumble in the dark with the latch to the gate, and I figured I'd need to have an electrician install an outdoor light fixture there. Expensive, right?! Well, I stumbled upon this and thought it was the perfect, inexpensive solution to my problem. After 5 minutes drilling the baseplate above my gate and attaching the light, it was working perfectly. The range of the motion sensor works really well - anyone approaching within about 10 feet sets it off, it stays on for just under a minute and turns off if nothing's moving. It's quite bright, but won't wake up the neighbors or anything. I'll definitely be getting more of these for the other dark corners of my yard!I was actually surprised by how big this thing is. Basically picture a sphere 6 inches across. It takes 4 C size batteries, which is kind of a weird size. So don't forget those if you're buying.

I bought this after purchasing another NSI outdoor timer because I was happy with how well-made it was.  I specifically wanted two separate items on different schedules, so I bought a second timer instead of plugging both things into the one timer I had.Unfortunately the plug for this item is L-shaped, so it's impossible to plug two into the same outlet. The packaging actually shows a straight plug, which is why I bought it thinking it would work. Pretty misleading! If you have multiple outdoor outlets, you'll be fine, but if you have only one outlet with 2 plugs side-by-side, you won't be able to fit two of these timers.I solved the problem by buying a 2-foot outdoor extension cord, but it was disappointing that the packaging misled me. I had to order another part to get it all working together and wasn't able to set everything up the night this item arrived in the mail like I was planning.

What can I say? It looks like an octopus trying to punch two people at once. It's a solid hook that I attached to the back of a door to hang things up. It's super sturdy and the positioning of the holes makes it less likely to wiggle around than similar hooks with 2 parallel horizontal holes for the screws.

Lovely egg crate for holding the eggs I get from my chickens. It arrived in great shape (Another similar item I ordered previously arrived broken) and is a good size for eggs from small to large sized. Makes for a great countertop display of your eggs, or fridge storage that makes it easy to keep your eggs handy.

While this item looked quite nice and was wrapped very tightly (maybe TOO tightly?) it arrived with a big corner cracked off. There should probably have been more packing material in the box it came in, not just wrapping around the item.The crate itself was made of nice, solid porcelain in a clean white color that makes a nice display for the eggs I get from my chickens.

Nicer quality squeegee than the cheaper OXO one, which I've had in a shower for a couple of years. However, they both have the same HUGE suction cup that stopped sticking to the large tiles in my shower recently. I guess it just wore out, because the new one works again.I have subway tiles (about 6" x 3") in my shower and they are JUST big enough to support this suction cup. If you have tiles that are smaller, the suction cup for this item is too large to actually stick. If you have somewhere else convenient to stick it, it could still work for you.

Having had a few days to try out this microwave, it's definitely got some issues. It looks pretty slick with its mirror finish, but I've had lots of annoying little problems. For the price, these should NOT be an issue:- You can't see what's cooking inside the microwave because of the mirrored exterior. If you're trying to melt butter or something, you won't be able to peek inside to see how it's doing. Result? Microwave interior covered in butter. The floor of the microwave is indented, too, not flat. So it's going to be a hassle to clean up.- The power levels on this thing make NO SENSE. Most microwaves have power levels 1-10. This one does, too... Kind of. What actually shows up on the display is 40 or 50 instead of 4 or 5. What the heck? Who designed this thing? The interface for operating it makes no sense at all. Just trying to cook something at a normal power level is awkward to punch in, too. Sometimes (not always) you have to press cancel before you're able to enter a cooking time. I have yet to figure out when or why I have to do this. So I always just press cancel before entering a cook time for something.- The inside is significantly smaller than other microwaves that are the same physical size. My old microwave took up the same amount of space on the counter, but was 1.7 cu feet. This one is 1.4 cu feet. The inside is much smaller.It heats food up just fine once you figure out the weird power levels. Which is great if you know exactly how long it's going to take to cook something, or don't care about ending up with undercooked or overcooked food. But microwaves have windows for a reason: power levels vary, and for most things you're cooking, you want to keep an eye on things. This microwave makes it impossible to do so.If you need an extra mirror in the house, this microwave could be just the ticket for you!

When this arrived and I opened the mailbox, I thought "did someone order coffee?!?" It was even double-wrapped in bubble envelopes and I could STILL smell the delicious mocha flavor.The texture of these small chocolate bars definitely trends toward the "gritty" end of the spectrum, but I kind of like that. It's what gives it such a distinct coffee flavor. I once tried an amazing 'chocolate' bar from Sahagun in Portland, OR called "KA-POW!" that is actually made from very, very finely ground espresso and cocoa butter. Not technically chocolate since it doesn't contain cocoa solids, but deceptively similar in texture AND flavor! Well, this Scharffen Berger is like the poor man's KA-POW! (Which is funny, since this is still pretty pricey - just not as $$$)My only real complaint about this thing? The wrapping seems shoddily applied. The green paper wrapper had slipped off of about half of the small bars I received in my shipment. Scharffen Berger, try to make sure your bars don't end up in customers' mailboxes as a bunch of disconnected wrappers and anonymous-looking foil-wrapped bars, okay?

If you've read Terry Pratchett before and like his books, you should enjoy this collection of short stories from his early years. They were written by Pratchett back in the mid-sixties while he was writing for a small local newspaper in Buckinghamshire. There are familiar characters (Tales of the Carpet People) as well as new ones you'll enjoy meeting for the first time.There are some characters and settings that may make you realize they're the precursors to some of his other works such as the Discworld series. (The knights from Dragons at Crumbling Castle and Edwo the Boring Knight definitely bring to mind the people and settings from Discworld.)There are fun illustrations and typographical flourishes throughout the book that keep your turning the pages until you're finished and wishing that Pratchett had spent more time writing these fun short stories years ago so you'd have more to read!

I was happy to see this new addition to Scharffen Berger's lineup. I usually buy their 70% bittersweet chocolate bar. While this new bar only differs by 2% from the existing 70% bittersweet I was surprised by how rich and nutty the flavor is compared to the 70%, even though the ingredients list is identical. I guess that just goes to show what a difference the raw cacao quality makes to a product like this. It can either be really mediocre, or really amazing. This product definitely falls into the amazing camp.An added bonus: the new bar is actually made with Rainforest Alliance Certified cocoa beans. That's definitely an improvement in terms of sustainability, so I'm happy with that. Definitely going to try the other new bars they've come out with, and I'm relieved that the acquisition of Scharffen Berger by Hershey hasn't decreased the quality of these bars.

Unobtrusive and functional bike stand that's great for storing your bike while it's not being used. If you have slippery floors (wood, laminate, tile, etc.) you may want to add some sticky pads/feet to the bottom of the stand, otherwise it may move around while you're moving your bike onto/off of it. The rubbery top protects your frame from getting scratched up.How it works: basically you just rest your rear tire on the floor-level tray, and place the read axle on the rubbery part. It's quite flexible for different size bikes, too.Just one caveat: While I don't have disk brakes on my bike, the packaging says it's compatible with "most" disk brakes. Some of the other reviews mention specific bikes with disk brakes that do NOT work with this, though - so do your homework if you've got disk brakes. Otherwise you might end up having to return it.

This is a good product - definitely better for the environment than the kind with wasteful applicators. I would prefer that the cotton was unbleached, however. As an added bonus, these guys take up very little space compared to a box of traditional tampons with applicators - you can put one in that super tiny (and previously pointless-seeming!) pocket of your jeans in case of emergency!

This is an OK solution for exercising with your iPhone 6 (and some other models, apparently, judging from the other reviews that mention previous models also fit in the case). In my opinion, there are some improvements that can be made to this product:- bulky design: significantly wider than the iPhone 6 itself. I would be concerned that this would be a target for thieves if you're running around in a higher-crime area.- less space between the clear plastic cover and the phone's screen. It can be hard to navigate when the plastic is bubbling up around the edges due to too much space in there. My phone (with no case on it) fits easily inside,- it's too easy for the edges of the case to accidentally press the power button on the top right ,turning the screen off when you don't expect it.- the stitching on the back of the case, which rests against your skin while you're exercising, will allow moisture inside the case, especially if you're particularly sweaty.There's an extra slot behind your phone where you can stash some cash, cards or maybe a key, but nothing too big. It's not as deep as the slot your phone goes in, so it's easier to take a card out than if you had to fish around inside to find it.  This area is also protected under the back flap in case it's raining. However, these items would be closest to your skin, so it's likely that they would get wet if you're sweating.On the plus side, the extra slot might prevent the phone inside from getting AS wet as it would otherwise.
