If this is a concern, then I'd recommend this case over the Belkin Sport-Fit arm band, which is only a dollar or two cheaper anyway. Belkin's non-Plus arm band doesn't have the extra slot for cards/keys/etc. and would be more likely to retain moisture in the area that holds the phone. Now, the Sport-Fit Plus (this item) will probably still get your phone a BIT damp if you're sweating (and who doesn't, while exercising?!) but note quite as much, just based on the design. I'm still concerned that this might lead to long-term damage to my phone.Otherwise, the armband is comfortable, smooth neoprene that shouldn't irritate your arm while you're moving around, the phone (at least with no case) fits inside alright (though with a bit too much room to spare, which makes it harder to use the screen) and the opening for headphones lines up well with the jack on the phone itself.

This arm band functions well enough - the Iphone 6 fits snugly inside and you're able to see everything on the screen. There's a flap on top that prevents rain from getting in and soaking your phone. It's relatively easy to use the touch screen through the thick plastic cover, but you do have to press down really hard because there is an annoying amount of extra space between the plastic and the screen.When it's on your arm, and you move your arm up to look at the screen, it rotates to landscape mode. This isn't too annoying for most apps that support rotation, but the iPhone home screen doesn't rotate, so it's kind of awkward to be looking at that at a 90 degree angle and trying to figure out what you're doing.There's a small opening on the bottom for headphones.I haven't had a chance to use this in the pouring rain yet, but it seems like it would do a decent job of keeping your phone dry. Not too sure about the seams on the front, though - if those don't stand up to the test of time/rainstorms, it's going to get (and stay) very wet in there. I'm concerned that it will get steamy inside just from sweating, too, if you're doing a really intense workout with this thing on. The stitching on the back will probably allow moisture to get into the phone area just due to the sweat on your skin.Really, the bottom line for me with this thing is that it's bulky enough that I'm not sure I'll use it regularly, especially at the gym. For an outdoor run: MAYBE. I use bluetooth headphones when I work out, so just having my phone nearby is usually fine. I would say that this item would be less annoying to use with bluetooth headphones, too, even though it would work with regular corded headphones/earbuds. They will flap around a lot while you're running, though.

Fun little gadget that's reminiscent of the Fitbit for step tracking, but for keeping track of temperature, UV index, and humidity either at home or on the go.Big pluses for me:- ability to monitor humidity accurately inside my house during winter, when it's REALLY dry!- ability to monitor UV index when outdoors so you're reminded to reapply sunscreen regularlyThe app is available for iOS and Android. I've been using the iOS app, which looks pretty good. The camera feature seems like overkill, though - you can use the button on your CliMate as a remote to snap a photo on your iPhone, but ONLY within the CliMate's app. Not just when you have the camera app running. The CliMate app superimposes some graphics showing the current temperature, UVI, and humidity level. You can integrate with Facebook or otherwise share these photos with friends via email, text message, or any of the other default options iOs has.There's a short little rubbery "lanyard" it comes with so you can clip it onto a backpack, handbag, zipper or what have you while you're on the go. I'm wary of how insecurely the CliMate attaches to the lanyard AND how the lanyard attaches to whatever you're putting it on. There's a definite risk that you'll easily lose this little gadget. I'm also not happy with how the CliMate fits on its stand - the post is much too wide, so you have to keep twisting the little cloud-shaped object onto it for a really long time before it stays on, and even then it won't stay on very long.Other than the stand and the lanyard, though, this is a great concept for an app that you can use to monitor, at the VERY least, temperature. If you've got one of those weather stations where you put a sensor outside and can look at the temperature, humidity, etc. remotely from a display you keep indoors, this is like an advanced version of that which can be monitored from your cell phone instead. The only catch here is that you can't sync with the CliMate unless you're not nearby. When you come back into range, though, it will sync with your phone and send you all the data it's been collecting.

I like using this for my kitchen counters. Whoever remodeled the kitchen before we moved in decided it would be a brilliant idea to install white tiles with white grout. Well, the grout stays white for about 5 minutes until something gets spilled on it - coffee, crumbs, spices, etc. I like using the fine tip of this bleach pen to apply a bead of bleach gel along the grout and let it sit for 5-10 minutes, then wipe it off. Clean off the counter with hot water, dry it off and it actually seems like the gel keeps working. I notice a significant brightening of the white grout after the initial 5-10 minutes, but even after removing the gel and wiping down the counters I think it gets even whiter within the next few hours. Definitely really great for this job.

These little packs are perfect to keep in the car, a handbag, gym bag, etc. The designs on the packaging leave much to be desired (some are downright ugly) but that's not TOO much of a sticking point. Good value in getting this larger pack instead of buying individually one at a time, too.

Got this for my new iPhone 6 even though the top sticks out a little bit it's inexpensive and better than nothing! Nice soft inside kind of doubles as a screen cleaner every time you put your phone in or take it out, too! Nice subtle design on the outside, too.

Got these as a gift for friends, intending them to be used with votive candles. They really are very, very tiny for mugs, though. Maybe good if you're drinking something very strong or rich, like an espresso or some drinking chocolate? Great quality, though, and so cute!

I've attached a picture here to show the mild issues in a less than 2 month old Sonicare toothbrush of this design. It was a replacement for another one (same type) that become unusable due to how much gross, smelly gunk/mold built up inside under the replaceable brush head.I would skip this design and go for the kind with the thinner brush head, not this big hollow design. The other type is way easier to clean and lasts much longer!

Really, there's no much to say about these! They're nice, and just what I was looking for to stick on homemade jars of jam and things for the holidays. Inside the package are 3 letter-sized pieces of thick, linen-textured paper with sticky backing. You can either print a set of labels with them using your printer, or just write on them with a sharpie or something if you've got nice handwriting and are lazy. (Hello!!)If you're going to print, go to http://www.avery.com/print to download a template (#80501), otherwise, have fun decorating by hand. Peel off each sticker, stick it to whatever needs a fancy label, and you're good to go!-1 star for the fact that I only get 45 labels/3 sheets of paper with sticker backing for almost $10. That's expensive! If you have, say, 100 things to label it's going to set you back almost $20. That's pretty pricey, in my book!

This a really sturdy exercise band. Unlike free weights, exercise bands don't really have *exact* weights assigned to them, so as you see this one has a range of between 30-50 pounds depending on how you're using it (what exercise you're doing, how far you're pulling it). It's basically a really long, thick rubber loop, so there's a lot you can do with it: stand on it and pull up for triceps curls, wrap it around your upper body and pull forward for biceps curls ... the list goes on.While the product doesn't come with any suggested exercise ideas, you can easily find some with a quick Google/Bing search for "exercise band workouts".This thing is great to throw in your suitcase for traveling, or just to have around the house so you can get in some strength training while parked in front of the television.

... But I can't promise it won't be stolen by someone who's sick of all their boring black micro USB cables.Basically does everything a USB 2 -> micro USB cable needs to do, otherwise! Charges my Kindle, Windows Phone, external USB battery and any other micro USB compatible gadgets. Soft-feeling plastic cabling feels nicer than the harder plastic-feeling cheap ones you tend to get all the time.Colors are perfect for telling what cable is charging what thing when you've got multiple devices plugged into a USB hub, as well! It's a small, but it really does save time even with just a couple cables.

Perfect for charging my iPhone 6 right next to my laptop while keeping things tidy and not having to deal with messy cables dangling everywhere, getting in my way. Other than that, the cable seems very tough (as it should be if you're going to always be pulling at it) and is a welcome backup for the flimsy white one that came with my iPhone.

Really happy with this printer. Our old Brother laser printer kicked the bucket after 10 years of service so we settled on this instead of the more expensive wired ethernet model. It was set up and working in about 5 minutes after pressing the "Wireless" button on the device and the "WPS" button on our router. It automagically shows up on my Windows laptop as an option for printing without having to install any drivers or software (Windows 8.1) and I was able to easily print from my iPhone, too! I had always wondered why printing was an option on that thing. It's actually really useful!
Bought just one box of these at a local store and my gosh, they are quite possibly one of the yummiest cookies ever on the planet, yum!!!

Looks even better in person! Just got it so while I can't vouch for certain its longevity, I can tell you I love the quality feel of this fabric and have feel confident it will perform very well. It doesn't feel too plastic-like, nor does it feel like pure cloth which would make me worry about its tendency to absorb dirt and mildew.

First hummingbird feeder ever and this thing rocks!Pros:• Holds firm – had up 3 weeks now, not a budge, don’t expect one either• Easy to use – lifts off easily (leaving the mount/suction cups intact)  for replacing with fresh nectar• Instant entertainment – worked on day one, and now multiple times per day we’re treated to free and delightful entertainment!• Looks good – was worried at first we might not like seeing the suction cups/mount right there “in our face” on the window but it’s not that bad. Plus having the little guys right there that close to us is priceless, wouldn’t trade that for one further away.• Birds not afraid even with us right there – sure, they’re a tad skiddish and will buzz off sometimes when we move or look up at them, but they come back and often stay there quite a while. It’s totally awesome!Cons – None.

Works really well, like the battery indicator. Definitely lasts a lot longer than its smaller, cheaper cousin. Only wish it weren't so prohibitively expensive, dang. But, needed a second battery for my power-hog blower and was over a barrel (and they know that) because, um, you sorta can't find generic batteries for these things.

Unbelievable little tool, works really great! The different heads (a nice little variety of them at that) stay nicely in the tool when working, change out very quickly and easily, and when done, all fit neatly in the tool. Oh yeah, and how cool is it that the heads are magnetic? Really helpful for when working with those tiny little screws.

Life saver! Wifey used 5 cans to spray paint 4 rocking chairs, said she did the first one without this and her hand was already sore, but she was able to do the rest with no problem at all with it, that there's no way she could have finished the job without it. No more paint on the index finger, no more drips down the can, and no more hand cramps. Sweet!

Ingenious product, works flawlessly! I've primarily used the $20 Stanley that finds each edge of the stud and always found it only a 5-6 out of 10 for reliability, still always the guessing game. I bought the CH Hanson 03040 magnetic one because so many raved about it and, well, it's okay but come on, it finds the nails, that's it (and do drywallers nail in the center of the stud every time? Come on, impossible to do!). This thing, however, is flipping awesome, virtually images exactly where the stud is, the lights moving as you move the unit on the wall, truly amazing!

Tired of the precarious leaning that always occurred when I'd hang Christmas lights or something, I decided to spring for this bad boy and very glad I did!Their solution for micro-adjusting is really quite ingenious, works very well, perfect every time. Love the level on the bottom rung. Heavier than the cheap-o I had before and a little cumbersome for my small size but absolutely, positively worth the trade-off without question. The catches for the height are extremely well designed. The rope and pulley for raising it is a worthy option, but I use so rarely I removed the rope because it was just in my way.Bottom line - don't skimp and buy the el-cheapo, spend the extra dough and get what should be a lifetime ladder, you'll be glad you did!

This thing is the next best thing to sliced bread, I absolutely LOVE IT! Looks nice, feels nice with the felty-velvety inner lining, and has made finding things in that wonderfully cavernous console (in my 2007 Tahoe) a snap. I've died and gone to organizational Heaven! :)And yes, there's a trade off, but well worth it, and the trade off is that now I do have to pick it up to get things from underneath and to put them back. But, that's obviously not the case for stuff I have loaded in the top. And, I w-a-a-y prefer this over digging to find stuff. Now, whenever I go to get something, it's virtually instant, and I absolutely love that.

First pair of shoes I've purchased online but am thrilled with these. This one was easy for I had a nearly identical pair and love the fit. I love the width of these shoes, all Skechers tennies I've had have all been nicely wide, unlike others, especially Nike which is the worst. I did verify with Skechers corporate that if the size doesn't have a letter after it, it's a medium. I always suspected otherwise simply because of the awesome fit. That may help some of you who wrestle with wanting to be sure before ordering, too.PS - I will say, though, that in nearly every other shoe I've ever worn I've worn an 8-1/2, but with these it's always been a 9 (my 3rd pair so far and it's consistent).
What can I say, except it looks good, works great, works perfectly, and it's priced right from Amazing-Amazon, love it!

After years of using my traditional, edge finder stud finder with mediocre results, decided to look for something new, tried this and, meh, I still actually prefer my traditional one better. This thing does do exactly what you'd expect, and very well at that - when it finds a nail, it stops on a dime and holds extremely well. The level tells you when you're pointing in a straight line upward, so in case you don't want to tap into the stud right there, you can at least use a straight edge up from the handy point on this thing then do it there. I guess it's a personal preference thing, and I still wound up going back to my old traditional over this one.Nonetheless, this thing works just as it should, which is why I went ahead and gave it 4 stars, dinged it only 1 star for my personal preference thing.

Initially didn't buy these but after I got all of my Gladiator shelving and such up, decided to give it a try and very glad I did, turned out to be the perfect finishing touch, wouldn't have it any other way!

Ball looks very good, very visible; eye hooks are tiny; string's very, very small but it works.Like other reviewers I wound up not doing the retracting thing, just hung it from my ceiling like my old tennis ball had been before. If you hook it up the way it's designed, it retracts up and out of the way when the garage door is closed, not a bad idea if you're frequently in your garage without a car with the door closed. However, when I'm in my garage with no car, it's generally when I'm puttering in the yard and leave the door open. No benefit whatsoever to have the ball retract after I park, the ball just rests on the windshield, who cares.Bottom line is, my recommendation, unless you really want the retraction for your particular (and likely exceptional) case, just use a tennis ball and your own string.

For such an awesome product, only a simple review required – this thing works! Just charged the battery, plugged it into my universal remote, sat the little “spaceship” in front of my gear in the media closet, and voila – all activities functioning perfectly!! No wires to run for a traditional remote extender (what a joy)!!
Not much to say except, good looking cord, feels good (flexible, cloth/fiber as opposed to rubber), works great, no issues.

Really not much to say except that it works awesomely! Plug and play, just plugged it in, programmed my Harmony 650 remote (which recognized this, by the way - sweet!), and the switch powers on/off and changes channels just as it should, zero issues. I do not use the supplied remote, don't need it.*** Update: For what it's worth, doesn't work well with the Etekcity Wii to HDMI 720P / 1080P Converter HD Output Upscaling Video Audio Adapter - Supports All Wii Display Modes. Sound is find but picture is a little snowy. It does however work well as I stated earlier with the Harmony 650 Remote, Xbox 360, and my Sony BDP-S590 Blu-Ray Player.
Not much to say, does what it's supposed to do and looks great.

Pros:• Looks outstanding, feels awesome in the hands!• Standard batteries (doesn’t require the charging station like my old Harmony’s)• Awesome database, recognized everything (even my Sabrent HDMI switch)• Love the ability to create favorite channels (I’m a cable cutter) with either names or icons (eg, I used the actual ABC logo instead of just naming it ABC, etc)• Works flawlessly, does all activities I programmed (granted, mine’s real simple)Cons:• The backlighting is a pro, except one big, dumb oversight – why on earth didn’t they make the primary activity buttons backlit??? I mean, the two main functions I want to do when I walk into my dark living room and grab the remote are 1) watch tv or 2) watch dvd, and guess what – neither of those buttons are backlit!!! I still love the remote but that is just a real, well, “aarrgghh!!”

After finally being fed up enough with the cheap-o stick-on felt ones and reading reviews on this one, I had high hopes but those faded pretty quickly. No, they didn't scratch my hardwood floor but, they were certainly loud, and the sound they made against my floor made me very uneasy, certain that it would only be a matter of time before they did. Besides, the last thing I want is all that noise.After trying these I tried some "Waxman 4718795N 1-Inch Nail On Round Felt Pads, Brown" and found them insanely awesome, best thing since the wheel OR sliced bread, highly recommended if you have hardwood floors, want high quality and low noise.

A screw connector (the little input you drive the screw into) on the HDMI port broke off, forcing me to tape it back on so I could get my plug into it. I didn't mind so much since it was behind my tv but, like some other reviewers noted, these things aren't the highest quality where the screw connections are concerned.
Good looking, good quality, flexible cable, works very well.

Like all the Gladiator parts, high quality hooks that works very well. I actually bought one of almost every type of hook, tried all the stuff I wanted to hang on each, writing down what I wanted to hang on what type of hook, then bought the rest, am going to return the couple I wound up not using.These hooks are versatile. Like other reviewers, I too found the L-hooks to be more in demand, about 2 or 3 to 1, but was definitely able to find some uses for the J's as well.

These things are so very awesome, love 'em, great purchase!! I used #8x2" Spax silver constructions screws and boy, WAY better than drywall screws. Seriously, I've been hooked on drywall screws for just about everything for years, and the construction screws go in so much easier. But back to the Geartrack - speaking of screwing, I really do like the little indentation that makes it so much easier to put up.Tip:  Level and mark in a couple of places on the wall where you want to hang this, and use just the tip of a black marker to mark in that little indentation where you want each screw (obviously at the studs). Then take the Geartrack to your workbench and get each of your screws started in the track - just a tiny little bit, just enough to hold. I did this, made it SO easy to hold up to my leveling marks with one hand and use the screw gun with the other hand to drive a couple of 'em in enough to hold it, then I could relax, take my hands off of it, and drive all the screws hassle free with just the one hand.

Very, very high quality, looks very good on my wall, supports more than the stated 50 lbs. I saw a couple of older reviews where people mentioned this thing supporting 100 lbs, whereas now it says 50. Not being sure which was correct, I took a chance that some overzealous lawyer made them change it and so far, happy to report that my 75+ lbs are showing no signs of trouble at all on the Geartrack I installed.*** Granted, those overzealous lawyers make me inclined to remind you to take the mfr's recommendations, not mine, know what I mean? :) ***
Nice bulbs, have used half a dozen so far and found no problems. Bright, clear, and (I really like this part), incandescent.
Not much to say except this bad boy works, very, very well, thrilled with the purchase!!!

We have a large, heavy leather sofa which reclines on the outside two of the three sections, on a hardwood floor. Measured the 12 feet on it and these fit very, VERY tightly, needed the hammer to tap 'em on and boy, let me tell you, that puppy doesn't move anymore at all!!! We got SO tired of every time we kicked our feet to put our couch from reclined to upright, the couch sliding back against the wall, we just had to find a solution and these are the absolute bomb, LOVE EM!!!

Like all the Gladiator parts, a high quality hook that works very well. I actually bought one of almost every type of hook, tried all the stuff I wanted to hang on each, writing down what I wanted to hang on what type of hook, then bought the rest, am going to return the couple I wound up not using.Of all the hooks I purchased, this one was by far and away the most versatile. I bought a bunch of these, and only one or two of some of the others.

Like all the Gladiator parts, a high quality hook that works very well. I actually bought one of almost every type of hook, tried all the stuff I wanted to hang on each, writing down what I wanted to hang on what type of hook, then bought the rest, am going to return the couple I wound up not using.This one worked well for a particular combination of broom-type items I was hanging but interestingly enough, I found the cheaper twin hook worked as well or even better in most cases for me. IE, I purchased one tool hook, and a bunch of twins.

Bought for my daughter who loves it - kid approved! I helped her put it up and it's very, very nice.By the way, I ABSOLUTELY recommend Scotch 2-Sided 3M 109 Wallsaver Removable Mounting Tape available here on Amazon, especially for these silk posters. I run that stuff as close to the edge as I can, right up to the corners on the short side then about 75% across the middle of the long side and it keeps the edges from curling up, something silk posters are inclined to do far more than standard paper posters."There was a boy. His name...Merlin." Great show, our whole family loves it.

This headset is very attractive, callers are extremely clear to me, and I've been told by everyone I've asked that I sound "crystal clear."Next on the importance list is comfort. When I first put it on, it felt so comfortable I'm pretty sure I let out an audible "ooooooo." But then, it didn't take long on one ear, I mean 10 minutes tops, for the discomfort to start setting in on the earpiece side -- the other side never bothers me at all. If left too long on one ear, discomfort actually turns to pain. Fortunately, it's extremely quick to flip it around and change ears, go another 10-15 minutes, and repeat as necessary. I'm not on constantly so take it off between every call. Disclaimer - I do have a good size noggin, which very well plays a part in that, though I suspect unless you get the old fashioned big ones like we used to use for stereos decades ago (and are still available), you're going to experience this same thing no matter how large or small your head.Mute and volume (it's on the cord, not the headset itself) - I use my phone exclusively for this so it's not important to me. I have the headset volume turned all the way up and control the rest via phone. I read at least one other reviewer complain about the headset mute working only while you press it as opposed to toggle on/toggle off style, but since I use my phone anyway, it doesn't impact me either way.All in all this bad boy gets 4 stars from me, only dinging 1 for the comfort since I'm not convinced any one of this style is going to be much better.Now if only someone would make one that sounds this good that you could wear for an hour or more with no discomfort, one that also has a high quality retraction mechanism for the cord, I would then say that cord utopia had been found. If any of you know of such a thing, oh goodness, please let me know! :-)

Not much you can really say about a phone cord but, quite simply -- it looks good, the length is as described, it's lightweight and flexible, relatively inexpensive, and it works, voila. And it's on Amazon Prime - sweet!

I write very few reviews for films, but had to make an exception for this one. When Challenger exploded 73 seconds after departure, America's heart skipped a beat. Anyone who remembers that moment has got to find immensely interesting this amazing behind the scenes look at what happened on the commission that was charged with investigating and reporting on the cause of that terrible disaster.I've honestly done no additional research to verify the accuracy of this film but find it very, very convincing and don't doubt for a moment its authentic retelling of not only what occurred on this particular commission, but what most certainly happens on many similar, when cya and agendas rule the day, when those in power have already given the commission the answer they want the public to hear and it's only their job to give the equation that supports that, period, no push-back allowed.William Hurt delivered an outstanding performance portraying a real life character, and from the video clip they showed of the good professor in real life, he played him to the hilt. A poignant case of an incredibly intelligent man, he was dedicated to his work, and to truth at all costs. The way this man persevered, staying on to see his work on the commission through to the end during the very most difficult time of his, or anyone's life for that matter, makes him a true hero in my book.Bottom line, love it, gotta recommend it, watch it, you won't be sorry!

Priceless little gadget, works extremely well, have spun gobs of lettuce and other veggies in ours and never had a problem whatsoever, never saw a spec of dirt on the leaves afterwards. And it's dishwasher safe, too, with one caveat. The outer parts are hard, white plastic that can withstand heating element exposure in the dishwasher. However, the inner basket, as well as the connecty-wheely sort of gadget under the top lid are both very obviously very lightweight, delicate plastic that would not. Therefore, when our daughter put the basket in the bottom of the dishwasher, naturally it came out all deformed, ruined.Thus, the wifey just happened upon one of these at a garage sale and bought it. Alas, that one didn't work well, kept skipping gears every few turns like it just wasn't connecting properly so, went on Amazon and bought new again and, just as awesome as our first one!

Since we returned this without use, I almost started to not write a review on this one but thought, well, just in case someone else had the same issue as me, I might as well, it might help to know there were others. And before I tell you the problem I feel it important to tell you that imho, I completely feel ours was just a fluke so still recommend this pin, for it looked good, rolled good, and my bet is that short of our fluke, this is a fine pin so giving it 4 stars anyway.That said, there is an opaque/clear-ish plastic fitting on each end where the handle fits into the rolling pin. On ours, one end was nice and flush like it should be, the other sticking out about 1/2" or so, and sort of crooked at that even. It didn't prevent the pin from operating normally but, every time I tried to picture using the rolling pin, that little oddity stuck out at me and screamed, "hey, look at me!" I knew I'd never be happy so returned it right away. Then, instead of replacing it, my wife then told me that she wished I'd checked with her first since she wanted one of these new-fangled French ones without handles. Oh well, call me old fashioned for I prefer what my mom always had but, ehh, happy wife, happy life, right? :)

Pros:* Compared to Others - Better in all aspects than previous headsets I've used, including: Jawbone Prime; Motorola H17, H730, Oasis, & HS850; Plantronics Voyager 510; Samsung HM1700* Comfort - Wow, amazing! I originally liked the kind that wrapped over the ear for security, then got used to the nakedness of just in ear, so wasn't sure how much I'd like this one but wow, it feels so comfortable yet at the same time perfectly secure, zero worries about it falling off!* Clarity - Sounds really clear and crisp to me, and others have told me I sounded good. I had trouble with all of my previous headsets with people saying it sounded cruddy, muddy, crackly, or breaking up, or ... enough already I said! So, while I've only had a short while, initial reports are good so I'm happy. Will update this review later if anything changes in that regard.* Voice Alerts - Love this feature, wouldn't want a headset without it. Knowing the battery level is a huge deal to me, to anyone I'd imagine. Plus, telling you "power on, power off, connected, volume maximum" all are equally nice, I like how they programmed these to work.* Tap to Call Feature - A must. At first thought this didn't have it until I did what all us guys hate to do and, uggh, read the manual, then learned I had to press and hold it for 2 seconds. * Power Switch - No issues. Sure, I really did prefer the boom operation on my last Moto (open - on, closed - off), but this one is no problem, got used to it real quickly.* Volume Switch - Very nice. Like any new gadget, wasn't sure I'd like the "tap up 3 times to maximum then repeat " thing but wow, surprised at just how much I really like it on this one - it's really quite simple. For each tap, an unobtrusive beep gets louder until, at its loudest, the alert simply says "volume maximum," then another tap resets it to its lowest level, so it's always an "up, up, up" action, not "up, up, up, down, down, down" action.* Battery - Good. Granted, I've not used it mondo-extreme yet, just a bit here and there throughout the day, but seems about normal. My one check was little use over two days on standby then had to connect that evening.* Distance - No complaints. Granted, I'm wise enough not to stray too far from my phone when using BT so haven't been more than, oh, 5' tops from this thing, but zero issues thus far.* Reversibility (left or right ear) Feature - Works extremely well, very impressed. It's intuitive, didn't take long to figure out how to operate it. Works well, seems well made, although I'm wise enough to use care when flipping it around, engineering can only go so far with a light little contraption like that.* Looks - Very attractive. Sleek, not too big, not too small, just right!Cons:* None to reportSummary:With all those pros and no cons, of course I'm going to absolutely recommend this headset to anyone, without hesitation, and twice on Sunday :) Buy this bad boy, you'll be quite happy you did.

Love, love, love this game! We all have that connection to our childhood, those memories of playing Monopoly, and playing it now is like a nice warm blanket on a cold night ... comforting, relaxing. Only, we don't have the patience to play for 2-3 hours anymore, knowing full well half way thru who's going to win and just continuing to play to be nice to the winner.No more, says Monopoly Deal - have some fun, play Monopoly, getting your childhood fix of comfortable nostalgia, but now you get to do it with quick action throughout the whole game, and there's no clear winner until right up until the end. Even if someone's in the clear lead, it's possible for the tables to turn on a draw and - surprise!Tried to pick up locally because I remembered buying before for like $6-7 but alas, only found the new Monopoly Millionaire Deal and on taking a quick glance decided I just didn't want to change, I wanted my original "love" so bit the bullet and bought this, and, while it was more than it should be, I'm just darned happy to have it again (I really should stop giving my games away as gifts...starting to get expensive!)

Great looking, original sheets, and shoot me for not reading the description closely enough but come on, just one pad of 80? They could have at least given us 8 packs of 10, or 4 of 20, something like that. Heck, I'd have paid a buck or two more to have the cardboard under each pack so we didn't have to stack 3-5 to keep the pencil from indenting the wood table underneath.Next time, I'm making my own. Sure, I'll have to get the paper cutter out but, heck, that'll only take me an extra few minutes. Plus, like the potato chip commercial used to say, use "all you want, we'll make more!" And anytime I choose, too :)

Pros:• Cup quality is nice. A couple reviewers mention about the felt peeling away, and while I only just got it and used it once or twice, I checked it with my finger nails and it seems nice and tight. It's even rolled over real nicely, and again, looks and feels tightly glued.• Quiet dice rolling - yea!! No more brain-jarring, clang-clang-clang when playing Yahtzee in that original, unlined plastic cup that came with the game. Finally, after all these years, peace and harmony when playing - yippeee!!!Cons:• Cup diameter is rather large. Worth noting, however, that it's no larger than any other felt lined cups I see on here so, I don't really have a better option so am keeping this one. Got used to my old Yahtzee cup which was probably 2-1/2" round (this one's 3"), and just liked how that smaller size felt in my hand - amazing how much that silly 1/2" makes.• Dice are el-cheapo's. I mean really, a bunch of the numbers have the spots not completely filled in and, well, all 3 of our family agreed that it was distracting during the whole game. I'm keeping the cup but going right back out and finding me some better dice.Summary:Worth the purchase for the cup alone, unless you can find a felt lined cup that is less than 3" in diameter by 1/4 - 1/2". And buy for the cup, not for the dice. That way, if you're like me and don't like the dice, you won't be disappointed.

I am sure I feel cardiovascular improvement in my running and exercise in general. I bought it after watching a Dr Oz show where they were talking about reducing belly fat. I have to say it seems to be working. I would recommend this product!

I find that supplements are easier to take regularly rather than trying to work foods that contain probiotics into my diet every day. This is my brand because of the variety of strains and because it’s not harsh on my system. This is a very great product!
I love these. Never going back to another sandal.
Does what it's supposed to, but is not three feet. It's the same length as the original cord.

Recently, the charger that came with my 5S crapped out on me..so I needed a new one. I didn't want to buy the "stock" cable from Apple because they are way too expensive. Both my husband (5C owner) and I (5S owner) use these cables. They charge quick and don't heat up. I highly recommend buying this set!

This crime fiction book is wonderful. Kipling does a great job with attention to detail. I am eagerly awaiting the next assassination/conspiracy book to come out by Kipling. Undercover is the epitome of a great crime thriller book. It's a fast-paced book that will keep you wanting more.

I am absolutely APPALLED. I received this in the mail today and the box wasn't damaged, but the vellum looks like it had been wadded up into a ball and then shoved into a plastic bag. Every single sheet is UNUSABLE. I will be contacting Amazon about this right after I post this review. I DEMAND to get my money back. It looks like it was handled by a three year old before it was sent to me. I highly recommend that you do NOT buy this. It's a waste of money.

I was curious to read this book because I am aware of karma and how it affects our lives. In some instances, Karma affects us immediately, while in other cases the results of one's karma are delivered later. However, sooner or later one ends up paying for one’s bad deeds and benefiting from the good ones. All ten short stories in this book illustrate that even the smallest of actions accrues karma and that their effect is not limited to your current life but goes much beyond. The stories also show that no one is immune from the law of Karma, i.e. every action has an equal and opposite reaction. I enjoyed reading this book and gained valuable insights into reincarnation, after-life, and Eastern mythology.

My husband's libido and duration has been lacking the past few years due to growing stress from work and from being stressed about the kids. We were having sex maybe once or twice a month and that was stressing both of us out even more. At first he didn't want to even think about purchasing a male sexual enhancement supplement, but after a little talking to him we decided to find a good one. We have friends who didn't like the effects of viagra or felt like that viagra was an "old man's pill", so he didn't even want to try that. One of his friends suggested Virectin to him and we looked it up here on Amazon. The price was low in comparison to other supplements that we looked at and it made us both a little nervous, but we decided to try it anyway because we didn't want to spend too much money. The "you get what you pay for" saying is no longer in our vocabulary thanks to Virectin. It has worked WONDERS! We absolutely love and would definitely pay more if we had to. This is an AMAZING product for the price. We're now having sex almost every other day now. Such a huge and great change for us! My husband hasn't experienced any bad side effects and he lasts for such a long time. He even lasts longer than he did in our college days. ;-) We both HIGHLY recommend this product! We have found our go-to sexual enhancement supplement.

My husband and I are both runners that both HATE headphones with cords. They're a nuisance because they get tangled and are just a mess. I bought one pair of these to try out because we wanted to try something new. The design is wonderful! It's colors are unisex and it looks very sleek/modern. The bluetooth connects extremely quick and the headphones work like a charm. I bought a second pair too, so that my husband and I could each wear a pair while we're running together. They fit nice and snug on both of our heads and cover our ears perfectly. We don't worry about ear pains or the ear buds falling out because these are "over-the-ear". We both run for an hour or so each morning before we get ready for work/taking the kids to school and we haven't had any battery problems.One full charge seems to last us weeks! They're durable and they feel as light as the dreadful earbuds do. The shipping was fast and there wasn't any damage at all to either of the headphones. These headphones are definitely worth the price. They are so much more comfortable and they don't come with the annoyances that corded ear buds do. I highly recommend these!

I bought one for myself and one for my mother. This slicer works WONDERS. No more having to risk cutting myself with a knife while trying to prepare food for my family. I especially loved that there are three sets of blades so that there can be different sized cuts. This is a great tool that will benefit ANYONE! I highly recommend this. The fact that it came with a free recipe book was an awesome bonus too. This slicer is so easy to use and has a great design. I haven't seen one like it! This was a great purchase, and I will more than likely purchase this again in the future as gifts for friends and other family members.

I bought this loom bands bracelet kit for my niece to use when she's over at my house visiting (which is quite frequently). It is so much fun and easy to use! I highly recommend buying this loom kit. It is great for bonding or even as a hobby to do alone. Great product!

I really enjoyed H2O and couldn’t put it down. It was so hypnotizing that I read it one sitting! The story takes place in the near future on the west coast of the U.S. Most of humanity has been wiped out by a virus and the few who are left live in small towns that trade with each other, but for the most part don’t communicate with each other. Roy, the main character, suspects that there’s a reason why this post-apocalyptic world is so divided and “small” and when he follows up on his suspicion, he discovers the secret. The one that’s been in plain sight, except that because no one is allowed to gain too much knowledge, no one figured it out.

This is definitely a high-octane novel. The world which Ms. Lake creates is well-structured, the place of each demonic and otherworldly race in the story clearly explained. This is an entertaining read for fans of the fantasy genre.VeronicaReviewer for Coffee Time Romance and Morehttp://www.coffeetimeromance.com/BookReviews/calmbeforethestormbycaralake.html

First let me say that I enjoyed reading First very much. It is a deeply emotional read that will keep you on the edge of your seat. The reason I gave this book 4 cups, instead of 5 cups is that the pornography scenes were just a little too realistic. I suspect that the author meant for them to be, but in my case it was just a little too much information, and made it difficult to enjoy parts of this book, although overall I found it to be a fantastic read. Also, I was very satisfied with the love scenes between Tommy and Mike which were in my opinion perfect. In addition, the end was very very satisfying, and yes, that did make up for what to me were porn scenes that were too detailed. If you enjoy realism in your stories, and heartbreaking emotionalism, mixed with a beautiful love story, then you will most definitely enjoy this book, and I can definitely recommend it for those reasons!ReginaReviewer for Coffee Time Romance & Morehttp://www.coffeetimeromance.com/BookReviews/firstbykcwells.html

I love books with lots of suspense, great characters, and some romance tossed in for great measure. Murder in the Mist has all that, yet as well as I enjoyed the book I am so disappointed in the ending. All I can say without giving it away is a cliff-hanger; continued in another book. Although I do love series books, I personally love when each stands on its own. Sadly that was my reasoning in only a 3 cup.Matilda Reviewer for Coffee Time Romance & More - See more at: http://coffeetimeromance.com/BookReviews/murderinthemistbylorettacrogers.html#.VaFhrY39N9A

For a time, Behringer dropped this mixer from the lineup shortly after introducing the XENYX series, then brought it back.We've been using one for about nine years, toting it to and from church in a wheeled carry-on suitcase with cables, power cords and adapters stored in the lid.  The mixer shows no signs of giving up the ghost.  At a typical Saturday evening Mass, the "choir" consists of my wife and me.  A Behringer C2 condenser mic picks up both her voice and her C.F. Martin guitar.  I slip on a Shure WH20XLR headband mic.  My MacBook Pro's sound output is routed into a pair of line inputs for some pre-Mass meditative Muzak or for when we have to project a DVD or video on the screens.  When the children's or adult choir joins us, I plug in two more C2s, adequate for a whole choir.For hymns and songs, I dial a little Cathedral reverb (effect 01) into the final mix, allowing a few seconds of music to hang in the air when the singing stops.  With a  twist of the Send knob, the effect disappears for spoken announcements while the reverb fades gracefully to silence.

Next to me, my wife's most prized possession is her Martin guitar which she always strings with genuine C.F. Martin strings.  We originally used Dean Markley and Seymour Duncan pickups to hook the guitar into our mixer to be amplified by the church's sound system, but something was missing.  The sound coming over the speakers lacked the nuance and subtleties of the distinctive Martin sound.  Makes sense, because an inductance pickup is deaf to the rest of the guitar.Since she sings while she plays, one of these mics serves as both the guitar pickup and a vocalist's mic, blending the guitar and her voice into one pristine signal.  Another pair picks up an entire choir, leaving us one to spare for an additional soloist.

The main difference between the 21st century version of this coffee maker and its mid-century incarnation is the color of the filter cone, the latter being transparent plastic.  The borosilicate glass carafe still bears the name Schott, one of Germany's most respected glass works. The design and operation are the same: slip in the filter, measure in the ground coffee, bloom it with a careful splash of boiling water, wait about a half- to a full minute, pour in the rest in a steady circular motion. When the water has drained through, take away the cone, slip on the keep-warm cover, pour and enjoy.  Yes, I know it's the same method as the Chemex that predates it in the USA and, yes, the Chemex coffee maker never lets the brewed coffee come into contact with plastic, but I'll lay odds that even the staunchest fan of Chemex or any other brand wouldn't be able to do much better than chance in a double-blind taste test.We keep this one on hand for when we're in the mood for some decaf with dessert, and the pour-over method seems to bring forth the fullest flavor.  The technique takes a little more precision than I can muster at 6:00 in the morning so we also have a programmable electric Melitta to perfume the house with the aroma of a fresh pot of coffee by the time the alarm clock goes off.The cone, carafe and lid can go into the dishwasher and, as an added bonus, the filter cone fits the carafe from our previous electric coffee maker, allowing continuous java production during a dinner party.  If there's a drawback, it's not the fault of the coffee maker itself but market dynamics that make #6 filters hard to find in bulk.  No biggie.  The ubiquitous #4 filter fits just fine and requires only a small adjustment to the pour-over rate.  Better yet, use the "stopwatch" method: after the first bloom, drizzle the water in a circular motion just enough to keep the grounds wet for 30 seconds, wait 30 seconds, repeat.  A little extra effort yields a lot more flavor.

[This review is for the 12-cup glass carafe model.]After 6 years, the DeLonghi developed a leak and by now it's at the recycling facility yielding up its recoverable components. During its final week, we used it to manually brew our coffee using the traditional Melitta pour-over method while waiting for this one to be delivered.  Once it arrived, life was back to normal, including waking to the aroma of a pot of hot coffee.This Melitta electric combines nearly every feature of every coffeemaker we've owned.  It uses the tried-and-true #4 filter which fits in a funnel-shaped basket.  This design ensures that all of the water passes through all of the coffee grounds, eliminating dry spots and under-extraction.  The clock and timer are no-brainer simple to set with separate hour and minute buttons, and the sapphire blue lighted display is easy for a tall user to read without bending, squatting or squinting.  A bright green LED confirms that the timer is set and ready to switch on at the preset time.  One not-so-obvious advantage is a swing-up lid over the basket instead of a hinged swing-out basket, allowing you to use the manual pour-over method during a power outage (that is, if you have a way to boil the water). The only thing it lacks is the DeLonghi's end-of-brew beep.We liked the "aroma" feature of our old DeLonghi and this Melitta's "Robust" brew-strength setting does the same thing: cycling the heated water flow on and off at approximately 30-second intervals so the coffee grounds alternately bloom and soak to develop a deeper flavor reminiscent of perked coffee without the grounds and sediment.  "Bold" shortens the pauses and "Regular" is the traditional constant flow method.Among its best features is the spout on the carafe: a simple lip that never dribbles, even when you desperately pour that first cup with an unsteady not-yet-caffeinated hand.*Melitta Bentz, inventor of the Melitta drip coffee maker and founder of the company that bears her name.

The bull's eye store was once a reliable source for coffee filters in bulk, but those days are long gone. Ditto for the ubiquitous corner drugstore chains. Even the upstart cost-cutting mini grocers sell No. 4 cone coffee filters at boutique prices.Rockline is the second-biggest American producer of Melitta-type cone filters and the No. 1 producer of private label brands, so I know they can be trusted. Maybe my taste buds are pedestrian but I can't detect a difference in flavor when I brew 100% Colombian coffee with these filters or with unbleached filters. Similarly, the "flavor pores" and rippled texture of the leading brand don't seem to make much difference. Where I really feel it is in my wallet. When I get down to the last bag, I bundle these into an order that qualifies for free shipping.As to performance, I've never had one blow apart or collapse and divert the water around the coffee grounds. Just remember to fold and crease the crimped seam before placing the filter in the basket, and when the coffee's brewed, grab the filter by the folded seam to lift it out.

We've replaced canned tomato sauce in all of our favorite recipes with these ravishing red beauties from Italy and we're never going back. Aside from being peeled and then pasteurized in the can, these San Marzano plum tomatoes are just about as fresh as when they were plucked off the vine in the Campania region of Italy. That means they aren't cooked until you cook them, and what a difference THAT makes, especially when you simmer your marinara sauce all day in a slow cooker or throw it together on the spur of the moment in a pressure cooker.Amazon's free shipping makes them a bargain compared to ordinary canned tomatoes and a steal versus the price of San Marzano tomatoes from the store.

This pair of LED retrofit bulbs are perfect for base-up installations as in many license plate fixtures where a longer bulb won't fit.  The brightness and 180 degree dispersal pattern illuminate the license plate and even spills a little light beyond the rear bumper for a little rolling pavement bling.

Trunk and cargo area lights seem to be an afterthought, almost as if car-makers are saying "Throw a low-wattage fixture back there and we'll have one more 'standard feature' to pad the list in the brochure."  That all changes when you plug in these li'l chunks of the Sun. Because of their extra length, they're particularly suited to horizontal installation as in dome, trunk and cargo lights.  If you can plug them in and they fit the enclosure, they're perfect for many cars made within the past 10 years and beyond like the trunk light in our 2004 Honda Civic sedan and the cargo light in our 2013 Subaru Impreza hatchback.  The pure white light complements the LED dome and map light bulbs we installed, spreading that white-hot LED bling into the dark forgotten regions.

When I'm providing over-the-phone technical support to co-workers who are on a speakerphone, they sometimes comment that I sound like I'm sitting across from them in the same room.  That's how good the sound is from this non-amplified wired headset.  It just proves that there are times when the old ways are still the best.  There's no "underwater" gurgling as with many wireless headsets, nor do you need to keep it charged up and/or supplied with batteries or deal with compatibility settings.  Once you learn to live with the lightweight coiled cable, it's like wearing a pair of glasses: you get used to it and life goes on.

How you install these depends on how the old bulb is held in place.  The dome light in my wife's 2004 Honda Civic sedan has C-shaped connectors that grasp the bulb at both ends.  The bulb slipped right in.In my 2013 Subaru Impreza hatchback, a pair of slotted metal blades hold the bulb.  They needed a little bending to wrap them around the pointed ends of the bulb.  In both cars, these bulbs bathe the interior with plenty of pure white light that's bright enough to read by while preserving the "turn down the house lights" effect without the flickering some reviewers mentioned.  One map light in the Subaru sheds enough light for both the driver and passenger.  Switch 'em both on and you have nearly enough light to perform surgery.As to getting the desired color, I ordered from YupBizauto on the "More buying choices" list and received 2 perfectly matched pairs of white bulbs shipped from California instead of waiting weeks for the boat from China.

Even though we live well within the immense broadcast footprint of 50,000-watt Los Angeles talk station KFI AM 640, the sound quality of the station's audio stream on IHeartRadio has surpassed the bandwidth capable of AM radio. So, an iPhone with the IHeartRadio app and the Bose SoundLink have become our favorite way to listen.The sound, of course, is all-Bose: ear-opening fidelity from an eye-poppingly small box. Bass and treble in balance instead of exaggerated, and a natural vocal presence that literally puts the on-air talent in the same room with you.When we first used the SoundLink to listen to streaming web radio, it had a tendency to drop out for several seconds at a time. The sound was also marred by annoying ticks and pops. The solution: bypass the Bluetooth and use an ordinary 3.5mm male-to-male audio cable connected between the iPhone's headset jack and the SoundLink's AUX port. The Bluetooth and WiFi don't interfere with each other, and the show goes on.
