Love these.  They are versatile.  I bought my 28-year-old daughter a pair too.  They are great rain boots.  They work with flowy dresses for a boho look.  Where them with leggings and an awesome tunic.  They are perfect tucked into straight or toothpick jeans.They add a little edge to any outfit. The toe box is wide and sturdy.  The are super comfortable and have a zipper on the medial (inner side).  I have worn them horseback riding with my friend and they are perfect cowboy boots too!  If you ride motorcycles, they work for that as well.  I've had too many bad bike experiences to ever get back on a bike, unless it's a bicycle or indoor bike.  These would not be great for those activities.I can't recommend them enough.  I bought them on an Amazon special, but these are forever shoes. You won't regret buying and you'll love wearing.

Bling, bling!  I needed two of these knobs.  They come in a box of six.  My 3 granddaughters got 3 and they look like giant diamonds.I would not usually use Crystal knobs anywhere.  We had a new display built and instead of magnetic opening glass doors like our previous cabinet, we decided to put knobs on.  Because of all the glass and mirrors I thought they would be a nice addition, blend in, and look different than the tradition knobs and pulls on all of the other cabinets.They add just the right amount of sparkle. They were easy to install even though the glass cutter made the holes to large.

It took two tries because the seller sent me the wrong color first, but I love this divided crate with a handle.  I use it to keep some of my many markers in it and organize them in the six compartments by color.  It blends in nicely with my reclaimed wood console, so I don't have to hide my markers and it adds to the decor.I have it in yellow.  They sent the blue at first.  If that is the color you are interested in it is very bright.This is made well and is quite sturdy.  A good purchase.

Nice looking straight leg Jean with a hint of stretch.These are comfortable and have a slightly darker wash.  I bought them at 50% off during a daily lightning deal.The straight leg is fairly narrow at the ankle, but these are definitely not skinny jeans.  They look great with tucked into boots, with heels or flats, depending upon your inseam.  I purchased in the 32" inseam, which does not leave room for real heels.  So far I have enjoyed these for two weeks with a variety of different looks.

Wow! I can't believe that there are only three reviews of this awesome cycle as I am writing this. More shocking is that the overall rating is average at this time. Okay, okay... I get it. One reviewer has had an issue with the crank.  That is unusual for a new bike that does not get the same level of use as a bike in the gym.  I am a Spin instructor and I have this cycle at my home. Let me share a few things about this bike and the online buying process.First, a few things about the price. Expect to pay anywhere from $1,195 to $1,795 retail for this exact cycle online. Many fitness equipment sites sell this bike and will tell you that you are getting a "deal." Well, as of January 13, 2015 the price range is $1,200 to $1,800. You should always receive free shipping from any online vendor for this product. If not, look elsewhere.To get a price as low as $1,195 you will have to find and wait for a sale at a site that is targeted towards professionals, yet is not wholesale, which might require a business license or bulk purchase. I have found that Mad Dog Fitness, Spinning's official trademark, often offers specials on all Star Trac bikes. Try going to their web site directly.  On January 13, 2014 this bike is available for $1,395 from spinning.com with the DVDs and other extras.I was going to purchase this particular bike in 2010 for under $1,200 with a $200 special offer.  My husband did his research online and he decided to buy this for me as a birthday present from a small second party retail fitness business he found online. He paid, wait for it... $1,695 in 2010. It was new, completely assembled and tuned up. This is something that is not done if it comes from most fitness equipment retailers. The tune up works out certain "hitches" that frequently occur in the gear/resistance, crank, and chain with the beginning use of any new gym-quality bike. As an instructor who has taught Spin for 19 years I have seen these type of issues over and over again. Beginning with a tuned up bike from the start helps prevent problems later. This is about a $200-$400 value.Now, about the cycle. I teach Spin and indoor cycle on many different bikes. This remains my favorite. It is why I choose it for my home bike. It offers you a good number of options to adjust the seat and handle bar height. You can adjust the seat and bars fore and aft as well. All of these adjustments are critical. Getting your bike professionally fit to you by a good instructor is as important as a great tune up. The handle bars are wide enough and solid to be very comfortable. This is something that is missing in many lower price indoor cycles.This bike uses a chain, not a belt, to move the weighted fly wheel. This is one of the reasons that it feels authentic to outdoor bikes. Belts feel smoother, but less realistic. The fly wheel weighs 38 pounds. This is a good size. Cheaper home models can weigh between 25 and 31 pounds. The weight of the fly wheel is important to how hard you work, how the resistance feels (smooth vs choppy, challenging vs too easy), and how simulated hills and speed are performed. In a nut shell - how many calories you burn and how much fun and safe your ride is. A heavier fly wheel means you can increase your work when you want.The other HUGE bonus to the Star Trac line of bikes that many other bikes miss is that the fly wheel weight is on the outside of the wheel as opposed to the center. The centrifugal forces of energy at higher speeds will help you feel as though you are being pulled into your ride. It makes your speed drills and cadence rides a dream.The stock pedals allow for cycle shoes with SPD cleats. If you prefer to use your Look cleats you will have to change the pedals. You can use traditional running or work out shoes with the stock pedals. My advice is to invest in cycling shoes if you are purchasing an indoor cycle for your home. You will increase your comfort and efficiency on the bike tremendously. You can also say goodbye to numb toes once you wear cycle shoes with cleats and clip in. You are literally part of the bike and you are working when you push and when your leg comes back around.The last thing I have to say about this bike is that it is gym quality. It is the same bike used in many gyms, including several gyms and studios where I teach. If you are not sure what that means you have not been to a gym in a while. :-) It is heavy in a good way. It is sturdy and and can take years and thousands of hours of rides. Pop some great music on, you do not need to wear a bike helmut to have a fun ride on this bike!

I wanted to love this cord, but it does not charge my iPad Air 2 as advertised.  "Compatible With but NOT limited to: Apple iPad 3 Apple iPad 4 Apple iPad Air 1 Apple iPad Air 2 Apple iPad mini 1 Apple iPad mini 2..."  this is from the language in the product description.I have some photos and I wanted to mention a few things other reviewers have written in their reviews* The cable is thicker than Apple's and appears that it would not be so delicate.* It is, indeed, 6-feet long.  That is a lot of convenience.* A few reviewers who ordered pink, as I did, wrote that they believed the color was closer to red.  See my images.  I feel it is a true pink and true to the image in the product images.* The connectors were not too snug and fit into any USB port that I tried.  Trust me, I tried many.* Those reviewers who have written that they will only stick with Apple products now might be interested to know that while I have never had a charging/syncing issue - every Apple cable I have purchased began to come apart towards the lightning connector within 2-6 months.  I expect that these type of cables have a short "shelf" life.  But I do expect them to work.When I connected it to my iPad it gave the initial charging sound and occasionally there was a flash of green on the battery, but within a second it would read "Not Charging."I am disappointed.  This is being returned today.

This is a gorgeous, yet blingy piece.  I love it.We are using it for our master bedroom doorway.  I am a bit more understated for the outside of the house.Pictures can speak better than my description.  My only disappointment is that no mounting hardware comes with this.  You will need brass or gold colored screws/nails to hang.

I wish I had used these candles this year.  I will use them tonight for the last night of Chanukah.I agree with most reviews and want to acknowledge the reviewer who points out that these are indeed made in China.  If that bothers you, do not purchase these candles.They are hand-rolled and wrapped individually in the box.  Not one fit into my Menorah.  They were slightly too big.  Such an easy fix to roll the bottom of candle a bit to make it narrower.  The honeycomb wax adjusted easily under my fingers.They burned between 45-60 minutes.  That is what I am used to unless you have an oversized Menorah.  The best part is that there were absolutely NO drips!! The previous 7 days I was using beautiful candles that I bought because they were drip less, but they dripped everywhere and I had to place foil under my Menorah and clean it each day.I will buy these every year.  I think they are awesome.  See my pictures.

These are beautiful candles and very colorful. For the aesthetic it gets 5 stars.  But the practicality and promise of drip less leaves me disappointed.I posted many images to help demonstrate the challenges that I faced.  I sent these to my daughter and she reported having the same issues.I believe these may be hand crafted.  It lends to the beauty.  That also causes minor and major variations in the bottom width and wick length.  Some candle bottoms were so wide I had difficulty getting them into my Menorah.  I had to pick away at the wax to get it to fit.  Others were so narrow that they would fall out or lean precariously.  I had to melt the bottoms to make them stick.  All of them left so much wax debris and even large wicks that I had to clean out each candle space every day.They are NOT drip less.  You can see from my pictures.  My Menorah would be covered with wax after each burning, requiring a scrub in scalding water.  Wax would even drip onto the surface where the Menorah stood.  I usually kept aluminum foil under it.As gorgeous as these are I will not purchase again.

I love Cole Haan and I love these shoes.  I have two pairs.They add a bit of sophistication to any outfit, including jeans.  I also like the slightly retro, masculine smoking slipper look.I always buy a 1/2 size up because I have wide feet.  With the slightly pointed toe that makes these a bit long, but super comfortable.  Just a week ago I did over 4 hours of heavy duty patio cleaning and yard work in my dark colored shoes.  That really is how comfortable and durable they are.When I'm working I may be standing and lecturing for several hours and walking back and forth across an enormous college campus.  No problems.  These shoes do click-clack when you walk.  Sorry, you can't sneak up on anybody.I usually wait for Cole Haan online clearance sales when they also have an additional 40-50% off.  I purchased these a year apart at such sales and spent around $40 on each pair.  I am a shoe nut, and these gets many compliments with a cute pair of pixie pants.  Retro all the way!

I am a huge Cole Haan fan.  I have these in pink suede.They run narrow, which accounts for many people writing about having to but a 1/2 - 1 size up, as I usually do.  Because they are narrow in the toe box, this is why many wearers report the bowing effect.  Cole Haan does offer this shoe in wider widths, but they sell out quickly.I wanted to address the top reviewers concern that some of the shoes from this seller may be counterfeit.  I purchased mine from Cole Haan.  She is correct that these shoes are made in India and that should be marked in dark brown under the tongue of the.  The size and serial number will be stamped in brown on the outside inner edge, which should be leather.Please see my photos.  The silver button at the back has a distinctive look.  Any other design is not a real Cole Haan shoe.  A few of the colors here do not have this design.  The same goes for the unique tread pattern that bears the Cole Haan signature and travels up the back of the shoe.  These are driving shoes; hence the tread and metal button on the back.I have one wide foot (forefoot/toes) and one normal foot since a bad surgery in 2013.  I find these shoes to be comfortable for my wide foot, and my post-op bad foot.  I can wear them for hours of teaching and walking across my college's campus.  I like the kapow fun color.  It livens up a black pant suit or jeans and a t-shirt.  I get tons of compliments.Disclosure: I bought these on clearance through the Cole Haan website during special with an extra 50% off.  I do that a lot.  They cost me about $47.00.

Love 'em!I read all of the other reviews.  When you buy shoes online it is such a gamble.  I have odd feet.  They tend to be wide, but I had bunion surgery on my right foot in 2013, which was botched severely, and I ended up losing my right little toe.  I usually buy size 8.5 to get the extra width, even though the length of my foot is 7.5-8.  As many reviewers have written about the width winging out, even with my wide left foot, the 8.5 B is wide.  See pictures.  To me that is better than even the tiniest bit fitted, because that might get too tight throughout the day.Anyway, no pity party.  I deal with it.  I do look for shoes that are comfortable and hide my scars.These shoes are adorable stand-out slip ons with an athletic vibe.  I have them in patent leather, so I would feel comforfortable wearing on a rainy day.  I also have them in a color not available here: bright pink.  I bought mine through Cole Haan on clearance with 40% off and paid less than $45.  Although they were final sale.The non-slip white contrast sole is cushy and fashion-forward.  These look good with jeans, shorts, and even a suit.  Compliments galore!  I'm glad I went with such a kapow color.

Not only do these not have much of a cherry flavor, they are quite waxy in texture and not as red as I would prefer.The price is way too high for an artificial product that does not deliver on strong flavor, almost no cherry flavor, lackluster color, only a 10 ounce package, and rarely can find a seller that does not charge for shipping.If you really need Cherry-Flavored chips and not dried cherry pieces, try melting high-quality white chocolate and adding real cherry extract and blending with a few dark sweet cherries in a powerful blender until completely smooth.  Pour out onto waxed paper to cool and chop into chips.  It is a lot more work, but worth it for the final product... only if you really need it.Avoid this these chips.  They are a waste of money, calories, and full of artificial ingredients.

This has an odd fit.The 12 pounds is a perfect weight for someone accustomed to using any weight vest or weight belt for power walking or additional resistance during weight training.However, the fit is both loose and snug in all of the wrong places. It connects at the top of your chest.  This means that men will have a hard time wearing this unless they have a small frame.  For women, it has to click above your breasts, which be uncomfortable depending upon your size.  The closure is fairly high, and because the weight of vest is primarily in the back and hanging beneath the closure, it keeps riding up and feels like it is going to choke you.The remaining weighted part of vest has no way of being kept snug to your body, so it tends to flop and move around a great deal.  I have used it for power walking.  I cannot imagine using it for running (which I cannot do because of arthritis) or any higher impact activity.  If you are bigger through your back it may fit slightly closer.The teeny, tiny pocket will only hold something as small as an iPod Nano.  That does not work for me because I walk with my phone and use it for my music.Sadly, I have not even been able to get use out of this for clients in my outdoor H-I-I-T class.  No one likes the fit.
A fun and upbeat song with a super beat.  I love listening to it in the car and using for workouts and teaching cycle and HITT-style classes.

First off  these pumps are beautiful!  I bought them in nude in February 2014.The nude color lengthens your leg visibly and provides a clean line.I love Via Spiga shoes.  I have always found them to be made well, comfortable, supportive, and stylish.  These shoes are no exception.I purchased my pair at a large department store in a size 8B.  Even with my wide feet and an awkward right foot after several surgeries, these shoes are comfortable.  I cannot wear high heels any longer unless they are a wedge since my foot surgeries.  I have worn these shoes for 14-hour days when I have been on my feet and walking for long periods of time.  They did well!These are great for more work and professional attire,  they work the best with dresses, so you can take advantage of the color lengthening effect.  They also look sleek with straight-leg or wide-leg trousers. These shoes are a little too conservative for jeans or capri pants.At these sale prices, no one should regret buying these shoes.

It has everything that you need.It is hard to slug through it and find what you want, but it is there.  Essential to any officer on a committee that must ollow parliamentary procedures.  It has saved us from many disputes.

It is nice to have Aspirin in the house.  Thee are so many uses.I have used it in a soaking bath for my husband's injured elbow and it worked.  He was amazed. I made a poultice from it to combat the occasional acne breakout before it reaches the surface and on a mosquito bite. It brings down the inflammation and pain.After much research, it is the only pain reliever that I can give my 100-pound dog.  I still use it cautiously and no more than 2 days in row before he has go see the doc.  But what a life saver.Avoid using it to treat fevers, even in adults.  Stick with Tylenol and Motrin.

This small tool will help save your hands from the majority of the usual stickiness that covers your fingers/hands when extracting roasted garlic.It has a flat, broad, slightly curved scoop at the end of a short thick ceramic handle.  The scoop works well to get under roasted garlic cloves and pop them out whole or dig the dregs out.  You may still need to squeeze a few of the smaller cloves in the center of you want to get all of the roasted garlic out.A seafood fork with long tiny tines and a narrow scoop works well also, particularly on the smaller cloves, but lacks the ergonomic heft.

I recently cut my super long hair.  This straightener is not very powerful, but it stay hot.  It would not have done anything before with my long hair.  It can handle my shorter layered hair and get most of the curl out in a reasonable time.The price was fair and I will not feel upset if this is no longer working in a year.A nice compact on a budget.

A few years ago I swore to myself that I would never spend this much money on a blender.  Well... it is worth it.I have not explored all of the options with this amazing and SUPER powerful blender yet.  So far I am making daily protein smoothies from homemade recipes.  My husband is very happy about that.My next attempt is to make "hot" soup with the Vitamix using ingredients that are not hot.  My daughter is excited for us to do this soon.I love the various settings and the heft of the base.  The pitcher lifts off and is placed on easily without needing to be locked in place.  There is an extra safety feature that requires you to turn the blender on using a toggle switch on the rear right-hand side.  My granddaughters like to see the lights turn on when it is switched "on."It is very loud when it is crushing large ice cubes.  However, it will crush them quickly and then it is smooth and quiet.  Actually, it is remarkably quiet for its power.I had hoped that it would be powerful enough to really pulverize flax meal that I would add, but it is not.  If I do not want larger chunks of flax meal in a smoothie, I need to zap that in a coffee grinder first until it is a fine powder.Here is one of my recipes for a super-charged, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, protein boost, cherry/berry smoothie.Alter the amounts to taste and according to the number of servings.Fill pitcher 1/3 with iceAdd 3/4 cup non-fat plain Greek yogurtAdd 1 bananaAdd 2 scoops of "Body Fortress" "Advanced Whey Protein" vanilla flavor*Add 2 scoops of "Amazing Grass" "Green Superfood"Add 3/4 cup fresh or frozen/defrosted cherriesAdd 1/2 cup of fresh or frozen/defrosted strawberriesAdd 1/2 cup of fresh or frozen/defrosted blueberriesAdd 1-2 fresh kale leaves washed and ripped into small piecesAdd 2-3 tablespoons of honey (to taste to cut tartness of berries)Add 2 teaspoons of Neilsen-Massey Pure Vanilla PasteAdd 1 teaspoon of Almond extractSqueeze the contents from 1-3 "Now" Omega 3-6-9 1000 mg Essential Fatty Acid Soft GelsPour 1 cup unsweetened plain or vanilla flavor almond milk over contentsPour 1 cup pure cherry juice (you can get it at places like Trader Joes) over contentsPlace lid on - turn on - set to snowflakePULSEIt will be really loud for a few second until the ice is broken up.  Let it continue blending until you see all ingredients mixed thoroughly- then give it another zap or two, just to be sure.  Taste, pour, and enjoy.This make 4 large servings in a full pitcher and has a good amount of protein, and almost a daily dose of fruits and vegetables.My granddaughters do not know that they are drinking their greens, kale, flax seed, or essential fatty acids (high Omega).  They only know it tastes wonderful.  The cherry versus strawberry lends to the sweeter taste and is higher in anti-inflammatory properties.*I like this protein power because it mixes well, tastes good without any chemical tastes, and has some of the highest protein to calorie and fat ratio I can find, particularly for the money.  Vanilla is always a good best because it can even go with chocolate.Try my smoothie out and let me know if it worked for you.  :)Update June 8, 2015: I have now made hot soup from room temperature ingredients.  Easy!  Last night I took frozen strawberries rinsed then off and made stawberry Bellinies with a tad of simple syrup (previously made with Stevia), a bit of Chambord and a sparkling brut.  They were the hit of our neighborhood GofT night.  This machine can do anything!

I purchased this after reading so many excellent reviews.  I have long known of ginger's abilities to decrease nausea and aid digestion, so I thought I would give this a try.I took one capsule the day after receiving this when I had a bit of nausea.  I ended up with horrible burning reflux throughout my esophagus and to the back of my throat.  The best way to describe it is similar to the burning of a severe mint without the mint flavor, but all of the heat and pain.  Needless to say, I was in extreme discomfort.So, this was a big disappointment for me.  At least the price is super reasonable.  I feel it was worth trying as everyone may have a different experience.  I do have lupus, and GERD, and other chronic ailments.  I was hopeful that this could be used as a natural replacement for a prescription medication for nausea and general digestive health.Others may have a better outcome.  Certainly, many have written about them.  I wanted to share one experience that was not great, but may be isolated.Since first writing this review I learned that I may have had a bad interaction with one of my medications.  I also learned that people who take "blood thinners" (warfarin, lovenox, plavix, any NSAID, such as ibuprofen, aleve, or prescription NSAID), also those with diabetes, and those taking high blood pressure medication.According to my research, this works best as a preventative, particularly for pregnant women with nausea, and may also help individuals with chronic joint pain.  Too bad it is not for me.
